description:
Such a good ice cream stand with many great and unique revolving flavors. I got the Strawberry Basil and it was super good. I also sampled the Harvey Milk + Honey Graham and that one was excellent as well.

The staff is great. The ice cream is great. The line....not so much sometimes because it can get too long. But do sample some flavors and try this place out!
author: Victor L.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is a San Francisco Staple. Since I was in the ferry building, I made sure to stop by for dessert, after returning from Treasure Fest on Treasure Island. The line was SO long, but worth every bite! They have rotating flavors, and all of them are so interesting and well-thought-out. 

Secret Breakfast: I forgot what's in this flavor but it was magical-I think there's some alcohol infusion if I remember correctly.

Matchadoodle: Woah! Matcha and Snickerdoodles?! Who would've thought these tasted so good together. Matcha ice cream mixed with chunks of snickerdoodle. Amazing! There was a nice contrast between the smooth, creamy ice cream and the chewy cookie.

It's $4.75 for a single scoop, but they let you get two flavors! Perfect for me because I'm so indecisive. A little pricey, but worth the work that goes into these flavors. 

Can't wait to come back and try new flavors!
author: Megan H.

description:
YOWZA! I'd marry this ice cream if I could. 

Yesterday I had the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham with the Golden Milk (Turmeric) & Gingerbread. They were both scrumptious! My only regret is getting a single scoop and NOT a double. Seriously out of this world delicious -- now if you'll excuse me, I have some ice cream to propose to. ‍

*The only reason I don't have a photo of this holy union is because I devoured it too fast. True story.*
author: Emily G.

description: Wanted to try this place because it seemed popular on YELP. The ice cream was good but nothing super special. The Strawberry Basil was my favorite and the reason for the 3 stars is because the person helping us was really rude and cold.. She was giving us an attitude and rushing us when we were obviously going to buy ice cream, so that definitely killed my mood.
author: Katelin N.

description:
Definitely some of the best ice cream you can get.
We had the foie gras with cherries and also the strawberry basil. If you're a fan of Foie gras you have to try this ice cream... definitely going to add it to one of my favorite ice cream ever.  And the strawberry basil was delicious super creamy and balanced. I would give this place five stars but the servers were just kind of blah.
author: Mike C.

description:
Yum. Just yum. 

I asked to sample the Secret Breakfast, which was cornflakes and bourbon. 'Boozy'. I was sold. 

Wowsers. A single scoop which contained an evil conglomeration of cornflakes that were crunchy and sweet. Crazy good. The ice cream tasted boozy... but not for long.
author: Richard L.

description:
I love the ice cream here. There can be a long line, but don't let that intimidate you... it can move pretty quickly.

The flavors are very unique and usually I want to eat all of them, but sadly can't because of being gluten sensitive and also non-elastic pants.

My brother loves the secret breakfast.... wasn't so gf friendly so I stayed away and  watched him with sadness as I saw him enjoy it. I really enjoyed the salted caramel with coco nibs.

Next time, I'll save more room for two scoops so I can make my way through the menu.
author: Gita r.

description:
Once I spotted a sign that noted Humphry's as one of Food Network's "Top 5 Ice Creams in America" my mind was made up  - I couldn't leave SF without a taste!

I ordered a scoop of their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, but sadly, the flavor didn't quite live up to it's name.
I expected to taste powerful notes of coffee, tamed by the sweetness of condensed milk, but it turned out to be rather mild in strength and more on the milky side.  I also didn't find that the quality of the ice cream justified its steep price of $4.50 for one small scoop. It wasn't very creamy nor rich... but unfortunately contained a bunch of tiny ice crystals throughout.

I'm disappointed to give less than a five-star rating to an ice cream shop that won the title of one of the best in the nation, but it wasn't too memorable overall. I contend that Humphry's does offer some unique flavors that you won't find elsewhere, such as their signature "Secret Breakfast", but to me, an award-winning ice cream should excel in more ways than one.
author: Courtney L.

description:
I was taken aback by the flavours at this little ice cream store inside Ferry building - no matter how weird some of the combinations may sound - they taste really good in the end.
Since it was my first time here we went for the classic Secret breakfast flavour but paired that with a brownie - all I can say is that every bite was divine and it's definitely become my favourite place to stop by for dessert when in SF.
author: Mehak C.

description:
One of the best ice cream places in San Francisco. They have super unique flavors that you won't find anywhere else. The ice cream itself does not taste artificial at all (although some flavors are definitely a lot more sweet than others). 

My favorite flavors: Jasmine lychee and the After school special.
author: Kelly C.

description: Nothing is quite like ice cream by the water! Their ice cream is very rich and they have some great flavors. I got the Vietnamese coffee flavor, and it was excellent, with a great strong coffee. The only warning I would say, is be aware of the price. Just one scoop alone is over $4. If the line is really long, worry not, it goes by quite quickly.
author: Jane H.

description:
This place is original. The flavors are unique and there is alwayyyyys a line wrapping around the store at the Pier. But wait in line, try the different flavors! I tried Secret Breakfast, a peanut butter flavor, and also the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. I thought the secret breakfast was a bit too sweet. It has a slight hint of bourbon in it which was interesting. I really do think the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream here is a home run. It's what you should get. It's the only thing you should get. It has the best coffee flavor I've tasted in an ice cream! 

What to try: blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream

Water rating: n/a
author: Amanda P.

description: Even though I didn't get a chance to try their strawberry basil flavor because it was sold out, I truly enjoyed the flavors that I did choose.  One was the Vietnamese coffee and the other was the Secret Breakfast.  Their cone was crunchy, fresh and delicious as well and they do allow splitting of the single scoop.  I ended up getting a decent amount of ice cream with the split for $5.  Don't let the lines intimidate you because this place is worth the wait.
author: Monica G.

description:
I am usually the first one in a group to sniff out some ice cream and naturally while on the pier after a later dinner I found Humphry Slocombe via the Yelp app. 

Located in the marketplace on the pier, it is pretty easy access on foot, but can be a pain if driving as your only real option is a overpriced parking garage. Anywho, back to the ice cream shop, it is open pretty later compared to many of the other shops that were closed or closing down when I arrived (8ish). The line was pretty short, which was awesome, easy in and out for me. They clearly list the flavors on a board ahead of time so no need to hover over the ice cream fridge trying to figure out which flavor to choose. As with any ice cream shop, tasting is a must beforehand and I performed my due diligence in tasting what I could. They are pretty generous when it comes to the scoop sizes, but be prepared for higher prices than your average ice cream shop, I believe I paid around six and half dollars for two scoops. Fast forward to the final choices, I ended up going with their secret breakfast, which was a blend of cork flakes and bourbon with a second scoop of blue vietnamese coffee. It was an absolute perfect blend for a post dinner sweet, and would easily re visit them if I was in the area again to explore some other flavors (Although that secret breakfast was terrific!).
author: Ryan A.

description:
Humphrey Slocum is my favorite ice cream place in San Francisco.  In a city that is rich with high quality ice cream places, HS is tops in my mind.  Their flavors are delicious and unique but what I like most about their ice cream is the texture.  I like my ice creams to be very dense and rich that requires some chew.  Not a fan of lighter ice creams that seem like they've been left out of the freezer to warm for a little bit.

My favorite flavors are there vanilla (French and/or Tahitian), brown butter and black sesame.  One of my main measuring sticks for an ice cream place is how good their vanilla is.  If done right, vanilla is not some plain Jane flavor that needs topping.  If done right, vanilla is a very sophisticated and complex flavor.  Humphrey Slocombe nails their vanilla.

Service is always friendly.  Pro tip:  If you don't like to wait in line, go during the week days and in the middle or early part of the day (especially at the ferry building).  Their Mission shop is also a nice place to visit.
author: Oliver S.

description:
Fresh flavors, balanced sweetness, don't make a mistake and skip this small iced cream shop! It's in the marketplace and tucked away on a corner. 

Worth every calorie.
author: Bree B.

description:
My philosophy with ice cream shops is you can't just get a bunch of scoops.  Seriously, just buy a pint from the grocery store if you want to do that.  Instead, to truly experience the ice cream shop magic, you need to try the sundaes and other concoctions.  Mr. Slocombe did not disappoint on that front!

Make It Gay Sundae: Perfect for Pride Season!  A base of Harvey Milk (of course), which is pretty neutral except for the nice chewy soaked graham crackers.  Then pink fluff!  I love fluff in general, but pink fluff makes it seem so festive.  Then froot loops, which are both colorful and playful at the same time.

Secret Breakfast Sundae: The bourbon caramel is pretty cool.  It actually tastes like bourbon and it looks pretty awesome being a translucent gold hue.  The secret breakfast ice cream is one of my favorites since cornflakes + (frozen) milk + bourbon is just awesome.  I also liked the corn flakes topping because it was a nice contrast to the softer corn flakes mixed into the ice cream.

Fudge Brownie Deee-lite: This feels like it's out of the Ghirardelli playbook.  Gooey brownie, hot fudge and a scoop of the ice cream of your choice (I chose Vietnamese Coffee).  Probably the heaviest of the sundaes I've tried, even though it's just one scoop of ice cream.  Love the chocolate overload.  Ice cream here is way better than at a Ghirardelli parlor.
author: Adam B.

description: Super stingy with the portions and pricey! Heard many great things about this ice cream but overall, was not impressed. The workers were rude and not friendly. Not one person smiled. The infamous "secret breakfast" flavor was mediocre. And it was very soft ice cream that kept melting way too quickly. There are way better other ice cream places in SF!
author: Monissa W.

description:
I'm not a huge ice cream person since I'm allergic to milk but I stumbled here with my friend while at the Farmer's Market at the Ferry Building. Even though we were stuffed, we got in line because the flavor list was SO good. The secret breakfast flavor is my all-time favorite-  the bourbon ice cream is so well made and I loved the pieces of cereal that are already churned into the ice cream. It's the perfect balance of flavor in every bite!

They also do a coffee ice cream sourced by Blue Bottle which is really good! Overall, a major hit whether you're a big ice cream person or not!
author: Megan K.

description: So I have had a lot of ice cream and this place was good, but really no different than some other places. They have some interesting flavours but nothing that particularity attracted me. I got the one with honey and the honey flavour was really strong so I believe they definitely use authentic ingredients. The flavours have to really grow on you because I was not a fan when I first had a try. Overall a good place to visit, but there are definitely better places to visit that will have better flavours and give you a bigger portion.
author: Alexis W.

description:
Ended up coming here on a Sunday afternoon since we were in the area. I wasn't able to decide right away on what I wanted to get since everything sounded so good. 

I finally went for the milky tea and my mom got the french vanilla. The milky tea is a breakfast blend tea with a drop of condensed milk. The sweetness of this ice cream was just right. I should have gotten it with an ice cream cone but I got a cup instead. As for the french vanilla, it was just your classic french vanilla ice cream. This ice cream ended up being way too sweet but overall it was still delicious. 

Overall, good service and good ice cream. I will definitely come back again to try the other flavors.
author: Michelle R.

description:
The ice cream location was one of the many things I saw while visiting the Ferry Building. All my friends were in an ice cream mood so why not!

Their flavors really do stand out. A lot of their flavors do have some wacky names to say the least and thats not including their other concoctions.

Got two scoops, one of the secret breakfast and one of the harvey milk/honey graham. The fact that they put chunks or pieces of the foods in the ice cream is a winner for me such as pieces of honey graham crackers. The portions aren't that big compared to what you would get at say Salt & Straw, but still was delicious overall.

Looking forward to trying their other flavors and items!
author: Timothy D.

description:
Nice to see an outpost of the Mission original here at the Ferry Building, although to my waistline's detriment, it's open fairly late and lies right in the middle of my evening commute. You'll find familiar, high-quality favorites like the Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream with cornflakes) and black sesame (toasted black sesame seeds with sesame oil) as well as a cast of rotating flavors. 

If anything, I hate that it's in such a touristy location because I wish all the tourists would flock to true touristy places like Ghirardelli and leave the good local stuff to us locals. ;)
author: Vincent L.

description:
Came here first-time on a Saturday evening. 
- Ordered: Salted caramel w/ coca nibs & Malted milk chocolate. Good but too sweet for me. (They didn't have olive oil or matcha flavor that day)
-the cone doesn't cost extra, and you can do a split scoop for 2 flavors in a single scoop
-they let you taste as many flavors before buying. great customer service. 
-the pints are a good deal 
-Overall a happy experience
author: Jess W.

description:
One of my all time favorite ice cream places!  Please open a location in San Diego!  Please!

They have 2 locations in SF, this one is located in the Ferry Building.

They are known for their unique flavors, try them all!

Secret Breakfast:  Bourbon & cornflakes.  Chunks of cornflakes.  Light Bourbon.  Very delicious!  A must order!
Harvey Milk + Honey Graham:  Lots of graham cracker, sweet.  So yummy!
author: Saleen D.

description: Had to stop by to try the Secret Breakfast. Mixed with a light hint of Bourbon, corn flakes, vanilla bean. Pretty good, with a perfect mixture of flavors in a very creamy consistent texture. This place has a lot of unique flavors so don't expect your standard run of the mill ice cream. this place caters towards the more adult crowd, with adult ingredients and top notch quality catering to the real ice cream afficionado.
author: Gregg R.

description: Loved the chocolate brownie fudge. So flavorful compared to the other popular option that rhymes with fairydeli ;-) Plus great location too, pick something up and walk past the ferry building market to get to the beautiful walkway for a view of the bay bridge at night. Makes for a great experience!
author: Harish D.

description: Maybe I didn't get the right flavors but I thought this ice cream was just okay and not anything different than other ice creams that I've had. I stopped here on a whim while at the Ferry Building and they had a decent line so I thought to myself "this has to be good". I asked the staff member behind the counter what her two favorite flavors were and got those in a cup. She recommended the malted milk chocolate and the peach melba. I preferred the malted milk chocolate between the two, but honestly wasn't blown away like I thought I would be. Perhaps I tried the wrong flavors and need to try more. Nevertheless, worth a try since they have such a dedicated following and lots of fans.
author: Jade M.

description:
Humphry Slocombe serves some of my favorite ice cream in SF. 
2 words: Secret Breakfast. 
Their signature flavor has bourbon and corn flakes, but it's balanced so that the bourbon isn't overpowering and pairs perfectly with the creamy vanilla bean, and the corn flakes add a perfect crunchy texture to the smooth and amazingly flavored ice cream. I've tried other flavors such as Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Hong Kong Milk Tea, and (Harvey) Milk and Honey, and all are delicious and solid. 

While the Ferry Building location can get busy, it is a nice setting in that you can pick up your ice cream and go outside to get a view of the bay bridge on a nice day. Humphry Slocombe in the ferry building serves a unique spin on ice cream for those into adventurous flavors.
author: Steven V.

description:
I'm toggling between a 3.5 to 4 stars. This place is UNIQUE and hipster lol (I predicted they'd have olive oil as a topping and alas, they did). This isn't bad! I enjoyed the flavors I got--one was the Firebrand (caramel and chocolate pretzels) and the French tickler (banana and sugar cookies).

Both were good texture (the ice cream base) but I was very disappointed with the texture of the items that were mixed in! This was unpleasant for me. The chocolate pretzels were stale-crunchy and the sugar cookies were unpalatable. I enjoyed the flavors but the mix ins were distractingly in there and not in a pleasant way. It was just tasted old. It is hard to make mix ins that fit the ice cream. I still ate it all haha, so the flavors were really good. I was excited for the idea of having cookies/pretzels in my ice cream but was then disappointed in the textures they had. :(
author: Natalie M.

description:
Humphrey slocombe is located in the ferry building and is one of the vendors that's still open when everything else closes. I love coming here for a night time ice cream run.  You have to try their secret breakfast! I recommended that flavor to anyone, it's just so perfect. 
I also tried their salt & pepper flavor - was very reluctant but it was surprisingly good. They may not have this anymore though since it's a monthly flavor.
author: Vicky R.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is of the best ice cream places in the city! They always have creative flavors. A few days ago when I was there, they had around 5 flavors for SF Beer Week. Beer ice cream?? Definitely interesting.. Lol!

I love texture, so I ordered a single scoop of the secret breakfast (bourbon + cornflakes) on a sugar cone. It wasn't too bourbon-y for my taste and I loved the cornflakes! I'd definitely get Humphry Slocombe again if I was in the area.
author: Tara A.

description: This ice cream is delicious.  I didn't want to seem rude or obnoxious but I really wanted to try all of the flavors. After reading the reviews and talking to the staff I settled with the blue bottle coffee. Wow wow wow is it creamy and rich. I was hoping the cone would be filled a little more, but its probably better for my waistline that it wasnt. Kind of pricy but not ridiculous. I would definitely come back and I'd surely recommend this place to anyone who likes ice cream.
author: Keith F.

description: Honestly, I was not a fan. I liked that there were so many unique flavors, but I thought my ice cream tasted a bit sour. It actually tasted like frozen yogurt with the consistency of regular ice cream.
author: Mallory L.

description:
Yum!

Located inside the Ferry Building Marketplace, we passed by this cute ice cream shop and had to give it a try. Read good stuff about the Secret Breakfast flavor and it definitely did not disappoint. It's their signature flavor and most popular. I appreciate that the ice cream is smooth, creamy, and not overly sweet. The ice cream is blended well, no chunky ice crystals. So smooth to the palate. 

They offer all sorts of interesting flavors like bacon, candied ginger, ancho chilies, blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, banana, beets, carrot, brown butter, carrot mango sorbet, cheese, maple walnut, corn, cucumber, foie, hibiscus flowers, jalapeños, limes, candy capp mushrooms, peanut butter curry, chips, prosciutto, saffron, rosemary, salt and pepper, tarragon, thyme, and so much more! 

In addition to ice cream, they also sell cakes, pies, cookies, and a bunch of toppings for their ice cream. The cashier was sweet and quick. They also ship their ice cream through Amazon and Goldbely.com. Wahoo!
author: Kimberly J.

description:
Awesome ice cream on 4/20! They had a special munchies ice cream that came with chips, pretzel sticks, and hot chocolate on top. It was really good. I've been here before while I was in town and it didn't disappoint, once again. 

It's nice to take your ice cream out by the water and enjoy it with the pigeons, just don't feed them!

Thanks for the great treat!
author: Clifford M.

description:
I remember bookmarking Humphry  Slocombe Ice Cream and I got to try it on a Saturday afternoon! The Ferry Building is a tourist trap btw. 

Humphry Slocombe has a long line that will go back quickly, and the crowds are packed in this building. The person who served me was great, she allowed me to try a bunch of samples for my indecisive self, and recommended the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (which I had my eye on). Put them together, and its called the (Complete Breakfast!) I got that since it was pretty good, but so was Harvey's Milk and Graham Crackers? But actually purchasing it and eating it was a different story for me. I got tired halfway and threw out half the scoop. The Secret Breakfast is kind of like eating cereal with milk, and the coffee is just coffee. 

Price: $4.50 for one scoop
author: Jessica H.

description:
4.50 for one scoop. 

Olive oil and rhubarb: interesting flavor but wouldn't order a whole scoop

Breakfast surprise: 4/5 burbon and something crispy, good flavor

Milk chocolate: overwhelmingly chocolate

I prefer bi rite
author: Kim l.

description:
Went back and finally tried the 
Harvey's Milk-  Vanilla and Honey Graham Crackers
Secret Breakfast- Bourbon and Cornflakes 

These were both delicious and forced me to change my Ice cream rankings below as well as update my star rating up a tick. I'd definitely recommend trying / taste testing both at the minimum.

It's good to give restaurants and people for that matter second chances. 

So many good ice cream/chocolate spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

So many good ice cream spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Smitten Ice Cream
8 Teuscher Chocolate 
9 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
10 Over the Moon
11 The Ice Cream Bar
12 Coletta Gelato
13 Cako Creamery
14 Bi-Rite Creamery
15 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
16 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
17 Mitchells Ice cream
18 St. Francis Fountain
19 Z Cioccolato
20 Joe's Ice Cream
21 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
22 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
23 Recchiuti Confections 
24 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description:
Food: 3/5      Price: 3/5  

Humphry Slocombe is an innovative San Francisco ice cream parlor, located in the Ferry Terminal in SF. If you're craving ice cream with flavors you've never tried before, that have often been called "wacky" or "adventurous", then Humphry Slocombe is your destination - bacon, candied ginger, beets.... they of course also carry some usuals like Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, banana, sea salt caramel etc.

POG Sorbet - passion fruit, orange, guava. What you'll get in this sorbet is a very sweet tropical melange. I would have preferred to taste the flavors individually; taken together they are muddled, with the passionfruit lost completely. Overall, too similar to fruit punch.

Ordered:
* POG Sorbet (1 scoop, $4.50)
author: Victoria L.

description: Got French vanilla cone and cinnamon dulce de leche (tastes like Cinnamon Toast Crunch). Both were delicious! So many unique flavors, great creamy ice cream, and fast service. I'll definitely be back! :)
author: Reena S.

description: We always saw huge lines building up for this place, and figured out why when we tried it out. This place has the most delicious ice creams ever. We tried the sesame seeds, surprised breakfast and malted chocolate and liked all three of them. We wanted to only try one scoop but ended up taking all three flavors as we were unable to decide which one to pick
author: Amar P.

description:
Please pardon the drool as I write about some of the best Ice Cream in SF! I have to say I didn't get to my Mr. Slocombe (I call him Hump) but he sure outdid himself with the flavors this time. 

I had the secret breakfast (because a little bourbon never hurt anyone) and the cinnamon tres leches. Both such good flavors! I really like the quality of the ice cream here.... you can tell they take pride in providing a superior product.

Just FYI... there is likely going to be a line for the ice cream here, but it goes by fast and is tooooootally worth it. 

Stay Cheerful ;)
author: Garen A.

description: I really liked the ice cream here. I got the malted chocolate and secret breakfast, and both tasted great. Melted quickly, but enjoyable nonetheless. I suggest getting it in a cup and having the cone on top.
author: Dillon L.

description: Ice cream. I wanted to try something new. I was scrolling through the Yelp search...and this seemed interesting. The wait was somewhat long though, and the service/staff seemed somewhat disorganized. I purchased the "Who's your Daddy? Sunday". I didn't like it that much. However, I would go back and try something else. I'd give it a second chance. I also got a taste of the black sesame ice cream. I did like that. Very unique.
author: Olive R.

description:
I had peanut butter fudge ripple!
It was heaven 
The line was kinda long for an Ice cream but it was worth every min!
Ugh I should've ordered 3 scoops! My one scoop wasn't enough
author: Sunny L.

description:
Rich ice cream combined with unique tastes made from locally sourced ingredients. 

I'm a hayooge fan of their housemade Duck Fat Pecan Pie. Rendered duck fat gives the pie base a buttery decadent goodness that regular lardo just can't replicate. 

Pies are available to purchase in a tartlet size that you don't have to tell anyone about. Or if the sharing mood strikes, a whole pie runs about $45 with advance notice. 

When I'm feeling naughty, I indulge in a "DUCK YEAH! Sundae" aka Duck Fat Pecan Pie a la mode. 

I decided to go against the traditionally topped scoop of Brown Butter and chose to pair it with a new holiday flavor (Guiness Gingerbread). DAMMMMN DANIEL.
author: Geminyna J.

description:
We tried three flavors, all of them were amazing:

1. Secret breakfast: Bourbon flavored ice cream that was a little bit too sweet for me.
2. Apricot: Deliciously fruity and refreshing, this flavor had chunks of cookie inside.
3. Olive oil and rhubarb: This flavor combination surprised me, but was my favorite.

The line was long but moved quickly and the girl at the counter offered us samples of the ice cream before we ordered.
author: Kristina H.

description:
This is located inside the ferry building and it is the perfect treat after walking around the farmers market on a sunny Saturday morning! I've been here 2 Saturdays in a row and I'm discovered my new favorite flavor! The golden milk and gingerbread is hands down, the best thing ever! Be warned that it is pretty unique and bold. 

If you want something a little lighter for your pallets, I would go for the togarashi tea. 

Everyone always tries the secret breakfast, but I think it's a little too sweet. My friend got a whole scoop of it and ended up not finishing cause it got too sweet after a couple spoons. 

You can try all the flavors if you really want to, before purchasing !
author: Chi L.

description:
Always get solid ice cream here. I usually come right before they close around 8 pm because there's pretty much no line. The ice creams makes for an excellent dessert after dinner. 

My friend always goes there and suggested the secret breakfast ice cream flavor. I got it in a cone and it tasted delicious, balancing the salty flavor of bourbon with the crunch of the cereal perfectly. 

Try to avoid the lunch/early afternoon line. Otherwise, it's a great ice cream shop.
author: Nathan C.

description: Buy a pint and skip the line...... pretty good ice cream.. different.. while strolling and enjoying nice view by the water.. wont be just driving here for this though.. might want to come on top of other things.. like eating oysters by the water at the restaurant in the same ferry building.. parking is a bit challenging..
author: Aristo A.

description:
Let me clarify as to why this is: "ice cream
for adults" It's so delicious like seriously the best ice cream I've ever had. The coffee is amazing but the strawberry OMG the strawberry is the best! I'm not a "fruity" ice cream fan and this was addicting! All of the samples we had were 100% delish! Very very high priced but we ordered a triple scoop in the same bowl and divided it! $4.50 for one scoop!
author: Brittney P.

description: This is one of the top 5 ice cream spots in America for a reason. The brownie delight with malted chocolate ice cream is simply the best. The flavors are deep and pull all the right strings. Not to be missed!
author: Gopi V.

description: I saw this great reviews and the line and felt like I needed to see what all of the hoopla was about.  I was sorely disappointed.  Ghiradelli is a much better option when in the area and it is a San Francisco staple.  I see what brings people to this place though with the unique flavors and a flavor or two tailored to our vegan friends.  Plus, the location in the Ferry Building makes this a hot spot for a post-lunch dessert.  I liked it ok, just didn't love it.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Wow... how many times have I walked past this place thinking about buying ice cream from here and just never done it?  This place, and I guess many other stores at the ferry building.   There's a significant sensory overload at the Ferry Building, and it's hard to focus on just one location with every other place screaming out to visit them.

So this was my choice of the day, and I keep asking myself, "why not before?!?!"

The ice cream here is amazing, and though a little bit pricey, well worth treating yourself to some amazing ice cream on occaision.

The flavors change all the time, but this time while I was there I had the blueberry ice cream w stressed (great creamy natural blueberry flavor) and my parents had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese style coffee ice cream (not too sweet w an intense coffee taste).

Go back often and try everything...I wish I could have tried more that day...delicious!

Happy eating!
author: Bradley H.

description: Stumbled against this gem and was so happy! We will be back. I love the creativity with flavors and specials offered
author: Rashni R.

description: This isn't going to be a very long review like my last one but I had to write this because of how good this was.  This ice cream was in the fairy building in San Francisco and really wowed my family with their flavors. Another family member of mine and I got the strawberry basil ice cream and after eating a lot that day I was happy with how refreshing the ice cream was. It was creamy, soft and had a hint of lemon. Fear not, it's not to noticeable if your not a fan of lemon. When I tasted this it just had the flavor of lemon it did not say that it did though. My other family member got the Blue Bottle Ice Cream. They said it was super creamy and the coffee taste really came thorough with her ice cream. No wonder there was a blue bottle ice cream that day, Blue Bottle was just across from their. The only sad part is, is that the flavors change everyday so by the time you read this the might not have these flavors. But I promise you that every flavor will be rich and creamy. I hope this review helped you and now made your decision much easier to go here!
author: Molly A.

description: I was a bit disappointed by Humphry Slocombe. I think I may have had too high of expectations due to the hype. I tried the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. While they were both yummy flavors, the ice cream was too icy for me. I think some of the other SF ice cream spots have just as good flavors with more creamy and delicious ice creams.
author: Emitom H.

description: Blue Bottle flavored coffee, yes sign me up. This place is never disappointing. The staff is friendly and very patient allowing one to try as many flavors as they want. Perfect desert after sampling the foods of the market.
author: Manny G.

description: Interesting flavors, long lines, quintessential SF. I'm not a big fan of their breakfast cereal flavor but love love the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor. They always have new flavors that you can sample. Had a scoop of matcha doodle today. They also have beer and wine infused flavors.
author: Yin H.

description:
I love unique ice cream flavors and this place definitely serves some creative flavors.  I ended up with the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflake) and Brown Sugar Kitchen (brown sugar ice cream with apple jam and cornmeal cookies).  Two scoops was $6.75 and you are able to sample flavors before you decide what to buy.

The scoop size of each was generous.  I usually like to get my ice cream in a cup because a cone usually gets too messy as the ice cream melts.  I stood in line just in time because the line suddenly grew and the Ferry Building gets very crowded especially during lunchtime.  Also, since Humphry Slocombe is located right inside one of the Ferry Building entrances and is right across from Blue Bottle Coffee, it is in a prime location.
author: Julie F.

description: Amazing ice cream. I remembering being blown away the first time I came here and have come here many times over the years. I like bringing out of towners here and seeing their reaction as well. My faves are the secret breakfast and horchata.
author: Sunil R.

description:
My friends and I went down to the Ferry Building, and after having an amazing porchetta sandwich at Roli Roti, we decided to get some ice cream. I'm glad we went here because the ice cream was delicious!

I had the secret breakfast, and it tasted like a mix of cereal, a nice creamy milky ice cream, and a touch of bourbon. It sounds weird, but it all came together super nicely! It was one of those times where I wished I had gotten more, cause it was so delicious!

There is a bit of a line to wait in, but when you get to the front they let you try a few samples before ordering. I tried a bit of the Vietnamese Coffee and that was tasty as well!
author: Tyler T.

description:
This place is super nostalgic, since I used to come here all the time during high school when I wanted high-quality ice cream. Ive tried most of their popular flavors, such as vietnamese coffee and secret breakfast, and I always go for some of their more interesting flavors when I can.

On that specific day, the unique flavors, other then their usual flavors, included peppered mint chip, strawberry captain crunch, and elote. I tried the strawberry captain crunch and I wasn't a fan; the captain crunch cereal was soggy and the strawberry flavor wasn't too pronounced. I also didn't like the elote flavor, since it just tasted sour. I did enjoy the peppered mint, which had a kick to it from the black pepper. I also liked how the mint ice cream was made from fresh mint, which could be seen from the green specks in the ice cream. 

The consistency of the ice cream is always great, but some of the flavors could be more pronounced. Otherwise, this is a great option for artisanal ice cream!
author: Sandra S.

description:
I think I've found my favorite ice cream flavor ever: Harvey Milk and Honey Graham!

The honey flavor is delicious and works so well topped with graham crackers. I also got a scoop of the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor. On it's own, it's just good but try eating it together with the honey one - AMAZING COMBO.

This place is definitely on the top of my list for ice cream shops in SF!
author: Angela P.

description:
Pretty solid ice cream, but I wish there was a bigger variety of flavors. Service was also a bit messy. 

My friend and I went to the Ferry Building on a Sunday night, and I was particularly excited to try this place out. Most of the shops were closed by the time we went, but there were lines of 20+ people for both Humphry Slocombe and Gott's Roadside next door. The line moved at a normal rate; I waited for a total of 15-20 minutes.

Service was alright. There were only two servers working, and one (curly-haired girl) seemed to be busy scooping while the other (redhead girl) was taking orders. I didn't notice there was a second cash register to the left of the counter that the curly-haired girl was in charge of. I assumed Curly Hair was standing there to handle the order for the couple in front of me once the redhead, who was working the cash register to the right, told her what to scoop.

I was patiently waiting for the couple to finish ordering before asking for samples and ordering myself, until two women behind me swooped in and cut me... They started asking for samples from Curly Hair, who proceeded to assist them. I know it's not really Curly Hair's fault that the women were rude and clearly don't understand the concept of a line, but she should've communicated better with some eye contact or at least an "I can help who's next!" Besides that, the redhead was friendly and helpful.

Most of their flavors for the day did not appeal to me. They were definitely unique, but the selection seemed a bit limited. I noticed a chocolate and cereal theme going on: Secret Breakfast, Malted Milk Chocolate, Choco Taco, Oatlandish, Cap'n Crunch & Berry, etc. I don't have anything against chocolate or cereal desserts; I just prefer ice cream flavors such as green tea, black sesame, honey lavender, pistachio, and the like.

Still, I heard great things about their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor and was determined to try it. I ordered a single size in a cone, which came out to $4.50. I was pleasantly surprised that the cone did not cost extra, as most specialty ice cream shops charge at least $1 for a cone!

I'm a fan of Blue Bottle Coffee, so naturally the Vietnamese Coffee flavor did not disappoint! I don't normally like coffee-flavored ice cream (at least from the grocery store) or even Vietnamese coffee (despite being Vietnamese myself). However, Humphry Slocombe's take on making this super sweet drink into ice cream was borderline genius. The ice cream was at the perfect amount of sweetness - not too bitter like ice cream from the grocery store, and not too overwhelming and migraine-inducing like coffee from Lee's Sandwiches. Would definitely reorder!

Because of their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor alone, Humphry Slocombe sits at a solid 4 stars (rather than 3 stars due to the service and limited selection) for me. I can see why it's rated as one of the Top 5 Ice Creams in America by the Food Network!
author: Megan L.

description: They make the best coffee ice cream. They use blue bottle coffee (and I say that with my nose raised slightly indicating something snooty) and it really works well.
author: Bob F.

description:
out of bi-rite & humphry, i liked humphry's ice cream's consistency. but the flavors they both offer are so different that they can't really be compared. 

BLUEBERRY BOY BAIT - my absolute favorite. love almost everything blueberry so maybe i'm biased but this flavor is so hard to find. very creamy and i think there was pie crust bits which added some texture. the last time i had a good blueberry ice cream was last summer at molly moon's when i visited seattle. 

BLUE BOTTLE COFFEE - solid coffee taste. did not melt easily like bi-rite did and was creamy.
author: Yan L.

description: Humphry Slocombe attracted me because of all the cool flavors. Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee? Black sesame and chai? I'm in. The coffee flavor was good but the black sesame lacked the thick ice cream texture I love. And the chai was just soft and gritty. Didn't impress me ‍
author: Jessica D.

description:
Plenty of ice cream shops in SF, but what makes Humphry stand out is the ability to split each scoop, so you're getting double the value per scoop - amazing! The scoops are large too, so my 2 split scoops actually felt like I ate 4 legitimate scoops, which isn't a bad thing. The staff was great as well as they provided all the samples I wanted - Humphry is the place for you indecisive people like me. 

I went 2 split scoops and got the famous secret breakfast, the Vietnamese coffee, the peanut butter, and the chocolate. The peanut butter and the secret breakfast were a tad bit sweeter than the coffee and the chocolate, so all flavors balanced each other out. Of the four, I would say the secret breakfast was my favorite - it reminded me of Milk's cereal soft serve, except unlike Milk, this wasn't cloyingly super sweet. The peanut butter was too sweet for my liking, but definitely packs the peanut butter taste, so perfect for you peanut butter lovers. 

Definitely a stop, especially since it's splat in the tourist spot.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Arguably the best ice cream in San Francisco. There is a little bit of overhype, but with their rotating menu of flavors, constant experimentation, and staple favorites, it makes this place a go-to for the local as well as the out-of-towner. I have yet to find another unique combination that makes Secret Breakfast my all time fav here. This is my suggestion to all first timers and visitors I bring to the city and never disappoints. 

Some other flavors that I rotate in my second scoop are the Tahitian vanilla, malted chocolate, and Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee. 

This set you back about $6 which tends to be on the pricier side of ice cream, but you really do get what you pay for. 

For those looking for a classic pairing, just look right across the way at Blue Bottle. Other delicacies also offered here that may peak your interest is their bourbon caramel sauce as well as their bacon peanut brittle. Much awesome.
author: Chris B.

description:
Best ice cream in the bay. Easily. 

Order Harvey Milk Graham or Secret Breakfast. Or Golden Milk/Turmeric if they have. 

Seriously - from one ice cream fanatic to another, this place has incredible ice cream. They've perfected the art and science of ice cream making and have the most unique flavors.
author: Sela B.

description: Great location inside the Ferry Marketplace across from Blue Bottle Coffee. The ice cream is smooth and creamy. Great variety, too! Friendly and fast service.
author: Juan M.

description:
Things I like about this place:

-unique flavors of ice cream that taste good
-you can try before you buy
-servers are friendly

If you want to sit and eat your ice cream, then good luck finding a chair.
author: Monica S.

description: Ice cream was good, I wasn't really sure what flavor I got because it had an unique name to it but it tasted like salted caramel, I wanted to ask the girl more about it, but I felt like we were being rush because the line was getting long and  I think they were just over whelmed? But the ice cream was good, just a Mystery to me now because I totally forgot the name of the ice cream flavor.
author: Maricel J.

description: Loved this San Francisco place ever! I've never tried it before with my daughter (Fernanda) has not been this place before. So I tried a Harvey Milk and Honey Graham and it was very delicious, and it has Raw Blackberry Honey ice cream with house-made graham cracker cookies folded in. So I do not have any toppings, because there was nothing in this place. So my daughter ordered Strawberry  Capn Crunch, because she has not tried this flavors yet also and it has Captain Crunch cereal swirled into our dreamy strawberry ice cream. She totally recommended 5 stars just like mine as it is.
author: Tatiana V.

description:
There was a long...long wait for ice cream on a Saturday afternoon. I've had Humphrys before but from Whole Foods and wanted to give this place another try. There was probably about 20 people ahead of me, so expect a line.

Out of all the flavors I tested, even the "breakfast" flavor, I still ended up with the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee; the same one I had from Whole Foods. Vietnamese Coffee is the top flavor out of all.
author: Mary S.

description: Really good ice cream in the Ferry Building. A tad on the expensive side, but makes up for it in taste. I did the Secret Breakfast Sunday, which was 2 scoops of Secret Breakfast ice cream, with Bourbon caramel and cornflakes. Yummmmy!
author: Bryan M.

description: A great ice cream place in 1 Ferry building. I tried their harvey milk, oolong tea, and coffee flavors. My favorites were the tea and the coffee ones. So I split 1 scoop into 2 flavors. You can also ask to try few flavors before you decide. My server looked little bored and tired even though I went before noon.
author: Sarah C.

description: Really good flavors u can taste. We tried the Vietnamese coffee, sorbet, and several other flavors. All tasty and uniquely true to their namesake.
author: Rose L.

description:
Before I say anything else - the flavors and quality of the ice cream were amazing. I sampled Toast & Jam, Black Sesame, and Blueberry Boy Bait (my favorite). The Black Sesame had generous amounts of ground-up black sesame seeds in it, which gave it a rich and deep flavor.  The Blueberry Boy Bait was the closest to blueberry pie in ice cream form I had. 

However, their scoops are small compared to other ice cream places such as Salt & Straw, Bi-Rite, and Jeni's. And the service was rather abysmal - the girl serving me acted as if it physically pained her to let me sample 3 flavors, and never once smiled. Ice cream is happiness in food form, and to have it marred by an angry employee is a shame.
author: Jen L.

description:
I love that they update their website with the current selection of flavors. I had never eaten at Humphry Slocombe before despite walking by it a million times, but I happened to browse their website one day and noticed that they were offering a black sesame flavor. I've been a little bit obsessed with black sesame ice cream recently ever since trying it at Marco Polo in the sunset, so I decided to go for an afternoon walk to the Ferry Building to check it out.

I got there around 3:30 on a Wed afternoon and there was a line. We waited around 15-20 minutes before it was our turn to order.

Once it was our turn, I tried a couple flavors for the heck of it, but nothing particularly stood out to me, so I stuck with a single scoop of the black sesame in a cone ($4.50). I was honestly a little bit disappointed by it, as I could only taste a faint black sesame flavor in the ice cream but not a whole lot. Still, it was tasty and I enjoyed slowly licking away at it as I walked back to my office.

Marco Polo still holds a special place in my heart for having such amazing black sesame ice cream!
author: Dianna H.

description: Best flavors "secret breakfast " and "Vietnams coffee" its balance of right sweetness and cons are crispy n not too sweet gem in ferry building
author: Vinod A.

description:
We were finding good eats in the Ferry building and saw a lot of people lined up for Humphry Slocombe, so we thought we must try this too. We were there during peak lunch hours on the weekend and waited around 15 minutes on the line. I thought this better be good ice cream, and it was so worth it! (Except we still hung around Ferry Building and a few hours later their line was gone! But a lot of flavors were sold out as well) I highly recommend their Secret Breakfast as this is their signature menu, as well as their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. There were some cereal bites in the secret breakfast and I think that's part of what made it so good. There was a strong coffee taste for the Vietnamese coffee and I loved it! 

I love how all the restaurants in Ferry Building collaborate with each other to get this mix, such as this this blue bottle and humphry crossover.
author: Gloria C.

description:
I had previously visited Humphrey Slocombe over a year ago and my memories of the flavors were vague. I had some time to kill and decided to refresh myself with some ice cream. I went during lunch time and there was barely a line. Score!

I always try to look at the menu prior to going to places so I can hem and haw over options in peace, rather than feeling that the server and the people in line are going nuts. Unfortunately, I didn't have time to review their flavors. So I read some reviews in preparation and there were a lot on the secret breakfast. 

I sampled their tricolored matcha, raspberry and some other flavor sorbet, as well as their parallel lines flavor. The tricolored sorbet looked beautiful and it tasted like a burst of multiple tropical flavors. The parallel lines was composed of brown sugar and brownie bits. I didn't get any brownie bits and this was very sweet.
Since a long line had started forming behind me, I winged it and went with a scoop of the secret breakfast.

The secret breakfast has a very mild boozy flavor and is fabulous! Bourbon is combined with generous cornflake clusters that are embedded in the scoop. Alcohol based ice creams do tend to be on the sweet side. I wish it was a tad less sweet as they also have an additional sweet element, cornflake clusters. The cornflake's flavor wasn't able to come through more prominently.

I'm glad that Slocombe did not use an over powering amount of alcohol in the secret breakfast. Their scoops are on the more expensive side and are pretty sweet. But if you have a sweet tooth, this is a good option for a treat now and then. Perhaps, I can find a less sugary flavor next time around.
author: Uma A.

description:
I've recently been addicted to this PC video game called Fallout4 where they have mutated, two-headed cows called brahmin running around. Humphrey-Slocombe is easily recognizable in the Ferry Building by their two-headed cow logo and the lines of people.  To say they offer unique ice cream flavors is an understatement - the flavors seem like from a different planet!

We first had their excellent Azuki Red Bean Ice Cream at SF Asian Art Museum.  Here at the Ferry Building, they offered some really good flavors that melded with offerings from other vendor's offering - like an Alien Xenomorph consuming the host or Assimilation by Borg:

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - Blue Bottle is located opposite the ice cream stand and this was excellent - bold and smooth.  Why have separate coffee and ice cream when one dish works.

Cowgirl Creamery Fromage Blanc with Strawberries - Cowgirl Creamery is a popular cheese place in Ferry Building.  Making ice cream with cheese is interesting - a slightly salty taste and some granular texture to go with the sweet and smooth ice cream.

I tried a sample of their IPA Manzanita Ice Cream and jt had this interesting flavor - you still get sweetness but also definitely boozy flavors.
author: Daniel C.

description:
We've been here a number of times, most recently on a Monday afternoon.  On weekends, the line is really long but definitely worth the wait. 

My favorite flavor is "Secret Breakfast" which is a bourbon ice cream with corn flake cookies mixed into it.  We've also tried a number of the other flavors, all of which were well done (flavorful and often unique; e.g. with curry or other unexpected ingredients).

Update: We've also had the Bourbon Come Float.  It is just as good as it sounds: Two scoops of secret breakfast ice cream, bourbon caramel, and regular coke
author: Paul O.

description:
When it comes to ice cream, I trust Sarina C.'s recommendations so after passing Humphrey Slocombe's ferry building location numerous times as well as their food truck in Off the Grid in Alameda, I stood in line to give it a try. 

The line was about 7 people in but there were three people working the line so it went pretty quickly even with everyone in front of me asking to sample at least 2 flavors. When I finally got to the front, I asked to taste the secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) as well as the Milk and Honey Graham. Both were excellent and I almost got a double scoop but I'm seeing the dentist tomorrow so I opted for a single scoop of the secret breakfast. 

I can see why people rave about this place. The ice cream is creamy, flavorful, and the secret breakfast had just the right amount of cornflakes to not overpower the ice cream. They normally have quite a few flavors available and the employees were patient with people trying a few before ordering. 

If you're there for ice cream sandwiches, go early. Those seem to sell out quickest due to their limited quantity. Also be aware that there are some flavors only offered in the ferry building and some only offered at their Mission storefront. 

All you ice cream lovers, be sure to give HS a try. Even at $4.50 a scoop, you won't regret it!
author: Olivia C.

description: 4.50 for a scoop of secret breakfast! I love the crisp crunch of cereal, it gives the ice cream more texture. The ice cream has just the right amount of sweetness and "creamyness". It's highly rated for good reason :)
author: Leo W.

description: Stopped by after reading yelp reviews and there was no line so I jumped in.  After my cone there was 10 in line so I was lucky!!   Ice cream has good smooth texture with unexpected cereal crunch and true flavors.  I'm a new fan.  Next time will try bourbon caramel sauce.
author: Jodi M.

description:
Ok I have to update my prior review of Humphry since they had a problem with melting ice cream at the Ferry Building.

My last 5 visits to Humphry have been top notch. The ice cream here is as good as it gets, Honey Graham, Blueberry Crisp, Peanut Butter, the Malted Chocolate, Yuzu Cream, and even the Vanilla all amazing and just fresh and exploding with flavor, and freshness.

One of the best ice cream establishments in SF.
author: Michael C.

description:
Artisan Ice Cream with some crazy flavors!

Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is one of the many stores located inside San Francisco's Ferry Building. Me and a party of 3 came in at around 7pm on a Friday and did not have to wait at all to order. 

At Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream, there are very many different, and most importantly unique flavors. There are flavors such as Harvey Milk with Honey Graham, Maple Walnut, Coconut Sherbet, etc.

I got the Secret Breakfast (Bourbon with Corn Flakes) with a waffle cone (a MUST for ice cream), which is one of their more popular flavors.

I had mixed feelings about the Secret Breakfast. On some bites, I could not taste the bourbon at all and only had vanilla, but some bites had a very apparent bourbon taste. I thought the corn flakes were a good addition to the ice cream itself. Secret Breakfast to me is an awesome idea which combines adult themes (bourbon) but still goes back to the whimsical roots of ice cream being fun (corn flakes). My scoop this time around might not have had the best ratio, but I think the idea is great.

While the flavor of the ice cream was okay, the service that I received was not great. I felt that because I took a little more time than the rest of my party to try and decide on my flavors that the person who served me did not treat me well.

I would come here again just to see what crazy new flavors they have, but actually getting some ice cream and going through their service is something I would have to think about.
author: Anthony Y.

description:
So I can't review their Ferry Building location - but I am reviewing their food truck at Outsidelands 2017. If had their Secret Breakfast flavour before - even made it myself (thank you Williams Sonoma) but when I saw the Secret Breakfast Sunday at OSL I couldn't resist! It was a-MA-zing! So good that I didn't want to share it - not even with my son.

Two scoops of Secret Breakfast Ice Cream topped with Corn Flakes and a burnt Salted Caramel drizzle. Heaven in a bowl!
author: Adrienne M.

description:
Since 2017 began, I've become quite a fan of gelato, so the idea of ice cream hasn't appealed to me much lately. Still, with all the buzz this place gets, I knew I had to give it a shot when I was in the area. 

The line was (not unexpectedly) long, but the staff were efficient, despite everyone asking for samples, and friendly despite how busy they were.  

The flavors all have strange names, so you can only guess what they'll all taste like. While in line, contemplating the flavor choices, I gleaned that the most popular seemed to be Secret Breakfast: a curious combo of bourbon and cornflakes. Normally I don't like alcohol-esque flavors (even in desserts, especially in desserts), but I figured if it was the fan favorite, I ought to give it a try. I was not disappointed. The caramel flavors mixed amazingly well, and the clumps of cornflakes gave the ice cream a texture that really rounded out the experience. I honestly can't even remember the other flavor I tried, because as soon as I tasted Secret Breakfast, my single scoop was decided. 

A single scoop of Secret Breakfast in a cone was ~$5, so it was pretty expensive as far as ice cream goes, but it was definitely worth it. 

I'll probably be sticking to my gelaterias, but I highly recommend that if you're an ice cream fan, to brave the long lines and give this place a go.
author: Waverly R.

description: Yuzu ice-cream was great! Ask for the daily discount special some time they have pints on sale.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Wow. Just. Wow. This is certainly some of the best ice cream I've ever had. And I never would've expected it going in. I'm not much for weird flavors. I appreciate crazy in your face flavors and creativity, but I was still surprised. Even with a bit of a line, they were nice enough to let me sample a few flavors. I decided to go with two scoops - one of Spotted Dick and one of Black Vinegar Halva. 

The vinegar actually tasted like a very warm caramel! So nice!! And the sweet bread added the perfect texture to the smooth, creaminess!

But the Spotted Dick was even more amazing! The ice base was like a sweet maple. And the currants added not only a sweet tangy-ness, but a nice little burst when I bit into them! Hubby didn't think he was in the mood to get ice cream, but he did try a bite of what I got...that changed his mind! He got in that long line in order to get three scoops of Spotted Dick! I'm really glad he did, because he shared it with me!!

This place is so fantastic and I hope I can make it back on my next visit to San Fran!
author: Katie H.

description:
This place is located next to Gott's in the Ferry building. The flavors are incredible. A single scoop on a cone was about $4 and change. You can't beat the quality. My last visit I had the malted milk chocolate, my husband had the Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple, my son had the cheesecake something. All of them were creamy and fresh and delicious. 
The line was a little slow and there is no seating, but just walk out the back door and enjoy your ice cream from a bench while watching the ferries cruise in and out.
author: Kristen M.

description:
I figure if an ice cream joint is in the Ferry Building it must be good, right? Secret Breakfast flavor had chunks of ice crystals/chunks - about 4 millimeters in diameter. The kind of ice crystals that shoot pain into your tooth's nerve. Pretty disappointing.

A month later I tried the same flavor "Secret Breakfast" at a San Jose coffee shop that carries their ice cream and the texture was better.

But this review is for this particular experience at the Ferry Building location. I taste tested about three to four flavors and purchased two flavors to eat. It's alright.
author: Thien H.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe never fails to deliver. Sampled and bought a single scoop of their Malted Dulce de Leche and loved it. Perfect creamy consistency, crunchy bits of dulce de leche swirled in atop an equally crunchy cone. Arguably pricy at $4.50 but I guess you're paying for quality ingredients at this point. 

Other notable flavors: Secret Breakfast (a crowd favorite - bourbon and cereal) and Spotted Dick (brown butter ice cream with currant, brioche, salt)
author: Patricia Z.

description: One of the best ice creams we have tasted so far. There are so many unique varieties and they are all so tasty. We even got to try the beer flavored ice cream, it was fun!. Amazing quality though a bit on the expensive side
author: Ashok J.

description: We walked to the ferry building marketplace that has a lot of places to eat and shop.  I was craving something sweet and we passed Humphry Slocombe ice cream and knew I needed to get some delicious ice cream.  The only problem I had was deciding which ice cream to get.  We finally decided on the peanut butter fudge ripple in a sugar cone and secret breakfast in a cup. If your in the area be sure to check them out, you will not be disappointed.
author: Malia T.

description:
Yes this place is worth the hype and the price! I'm not a big fan of bourbon, but after sampling the Secret Breakfast,  I just had to get a scoop. I felt that the corn flakes really made the ice cream taste that much better, and gave it a nice texture.   This place has very unique flavors, and I was just going to go with the Tahitian vanilla, but decided against it, and try something different.  Which I'm glad I did. 

There always seems to be a line at this place, but it's worth it. The employee who helped us wasn't the most bubbly person, however,  he still did his job.
author: Monica K.

description:
Humphry Slocombe serves my favorite scoop of ice cream in the Bay... You MUST try the Secret Breakfast flavor!

The bourbon is highly distinguishable and pairs so well with the salty cornflake bits. 
Take a walk around along the pier, then stop by the Ferry Building to pick up a scoop of your own!

They also have a wide variety of unique flavors that are fun to try. Don't be afraid to ask for samples - the servers are nice!
author: Monica H.

description:
AWwwwww.... Secret Breakfast. Secret Breakfast. Secret Breakfast. Secret Breakfast. 

Pairs well with a cup o' joe from Blue Bottle across the hall.
author: S F.

description: The line was really long so I had to check this out! I saw this place was named top 5 Best ice cream places according to Food Network. I tried several flavors and what I like is the unique combinations of toppings. My least favorite was milk Harvey and graham. I ended up getting White Russian Black Forest cherry in a cone. I liked the cookies and cream pieces! $4.50 for a single scoop was worth it. Despite the line, they go fairly quickly although the staff were a little pushy and I felt a little rushed.
author: Jenni K.

description:
Pretty tasty, but to be honest, I was so full from the other food that I had eaten that by the time I was able to eat my ice cream, I couldn't fully enjoy it. I got the secret breakfast (rum and corn flakes). Tasty, but a little too chunky for me. 

The wait for the line wasn't bad and the staff was super friendly. They have very different flavors but they all compliment each other well. Not a bad ice cream place and the prices were decent. If I'm ever in the ferry building again, I'd definitely come here. I love ice cream, but I'm not sure that I would come to sf JUST for Humphrey slocombes.
author: Heather I.

description:
Amazing ice cream spot in San Francisco.
Located inside the marketplace, it's worth a shot venturing out and finding this place. You won't regret it. Lots of places to try different foods and desserts but for ice cream this is the place.

The selection of flavors they got...it's so vast and unique...but my all time favorite that I've tried from here has got to be their Secret Breakfast. You have to try it. It's a bourbon infused ice cream with corn flakes. Very pleasant combination of sweet, salty, savory, and ugh I would definitely come back and try it again. Ahhhhhh...

Another flavor that was pretty good was their fromage blanc with strawberry. Cheese and strawberries. It sounds like a weird flavor combination but it works.

Pricing wise it was worth it. Of course it'll be a bit pricey but what're you gonna expect if you're on vacation tryna ball out. Sometimes I like to pretend I'm rich.

TL;DR
Eat breakfast twice. Get the secret breakfast.
Odd flavors come together very well.
Don't be shy to venture out and try their different flavors.
author: Karen Y.

description:
If you can make it to the Ferry building the next time time you're in the City, give this place a try. 

It's earned a reputation for amazing fresh ice cream, and it doesn't disappoint. Be ready to wait in line if you stop by mid summer. 

Their Secret Breakfast ice cream is the best worst kept secret in town. Pair it with a scoop of their Vietnamese coffee. If you prefer your coffee warm, go across the hallway to Blue Bottle and get a nice espresso.
author: Charo F.

description: Horrible service and less and average ice cream. We arrived and the staff was talking, laughing, not paying us any attention standing in line. Multiple times they glanced over at us and didn't ask for our order. All 3 employees were talking to each other and leaning against the counter. There were 5 people in line behind me and they didn't acknowledge any of us trying to purchase ice cream even after I pulled out my debit card and sat there waiting to order. Finally someone on staff asked what I wanted and gave me the tiniest scoop of ice cream I've ever received for 5$. It was about the size of a golf ball. I will never be back here again.
author: Lisa O.

description:
I don't normally eat desserts. I'm a saccrophobe (well, at least when it comes to simple sugars). However, in the spirit of being on a NorCal adventure, I just had to try this high-rated place.
The line was pretty long, but the wait was reasonable. I decided on the coffee ice cream, which is very expected of me.
Our orders came out quick, and well made. The staff here was super friendly, and made the experience all that much more enjoyable. 
The ice cream was delicious, and it came in an equally delicious cone. I've forgotten was ice cream tastes like. But I'm still not going to have it regularly, as I'm more of a carnivore than a saccrophile.
Whether you have a sweet tooth, or not, I would recommend this place. Try em out!
author: William G.

description: The blueberry ice cream is literally the best ice cream I've ever tasted. Light and tasty with bites of oatmeal cookies. The best, most unique flavor I've ever tasted! Plus the employees were super nice too, and let us taste all of the flavors! Definitely a must try!
author: Chelsy D.

description:
After we finished lunch next door, we noticed there was no line at Humphry Slocumbe so we stopped by and got to taste the popular ice cream for the first time. The flavors were delicious, unique, and worth the hype.

The friendly staff let me taste a couple of samples and I decided on scoops of the secret breakfast and blue bottle Vietnamese coffee in a cup and my wife had a scoop of Tahitian vanilla in a sugar cone. We enjoyed our ice cream on a bench at the back of the Ferry Building. The bourbon was definitely pronounced in the secret breakfast and the base was creamy and not too sweet. The other flavors didn't miss either, most definitely top tier ice cream.

For three scoops of ice cream and a sugar cone the total was $11, but "heaping" is the very last word I would use to describe the scoops. I wanted to get the spoon in the picture for size gauge, but I had to rotate the cup to take the picture because it was half-moon eclipsing the secret breakfast. Is it worth waiting 15 minutes for 5 or 6 spoonfuls of ice cream? Yes, if you're looking for a unique flavor that you've never tried before.
author: Arthur M.

description:
Not hard to miss when walking into the Ferry Building.  There's usually a line here but they move pretty quickly.  

Brown Butter: Yes baby! The taste of delicious butter in my mouth without being judged and feeling over gluttonous.   
Secret Breakfast: Love it.  I love the crunch from the cornflakes.  Probably one of their more popular and unique flavors.

I already started buying a bunch of their pints from my neighborhood Whole Foods because I miss it so much already!
author: Jackie N.

description:
I'm... not sure what all the rave reviews are about? We paid $9 for the TINIEST 2 scoops of ice cream I have ever received at an ice cream shop... Had it been perfect, I would have no complaints but unfortunately the ice cream didn't live up to its hype.

Flavor wise, the ice cream was pretty good. We had one scoop of the Jamoca Almond fudge and 1/2 scoop of Secret Breakfast and Recchiuti Burnt Caramel Crunch.
The textures in all 3 of the ice creams are what we had a problem with. The almond slices in the JAF were pasty and had a weird, stale texture. My mom ended up throwing hers away after a few bites. The Secret Breakfast tasted only like Bourbon and I didn't taste much cereal flavor but I DID have a lot of soggy cereal bits which was unappetizing to say the least. Lastly, the RBCC tasted pretty good but the chocolate pieces in it tasted like cheap chocolate with a similarly bad texture to match. 

I'm comparing the Secret Breakfast to the cereal milk flavor at Momofuku Milkbar and at After's ice cream and it just didn't have any flavor other than Bourbon. If it had been touted as a Bourbon ice cream, I wouldn't have been as disappointed but I also wouldn't have ordered it. Maybe it's just my expectations not lining up with  reality? I just personally couldn't get past the flavorless and soggy cornflakes. 

Compared to McConnell's in Santa Barbara or places like the Bent Spoon in Princeton, NJ (both shops charge similar prices, they may be even more expensive) this ice cream is definitely not worth the price tag or the calories.
author: Sarah A.

description: Wife and I ordered the brownie dish.  Wife had the caramel sauce with vanilla ice cream.  Ice cream was good but the brownie was hard and difficult to cut into.  I had 3 scoops with the brownie.  Chocolate fudge was great.  The peanut butter was awesome, chocolate was okay and i forgot the other flavor.  Would I try them again?  Maybe
author: A T.

description:
Pros: great tasting flavors
          grab and go (pre-packed pints, ice cream
          sandwiches)

Cons: small scoops
           sugar cones aren't fresh 
           line wait 

Any weather is ice cream weather =) Saw the line wrapped around the corner, heard it was great and it was definitely worth the wait. It happened to be beer week so they also offered alcoholic flavors. The blueberry daze was delicious and had a good balance of fruit and alcohol. They also offer samples which is great if you can't decide between flavors. They have sundae and Mexican hot chocolate as well.

I sampled the peanut butter fudge ripple and burnt caramel crunch. Both flavors were good but preferred the burnt caramel. Of course I went with the double scoop in a cone for my picture snapping. I picked the milk and honey graham and burnt caramel crunch. Milk and honey graham took the cake out of all the flavors because it was creamy and had a nice sweet honey flavor. 

My complaint is that whoever scooped my ice cream put the scoops on very crooked so it was leaning to one side and was rushing to eat before it fell off the side. The sugar cone was a little on the crunchy side and didn't taste too fresh. It was about $6 for 2 scoops and the scoops were a bit on the smaller side.

They also have pre packed pints and ice cream sandwiches in the freezer if you wanna grab and go without the wait. The store also offers merch such as tshirts and pecan tarts.
author: Janelle N.

description:
Working in the financial district has its perks. Like being able to walk here and get a scoop whenever you want. They have some staples, like secret breakfast and peanut butter fudge ripple, and flavors of the month like butterbeer. It tastes exactly like the butterbeer at Universal, except it has Anchor Steam beer as an ingredient. 

What I like about this place is that they have weirdly unique flavors, like lime and curry. I wouldn't sample it, but it's nice to see a variety. Their prices are a little higher than most, though.
author: Johnny L.

description:
Wowow. One of the best ice cream shops I've ever been to! I can't wait to come back to SF just for this!

I sampled a few of the flavors, but ended up getting their specialty, Secret Breakfast, and raw blackberry honey. I don't think you could go wrong with any of their flavors. 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - tastes exactly like Vietnamese coffee. So good. The perfect amount of sweetness. Blue Bottle is a vendor across from Humphry's. 

Secret breakfast - omg. The texture and flavor of this ice cream is everything! The corn flakes aren't crunchy, but they aren't soggy either. So perfect. I read some reviews that the flavor of bourbon is more prominent with different licks. I agree, but I kinda like that! 

Raw blackberry honey - yummmm. Just hints of both flavors, but you can still reallly taste them at the same time. That sounds dumb until you try it. Lol. 

Everyone is commenting about how the workers are very friendly. My boyfriend and I both noticed that the girl tending to us did not seem to like us very much. We only tried 3 flavors and we shared the samples and chose pretty quickly. So...idk. 
I think each scoop was 4.50 each, the cone is free and toppings are 1 each.
author: Sophia T.

description: We saw this place in the ferry market building and heard so much hype about it so we decided to check it out. They had really interesting flavors here and all are pretty distinct. I sampled the elote, pepper and mint, and the blue Vietnamese coffee. I ended up getting the secret breakfast which contains bourbon and corn flakes. I can see why its a popular flavor. It wasn't too sweet and you can taste the borbon and at the same time feel the crunch of the cornflakes. Thw waffle cone was also very fresh. However, service was subpar, the person who helped us was literally rushing us. Also, for the portion, the price is on the pricier side. And it wasn't spectacular. It was a nice place to try and I'm glad I got the secret breakfast but it wouldn't be my daily spot for ice cream.
author: Huong L.

description: I had this place bookmarked for a while but at the other location. I was closer to this one so my friends and I came to try it out after we came from Exploritarium. We came on a Saturday afternoon so the line was pretty long but I thought the wait was worth it. Their flavors are all really unique and pretty good! I honestly forgot what I ordered but I know I added cornflakes on top and it was really good. I remember my friend ordered their secret breakfast flavor and hers was really good as well!
author: Alexa-Ferl S.

description:
Top notch ice-cream spot in SFO. Definitely a must visit place. I relished the choc blueberry liquor, Vietnamese coffee as well as the early breakfast flavors. Also conveniently located at the ferry terminal. I found it better than bit-rite I ice-creamery. 

Verdict - just go and soak in the goodness.
author: Umesh P.

description:
I stumbled onto this place while passing through the Ferry Building looking for some type of dessert. The decor of Humphry caught my attention and gave me the urge to try it out. Though I can't recall the exact names of the two ice cream I ordered. One was a salted type, and the other had bourbon. The salted ice cream was to die for! On the other hand, the bourbon had a very strong taste to it. Though it didn't have the alcohol burn, I wasn't a fan of the bourbon taste itself, that can reflect on the fact that I'm not a drinker. 

The employees were very friendly and was helpful with tasting and leaving you with a great experience. I would definitely come back here if I was around the area again!
author: Tony T.

description:
seriously....its about time there was an ice cream shop for ADULTS!

im totally digging the Black Vinegar and Halva ice cream. It's real and ready right now. #Halvabaloo #lickthat
author: Charlie B.

description: Bookmarked this place due to the high ratings and made a trip out there while in SF. Inside the Ferry Building, the line only took about 5 mins before I got to order. Unique flavors, but went with what everyone was raving about - the secret breakfast which was made of bourbon and corn flakes. Surprisingly, not too strong on alcohol and still can get the crunch on the flakes. I was pleasantly surprised and good nonetheless. I ended up slapping a scoop of the black sesame in my cup and I really thought it was good! (I've been a big fan of sesame ice cream, so this was a nice treat. Overall, good place to try out unique ice cream flavors!
author: Nancy L.

description:
Humphry Slocombe was a nice shop to get some ice cream that pretty much has a very small storefront to get your sweet tooth satisfied.  With it being a small spot, it is one of those order and go places.   This is perfect on those sunny and comfortable days where you can just walk right outside and enjoy it!  This was perfect for the tourist in me going around Embarcadero! 

I have heard much about the Secret Breakfast so I had to try it!  It has bourbon and corn flakes!  The combination of flavors was great!  I am glad I had tried this flavor and there were many other interesting combinations on the menu that I would love to try in the future.
author: Nobel V.

description:
Is the ice cream here much better than store-bought ice cream? Definitely. Is it much better than ice cream in other ice cream parlors? Hm....

I don't think the ice cream at Humphry Slocombe's is leagues above the rest, but you can tell it's good, quality ice cream.
