The flavors I've tried here tended to be on the overly-sweet side (secret breakfast, blueberry boy bait), but the Vietnamese Coffee flavor was just right. The ice cream here is also soft - perfect for licking and biting off a cone.

The workers here are really pleasant. No matter how many flavors people were asking to try, the workers would always enthusiastically serve them with a "sure!"

The line here tends to be long, but moves fairly quickly. There were about 20 people in front of me on a hot Saturday afternoon, and I got to the counter in less than 10 minutes.

If I'm in the area and have a hankering for ice cream, I wouldn't mind coming back to try the other flavors.
author: Taylor K.

description: So yeah, their ice creams are all otherworldly amazing, and as an ice cream aficionado, I love a place that consistently makes incredible ice cream. Though my new purpose for living is their float, made with their ridiculous vanilla sitting in a cup of Blue Bottle's cold brew coffee. It truly gets no better. I have tried their packaged ice creams you can find in a handful of grocery stores, and man, it is so much better fresh. I'm probably nuts for enjoying an occasional trip to the Ferry Building, but worth it for the Blue Bottle float!
author: Josh M.

description: They are quick and their flavors are yummy. The line was long but went by fast. I got the brownie Sunday with caramel instead of hot fudge and it was good but I wish the brownie was warmed up. They also sell pre-packed pints there too!
author: Michelle P.

description: Love the ice cream here. Wish we had it closer. Like at Hayward or something. Cause, honestly this is bomb ass ice cream. I'm usually picky with ice cream too. The, employees are super friendly also, and very helpful if they need to explain to you. About what's in your ice cream.. can't wait to come back again.
author: LeAza D.

description:
This is probably gonna to be one of my longest reviews because this place was sososo good! 1. Get the secret breakfast for sure. It's unlike any ice cream I've tried before; you can definitely taste a caramel-y, bourbon taste and it also tastes a bit like cereal and milk. My only comment is the pieces of cornflakes inside are really chewy, not crispy as expected. That's probably because they also taste like they might have been soaked in bourbon? Not sure. 
2. We also tried the peach and blackberry cobbler; it was amazing. It was so creamy and flavorful and had hints of maybe cinnamon and cobbler after you taste the berry flavor.
3. If you like to try flavors, be sure to ask for samples and also get a split scoop. This place is great that they offer split scoops! I can never try enough flavors. 
4. The cone is free!!! For the least mess and most to eat, get a cup and a cone. 

Overall, amazing ice cream!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Real little place within Pier 1. My wife and I stumbled across this place and boy we were satisfied. I got the Vietnamese Coffee and Maple Walnut; my wife, the brown butter.

First off, the ice cream is very rich and packed with flavor. The Vietnamese Coffee ice cream was strong but not over bearing. The Maple Walnut was really smooth and silky with chunks of walnuts. Overall a real pleasure to eat.

The winner of the day was the brown butter ice cream. It literally tasted like almond rocha candy which brought back a nostalgic feeling. Rich, smooth, and sweet...everything you'd want in ice cream.

Line was a little long but it goes to show how good the product it. Customer service was fast and friendly with The Bay Area feeling. Highly recommended. Cheers!
author: Klint P.

description: Yummy! Their ice creams are delicious and they offer very unique flavors. It is also an efficiently run place. You may see a line but it goes fast with one person taking orders and payments and others scooping and yelling out for you. On my last visit, I had a Secret Breakfast Sundae or something like that with corn flakes on top of my bourbon flavored ice cream. It was so good, not too sweet or creamy or melty. I hate soft scooped ice cream. The sundae was just perfect. My friends had some other flavors that they loved.
author: Jen L.

description:
Although I felt the Ferry Building was way too crowded for my tastes, I would make a trip back for the Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream. I treated myself to ice cream here after seeing their unique flavors posted. 

Although there were MANY super cool flavors that I've never seen before, I sent with a fairly simple choice of a honey-flavored ice cream with Amarena cherries on top. I'm totally a sucker for ice cream with cherries in it. My dessert was SO delicious. The ice cream was super tasty and it balanced so well with the cherries. "Yay! I'm a fan!" 

I truly think this is worth a stop if you're at the Ferry Building!
author: Megan L.

description: Not a bad spot at all, but I just wish the service was better. Maybe it was off date, but I came here with a co worker and it being my first time I didn't feel too welcomed. The young lady behind the counter seemed kind of annoyed and really didn't bring that whole friendliness factor. Anyways enough about the teenagers working here and more on the ice cream. I got strawberry with the flakes on too and enjoyed it. A bit pricey for what you get, but it was a very good quality ice cream. Would come back, but hope the service steps its game up.
author: James R.

description: On our way to get some clam chowder, our Lyft driver recommended us to this shop after we finish our meal.  He told us about how "unique" their ice cream flavors were and let me tell you, they were out of this world! Haha.  My friends and I tried a few samples before purchasing.  The flavor that stuck to me was the Salt & Pepper flavor.  Boy, do you REALLY taste that pepper! I ended up getting the Berry Captain Crunch since you can't really go wrong.  The ice cream was super flavorful and tasted like I was eating milk & cereal!  My friend got the Vietnamese Coffee and said it really woke him up LOL.  Sometimes, they change up the flavors so it's definitely unique every time I come here!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Mmmm! This was good. It was located right in front of Blue Bottle Coffee aka to the left when you walk into the Ferry Building.

I tried the Malted Milk Chocolate and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (?). Can't remember exactly what it was called, but the coffee one was perfect. I'm not a big fan of malt chocolate so that was meh, but my bf loved it.

The ice cream melted pretty fast, but it was also a hot day when I got it.

Pro-tip: Ask for the cup and just get the cone on top! :)
author: Carol L.

description: Ordered a root beer float that was completely disappointing: the drink was served room temperature, the ice cream melted completely, and it was half froth. When I asked for a top off the server was rude and told me I should buy a soda. It was a busy beautiful day in San Francisco and the line was 15 deep, but still, come on Slowcombe, I expected better.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Located in the Ferry Building Marketplace, Humphry Slocombe is a convenient stop for dessert as you stroll through the shops. The ice cream is tasty, and they have a lot of unique flavors. I tried a couple and liked them, but wasn't blown away or anything. 

I was really excited to try out this ice cream and was pleasantly surprised there was hardly a line when I came on a Sunday afternoon. I wanted to sample a few of their yummy-sounding flavors before settling, but I was a little turned off by the staff's overall lack of friendliness and hint of annoyance at having to give out samples. 

I thought their best flavor was the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee, which my brother had. I had the raw blackberry honey and peach lambic. They were okay. I would come here again if I was around Embarcadero, but it's not exactly my favorite ice cream in the city.
author: Linh N.

description: Just tried their secret breakfast flavor. Initially I thought there is rum inside it. The corn flare and the cream are well blended.
author: Big B.

description: They have a zillion different unique artisan flavors! You can't go wrong with any of them! Hibiscus beet sorbet, mulled wine sorbet, pink grapefruit tarragon sorbet are some of my favorites. The line can be long and even go out of the Ferry Building, but it's def worth the wait. It's across from a Blue Bottle, so you could divy up your group and wait for both at the same time! Haha, talk about 2 birds 1 stone! :)
author: Karen L.

description: Where do I start? Was so not expecting this place to be this delicious. I did taste 3 flavors but settled on the Harvey milk and graham crackers. This was no doubt THE BEST ice cream that I've ever had. I'm not really sure what Harvey milk is but it tastes great! The graham cracker bites were so soft and chewy in the ice cream. Just heavenly! I am only in San Fran for the weekend but I will have this at least once more before I leave. This place for sure is on the short must have list while in San Francisco.
author: Qunesha D.

description:
I scream for ice cream!  Glad this baby was at the Ferry Building when I visited because on a hot day, my friend and I made a day of it, having our own food tour and Humphry Slocombe's was sure to be last on our list for dessert. 

After waiting in the long line that fortunately, went by quickly, we were able to try all the different flavors we wanted, and will say, the flavors are verrrrry abundant.  From what I heard, Secret Breakfast was the one to try, which I did, and must confess - it was not for me.  There was just too much of different flavors going on with the bourbon, honey, cornflakes, etc... I like distinct flavors, but I wasn't sure what I should be tasting from this jumble.  However, I did find a favorite - Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  The flavor was outstanding, and really tasted as if you were drinking a creamy Vietnamese iced coffee, which I'm a fan of.  But to have the wonderful partnership of Blue Bottle Coffee, which is one of the best coffees in the world, just puts the cherry on the cake.  It was superb.  I also was able to do two flavors for one scoop, so chose Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple for my other flavor, which I recommend for anyone who loves peanut butter (like me!).  

 All in all - it's a great ice cream shop and a must if you're in the SF area.  I dig the unique flavor offerings, and they also have sundaes for anyone who wants to splurge!
author: Jacques I.

description:
This is probably my favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco!! I am a strong advocate for  anything that has ice cream in general. Ice cream is probably the one dessert I can eat at any weather,time or day. I have come to this ice cream shop around 3 times or more but every time i come here I have loved the variety of flavors and the texture of the ice cream. 

For flavors: I usually get the breakfast special (which consists of a bourbon tasting ice cream, that they are really known for) with a scoop of their seasonal/ monthly different flavors. The first time I came here I ordered the breakfast special sundae which includes two scoops of the ice cream with drizzled Carmel and cornflakes. Sounds like a sugar rush but everything actually went quite well and it wasn't too over powering with so much sugary ingredients. The other times I ordered a regular cone with oolong tea and rose. Both 10/10. 

The downside is that the ice cream does tend to melt rather quickly so I suggest to maybe get a cup if you are one of those slow ice cream eaters to not make a mess. Also test out the flavors and see which ones you like! They have a great unique variety of flavors that you can easily find a flavor that is right for your taste buds! The location is nice as well being inside the ferry building so you can walk around the pier with your ice cream on a sunny day!
author: Leslie F.

description: Oh my!  What a hedonistic indulgence this was.  Delicious beer goggles ( really tastes like beer), Vietnamese coffee, Tahitian vanill@, and psychedelic mixture of sorbets.  It was unbearably delicious.  A must for ice cream lovers.
author: Ali C.

description: I was at the Ferry Market my last morning in SF trying to get in as many good eats as I could before I left.  I chose Humphry over Blue Bottle, and to my delight, they had a Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee flavor, two birds with one stone!  Perfect!  The ice cream was perfect.  The line was long, but the workers were very efficient, and they still let me sample all the different flavors. Yum!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
I went here after dinner at the oyster restaurant right outside. I had the Matcha Doodle (matcha ice cream with snickerdoodle cookie bits) on a cone. So good! The snickerdoodle chunks were a great addition and the cream was not overly sweet. They allow you to try samples so def do that before purchasing! I wish I had written this review when I was in San fran 3 months ago but better late than never! 

P.s they have a Vietnamese coffee flavor that I didn't care for but my party enjoyed.
author: Han N.

description:
What does it even mean to say a place has good ice cream? Opinion and whim are so ever-changing as to barely mean anything at all, especially when you consider how disconnected environmental factors often deeply sway online reviews.  

But I suppose one could come here, close their eyes, and simply taste this ice cream and know it is something solid and worthwhile. After running through SF's top ice creams on my recent trip this remains my favorite.

The tin roof sundae is so simple and beautiful. As for flavors, I greatly prefer the Baracky Road, Tahitian Vanilla, and Malted Chocolate to Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee.

But really, whatever you go with will be good. This place is good.
author: Paul A.

description:
Over rated trash. Not even tripping off the price, this is SF so it's expected but damn can it at least be good? 

I sampled 4 flavors and they were honestly all weird. Flavors were too bold and not in a good way. I ended up getting 2 scoops anyway cos my kids really wanted ice cream. 

Got the mango carrot and peanut butter chocolate. I love the flavors of both mangos and carrots in general but this just was gross all around. Yuck! Very weird flavor. Felt the exact same way about the peanut butter one. It's like the 2 flavors did not mesh well at all!

Disappointed. Kids didn't end up liking it either they ate a couple spoons each and left the rest.
author: Guerito L.

description:
I'm never crazy about any of the flavors! If you're interested in artisanal ice cream and creative flavors such as fromage blanc with  strawberries (super heavy) or jalapeño corn bread - I can't get into these flavors! 

The names of their flavors are quite clever - one fave - Baracky road! 

4 stars for creativity and quality!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
You know how your mouth gets all cold after you eat a spoonful of ice cream and the second scoop just isn't as tasty because your taste buds are numb? I wish someone would invent a spoon to heat your mouth after each bite to bring your tastebuds back to optimal tasting mode. This is what I think about when I don't get enough sleep. Anyway....

Another review (number four!) from the comforts of my swivel chair and footrest made from stacked piles of printer paper. For some reason, I used to have the impression that Humphrey Slocombe's blue bottle coffee (and I LOVE coffee ice cream) was super perfect. For some reason, this time around, it just doesn't taste that strongly of coffee to me, although it's still something that I'd eat. I guess it just tastes like coffee with a lot lot lot of cream.

Other flavors I've tried are matcha snickerdoodle (deja vu much with my review of Craftsman and Wolves yesterday?), honey graham, strawberry tequila, secret breakfast, and sea salt chocolate. Matcha snickerdoodle tasted neither like matcha nor snickerdoodle (what is up with this very specific misnomer?), strawberry tequila was slushy and became sort of sticky after time in the freezer, secret breakfrast was alright-- the cornflakes were just kind of additional texture although I didn't OMG LOVE it.

I want to like this spot though, the flavors just look so avant-garde and promising! White miso pear and persimmon lychee sorbet look so delicious...just might get some tonight.... Btw, all their flavors that are available in store at any time are on their site at humphreyslocombe.com!
--

Update! I ended up getting them! Unfortunately, they are just okay. The persimmon lychee sorbet isn't too sweet, which is good, but the tough skin was ground up into tiny pieces, which is suboptimal. Don't know whether the persimmon and lychee together make a good combo, since you can't make out either fruit. It's not terrible tho. White miso pear! Yup, definitely can taste the miso, though it's mostly an aftertaste. Very verrrrry slightly sweet, but definitely more miso-y. Can't really make out the pear taste, although you can tell it's there because it's refreshing and because of the texture of the ground up pear. Maybe I'm bad at picking flavors?

--

Edit: Been back close to a bajillion times, and I can't say that my impression has changed. Since then, I've tried out a number of their summer flavors including:

Cinammon tres leches: I love cinnamon ice cream and this was not an exception. Not too sweet, which was a plus.

Blackberry honey: More like a honey ice cream, though the thought of blackberry was a nice touch. 

Elote:I like savory ice creams, and corn ice cream is super reminiscent of China for me. This was interesting, but I'm not sure I could eat a whole cup of it.

Here's your damn strawberry: Pretty standard strawberry.

Peach and blackberry cobbler: It was aite, I didn't love it but didn't hate it.

Earl grey plum sorbet: Not that sweet, which I liked. Not that memorable either though.

Hong Kong milk tea: They have the condensed milk flavor in this right, but the sweetness is a bit too much and masks the tea. 

Salted caramel cocoa nib: Eh, I got the salt and caramel part, but it didn't scream delicious to me. The nibs were a bit too large, but perhaps the point is to have something to chew on? Good chocolate flavor on the nibs.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I recommend the Butter Beer and the Vietnamese coffee. The price is expensive tho. 
The bad thing is, when I asked to take samples, the face of the server was ..."", disappointed me. Anyway, because I love ice cream so much, I don't mind.
author: Vanny P.

description:
Ummm... Delicious!  I'm a huge fan of ice cream and love their blue bottle vietnamese coffee and Harvey Milk/Graham flavors.  These 2 flavors actually partner well together. 
I went over to this location since it's about a 10 minute walk from work and wanted to check out their new flavor collab with Melissa King and they didn't have it.  But totally fine, because all their other flavors are wonderful. They have unique flavors that you can't find anywhere else and they're all very well made and delicious.  On hot days, the line here is long, but moves quickly.  I love that they're so close to work... I'm looking forward to trying the new Hong Kong Milk tea flavor.  Definitely recommend if you're in the mood for delicious ice cream.
author: Christine P.

description:
I finally got to try Humphrey Slocombe!

The flavors were a little disappointing, but I was able to choose a flavor I liked.

I got one single scoop ($4.50) of the peach & blackberry cobbler. It was fruity and creamy. I didn't like the pie bits in the ice cream, but it was still yummy! 

Another flavor I also liked was the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee.
author: Esther Y.

description:
Whenever I stop by the Embarcadero's ferry building I always have to stop by for a scoop of Humphry Slocombe  ice cream. Their Vietnamese blue bottle coffee is an amazing flavor of true blue bottle coffee and a must if you are a coffee person or not!

Their ice cream cones are also very good, just the right amount of crunch to compliment any flavor of ice cream you get!

The location and layout of the store is perfect, right inside the ferry building so you can grab a scoop and walk around the different stores inside the ferry building, or take it outside and walk the Embarcadero and enjoy the view!

Service is always perfect, always offering to let you try a flavor and any amount too.

A must try for any ice cream enthusiast and someone who wants to try very exotic flavored ice cream such as brandy infused ice cream, Vietnamese blue bottle coffee, balsamic caramel and many more!
author: Jonathan B.

description:
5 stars for the best ice cream I've ever had. Get the secret breakfast and don't question it. I have no words to describe how amazing it is but just take my word for it. If nothing else, at least sample it. 

4.25 for a single scoop, for one of the top 5 ice cream shops in the nation apparently! It's located in the ferry building which has a slew of other goodies so do visit and find something you like!
author: Nikki R.

description: We came here based on the recommendation from our waiter at Delfina. He said the French Vanilla was the best and I agree! It wasn't too busy when we arrived and there's plenty of street parking around the area.
author: Kat N.

description: Don't waste your money here. My ice cream has ice pieces inside. 2 scope for $6 , maybe I should just throw it somewhere else.
author: Suzy C.

description: This ice-cream is so good, first time here!! We stumbled across it while walking along the pier. Small ice-cream place, located inside the ferry building marketplace. There was quite a long line at times, but it gives you time to decide what you want to order. There are lots of different unique flavors choose from on the menu. When you get to the front you can also sample the flavors. We sampled a few and ended up ordering. I ordered a single scoop on a cone in the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and he ordered a single scoop in a cone of chocolate malt. It was very delicious ice-cream and not your typical ice-cream taste. It wasn't as sweet, but it was smooth, creamy, consistency, and it keeps you wanting more. This why they are rated TOP 5 on the food network.
author: Cindy W.

description: Found this ice cream place open in the Ferry Building after dinner.  Well executed ice cream.  The Vietnamese coffee I had was delicious and my wife loved her milk and honeygraham ice cream.
author: Zen D.

description:
Yummy for my tummy 
The ice cream is novel and consistent.

So much closer than Mission location

Not cheap, as most gourmet treats in the FB
author: Jana C.

description: I'm not very easily impressed when it comes to ice cream. But oh God, was this gooooood! I tried the sesame seeds and surprise breakfast, and they both blew my mind. If you are in the ferry building, do yourself a favor and try this place out. Because if they served ice cream in heaven, this is what it would taste like.
author: Trisharti G.

description: Got a scoop of walnut banana and one salted caramel. Yummmm! The ice cream was so delicious and creamy. You could really taste the milk and flavors. The walnut banana had chunks of walnut in it. Also, they let you try the flavors before you buy which is always a plus. Good and unique ice cream flavor selections. Located inside the Ferry Marketplace building. Would Definitely recommend!!!
author: Cui Cui Z.

description: Really interesting flavors paired with good service! I tried the TAHITIAN VANILLA and FROMAGE BLANC STRAWBERRY  ice creams recently and absolutely loved them both - unique and flavorful!
author: Ishani S.

description:
lots of daily flavors to try.  today, I had the Vietnamese coffee, blueberry.  weird combo but separately, they're great.  has a nice smooth texture, borderline gelato smooth.  nice dessert while strolling thru the farmers market.  

don't want to wait in line or too full to eat now?  they have ready-to-go pints in a freezer off the the side.
author: Roger K.

description:
I was staying across from the ferry building on a business trip and had a craving for sweets that needed to be filled. After doing a little Yelp research, Humphry Slocombe seemed to fit the bill.

It was nearly impossible to make my selection because of all of the unique flavors. They have a number of choices that I have never seen anywhere else.

Ultimately I decided on the Secret Breakfast after reading all of the Yelp reviews. I'm typically not a fan of bourbon, but in the ice cream it just WORKS! And I loved the little crunchies in there.

I also got the peanut butter fudge ripple. YUM!

I licked that bowl clean and would definitely order both flavors again!
author: Kristen W.

description: Got a secret breakfast cone at the ferry building, right in front of blue bottle. Kinda sweet so it's just ok for me. Not a fan yet. Would probably try other flavor next time. Coffee flavor seems like a better option for me I suppose.
author: Cheryl E.

description: Exceptionally good ice cream! Creamy & big chucks. The Carmel drizzle on top was super messy but totally worth it.
author: Ece K.

description: It was on the north end of 1st floor of ferry building. the ice cream has a great flavor but not tooooo sweet. Even the commonly seen vanilla ice cream tastes unique as compared to others!
author: Clare G.

description:
Do I believe in love at first sight?... Now I do. Well more like love at first taste.

Came here after dinner because I was craving something sweet after dinner. It was quite a long walk, and I was almost ready to give up on dessert... but I'm sure glad I didn't.

One of my "foodie" friends told me about this place, and when he recommends something it's usually really good, and this was no exception. There was a small line, but nothing that would steer you away from waiting. I didn't get my hopes up, even if there is a line, that doesn't necessarily mean the food is good. I once waited 3 hours for a hamburger that wasn't worth at 5 minute wait, but I digress.

My friend recommended the "Secret Breakfast" or the "Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee". I was leaning towards the coffee, because I had tried the coffee at Blue Bottle the other day and really enjoyed it. But when I tried the Secret Breakfast I was blown away! I've had other bourbon ice creams before, but nothing comes close as to how good this one was. And with the cornflakes to give that contrast in texture... just wow. This could be dangerous if I lived in San Francisco.

I would say the Secret Breakfast was probably one of the top 5 best ice creams I've had in my life, and now that I've found out that they ship nationally my life is over.

Definitely a must try for ice cream.
author: Kevin W.

description: Located in the Ferry Building, this location offers more reasonably priced fare compared to the other establishments in this historic building. The food is just as tasty, however, and the ice cream matches or exceeds just about every other location in The City. A rotating menu offers interesting and creative flavors alongside the traditional ones, like Dirty Chai, Secret Breakfast, and Charles Chocolate Mojito. You can get individual scoops are pick a couple and put them into a sundae. Like all the other food options in the Building, you can enjoy your food along the waterfront and Embarcadero.
author: Albert W.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream :) I LOVE ice cream and it makes me so excited to find ice cream stores that sell your not so typical flavors. 

After enjoying a savory lunch in the Ferry Building I needed something sweet for my palate. Waking around I noticed a long line for this place and knew it must be good. As I waited low and behold Yelp confirmed my assumption and knew I had to try this place. 

The staff allowed us to sample a few flavors which was really nice because we got to sample a number of really good ice creams. They have a variety of unique flavors with the typical standard flavors with a slight twist. I ended up getting the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and Tahitian vanilla. 

Their ice cream is everything I like in ice cream. Has deep rich flavors with each spoonful. It is nice and creamy with a very balanced flavor. Their Vietnamese coffee tastes just like it came from blue bottle and tasted like actual coffee. The Tahitian vanilla was a really nice sweet balance of the coffee as it had a slight malt flavor mixed with vanilla bean. It was so good. Like SOOO good!!

My only grip is that it is quite pricy, but considering the premium ingredients used I can see why the prices are the way they are. This is a great ice cream stop for a nice treat, but it definitely can't be my regular place. Otherwise my wallet will start screaming.
author: Melissa N.

description:
They are in the best location. Who wouldn't want a cup of Humphry's ice cream at the ferry building? Always a line but moves quickly. Humphry might not be my favorite creamery in the city but I do enjoy just coming here and getting my ice cream. Seasonal flavors all the time. And they make the most odd flavors. haha 

Recommend Classic **Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and **Tahitian Vanilla 
Recommend Seasonal:  **Blueberry Crisp and **Gingerbread Guinness
author: Sandy B.

description:
Great place for desert lovers. I was craving for ice cream and Yelp got me to this place. 

I ordered the Vietnamese coffee ice cream, which was creamy and delicious. 

The staff was friendly, the portion size was good and they also let you try other flavours on their menu before picking the one you want. 
The line was long at this location but it was moving pretty fast. 

They also have a option of to-go if you don't want to wait in line.
author: Simran K.

description: Ohhh yeah yup yup, say yes to this!!! Most flavors has nice salty kick to it, I think that's their thang. A bit too salty for me from just one bite so I went with seasonal pumpkin flavor which doesn't have much salty taste to it. I like that their ice cream is rich and not like sweet so sweet too sweet!!
author: Ploi S.

description: I got the Single Scoop Secret Breakfast ($4.50). The ice cream wasn't bad. I liked the little corn flakes that were in the ice cream. Some of the pieces were chunky and crunchy. They didn't taste like corn flakes but slightly salty cookies though. The ice cream was a bit expensive for its size. It was only a few inches in diameter, as shown in the picture I took.
author: Kristina M.

description:
This is one of my FAVORITE places to take my friends who are visiting SF. A hopeful meal @ Hog Island for lunch (if the wait permits), a stroll through the Ferry Building, and last stop at Humphrys to wrap it up. Cherry on top. ;-) 

DO: Get the Secret Breakfast. Especially if you are first-timer. You can't taste the perfectly crunchy corn flakes with underlying Bourbon flavors with just a free sample! I always tell myself to try something new each time I go, but 9 times out of 10, I find myself with a scoop of the Secret Breakfast. Welp. Every time is as delicious as the first. 

BTW, one scoop in a cup seems deceivingly small - The ice cream is quite creamy and dense, so one scoop ends up being pretty filling. Especially if you've been making your food journey through the Ferry Building! 

Other personal faves (limited) are the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham. If ya tryna get that IG pic, get the honey drizzle for an extra $1. Take that ice cream cone out the backdoor of the Ferry Building and take your money shot with the backdrop of the Bay Bridge. We got a winner!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
Are you kidding?

I've been a big fan of Humphrey Slocombe since they first opened their one door to the denizens of the Mission.  I would make the trip all the way from across the Bay after the real estate crash displaced me.  And now, I am sooooooo thankful they are closer and right near a Bart/Muni stop.

While their unique and sometimes whimsical dairy creations continue to innovate a standard Americana dessert, I am a forever fan of their Secret Breakfast.  There is nothing better in this world than having a world class steak dinner and then topping it off with two scoops of their bourbon infused vanilla ice cream smattered with crunch corn flakes.  If I could only duplicate this at home.

The line moves quickly so do not fear.

The Harvey Milk and Blackberry Crisp were amazing additions during this summer month.  Looking forward to what they have in store for the Fall and Winter menu  :)
author: Miika M.

description:
Every time I've come to the Ferry Building, Humphry Slocombe always has the longest lines. However, I went on a weekday not at peak hours once and was surprised that I could actually see the flavor selections. 

I tried the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham flavor which was very nice, but ultimately decided on the Oolong tea flavor. I'm a tea person so I always love trying tea flavors in ice cream. I was pleasantly surprised that the taste was so spot on and not just a vague tea flavor that some stores may have. 

The price is a bit steep, but the cute pun-y flavor names and uniqueness of the flavors themselves speak for themselves. I'll definitely try to come back to try more of their flavors next time I'm at the Ferry Building!
author: Isabel C.

description:
Mmm Mmm Mmm ... ice cream every day all day. I just wish I could have this ice cream 24/7. This is a must try stop if you are visiting the area. Their selection may look small but their flavor combinations are all unique and leaves you wanting to sample all the flavors.

They currently have this milk and graham cracker flavor that's delicious and also a blueberry swirl one and chocolate cheesecake (forgot the names). I couldn't resist, however, their black sesame and their classic flavor called secret breakfast. While the first one is earthy, salty, and so intense in flavor, the latter is creamy and sweet with hints of bourbon. Just wish the two ice creams were the same consistency. The black sesame was a little hard while the secret breakfast was melt in your mouth good texture wise.

Love love love this ice cream place.
author: Carlin T.

description:
I come here all the time for "coffee" breaks and haven't been disappointed yet!

Line in general moves quickly enough to not get too frustrated (and sometimes the line is rather long)- the staff are very good at being efficient but not rushing the customer.  This is great, given they release new flavors often and I am one of those who like to try most of them; this can be time consuming but the staff are patient enough to let me take my time deciding what I want to get.  

I'm a Harvey Milk + Honey Graham girl- I usually end up getting this one.  Love how there are chucks of graham cracker throughout to give texture to the creamy ice cream.  I've heard some people say that this one can be a bit too sweet, but maybe I just have a huge sweet tooth.  

Secret Breakfast is good, though the bourbon taste is a bit strong for my liking.  Other standouts I've had (some are rotated often so might not be there) include the Tahitian V*n!ll@, Maple Walnut, Corn and Brown Sugar Fennel.  As someone who doesn't like chocolate, I'm super happy with their non-chocolate flavors- there's almost guaranteed a new funky flavor to try for everyone.  

Highly recommend for those new to the area or those who live near the Ferry Building and need a break during the middle of the day and need some sugar in their system!
author: Audrey H.

description:
We tried out this ice cream from their truck at the Eat Real Festival in Oakland. DH got their famous "secret breakfast" flavor: bourbon & cornflakes. The flavor combo is pretty awesome - sweet with a hint of malt & corn. However, the texture wasn't the best. The corn flake clumps were slightly soggy. Goin' against the crowd here, but we wouldn't get this the next time.

The other flavor we got, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, was absolutely outstanding. Deep, complex coffee flavor with dense creaminess...so good!

Prices were a bit above average at $5 for a single scoop. Portion sizes were generous. See pics for pricing of other stuff.
author: Kari C.

description:
Overall good quality but on the pricy side.  

We got the Princess Project Float, Spotted Dick, and Malted dulce de leche for $17.  About $4 for a small single scoop of ice-cream! Normally the server will scrape at least two times to make one scoop but this shop (maybe just this server) did one small scrape only for the dulce de leche.   Looking at the Yelp pics, the size of a single scoop serving vary in sizes.  Maybe having a weight will help eliminate the inconsistency in size.
author: Shirley H.

description:
Ice Cream where you need it!

We all know how important it is to be devouring delicious ice cream on a warm day when we are cruising through a visually mesmerizing landmark building that has been converted into a public waterfront market, right?! OK, now that we agree, I suggest you enter the San Francisco Ferry Building from the right end, pick up your favorite flavor of ice cream and then cruise through the entire building. Thrust me, it is therapeutic! What about extra calories you might ask? Well you are walking, aren't you? Walk to one end from one side, do a u turn at the end and come back from the other side! That way you get to cover all the shops and you will burn the calories by the time you get back to where you started! Just remember these two tips, do not get more than one or two scoops, and do not go for seconds after you get back and you will be OK! Trust me!
author: Afshin A.

description:
Anyone who knows me and reads my reviews knows that I rarely write about an ice cream joint. 

Humphrey Slocombe is an exception. We stopped here on whim because my girl wanted ice cream. She ordered malted chocolate and I had a sample of the strawberry and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. The coffee was the winner. 

I'm not an ice cream aficionado but love coffee. This was a clear winner in my book, I only ordered one scoop on a waffle cone and wish I had ordered a double, it was that good! 

Their selection changes daily. One scoop was $4.25, but so worth it!
author: Micki M.

description: Came here at a friend's suggestion. Located in the Ferry Building (known for small eats/food shops galore - kinda like Philly's Reading Terminal Marketplace), this ice cream scoop shop is indeed quite the treat. Ended up getting a cone with 4 different flavors and I have to say, I was quite delighted to eat it all. In terms of flavors, I really enjoyed the Blue Bottle Vietmanese Coffee. Just very pleasant to taste, authentic, and quite the treat to devour. Salted Caramel Coca Nib is also quite yummy & worth looking into. Overall, a most noteworthy place to come get some ice cream. Flavors also tend to rotate from month to month although they do have some flavors that are pretty much there all year. Definitely would take the opportunity to sample those flavors before deciding what to get. They also make their own cones here which are fabulous so feel free to get your ice cream in such. Would definitely recommend to others!
author: Jack M.

description:
Amazing ice cream place at the Ferry Building. After eating a late lunch at Hog Island Oyster across the way, we knew we had to come here. The line is a little intimidating, but I think it goes by fairly quickly. The guy who helped us was so nice even when I asked to try four flavors. I tried the Secret Breakfast, Harvey Milk + Honey Graham, Cap'n Crunch Berry, and Elote. We got a double scoop of Secret Breakfast and Harvey Milk + Honey Graham.  The Secret Breakfast has chunks of cornflakes. Be careful! We encountered a chunk that was bigger than a gumball and impossible to chew. It was still a great flavor. It's sweet but salty. The Milk + Honey Graham was a lighter flavor but still very good. I didn't like the Cap'n Crunch Berry a much... mostly because the piece of cereal that was on the sample was very stale. The elote wasn't what I expected it to me. I love corn and thought I would like this flavor, but it had a spicy taste that I wasn't fond of.

I was watching the guy scoop our ice cream... and... let me tell you... he gave the most generous scoops. I was so surprised. I ended up not being able to finish the whole thing, but it was very good. It's definitely a great place to come by if you're at the Ferry Building!

*side note: You should avoid the Secret Breakfast and Milk + Honey Graham if you're lactose intolerant. I'm not too sure what kind of milk they use... but my boyfriend had a terrible tummy ache after we had the ice cream. :(
author: Teresa N.

description:
I love the creativity of Humphry Slocombe's flavors! I don't get the chance to stop by often but when I do, I tend to study the menu thoroughly before I order. 

This visit, I selected the Adzuki Almond Cookie flavor which is a collab between HS and the Asian Art Museum in honor of its 50th anni this year. I love adzuki beans and there were chunks of almond cookie in the ice cream. I was blown away by my second choice, Anchor Stream Cream. I recently toured the Anchor Steam brewery and the ice cream tasted just like the beer on tap with such a beautiful flavor from the added creaminess. I would buy a pint of this flavor! I truly appreciate the collabs that HS does with San Francisco businesses/organizations.  

I've come to this location during lunch on a weekday and the line was crazy long but moved quickly. I recently came during the evening on a weekday and the line just had a few tourists. There are cashiers on either side of the ice cream case to help customers.
author: Maya S.

description:
Delicious. Expensive. Worth it!

Mango ginger sorbet? Fantastic!
Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream? Incredible!

Modern day Ben and Jerry's
author: P C.

description:
Super long wait at all times, but at least it's in the Ferry Building now, right?

We tried the Secret Breakfast (love that bourbon and frosted flake taste), the incredibly strong Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and the Strawberry (I'm sure there was a fancier name, but I can't remember).

A bit pricey by the scoop, but one of the best ice cream shops in SF.  Gott's serving soft serve is almost as expensive just a stall down.  I'd say this is a must try snack in the Ferry Building along with the Boccalone meat cone and the Cow Girl Creamery raclette sandwich.  

Humphry Slocombe accepts credit cards including American Express.
author: Randy F.

description:
WOW, All I have to say is that I'm impressed with the creativity and deliciousness of the flavors

Secret breakfast -vanilla ice cream with a light bourbon flavor with large clusters of cornflakes embedded in the ice cream.   It made me feel very adult and felt like it was happy hour

After school special- vanilla ice cream with caramel and chocolate covered potato chips!   It tasted like an absolute junk food fest,  and takes me back to middle school,  even the slight chemical taste of a bag of original Ruffles made me feel like a kid

Thank you to the girl with the cat eyeliner for the suggestions and friendly service

This place is definitely a must try if you are an ice cream snob or a Bi-Rite lover.   It's very unique and worth a visit!
author: Tina A.

description:
I had no idea that my taste buds could be this happy!! As a huge fan of coffee ice cream, I have to say that the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor was as good as it gets. Most people come here for the Secret Breakfast flavor, who knew cornflakes and bourbon would taste so good?! The service here is superb. The line is obviously very long given the immaculate reputation of the product, but the staff is extremely efficient which was a big plus.

This is ice cream with a purpose, and absolutely made my first day in San Francisco a great one!
author: Michael N.

description:
There is typically always a line under the blue & white sign. Everybody loves ice cream, but I can't understand the reason for a line. I guess I didn't realize how many people love bourbon-flavored ice cream. Apparently Humphry Slocombe has hundreds of flavors, but they typically serve about 9 -12 of them at a time in little biodegradable bowls.

Secret Breakfast - bourbon & cornflakes:
I don't love liquor-flavored desserts or liquor-flavored ice creams, and this one is no exception, but Mr. Joy is a fan of the bourbon-flavored ice cream embedded with crunchy cornflakes. To me, the crunchy texture is the best part.

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee:
I'm always a fan of coffee-flavored ice cream. Again, this one is no exception. The texture is very smooth and creamy, with micro-flecks of coffee beans. It is very refreshing and a good pick-me-up on those hot days that just drain you.

I have been curious to try other flavors, but it's often hard to see the dry-erase menu on the tiles. Then there's the line that steers me away. $4.25 for a small scoop is a little steep, but not bad for a once-in-a-while indulgence.
author: Joy W.

description: Tied for best ice cream in the city with bi-rite. Everything is amazing. Texture, taste, flavor options, quality of ingredients. Easily one of (if not) the best ice cream shop in the country. XOXO Humphry Slocombe. I seriously love this place. Only negative is that they don't always have fluffernutter flavor ;)
author: Ryan B.

description:
I will admit I don't often have much of a sweet tooth. But adventuring through San Fran, the creative ice cream titles caught my eye and I had to stop at this small store front. Initially, I thought $4 for ice cream was a bit steep until I saw the hefty size of those scoops! The line was long but was moving fast. The servers were friendly and very efficient and even let you sample a few flavors without putting pressure on you. I tried the mango sorbet which wasn't overly sweet but had just enough flavor. 

They also have pre-packaged pints and ice cream sandwiches in multiples flavors for those you want to eat on their couch. Always a good option! Stop here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Leila V.

description: Humphry Slocombe has some of the most innovative ice cream flavors that I have ever tried! But alas, I keep going back for my favorite, the blue bottle vietnamese coffee. It's so GOOD! A good coffee flavor with the rich sweet taste that you would expect from vietnamese coffee. During my most recent visit, I got to try my friend's pink lemonade sorbet which was also really good! They have rotating flavors so there's always something new and intriguing to try when you visit. Prices are a bit steep with our total being $9.00 for both ice creams; we both got 1 scoop in a cup. Lines can also be a bit crazy, especially on the weekends. I think we waited roughly 25 minutes to get our ice cream and that was because we got in line when the line was still somewhat tame. Definitely a great ice cream place with good flavors, but it is on the pricey side.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
I didn't think I would like the Secret Breakfast flavor when reading the description, but YUM. It's delicious! Super creamy and rich flavor, with generous chunks of crunchy corn flakes. It was definitely my favorite ice cream that I tried while in San Francisco. 

While the ice cream is a bit pricey, I actually appreciated the portion size, compared to other reviews that suggested it was "stingy". I hate getting a huge scoop of ice cream that melts over my hands immediately, so this portion felt satisfying, yet allowed the ice cream to stay frozen (not a melted mess) while I ate it. 

Finally, if you don't want to stand in line, don't go during the rush hours. Try to visit during the week before or after the lunch and dinner rushes. I stopped by on a weekday at around 11 AM and hardly waited in line.
author: Nicole C.

description: Amazing ice cream. We came back twice in the three day trip to San Francisco! The secret breakfast was amazing. We also had the oatmeal and graham cracker inspired flavors which were good as well. The service is a bit unfriendly but the ice cream quality makes up for the lack of effort from the employees.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Grab a scoop on a cone, bring it outside, take a photo of it in front of the Bay Bridge, and snapchat it to all your friends that haven't blocked you yet because of your incessant food photos. 

This place has a wider and stranger (meant in the best way) variety of flavors than you'll find at almost any other ice cream shop, and has the quality to back it up as well. I really enjoyed the slight kick in the "elotes" flavor, as well as the simple goodness of the "harvey milk and honey graham". 

I personally prefer the sharper flavors of Bi-Rite and Tin Pot (south bay), but if you find yourself near the Ferry Building you'd be hard pressed to make a better choice than Humphry Slocombe.
author: Madhur B.

description:
I've always been a fan of HS ice cream and was so excited to see them open shop in the Ferry Building! It's been open for a while, but I haven't had the chance to stop by until recently. 

They carry the same flavors as the Mission location, but I'm not sure if they rotate the same flavors at the same time. I got a single scoop of a flavor I have not tried before (Adzuki Almond Cookie) while my boyfriend grabbed a scoop of Brown Butter.

Both flavors were creamy and delicious. Brown Butter is sweeter than Adzuki Almond Cookie, but I appreciated the texture and taste of the almond cookie in my scoop. 

Honestly, if you like good ice cream and if you like to spice things up, you will like Humphry Slocombe.
author: Sofia R.

description: This is the best ice cream shop in all the land!  The Duck Yeah sundae is just pure heaven!  This is always on our list of places to eat while in San Fran.
author: Kathy B.

description:
Delicious ice cream but not the best I've had. My favorite flavor is the secret breakfast which is usually available.

I also really enjoy the walk outside the building. Would recommend to friends and family.
author: Zaineb A.

description:
The best ice cream place I've tried in San Francisco hands down! Plus, it's in the Ferry Building which makes it super accessible and located in a very nice place to walk around (especially on Saturday mornings when there's a farmer's market). 

I shared a 3-scoop with my sister and friend for $8. The scoops are tiny given the price, but I guess that leaves more room in your stomach to try the food at the shops nearby. We got:

Tahitian V*n!ll@: I played it safe and got this flavor. It tastes like some very very good Vanilla Bean ice cream. Not too milky or creamy.

Malted Milk Chocolate: My friend really liked malted drinks and this one was his favorite. Unlike most other malt flavor ice cream, the malt flavor is super present here! It's also a lot richer/creamier than the vanilla and honey graham.

Harvey Milk + Honey Graham: This is my sister's and my favorite (more than just vanilla). I thought the milk flavor would be too overpowering but it's not! Plus the honey graham pieces make it taste delicious and have a cool texture! I'm gonna get this flavor whenever they have it (with addition to a few extra scoops of other flavors...maybe).
author: Sarina C.

description: This ice cream blows my mind. My favorite being the secret breakfast. The cornflakes combined with the bourbon flavor is amazing. I also love that the bourbon doesn't overpower the ice cream. It is just a hint of flavor and bourbon. The chocolate with smoked sea salt is super addicting. The chocolate flavor is super chocolatey and has the perfect compliment of the smoked sea salt. The ice cream is so creamy and delicious. It's some of the best around!
author: Megan S.

description:
i liked it, i liked it!  Quite a line to just get to order.  I liked that is was not the ordinary, handmade, hand crafted and you are more than welcome to try as many as you like before you  order. 
Many interesting flavor, very friendly help and while i was pretty much sticking to the tried and true of what i know/ what i like - i really liked it!
i had a scoop of the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and a scoop of the malted milk chocolate.  Really super good delivery on the flavor and texture.  the difference of the process between the chocolate and coffee was visible immediately and did not disappoint. 
Not a big ice cream eater but totally appreciated this specialty.  Loved it to the last bite, i would highly recommend a stop of you are in the ferry market.  You will be happy that you did.
author: Jan B.

description:
Humphrey I just can't love you, yet. You know I've tried so many times, including being treated like shit at the mission store, but I just can't. 

For your Ferry Building location the staff is great. So friendly and accommodating. I even love the images on the iPad mini you have by the register. Seeing Divine made my night. Unfortunately the ice cream didn't. 

We opted to grab a few pints since we were catching a ferry home. Secret Breakfast and Honey Graham, both sound killer in theory. We've tried SB at the mission store but didn't like it there either. Unfortunately it tastes weird and those chunky "cereal" bits are just soggy and add nothing to the SB experience. I will say that the ice cream texture is so right, seriously, smooth with a nice creamy melt. I just wished it tasted good. 

Honey Graham was going to be my saving grace. Unfortunately it suffers from the same drawbacks as the SB, the graham is soggy while the honey flavor is super intense. Some might enjoy the intense honey flavor, unfortunately we didn't. But again, the texture of the ice cream is superb. 

Because of the amazing texture and friendliness of the Ferry Building store. we will certainly come back. There's a ton of other flavors to check out, never give up!
author: Alexander C.

description:
I FINALLY got to try Humphry Slocombe after having it bookmarked for ages! The ice cream scene is so competitive in SF, but this is hands down my favorite (narrowly edging out Bi-Rite, and Salt 'n Straw hasn't opened yet). Not all ice cream is created equal, and I could really taste the quality of the ingredients. I love that they source locally- Blue Bottle coffee, McEvoy olive oil- and keep the flavors interesting. If you are a plain vanilla or chocolate person (why are you so boring?), you probably won't appreciate the weirdness. 

Per ushe, I wasn't shy about asking for samples. I tried the secret breakfast, harvey milk and honey graham, fat elvis (roasted banana with peanut brittle), and the peanut butter swirl. I had a really hard time deciding which flavor to pick, since I was limiting myself to one scoop, but my friend reminded me that I LIVE HERE NOW. No need for mental anguish since I can come back whenever I want! That made the decision easy, because I fell fast in love with the secret breakfast. I don't like the taste of alcohol at all, so I usually stay away from desserts infused with it, but this bourbon was sooooo bomb, and the corn flakes provided the perfect crunch to the creamy texture. I can't get enough of it. I'm afraid that I'll keep getting this same flavor on every subsequent visit, even though ALL of them are fantastic. 

LOVE LOVE LOVE.
author: Karen S.

description: Yummy ice cream!! I got the Black Sesame flavor - I've tried other black sesame ice cream before and those had stronger black sesame flavor. However, this one was great too! You can tell the black sesame is legit when you finish eating and have black sesame stuck all over your lips and teeth
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
As much as I love Humphry's & their delicious flavor combos this review is just for this location. My first impression was with their shop in the Mission and I had high hopes for this one as well since it's so close to my office/my experiences in the past. Being in the ferry building it's a prime location for tourists and the perfect opportunity for my coworkers to try the place for the first time. 

This location has been open for a while and even though it's in the ferry building the line for this place was non-existent which was a plus for me! I was excited since there was no rush to try any of the flavors of the day but the service was disappointing. Even though there was no line and there were two servers they seemed like they didn't want to help us/let us sample the various flavors we wanted to try. Even after we finished paying they didn't seem to acknowledge our presence. Although i'll probably come back when i'm craving my milk-honey-graham fix, this experience was disappointing.
author: Keizzel C.

description: What's a trip to SF without a stop at the famous Humphry Slocombe? There was a decent 20 minute line at 2pm. Once we got through that, we were able to try some flavors, though they only offer a handful a day. Ended up getting Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Both were good, but nothing amazing. Their cones are also pretty standard and not made by them (I think). Hopefully next time I'll get the chance to try some different flavors!
author: Ellen J.

description: Stumbled upon this ice cream stand inside the ferry building, after a a eating binge around the pier area. Already stuffed and not much of a sweets person, something drew me over here. Was it the unique ice cream flavors on display or was it the line that was at least 10 deep? Either way, I'm so happy that we found room in our overstuffed bellies to give it a try. Staff was friendly and informative and willing to let you sample whatever your heart or tastebuds desired. I sampled the Vietnamese coffee which was so rich and smooth and tasted exactly like the flavor of Vietnamese coffee. Go figure. But after sampling the pumpkin hazelnut.... yum! I was sold. Not only rich and decadent, but it had a crumble like texture folded in the ice cream. Simply amazing. Price is on the higher end at 4.50 a scoop, but trust me... it's well worth it
author: Paul N.

description:
Cute place! Awesome staff who lets you try everything you want! But don't get too greedy! I asked a staff member for a recommendation. She gave me her thoughts and said I can try both! I already knew I wanted the Malted Milk Chocolate, but I wanted 2 different flavored scoops! She let me try the Wicked, which was green tea with white and black cookies and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. They were both good, but I chose the coffee hoping it had some caffeine to keep me awake tonight! (I rented 2 movies from redbox)

Each flavor had a strong taste of the ingredients which was great! 

2- 2 scoop ice cream on a cone was $13.00. I would of thought that was expensive, but it was really worth my money! Yum!
author: Darlene M.

description:
Come here during the week not on the weekend, unless you're okay waiting for 30 minutes for the most expensive yet delicious ice cream of all time! 

All their ice cream is great but the Secret Breakfast is where it's at! I could swim that in that ice cream it's that good. It is really sweet so skip the secret breakfast sundae it just ruins the flavor.
author: Mal L.

description:
Kumquat poppy seed flavor was amazing here! So amazing I came back for a pint. 

Secret breakfast was underwhelming for me. It doesn't even compare to the milk and cereal flavor from After's ice cream in SoCal. 

I appreciate that they have unique, seasonal, and themed flavors! I came here around the time they had Wicked playing at the Orpheum. They had a flavor called "Wicked." It was basically green tea ice cream with black and white cookie. 

I liked their blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor. It's pretty rich in coffee flavor! It wasn't stellar though.
author: Dianna C.

description:
Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink):
1 star:  Never again.
2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back.
3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad.
4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return.
5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.

Really, one of the great ice cream houses in the country.  Flavor combinations to arouse and astound.  The ice cream is creamy, not icy, or too hard, or too soft.  Nice texture.  The flavors ring true without overpowering or overwhelming.

My go-to is typically the Secret Breakfast.  Bourbon ice cream with corn flakes.  Awesome.  Classic flavor combos.  Makes the brown liquor lover in me giddy.

This past trip, had a scoop of black sesame and a scoop of oolong tea.  Both were great.  The black sesame was sweet but just a couple ticks shy of savory - a great sweet, nutty, milky flavor combo.  The oolong tea tasted just like oolong milk tea.  You can taste the tannin, tempered by the sweetness.  It smelled like a good tea.

Humphry Slocombe does it right.  All the time.
author: Rich B.

description:
Unusual flavors, but yummy ice cream! Love that they have unique flavors like The Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and cornflakes...not so secret now, are ya?), Jalapeño Cornbread, and Harvey Milk + Honey Graham, which are all sooo good! 

Though I'm not a fan of the ice cream's softness. Sometimes it seems a little melted when I get it. I probably wouldn't get it in a cone as I imagine it would drip everywhere. Kinda pricey, but the place is located in the ferry building where everything is pretty much $$$. Nevertheless, it's still an awesome scoop of ice cream. 

You gotta try the Harvey Milk + Honey Graham! *heart eyes
author: Meghan J.

description:
Located inside the Ferry Building. Lines are long but worth the wait. Flavors change daily, but the must-try is the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes). 

My friend and I shared 3 scoops: Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (my second go-to), and the most interesting and unexpectedly delicious flavor, Watermelon Salted Sorbet. I don't usually like sorbets, but this was refreshing, and the added touch of salt really enhanced the flavor. We also sampled the Honeydew Sorbet (liked this as well) and the Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple (more decadent). 

I have yet to see in person the more outrageous flavors that are listed on their website, such as Foie Gras or Prosciutto. I wonder if anyone would actually order those.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Flavors: 
-Tahitian Vanilla: Call me basic, call me boring... this stuff is magical. My favorite HS flavor. Probably one of the best renditions of vanilla bean ice cream I've ever stumbled up... probably! I like it because it's versatile, even though it's "plain," so they say. You can easily pair it with any of the other flavors without compromising either ice creams flavors. It's rich and creamy and that's what I look for in vanilla ice cream, another thing, you can truly taste the bean... I want to say I can tell they aren't using extract and they're using high-quality beans, but I don't have proof other than my senses. Speaking of senses, the smell is pretty strong & amazing. 

-Secret Breakfast: Want a guilt-free breakfast, this one's for you. HS ever so popular and signature flavor. I do like it, it's extremely robust and noteworthy. I've never really seen anything like it, but it's just a little too bourbon-y for me. Not a fan of bourbon and this flavor has a healthy dose of bourbon flavor. I do enjoy the texture a lot and it's worth trying, just not for me.

Service: Cordial and patient, but don't take forever. It's good to scan the menu before getting into the long line.

Price: Considering location, flavor and quality - the price is very reasonable. Their flavors and extremely unique and the quality is premier. Definitely worth trying & coming back and trying some more.

Ambiance: Obviously not as large as the original location, but even the Harrison location doesn't provide a lot of seating. I'm a firm believer that ice cream should be portable & consumed on the go. Clean and vibrant atmosphere overall.

Overall: Admirable ice cream flavors! There is a reason why various outlets have listed HS on the "Best Ice Cream Shops in America" for numerous years. Definitely one of my top three favorite ice cream shops in the city. I highly recommend it.
author: Astrid Z.

description:
Not overly impressed with this ice cream shop. Their flavors were extremely rich and the cashiers weren't very friendly. I understand you work in the ferry building with a lot of foot traffic, but pushing aside one guest to help another doesn't look good at all. I do love how they use metal spoons for tastings - reducing waste one sample at a time. 

My mom got their money shot and I got the tin roof. The money shot was overly rich in the caramel flavor. I could only enjoy a bite or two before it gets overwhelming. The tin roof was decent, but unfortunately the Vietnamese coffee flavor doesn't taste much like coffee. The fudge was DELICIOUS, but it was countered by waaaaayyyy tooooooooo much salt. I'll definitely try this spot again when they change flavors and hopefully it will change my review
author: Courtney A.

description:
I thought this was just ok.  Located in the Ferry Building of SF, it was a hot day so was really looking forward to walking around with an ice cream cone.  

The line was pretty long at this location but I don't think it was worth the wait.  The ice cream ended up being very melty.  I had initially wanted a cone but due to the consistency, I opted for a cup so that I wouldn't have to deal with melting issues.

I think the taste was ok, the portion was a little small, nothing too crazy here.  I had better ice cream in SF and so this was just ok for me.  A little too melty for me and didn't really legitimize the cost or wait.
author: Matt K.

description:
The ice cream here is so good! The Secret Breakfast is surprisingly so good! The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee is also really good. I was pretty amazed on my first time trying Humphry Slocombe ice cream. I've always seen the long lines at this ice cream stand inside the Ferry Building, but I always thought they were just an ice cream shop. But tasting is believing. I'm now convinced it's one of the best ice creams I've tried. The ice cream here is creamy, delicious, and full of flavor. The Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes) really surprised me. Just from reading the description, I didn't even bother to sample it. But lucky for me, my friend ordered it to share and it was really good! The bourbon is tasty and the corn flakes add a nice crunch in the ice cream. Who ever would have thought those two ingredients together would make such a great combo? The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream was also very delicious and had great coffee flavor. 

I went in not expecting much, but I came out blown away at how good the ice cream was. The lines here are usually longer than their competitor, Gott's Roadside, just a few feet away, but it's definitely worth the wait in line. Food Network names it Top 5 Ice Creams in America and yes, I believe it's up there. If you are looking for excellent ice cream in the Ferry Building, this is it.
author: Jean S.

description: The ice cream here is super unique and it also tastes delicious. There's a long line but it's worth it for the unique flavors, I like this place more than Bi-Rite in case you're trying to decide between the 2
author: Apoorva D.

description: This ice cream vendor had a long line up but moved quickly. I ordered the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream. I am a big fan of Vietnamese coffee and this was very similar in flavor- pleasantly surprised! However, a friend ordered the cold brew float and was disappointed. Since there was no carbonation from cold brew, there were no bubbles forming a foam at the top. Also, this float only offered one scoop of ice cream whereas the other float option offered two scoops.
author: Angela M.

description:
Located in the Ferry Building, you'll usually see a line for this spot. The wait isn't bad, especially compared to the wait for Bi-Rite. 

I've tried the Secret Breakfast that everyone raves about, as well as the Black Sesame. If you enjoy a hint of rum, you'll love the Secret Breakfast! I actually prefer the Black Sesame as it is less sweet, but equally creamy and filling! Do taste test if you can't decide which to get! I also noticed they rotate their flavors for variety. 

Tip: If it's nice out, grab your ice cream and head to the back of the building. You can enjoy your ice cream with a gorgeous view of the Bay Bridge!
author: Kristi T.

description: Kudos to those who are daring and think outside the pint so if I could I would high-five the flavor creators of Humphry Slocombe for inventing some insanely delicious ice cream. Secret Breakfast is a mix of bourbon and cornflakes, and quite frankly, oddly satisfying. Normally, I would steer away from flavors like that because my taste buds would get so confused and reject immediately but this time around, I thoroughly enjoyed this funky combo! Persimmon lychee sorbet is, not surprising, tasty! Place offers samples so try a few flavors and get yourself a sinfully wild cup of heaven.
author: Helen C.

description:
Regularly different flavors? Um, yes!

I ordered 2 scoops the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and it was delicious. I'll definitely be back.
author: Stacey D.

description:
Service - Bad. They looked bored, annoyed, and the closer I walked toward them, the more irritated they seemed. Sorry, I thought you served ice cream, not attitude?

Secret Breakfast - Excellent. It made up for the service. The cornflakes and bits and pieces embedded into the ice cream was amazing. They could just serve this flavor only and they would still be in business. 

Persimmon Lychee Sorbet - Light and refreshing, but was no match against the Secret Breakfast.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description: What can I say? It's cold creamy goodness and worth the money, but maybe not the time. My friend got the blackberry honey and I got their classic cereal and milk. Both were delicious and I thought a small scoop was enough to satisfy my sweets tooth craving without making me feel like I ate too much. Location is great as well! :)
author: Mimi A.

description:
Took a break from Pokemon hunting around the Ferry Building and my friend wanted to try this hyped up ice cream place. The line gets really long and it took around 15-20 minutes to finally get to the cashier. To kill time, we were playing Pokemon during the wait and I found an Exeggutor, so that made up for the long wait..ahah There are unique flavors to try from this place and you can always sample as many as you want! I'm a person who loves to try new things and decided to get Salted Watermelon flavor which was pretty good. Always get the Vietnamese coffee flavor when it's your first time. 
-1 star for the small portion of a pricey single cup and long @$$ line 

Overall, the ice cream was well-made and I enjoyed my experience here :)
author: Judy M.

description:
I stopped by the Humphry Slocombe in the Ferry Building while my husband got coffee at the Blue Bottle stall right across the hall. I like coffee just fine, but ice cream seemed like a more opportune afternoon treat.

There was a short line, but it moved quickly. Service was friendly and fast, and I did a bit of sampling. I tried the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham, the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and the carrot mango sorbet--all good, and there was my taste of coffee. I knew all along that I wanted the Secret Breakfast, and I supplemented with a scoop of the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham.

I'd only been to Humphry Slocombe once before, the Mission location in 2010, but I remember loving the place, and other than the atmosphere--the Ferry Building has its own atmosphere, and it doesn't really get overridden--this one was no different. The ice cream was creamy and lush, and I loved the innovative, delicious flavors. I think the Secret Breakfast is the flagship flavor, if there can be just one, an utterly irresistible mix of whiskey and cornflakes, a perfect combination, at least with a whole lot of milk fat. The Harvey Milk & Honey Graham was exactly what I wanted--the sweet, simple luxury of milk and honey, with some graham cracker for texture.

I don't live in the Bay Area, but I'm up here enough that I hope to have Humphry Slocombe once in a while. Now that there's a location in the Ferry Building, which is easy to visit for out-of-towners (especially if you happen to be super into Pokemon Go long after most have lost interest), I'll probably get my scoops more often than twice in six years.
author: Steph C.

description: I got the Earl Grey Plum sorbet flavor and it was so good for the first few bites. There was more of an earl grey tea flavor than plum. The taste of the sorbet seemed to fade away the more I ate it, but nevertheless the flavor was so unique! The line was pretty long on a Friday afternoon. I would get it again if the line wasn't so long.
author: Christine Y.

description:
Quite expensive for ice cream O___0

I opted for two scoops anyway because I rarely come to this area. Apparently their secret breakfast and coffee favor are a good pair. I was hoping for something sweet but the secret breakfast was clearly the opposite.
I went for strawberry and coffee. Their strawberry isn't as sweet compared to other shops. I'm assuming they use real strawberries to make their ice cream which explains the bland taste ? 
Really strong coffee flavor! It's actually blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. Vietnamese coffee is stronger than your ordinary coffee from Starbucks or Peet's so that explained the rich flavor.

Would I return again? Hmm, maybe in a couple months? I'm not use to spending $6.5 for two scoops of ice cream ;/
author: Danae L.

description:
I love that Humphry Slocombe does not shy away from bold flavors, and I so love bold flavors in my ice creams, so really, HS and I are a perfect match! 

My favorite flavors here are the Secret Breakfast (the bourbon is wonderfully unmistakable), the Black Sesame (strong sesame flavor) and the Butter Beer. 

On this particular visit, they had a Jasmine Lychee flavor. I decided to have it with the Black Sesame.  Yummy! I hope they have the Jasmine Lychee next time too! 

Yes, their ice creams are on the softer side, but small batch ice creams with no additives to make them hard are naturally on the softer side. Their ice cream are as good and flavorful as the ones I've made at home using the best ingredients possible. 

If you are in the city, save room for dessert and try their Black Sesame if you've never had it! You'll be a Black Sesame lover for life!
author: Hazel C.

description: Unique flavors. Fabulous servers.  I was disappointed because I checked the website for flavors and hey didn't have the ones I saw on their site. But it was good anyway.
author: Wendy D.

description: Secret breakfast is indescribable of how great it is,it is so spectacular I can't put in words,just amazing!!!!!!!
author: Edward M.

description:
I love love love Wicked (matcha green tea ice cream with black & white cookies). I hope the flavor becomes permanent, but if it doesn't, you have until the end of March to taste the best ice cream flavor ever. Please make it a permanent flavor! If not Wicked, I love the Harvey Milk and Honey! The taste of bourbon in Secret Breakfast is a bit too strong for me, but a lot of my guy friends like this flavor.
Line gets long, but it'll all be worth it when you try Wicked.
author: Annie S.

description:
Pretty good! Finally got to try it and waited only about 10 minutes in line!

Got two scoops of Secret Breakfast in a waffle cone. Only problem I had with it is that it seemed like it was melting so fast, I had to eat it pretty quickly or it would drip down my cone.

The Secret Breakfast if good, I can see why it is a favorite. Can really taste the bourbon!
author: Elijah B.

description:
This is one of my top ice cream spots ever!
Their ice cream is so delicious! It's hard to say no!!
Malted milk chocolate, blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, secret breakfast. So good!
author: K S.

description: Nice people who work there. The ice cream was meh. I  tried the Viet coffee and it was just normal coffee ice cream. The strawberry rhubarb definitely was good. Very strong rhubarb taste that I was looking for.  The serving size for the price point I think is high but if you're touring SF it's worth a try.
author: Lily Z.

description: You can find super unique flavors here but I just went with their Vietnamese coffee and it didn't disappoint! It was perfectly sweet and creamy, just the way I like my ice cream!
author: Grace M.

description:
I tried a few different flavors from this ice cream shop. But my favorite was the sesame flavor-! I usually go for coffee but i gave it a try and I loved it-!

They change their menu constantly so they may not have the flavor you like next time you visit.
Hopefully I will be able to try their sesame flavor again-!
author: Jang R.

description: Humphry Slocombe is an SF institution with some of the most unusual flavors I've ever seen! Feeling fruity one day while stopping by the Ferry Building on a summer afternoon, I got a single scoop of the blackberry/peach cobbler and the Earl Grey sorbet--while the sorbet was light and melted extremely quickly, the cobbler was nicely creamy, though the flavors were quite muted and indistinct. At $4.50 for a single scoop, however, the ice cream was quite overpriced for what you get. As far as SF goes, my vote still goes to Bi-Rite!
author: David K.

description:
Really awesome ice cream here at the ferry building.  Lots of people had the same thing in mind as the line was almost out the door.  This is a ferry building must visit.  This was my second visit here and I got the Secret Breakfast and the Cabaret.  

I shied away from the Secret Breakfast last time thinking that it was some sort of alcoholic concoction since it mentions (bourbon and corn flakes) but it was a great consistency and had good texture to it.
The Cabaret must be a seasonal flavor since the musical is in town and they're running a promo of some sort.  The ice cream has smoked pineapple with green chartreuse.  I had no idea what green chartreuse was, and I still have no clue what it is, but I do like pineapple.

I got the ice cream in a bowl and it was a bit on the softer side, so that doesn't leave much opportunity to savor it since it was going to be a puddle of cream sooner than later.  I can't wait to try some more flavors next time
author: Jeff L.

description: Excellent ice cream! Tried the honey milk something and girlfriend got the peanut butter one with brownie and a chocolate hot fudge top. Man, this can't get any better!
author: Rodrigo F.

description:
Dear Humphry.

All I gotta say is... give me my secret breakfast. give it now! 
I would eat this ice cream for breakfast if I could. It's just so ridiculously good.

Why is it that if I have time to kill before going on the ferry (particularly if I missed the ferry and waiting for the next one).. that I somehow manage to always drift down the ferry building... all the way to the end where you sit. I know in my head as I start walking down the ferry building that if I keep walking.. I will end up near you.. and I will be drawn to you... and I will eat you... despite knowing how much fat and calories I am consuming but should not be... and yet as I walk down that beautiful building... I rationalize that I am just taking a walk, or that I am in SF so I must just enjoy what it has to offer in this beautiful building.. oh look at those balsamic samples or oh let me see how much those oysters that I would never buy costs.
