There is always so much to keep me distracted and before I know it, I am holding you in my hands. Not just one of you but two scoops. WHY.

If only you were a bit cheaper. those scoops are definitely got the SF premium on them. But that speaks to how good you are that I've bought from you anyway.

Until next time I have time to kill before my ferry and just want to innocently walk thru those halls...


ps. "thank you for a friend" flavor was really good too!
author: Paul L.

description: It's a great place for ice cream, but it's expensive and the way they make coke floats they put in ice cream first instead of coke ,so you get more foam then coke. Also the Asian lady rings takes minorities money first,but whites customers she makes ice cream order first .Its still a great place .
author: Terance C.

description:
Don't be scared by the line-- it moves very quickly. They have interesting flavors, some of which I don't quite care for, but interesting nonetheless.

I got the salted caramel with cacao nibs, and added hot fudge and salted caramel. It was delicious, and hit the spot, however I can't quite justify going here because of the high prices! It was good, but not THAT good that I'd want to spend $6.50 on a measly/TINY scoop of ice cream with some toppings. Each added topping was $1. So for $1 you can get Frosted Flakes on your ice cream. The margins must be ridiculous at this place. And as I mentioned already, the portion size is great if you're trying to be on a diet. Although, if you're really trying to spend you can head to the confections store right next door and get a $5 bag of 5 Swedish fish. Totallllly worth it lol.
author: Jin C.

description: I had the double scoop of ice cream here and shared it with a friend. It was my first time here. The ice cream is pretty good and the prices are comparable to most ice cream spots.  We had the Chocolate and Harvey Milk ones. Don't quite remember the proper names. I really wanted to try the Vietnamese coffee flavor, but I'll wait until the next time. It's quite a popular spot, as there was a line and then even more people who were standing around eating their ice cream.
author: Andrew S.

description: K.P was scoop'n it up! Delicious ice cream and service to boot!  Thanks for making the Marin Music Festival even sweeter!
author: nancy h.

description:
Bourbon Coke Float is all you need to know.

The ice cream sammich was good my client said.  Also someone got the secret breakfast sundae.  Looked amazing.
author: Drew O.

description: The best ice cream in San Francisco! Smooth, creamy and delicious. There is always a long line but it is well worth the wait. Make sure you stop in for a scoop when you are in the Ferry Building.
author: Dave G.

description:
Yum yum yum! I've been dying to try this place for the longest time and I finally got the chance to! This shop is located inside the ferry building. Lots of flavors for you to sample and choose from. My favorite and possibly all time favorite is the vietnamese iced coffee. The texture was perfect. It didn't melt too fast in your hands and wasn't soft like gelato. It was thick and the flavor was on point. It really did taste like you were drinking vietnamese iced coffee. The only thing I didn't like about the experience was the recycled cups. At the end when the ice cream melted, the cup gets very soggy and wet. Good thing there is an easy fix to that: next time I'm getting a cone! Definitely coming back again soon!

Price: $4 for one scoop and $6 for two scoops!
author: Amy T.

description:
Masterpiece.  That's the only fitting word to describe the Peach Melba flavor.

Humphry Slocombe has a small variety of unique an creative flavors that periodically changes.  While the quality of the ice cream is good overall, it's the Peach Melba that sets itself apart and is truly on another level above the other offerings.  The Peach Melba contains peach and apricot purees, combined with a raspberry jam and a neutral ice cream base.  Using seasonal stone fruits during summer is already a plus, but the concentrated flavor of purees intensifies those sweet flavors.  The raspberry jam adds a tartness that complements the sweet peach and apricot sensations and makes your mouth begging for more.  All of this is held together with a soft, creamy base, which is perfect for several reasons.  First of all, it doesn't complicate the product by adding in another flavor.  Secondly, the soft texture allows you to taste the ice cream immediately as opposed to the initial burning sensation of hard ice cream on your tongue.  It's a subtle characteristic, but one I appreciate in my cold desserts.  Put it all together, and you have a wonderful experience worth the wait.


Food:  5/5
Service:  5/5 or N/A
Presentation:  5/5
Ambiance:  N/A

Rating (70% Food + 10% Other) = 5/5
author: Derek C.

description:
Of the 4 times I've flown to SF in the past year, I always make it a point to stop here for handcrafted ice cream, particularly after indulging in delicious clam chowder at Hog Island Oyster Co.

Although Humphrey Slocombe is located right across from Blue Bottle Coffee, I usually pass on their coffee and end up getting the BBC Vietnamese coffee flavored ice cream at HS instead. I also recommend the black sesame, although a lot of people like the secret breakfast (bourbon flavor). Two generous scoops ($6) of two different flavors are enough to share, as the texture is very creamy and dense. You can try many flavors, but they'll run out of certain ones if you drop by later in the afternoon. In comparison to Bi-Rite, I prefer Humphry Slocombe because the flavors aren't too sweet and the consistency was better.

The line snakes around quite a bit, but moves fairly quickly and is definitely worth the wait. The staff are pretty friendly, but this place is no-frills with a whiteboard door as their menu (on the side).
author: Christina T.

description:
Ice cream is one thing I'd always have room for, no matter how much I'd eaten beforehand. (Usually)

I love that Humphry Slocombe is in the Ferry Building because now I find myself paying a visit whenever I end up in here.
I've always gotten the single scoops ($4.25), and you're free to sample some flavors you're interested in.

Their popular flavor is the secret breakfast, which is flippin' delicious with its unmistakably bourbon flavor with cornflake crunch, giving it a nice and fun texture.
The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee is also a choice here (and one I'll probably get when I'm back), the coffee flavor is very apparent and strong.
Another one I'd tried is the Brown butter flavor. The flavor is slightly salty but pretty sweet with a buttery tinge! To take it up a notch, I'd suggest adding the cornflake crunch topping to give it texture.

Try it when you're in the ferry building- ya can't go wrong with ice cream!
author: Mary F.

description: My favorite ice cream in the Bay Area.  I recommend blue coffee Vietnamese ice cream and secret breakfast.   Whenever I'm in the city, I must stop by. It's worth waiting in line.
author: Karen D.

description:
I'd scream for this ice cream! 

First off, the flavors are super creative and one of a kind. Major bonus points for the wide variety of flavors! I sampled the guinness gingerbread ice cream, secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes), and persimmon lychee sorbet. I ended up getting the guinness gingerbread ice cream and would highly recommend it. But just look at the flavors! Have you ever had something as creative as bourbon and cornflakes!? I've eaten TONS (and that might actually be an understatement) of ice cream, and I've never encountered such a flavor. I wanted to sample it just for fun and because I thought it'd be interesting. But it was more that that, it was actually delicious. All the flavors I sampled were very well done, and not weird. 

Additionally, the staff is nice and put up with me sampling three flavors. They also gave my friend and I complimentary water, which we appreciated.

Cone is also good. It's high quality and not stale.

And lastly, they have a funny novelty shirt that I was tempted to buy. It said "lick it. love it." I found it hilarious and just thought I'd mention it here if anyone wanted to buy one and tell the world how much they love their ice cream!
author: Julie L.

description:
Of all the organic ice cream parlors I used to scream for ice cream, Humphrey Slocombe has been and forever will be the one I scream the most.  That leaves Xanath Ice Cream second and La Copa Loca third.  Both ice cream parlors are still my favorite places to buy healthy and more flavorful ice creams.

Humphrey Slocombe has random variety of fruit and vegetable ice cream flavors.  One thing that had me scratching my head is whether or not the fruit I tasted here is different from the same fruit that is grown in a different soil.  For instance, both "Dirty Girl" and "Here's Your Damn" strawberries tasted the same to me.  I've been enjoying ice cream in all my life and I haven't had time to find out where the fruit flavors come from.  So, I scream for Candy Cap, one of the unique flavors.  There was never another mushroom flavor besides Candy Cap.  If I feel like it, I might come by to see which flavors pop up.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
COME for eating amazing ice cream, waterfront.
LEAVE because you don't like amazing ice cream, waterfront.

I had heard, like you, of the "secret breakfast." Cornflakes and bourbon. "Weird," you might say. And yet, it's delicious! It really works. Crispy and creamy, full of flavor. I love this stuff. In a way it reminds me of an oatmeal cookie. I'm making this weirder, huh?

Other favorites?

Jasmine lychee
Roasted milk chocolate rosemary

Both so floral and distinct. This kind of mixture pushes boundaries without breaking them. Approachable without being scary. Instead, highly rewarding. If you're the sheepish type, this kind of tasting might open you up a bit.

If I were to give a point of improvement, it was a bit icy. This could have been specific to the day, that shipment, that batch. Who knows. I've been back a couple times and it has certainly been better - so I'm going to chalk it up to a bit of variance. Ok, I'm done being pretentious. Go eat it.
author: Ardie Y.

description: EXCEPTIONALLY GOOD ice cream, and we should know.  We are ice cream fanatics. And, being from New England, we know good ice cream with all the local dairy farms and homemade ice cream stands.  We tried the Malted Milk Chocolate, Here's Your Damn Strawberry, and the Secret Breakfast.  They were ALL EXCELLENT!  I had the Money Shot which is the Secret Breakfast with their Bourbon Caramel sauce.  Now, I LOVE bourbon, BUT this was TOO MUCH bourbon flavor in the caramel.  The ice cream would have been better without "the money shot."  GREAT PLACE! A MUST STOP!
author: David L.

description:
Found inside the Ferry Building on the far left end, Humphry Slocombe is a great place for anyone craving ice cream! The lines move relatively fast, and the workers are nice and patient enough to let you try the flavors despite the crowd.

That was definitely a good thing, considering I was so unsure what to get. They offer unique flavors that kind of make you question the taste, but when you actually try it, you're sold on it.

Such a unique ice cream flavor includes the popular Secret Breakfast ice cream, which is bourbon infused vanilla ice cream with cornflakes. It seemed really questionable at first, but after trying it I knew I had to get it. You can definitely taste the bourbon, yet it isn't an overpowering flavor. The cornflakes help out with the taste as well.

I also had the Malted Milk Chocolate ice cream with the Secret Breakfast. Two flavors you don't necessarily expect to go great together, actually work well together. The rich chocolate taste of the malted milk chocolate ice cream balances well with the bourbon infused ice cream of the secret breakfast.

Humphry Slocombe is one of the best ice cream places in San Francisco! I implore you to try it if you have not. It is absolutely a go-to place next time I'm in the Bay Area!
author: Christopher G.

description:
We decided to give this place a try on a Sunday afternoon, and the line was very long!  We probably stayed in line for 10 minutes or so.  

The ice cream was delicious and packed with a lot of flavor!  One scoop was not enough, since the scoops were  pretty tiny!  I got the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and it definitely lived up to its name.  It had a very strong coffee flavor, which was yummy!  My husband tried the Secret Breakfast.  It had just the right amount of sweetness, and the cornflakes added the perfect touch!  

We will definitely go back again!
author: Samantha L.

description: Located right across from The Hyatt Recency in Pier 1. Nestled in a food court Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream is a very creative, handmade ice cream establishment. While there yesterday I had Strawberry, Vietnamese Coffee with fudge and cherries. Did not disappoint!  The strawberry in particular was outstanding.
author: Patrick A.

description:
I'll start by saying I'm not averse to paying a hefty sum for a quality dessert. Maybe this was because it was in the ferry building, but 4.50 for one tiny scoop of ice cream seems like you're paying more for the novelty/touristy surcharge than the scoop itself. 

That said, two of the three flavors my group chose were excellent. I had the Harvey Milk and it tasted like a cereal bowl in ice cream form, absolutely delicious. The blue bottle coffee was really well done, and samples of the secret breakfast did not disappoint. The choco taco was the singular letdown. It's supposed to be chocolatey from the mix ins but in the tiny scoop there was barely any, making it a glorified vanilla ice cream. Worth a try at some point in your time in the city, but there are better places to make your designated ice cream stop if you're here a lot.
author: Annie M.

description:
Stopped by this place while looking at all the foods in the ferry building! I got their Vietnamese Coffee Icecream and their peach sorbet. So good!

They made a mistake with my order since there were so many people and gave me the wrong flavor. However all I had to do was just walk back and tell them. They apologized and gave me a fresh cone! 

This place is definitely a spot to try out when you're in the area!
author: Nancy G.

description: My favorite stop at the Ferry Building! Delicious ice cream with creative flavors. I loved everything I've tried and my favorites are Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee (even though I'm not a coffee drinker). The prices are moderate and I wish the scoops were bigger, but I still enjoy my ice cream every time!
author: Janice L.

description: I was told they have bourbon ice cream??? Yas it is the breakfast ice cream. Perfect way to start the morning with some boozy and creamy snack.
author: David Dat T.

description:
It was fun to visit Humphry Slocombe at the Ferry Building this past weekend after having visited their storefront on Harrison a few years ago. Just as good as I remember!

Without hesitation, I ordered a scoop of butterscotch root beer. Where else can you find a flavor like that? My husband got a scoop of secret breakfast, which was also super tasty. There was a certain grit to the consistency of the ice cream that would usually bother me in a store-bought product but was somehow strangely appropriate from HS and maybe lent itself to the homemade feel of it. 

Service was good and their stall at the Marketplace is minimalist in style and very clean, though still inviting. Next time, I think I may have to opt for 2+ scoops.
author: Emily S.

description:
They have really interesting flavors here, but I was baesic and got two of the easiest, but tasty, flavors. What I noticed about Humphry's ice cream is that the ice cream is really airy. It's not like froyo, where it doesn't quite hit the ice cream mark, and it's not super creamy like usual ice cream, where lactose-intolerant folks will feel the effects after eating it. It's airy. It's fluffy. I don't think I've had ice cream like this before!

+ SECRET BREAKFAST: I had this at 10 AM, so I really did have this as my breakfast. After having other famous milk flavors, like Momofuku in NY and Afters in Fountain Valley, I think this ice cream wins. I am a huge fan of cereal, but usually the milk/cereal flavors tend to be a little boring. This flavor has a kick of bourbon that you can actually taste and the cornflakes provide a great texture to the scoop! 

+ HARVEY MILK & HONEY GRAHAM: I am a huge fan of honey ice cream because it provides a hint of sweetness without being overpowering. Instead of just honey graham crackers, I could really taste honey flavors on top of the sweetened milk. 

I wasn't too adventurous with my flavors, but they had flavors that ranged from Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee to Brown Sugar Fennel and Peanut Butter Curry!!!
author: Sophie P.

description:
San Francisco is stacked on good ice cream, and Humphry Slocombe is no exception.

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

Like more or less any other shop in the Ferry Building, the line at HSIC can grow lengthy especially on the weekend, but don't let that deter you. If nothing else, make use of the time to decide what one or two flavors you're going to go with, because let me assure you that nothing will haunt you like sampling a friend's selection and realizing that it's somehow even better than yours. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

Ice cream is, for whatever reason, expensive these days, and my order of a single scoop of Secret Breakfast in a cup was no different ringing up at $4.00. That's steep, but the price point was put into perspective when a scoop of Cookies and Cream and nearby Over the Moon ran me a dollar more on account of it being in between two oreo cookies. It's close, but Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

Humphry Slocombe keeps you guessing with a constantly changing flavor line up that's not always in line with what you'd typically find elsewhere. Standard Chocolate? Cookies n Cream? Peanut Butter anyone? No dice. Initially this had me a bit worried given that I'm typically one for the classics, but my fears were alleviated when one of the friendly servers insisted that I get Secret Breakfast. Bourbon flavored ice cream with corn flakes in the mix? I'll be honest - that sounded awful, but I trusted the system and went for it. 

Goodness me was I glad I did. Again, the combination truly sounded dreadful, but it couldn't have been better. No, it didn't taste like bourbon or cornflakes, but instead was a sweet but crunchy combination that I could have eaten far more of. From what I've heard, the other rotating and steady flavors are in the same ballpark, and that can only mean that both stars are warranted here. Dual Stars Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

Humphry Slocombe is a fantastic option for ice cream in San Francisco, but given that it's one of many fantastic options, I can't go the full five stars here. No Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description:
Three words.

Coffee ice cream.

That's all you need to know.

Seriously, this place serves probably one of the best coffee ice creams that I ever had .. ANYWHERE.  There are plenty of other flavors I tried, such as the oolong tea ice cream (also fabulous).

But that coffee ice cream is by far the best.  I came back a couple of times more just to savor it more before I headed back to NYC.

The lines here get crazy long at times, so keep that in mind.  But it's worth the wait.  It's no surprise why this place get so much foot traffic.
author: Kevin W.

description:
TL;DR: unique menu flavors, good samples, small scoops size, GREAT OOLONG TEA ICE CREAM

I don't usually spend much time in the Ferry Building, but I'm glad that I encountered this new ice cream stop. Although a little pricey, I had no regrets coming out of this place. With unique flavors and appealing aesthetics, Humphry Slocombe makes my list of quality ice cream stops in the Bay Area.

There was a bit of a line waiting to get served. The menu of the day had many unique flavors that I wanted to try. After getting samples, I was ready to order and the cashier was ready to help me. To be honest, the cashier was a tad bit pushy with me. This was probably just because it was a busy day, so I understand.

I ordered an Oolong Tea single scoop on a sugar cone. I was a little wary before ordering, as I didn't expect it to taste that great. However, all of my expectations were shattered when I had my first taste. To my surprise, the ice cream tasted exactly like my favorite Oolong tea! I thought that would be a hard flavor to hit, but HS nailed it. My scoop size wasn't all that large, but I enjoyed my ice cream so much that it didn't even matter.

At the end of the day, I paid $4.50 for a small scoop of ice cream. However, I enjoyed a quality scoop of ice cream with a unique flavor, which I value over everything else. If I am near Embarcadero Station or at the Ferry Building in the future, I'll be sure to suggest this place to friends and family.
author: Calvin T.

description:
People who know me have gotten over the crazy fact that I don't really like desserts. Yeah, I'm the weirdo who would rather eat a good salad than ice cream or a piece of fruit or vegetable over a cookie. My ideal cake is piled high with berries and I used to order fruit tarts and just eat the fruit. I therefore don't crave or neeeeeed ice cream or sweets, but I do like trying interesting flavors and get excited when lines for food are 20+ people deep. 

Yes, while walking through the ferry building, we walked past a humongous line and while I wasn't necessarily hungry or in need of dessert, I thought it would be a good idea to jump in line. While the lady behind me kept invading my personal space (I suspect cultural differences), I read up Yelp reviews and planned what to get. By the time I got to the front, I knew I was going to order "the complete breakfast": a scoop of bourbon and cornflake ice cream and a scoop of Vietnamese coffee ice cream. I didn't let the ice cream child worker know that though. I asked to sample two of the seasonal flavors I hadn't seen on Yelp: spiced pumpkin and brittle something or other. The pumpkin flavor was good.... Like pumpkin pie, and I didn't care for the other one. Coming from Hawaii, I did think the POG (passion fruit, orange, guava) sorbet sounded interesting, but I can get POG at home. 

My breakfast ice cream was probably one of the best ice creams I've had, super creamy and flavorful. Am I gonna want more tomorrow or next week, no, but someone who loves ice cream might think otherwise. 

I liked the set up and decor. It was cool that they wrote the menu on the wall tiles. The girl working looked to be in her pre teens and had a hard time following what I wanted to order. She also wasn't very friendly....ehhh whatevers.
author: Krysten I.

description:
Excellent ice cream, albeit on the sweet side. I tend to favor their fruit flavors as those seem more refreshing. Their small scoop is more than enough for me. Staff is always super helpful and will let you taste as many flavors as you want.
Pro tip: split your scoop for extra enjoyment.
author: Shoole S.

description:
OMFG. Artisan ice cream heaven. 

During a quick weekend visit to San Francisco with some high school friends, it was almost our tourist duty to stop by the Ferry Building, home of some of San Francisco's most delicious delectables. While I was able to resist most of the sugary treats, I couldn't say no to two scoops at Humphry Slocombe, a small ice cream stall in the Ferry Building whose line is almost always wrapping around the corner. 

The staff at Humphry Slocombe is extremely accommodating and regardless of the wait, the staff was willing to let me try 4-5 flavors before I made my decision. I loved that I didn't feel rushed -- it's important to me to feel like I can pick a flavor I like at an ice cream parlor, especially one that charges a little extra for quality ice cream (I got 2 scoops for $6.50)! 

Whenever you go, Humphry Slocombe will have different flavors available, but they're guaranteed to be good. When I went, the ice cream stall had a special flavor for Wicked, which is currently in town on tour. The flavor, which I got a scoop of, was matcha green tea with black and white cookies and it was SO good. I wish they would keep the flavor forever, but I'm just as happy savoring the flavor while I can. 

If you don't live in SF to grab some ice cream, Humphry Slocombe ships prints nationwide for a hefty fee (I am considering doing this when I get home to LA...). Overall, my experience at Humphry Slobome was great and I recommend stopping by if you're in SF!
author: Morgan G.

description:
I got their earl grey plum float, because I like to try weird things when it comes to famous artisan ice cream places. Because that's what distinguishes it from a normal Cold Stones right? 

Anyway the float aiiight but was overpriced :( it was just a huge chunk of frozen plum juice floating in earl grey tea topped with whip cream. It tastes much better when the plum melts and the sweet plum flavor mixes with the earl grey. I was honestly hoping there was ice cream in this "float", but there wasn't.
author: Anita Y.

description:
Humphry Slocombe actually much better than Bi-Rite imo; I am confident also iyo if you allow your palate to determine the flavor and not bi right in to group think. 

Everything is great here, except the occasionally seasonally flavors. Fortunately those go out of season.
author: Juliana P.

description: I really liked the unique flavors - I got Dirty Chai which was espresso with chai (mostly cardamom which I love). But the texture of the ice cream wasn't as rich and smooth as I expected. Great flavor but missed a star for texture.
author: Karen N.

description:
Blah ice cream.
Not many choices 
Have trouble seeing how this got food network awards
Open later than other ice cream stores in the area
author: Wenxua Z.

description:
$4 for one scoop and $6 for a double scoop. 

Decided to go for the Secret Breakfast and the After School Special. The Secret Breakfast has cornflake chunks in it and bourbon-flavored vanilla ice cream. Personally, I thought the bourbon was a bit overpowering. The After School Special, on the other hand, was unexpectedly yummy with chocolate covered potato chips mixed in with vanilla ice cream and caramel swirls. Who would have thought chocolate covered potato chips could work so well together (then again, I have yet to find a chocolate-covered product that does NOT work well together). The sweetness and saltiness of the chocolate and potato chips just melts in your mouth. I think I found my new favorite flavor, guys. 

Of course, Humphry's offer's a slew of unique flavors that are worth trying, including Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Peanut Butter Curry. Give it a try!
author: Nina Z.

description:
The first time I came to Humphrey's I was absolutely in love with their Secret Breakfast flavor. I was completely wowed by the subtle complexity of Bourbon + corn flakes, and how the genius behind it all made it work into a delicious ice cream flavor. 

I visited again this past weekend, and was a little disappointed in the Secret Breakfast. It was a little bit too sweet this time. And my friend who went with me both times also noted the difference in sweetness. Perhaps the flavor's sweetness level varies depending on the day? Overall, it was still good and still a memorable combination of ingredients. I'm still a fan of how the corn flakes mixed with the ice cream provided some awesome texture, but will probably opt for another, less-sweet flavor next time. The prosciutto flavor that I sampled tasted pretty bomb and is probably my new favorite!

Overall: DEFINITELY recommend coming by to sample some interesting flavors that will fosho pique your curiosity and tastebuds!
author: Joyce W.

description: Their flavors are so distinct. The malted milk chocolate is heavenly. I've been here more times than I can count - and even if I choose the same flavor, it's always good. My friends who I take here are always impressed.
author: Jane E.

description:
It was only 9am but it is ever too early for ice cream? I think not, especially when you get the Secret Breakfast. $4.25 for a small scoop is standard pricing for SF. This flavor was different than any ice cream I've ever had before and although it probably would've been too rich for me on most days, it felt perfect for the first thing to eat in the morning.

The texture was creamy and I could tell that it is high quality ice cream. There are quite a few great ice cream shops in SF despite the less than ideal weather and if money were no object, I'd try all the flavors at all of them. Given the constraints of the wallet and belt, I would like to recommend Humphry Slocombe as a safe choice for good ice cream.
author: Yi Z.

description: The cost is a little steep for a cup of ice cream but I've never tasted something like the 'Secret breakfast' flavor before!
author: Sneha S.

description:
Recommend their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Peanut Butter Swirl! 

Pros:
- unique flavors
- free cones!!! 
- inside of ferry building, which has many cool shops

Cons:
- expensive: I spent $6.50 on 2 scopes XD 
- super long lines (on special holidays especially) 
- small serving size
author: Wendy F.

description: BEST ICE CREAM EVER! I randomly stumbled upon this store when I was just strolling through Ferry Building. I saw a consistently long line in front of its shop so I was curious to see what the hype was about. I saw a poster in the front that said that Food Network ranked his place as top 5 ice cream spots in the U.S. so I knew I had to find out for myself. I tried their two most popular flavors: Secret Breakfast (bourbon with corn flakes) and Harvey Milk and Honey Graham. I really appreciate the flavors here, how they're creative but not too indulgent. I understand why Secret Breakfast is well-liked. The flavors just work in perfect harmony with another. Personally though, my favorite is the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham. I love how the taste of honey in the ice cream has real depth. All in all, I HIGHLY recommend checking this place out. I've tried ice cream so many different places and this place, hands down, beats them all.
author: Gina B.

description:
Great choice for a treat at the Ferry Building. The service here is nice and let you sample various flavors. The line moves fairly quickly.

I got the double scoop in a cone with peanut butter fudge ripple and harvey milk and honey graham ($6.50). The peanut butter fudge was very rich and the harvey milk was really sweet from the honey. Definitely more decadent flavors but really tasty.
author: Linda X.

description: I'm an ice cream lover.  From any crazy combine to your most simple vanilla. I don't mind that it's 62 degrees outside and the wind is blowing crazy because this is ice cream is well worth it.  Creamy, smooth, tons of flavor and not enough.  I should've ordered the ice cream sandwich because that was AMAZING!!  Ginger snap cookie with the Blue Bottle coffee ice cream, incredible.  It made my SF trip complete.  You must go down there and give a try.
author: Stacey M.

description:
Great place if you're looking for delicious and unique flavors of ice cream. I sampled a few flavors, but ultimately decided to go with Secret Breakfast and Harvey Milk + Honey Graham. Both were so good! And so different from any other ice cream flavor I've had before. Secret Breakfast's flavors are primarily made up of bourbon and cornflakes. The texture was great, and the bourbon helped balance out the sweetness. The Harvey Milk + Honey Graham's predominant flavor was the honey graham, and I loved the chunks of graham crackers that came in the ice cream. Texture of both flavors were super creamy and rich. 

Lines can get long here but they move fast. Also slightly on the pricey side, but totally worth. Will definitely be back. It seems like they rotate their menu a lot, so there will always be something new to try :)
author: Ashley Y.

description: Can't say I am a fan.  I find many of the flavors of ice cream offered to be original but the taste is a bit too sweet.  I really wanted to love the ice cream I ordered but didn't even finish it.  Overall I'm glad I tried Humphry but I think I have had better.
author: Tom C.

description: A must try if you love ice cream & dessert, especially on a warm day in San Francisco, which is rare!  This was one of the very few dessert places in the ferry building!  The reviews are correct because the ice cream was to awesome!  There were such a variety of flavors to choose from, such as Elvis the fat years, Psychedelic city, & Parallel lines. I had the Vietnamese coffee & Tahitian vanilla because I'm such a big coffee fan!  The flavors were so rich & creamy that makes you want to go back for more. We ate it all up so quickly!  My kids and I shared my serving because they were full from all of the eating we've done because I'm such a big foodie that I want to try everything that looks good!
author: Michelle A.

description:
Humph humph, why is Humphry Slocombe so far away from me :( 
Actually that's for the better... especially with my steadfast attitude that 50 degrees foggy and/or blustery SF weather is perfectly acceptable for ice cream. 

What stands out most about Humphry is that they really put the cream in ice cream--it's fresh and indulgent, but not overwhelmingly rich. How they can make such a creamy dessert that you can devour in hefty portions without feeling sick is beyond me. 

They have a good selection of traditional and experimental flavors. Perhaps the most popular is the not-so-secret-anymore Secret Breakfast. I also appreciate the character in their ice cream flavor names (looking forward to ordering the Here's Your Damn Strawberry Ice Cream someday). I sampled the Fluttermutter and I almost always get something different from my sample, but the creamy PB ice cream was as good as ice cream and there was no denying I was addicted and wanted moar P: 

Other notes:
- Although they don't offer cones, the ginormous scoops definitely make up for it. Prices are similar to most craft creameries.
- Line can get long but it moves quickly. Definitely beats the Blue Bottle line right across which is as long and slow as airport security.
- Lots of interesting ice-cream-related paraphernalia on the side shelf.

We shared a double scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee and the Fluttermutter for $6. HAPPINESS.
author: Edna C.

description:
Love the secret breakfast icecream 

The fromage blanc pistachio was really good as well way better than bi rite icecream ! 

It's creamy and soft not overly frozen. 

Love it!
author: Ruby P.

description:
-Tried the red hot banana which was amazing, but that's really all there was at this place for me. 

-I tried the thai chili lime sample and although it was unique, it wasn't something to be crazy about. Not even sure i'd want that to eat as ice cream. 

-Ended up getting double scoop of the hot banana and blue bottle viet coffee. The BB Coffee was average and the banana was great. 

There are better places in SF for ice cream in my opinion.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
This place is delish!! You know it's good when you see the line going all the way down the marketplace (but it moved quickly) The secret breakfast sundae changed my life a little bit. I eagerly anticipate my next trip out there to try all the foods. 

Pro tip: head there first to get your ice cream of choice, then walk up and down the water to burn off calories from the aforementioned sweet treat.
author: Ariel J.

description: I had the jamoca almond fudge and absolutely loved it with my sugar cone. Has actual slivers of almonds, which were delicious and a nice crunch. My husband had the shady lady ice cream sandwich, which was also very good! Only thing I wish is that the prices were lower!
author: Jo W.

description: 2 years later and this still holds true. Humphry Slocombe needs to train their employees in professionalism, especially in a tourist location where there will always be crowds. Regardless of how good the ice cream is, this low quality of service makes for an incredibly unpleasant experience. Go to the original location instead.
author: Alyssa T.

description: We ventured to the Ferry Building with the primary focus of visiting Humphry Slocombe after the insistence of our friends 20 YO daughter. I love ice cream like the next person, but did not expect this. Hands down the best ice cream I've ever had. We each chose a different flavor and shared - Vietnamese Coffee, French Tickler and Secret Breakfast (friend's daughter's insistence). They were all flavor explosions and AHMAZING. But the Secret Breakfast - I've been thinking about it ever since we left. I wish I had ordered a second scoop just so I wouldn't have to share. So delicious!
author: Tania H.

description:
Divinely delicious! Today, I finally gave into temptation, skipped the usual path straight to Urban Remedy and went to Humphry Slocombe's for icecream instead. I have 0 regrets. I ordered a double scoop of the Huracha Rose and the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham. The Huracha Rose is exceptional, hands down my new favorite ice cream EVER. I'm a little concerned that it's not an everyday flavor so fingers crossed they keep it around for awhile. The Harvey Milk and Honey Graham was unique, tasty and very very sweet. I liked this flavor as well, but I felt like just one scoop of it was too much sweetness. Don't get me wrong it was heavenly but it's so jam packed w deliciousness that a spoonful really goes a long way. I recommend busting out a glass of Sauvignon or Rosé and sharing a scoop with your "honey." 

Takeaways:

Good:
Convenient location
Friendly staff
Delicious ice cream

Bad:
Could be habit forming

Tips:
Expect to wait in a line
author: Leann W.

description:
When I asked The Nephew what he wanted to do after lunch, he said "ICE CREAM."

(Clearly we are related.)

So off to Humphry Slocombe we went. I warned him that they had some unusual flavors but actually at this location there wasn't anything too crazy. 

Black Sesame Ice Cream is awesome but oddly few places have it. I was happy to get my fix here.

The Nephew did the ice cream happy dance (actually more like a knee bob) as we watched his Bourbon Coke Float being made. Carefully applied bourbon caramel, Secret Breakfast ice cream and foamy Coke. He like. (Though next time maybe less caramel since the bourbon flavor was pretty strong). 

Ice Cream Win!
author: Amy C.

description:
Been on my bookmarks forever... like literally over 4 years but I finally had the chance to indulge after eating clean for 3 weeks.  Rob didn't hesitate at all every time I wanted to stop by a place and I think when he walked up to the menu board, he had his heart set on the Bourbon Coke Float.  I would have ordered it but since we just left Brenda's, I decided to go w/ a single scoop of their chocolate smoked sea salt. 

Service was pretty rad.  The girl that took our order was outgoing!  She told us that she loved making the float.  I didn't really pay attention to how she was creating this caloric-excessive float however, it looked super decadent when she had it showcased.  My selection was smooth, rich, creamy, and OMG... even their waffle cones were delicious!  

We sat outside the Ferry Building to enjoy our desserts before heading back.  Rob gave me a bit of his float and I kind of regret not ordering the same, haha.  I'm glad I got a chance to try this place (finally) and I'm glad I showed Rob the Ferry Building.  What?  He's never been... how odd is that?! Now we are both doing no sugar for 30 days.

Thanks for treating, dude!
author: Tram N.

description:
So many tasty flavours to sample. Yum! We were so torn but eventually settled on the Salted Caramel and Cinnamon, Secret Breakfast and Jesus Juice. All three flavours were great, but the Jesus Juice was probably our favourite because of the refreshing taste. I know some people complain about the cereal bits being soggy in the SB, but I actually found it to be quite an interesting addition. Cereal gets soggy when you add milk to it, so if that's something that bothers you then don't get it. You're welcome to sample as many flavours as you like and decide for yourself.  

This place tends to have a long line (even more so on the weekend) and the wait can be somewhat annoying, so if you're headed over with your kids or dogs then just bear that in mind. It's worth it once you've got those delicious scoops in front of you. Word of advice, once you get your ice cream, you might want to sit on a bench out on the pier whilst bird watching and soaking up the view of the bay. Very relaxing!
author: Zoe P.

description:
My favorite ice cream gem has now joined the Ferry Building! Funny how they took over an old Gelato spot.

I used to drive out to the Mission to get my Humphry fixing and then finally they started selling pints at Whole Foods. This location's top notch and a welcome addition to the Ferry Bldg.

I will say the staff here isn't as warm and friendly as the other location but it's probably because they're trying to move the lines of tourists that come here.

The prices here are also steeper for sure  - $4.25/1 scoop or $6.50/2 scoops or $8/3 scoops. Well, for $9 you can buy a pint.


No seating- grab n go and then find a bench inside/outside the Ferry Building or just walk around!
author: Veronica S.

description: The Asian girl service really bad attitude, bad service ever. Because her bad attitude that let me ignore how was the ice cream.
author: Lynn C.

description: Considering the line was long at the Ferry Building, the wait wasn't that long! Then, again, it helped to have a friend to chat withI liked that they gave me time to taste the flavors I wanted to taste before deciding on Pumpkin Hazelnut and Malted Milk Chocolate.Great team work behind the counter to keep the crowd moving along too
author: Marissa L. A.

description:
As many times as I've visited restaurants and shops near the pier, I have never checked out the Ferry Building. 

And boy was I missing out.

I usually expect ice cream places on a warm summer day to be fairly busy, and after trying Humphry's ice cream, I understood why they'd have a wrap-around line. I tried a scoop of their Secret Breakfast flavor, while my boyfriend tried their Bourbon Coke float. 
And I'm sure I can speak on behalf of both of us when I say that it was some amazing ice cream. Creamy, flavorful, worth every penny. The staff was friendly, and they even had pints for most of their flavors to buy and enjoy for the road.  With a good selection of unique flavors to choose from, I definitely recommend to check this place out if you're in the area! I know I'll be back for more!
author: Natalie V.

description:
Yum for the Kumquat Poppyseed!! 

Alright: The Vietnamese coffee flavor and Roasted White Choc Honey Lavender flavor.
author: J J.

description:
We were in San Francisco to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We were at the Ferry Building after having a consummate ride on the San Francisco Cable Cars. We were in the mood for a snack and Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream's storefront. The line was long so it had to be good.

My wife ordered a dip of "Cinamon Brittle" and I ordered the "Malted Dulce de Leche." All of Humphry's ice cream are 100% organic. The ice cream was the creamiest I have ever tasted. It coated your mouth with eat bite. The flavors were incredible and perfectly blended. What a treat!!
author: Chuck M.

description: I thought about grabbing some Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream a few times but was put off by the long line. I decided to finally get in line and wait it out. I got the secret breakfast float and the bourbon caramel sauces is delicious. I really enjoyed the secret breakfast ice cream.
author: David F.

description: SFO is finally redeeming itself in terms of good ice cream. After a bad couple of experiences I finally struck some luck with this extremely busy little place in ferry building. Don't be intimidated by the line as it moves fast. Innovative flavors abound like kumquat poppyseed, breakfast cereal with bourbon, vietnamese coffee .. etc etc. Prices are a bit steep ($4.5 for a scoop) but I'm guessing its in line with other stuff in downtown SF. Will be back for sure.
author: Sudipto G.

description:
Pretty solid ice cream spot. I was recommended this place by a co-worker specifically for trying "unique flavors". I'll admit they do have a variety of flavors that I wouldn't find elsewhere, but I do like some nice classic flavors that they cater to as well. Their ice cream was good, but nothing amazingly memorable about it. 

It's a nice spot to grab ice cream if you're close by and craving it, though I can't say much more about it.
author: Charisse S.

description: Not the cheapest, but interesting flavors, and tasty ice cream. Secret Breakfast was their most popular flavor, but I liked the Spotted Dick and Matcha flavors more. They do allow to split scoops, so I was able to have both flavors while only paying for one scoop. The line moved quite fast, and service was friendly.
author: Leo Y.

description: The line told us this was something we had to try and boy were those people right! The ice cream was well worth the 15 minute wait in line. I tried the secret breakfast and toast and jam. It was an unexpected creaminess with texture. The tart of the raspberry was a great contrast to the crunch of the cereal and brioche and the creaminess of the ice cream itself. I also sampled the salted watermelon sorbet and couldn't believe how yummy it was. If it's still there the next time I visit the ferry building I will definitely be ordering that. Don't miss out on this ice cream the next time you are at the ferry building!
author: Roma N.

description:
I always feel like I'm cheating on Amy's when I eat ice cream anywhere else (love you, Amys!!)

But man, the ice cream here was out of this world. 
You have not tasted strawberry until you've had the strawberry ice cream here. 
It was like strawberry amped up a few notches. It reminded me of an episode of "Everybody loves Raymond" where the whole family is in Italy - and Robert is eating peach gelato, in shock over how good it is, and says "It's like I've never tasted a peach before!" Paraphrasing, of course. 

I had a few other flavors (coffee, vanilla, cornflake/bourbon) and they were all well made, creamy, and delicious. Definitely on the top of my list of where to go when I visit San Francisco next!
author: Misha S.

description:
This city really loves its ice cream.  

Typical cold, foggy day?  No matter.  Grab coffee first.  

Typical cold, foggy night?  Shrug.  Just throw on your Giants hat.  And an infinity scarf, or 3.  Layer, layer, layer.

Whatever the weather conditions, San Franciscans habitually, & even happily, wait in long lines for their frozen San Francisco treat.  Mitchell's, Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe...what do they all have in common?

There's always a long line.

So, understandably, many city folks did the happy dance when HS opened this outpost in the ferry building.  But, then, guess what happened?

There's always a long line here now, too !  

We may have fallen in love w HS for their secret breakfast.  Cornflakes & whiskey in ice cream?  Genius.  And, where had you been all our lives?!

But, we've stayed in love w HS for keeping us on our toes.  Like w the flavor Elvis, the fat years.

Yes, you had me at secret breakfast.  But you've kept me w Elvis, the fat years.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Busy ice cream kiosk located within the ferry building. 

Ice cream here is rich, creamy, and melts quickly. The flavor of the ice cream gets somewhat lost amidst the rich milky taste of the cream base. 

Flavors here are imaginative. Everything I sampled had a rich creamy taste. Picking one that pairs well with a heavy cream is the way to go. 

Memorable flavors include: Blue Bottle (!!) Vietnamese iced coffee, secret breakfast, olive oil, Mexican chocolate, and beer. 

Tried the pear and green tea flavors. Pear was delicious, but the flavor of the pear doesn't quite pull through. I can imagine some people might be put off by the richness. Green tea tastes more like a milky green tea latte. 

Service is patient and efficient. There was a long line during my visit, but the wait was roughly ten minutes. 

Overall, a solid ice cream option where satisfaction is based on flavor selection.
author: Catherine S.

description: For me, this Emperor was stark naked. "Harvey Milk & Graham Crackers" was gloppy, tasted like Parmesan cheese. Daughter had malted chocolate that was okay. Also had a three-flavor sorbet with a German name that was by turns bitter and tasteless. There are some flavors that haven't been invented yet for a reason.
author: Alex A.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream!
Having wanted to try this for ever, I finally made my way up to SF to visit Super Bowl City, but it had reached max capacity by the time we got there. So we decided to treat ourselves to some ice cream on a rare sunny day!
The line was constantly long, but moved at a decent pace. The Secret Breakfast is its most famous flavor, but my friend said she thought the bourbon taste was too strong. However, I decided to try it for myself. However, I also couldn't resist getting the roasted white chocolate rose flavor!
The people working here are SUPER nice and happy to give out free samples of flavors. There's also a small separate kiosk/line for selective flavors and ice cream sandwiches.
The Secret Breakfast was certainly very bourbon-tasting, but I thought the strength of the alcohol was a nice complement to the cornflakes. However, the cornflakes are not as crunchy as I expected, having been mixed in the ice cream for some time had made it more chewy. Not my favorite flavor ever, but I really enjoyed it! The alcohol makes the ice cream extra creamy and not icy. The Roasted White Chocolate Rose combines two of my favorite flavors together! The fragrance of the rosewater syrup really complemented the rich smokiness of the white chocolate!
Yum yum! While expensive and while there's always a long line, this place is really yummy and warrants a try!
author: Sarina J.

description:
This place used to be Ciao Bella. I moderately liked ciao bella so I was a little disgruntled when I heard they were closing. Then I realized Humphry Solocombe would be replacing ciao...

Good Riddance, Ciao! You won't be missed! 

They were decent but not nearly on the same level as Humphry Solocombe. I've been hooked since I first tried secret breakfast at the HS tent in front of the ferry building. The rich and creamy base made for a wonderfully smooth texture that was contrasted by the pieces of crunchy corn flakes. Moreover, that bourbon really came through. Of course they have other flavors too such as horchata, blue bottle vietnamese coffee, and peppered lemon pound cake, but I always go for anything with bourbon. 

I'm so glad they have a spot inside now. Whenever I'm back home and roam around SF, I'm always tempted to stop by and grab a scoop of secret breakfast.
author: John B.

description: The Chaco Taco was a bit disappointing, but all the other flavors I tried were great! Went for their birthday party for free scoops -- line was about 45 mins. Another one to add to the SF Ice Cream Scene "hit list". :)
author: Steffan P.

description: Ugh the smooth creamy texture and flavorful sweetness... almost as good as gelato from Italy. It was airy and scrumptious. I tried the Secret Breakfast but ended up with the Harvey Milk & Graham-- can't resist "cookies in ice cream" types. Delish.
author: Eden W.

description:
I never tasted an ice cream like this. My friend had been raving about this place and when we got here, the line was so long we were discouraged to wait.

We came back a few days later during the evening and there was barely a wait. I got the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee on a cone and it was just heaven in my mouth. It was perfectly creamy and flavorful.

I can't wait to come back
author: Lena V.

description: Delicious. Very smooth, creamy and flavorful. I've had several flavors and they are all consistently good.
author: Gloria T.

description: OMG!  One of the best ice creams I've ever tasted--and I am embarrassed to say I've had quite a few--Golden Milk (ginger and tumeric)  Such a creamy fresh ginger flavor and the tumeric gives it a bit of depth and a lovely rich color!
author: Cathy G.

description: Really nicely done ice cream filled with flavor and not air.   Was very fresh with an interesting variety of flavor.   Maybe a little strong on the sugar, but that is something I will suffer through.  Lol
author: Phil B.

description:
5 STARS 5 STARS 5 STARS FOR THEIR SECRET BREAKFAST FLAVOR!

My boyfriend and I agreed that their Secret Breakfast flavor was the best part of our SF trip...LOL!

Inside the Ferry Building is a small ice cream shop.  They have all their flavors listed..and they all sounded SO good and interesting.  I wanted to sample them all but the line was long and I didn't want to cause the hold up.  I sampled the Blue Blottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor while my boyfriend sampled their Secret Breakfast.  Of course, I shared my sample with my boyfriend but he always forgets to share his sample with me and he slurped it up before I could even remind him -___-.

Anyways, we decided to get a scoop of each and share.  

I WISH HE HAD SHARED HIS SECRET BREAKFAST SAMPLE WITH ME because then I would've just ordered two scoops of that!!  OMG IT WAS SOOOOOOO GOOOOOOOD, I'm drooling right now.  Secret Breakfast is their bourbon based flavor with corn flakes in it.  Soooo creamy...and so delicious.  The flavor is really unique but addicting.   Don't ask questions, just GET IT.

Their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor was good too..but just not as good.  It had a nice strong creamy coffee flavor to it so I'd definitely recommend this flavor to coffee lovers!

1 scoop is $4, 2 scoops is $6 and 3 scoops is $7.50 and you have the option for a bowl or a cone.  I asked for both so he put the ice cream in a bowl and added a cone on top for no extra charge :)

I will definitely be back for more of their secret breakfast flavor..and if you haven't tried it yourself yet...you're missing out!
author: Regina O.

description: It's great ice cream don't wait - just go!  Located in the Ferry Building... So if your favorite 2 things are eating ice cream and people watching you are really in luck. Flavors - all are great, most are innovative, but they have amazing favorite Flavors like coffee and rum raisin. They will give you a taste when you ask, that is a fun way to learn all the Flavors. Sundaes and sandwiches, cones and cups. Go out by the water with your selection and relax.
author: Jacqueline S.

description: This place has really good ice cream! I had the Secret Breakfast flavor which is bourbon infused ice cream with Corn Flakes cereal. I don't drink but this flavor was pretty dang good. The service was good too. They are a little pricey though for ice cream. It was about $4.50 for one scoop in a cone. But I'm not surprised because of the location. But overall, I would come back and try a different flavor!
author: Mary S.

description:
It's difficult to write a fully accurate review of this place having only been here once and having only tried one flavor. I should've stayed longer to sample a few of the other flavors, but I didn't want to keep my coworker waiting.

I got one scoop of the secret breakfast flavor in a cup and it was good, not great. I picked it since it had received the most reviews and people generally seemed to like it a lot. I was worried about the bourbon flavor, but it wasn't really that that I didn't like. It was the cornflakes. They were really soggy..

I typically like cornflakes..in cereal, in chocolate, by themselves..and usually in ice cream! But I wasn't a fan of how they were so soggy. The ice cream itself was the perfect texture of creamy and it wasn't too sweet in my opinion..but soggy cornflakes were a bit off-putting.

I'll definitely be back to try their blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and the butter beer...will update my review then!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
OMG the most amazing of flavours. Came here on a hot and sunny Saturday afternoon, and got 3 scoops for $7.50 incl tax. 

Shared with a friend - secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes), blue bottle vietnamese coffee, and toast and jam. Pretty much had a breakfast bowl in the form of ice cream...=D =D =D

All of the flavours were outstanding. For secret breakfast, I found the balance of bourbon taste to be just right, and not too overwhelming. Vietnamese coffee tasted just like iced coffee, and toast and jam had crumbly graham(?) Bits and real jam (even had some berry seeds to crunch on).

I think vietnamese coffee was my fav flavour of the three. Also - taste tested a slew of flavours before deciding on these three. Thai chili lime sorbet is phenomenal, if you like spicy. It has quite the kick to it. You taste super spicy, then the soury lime, then hint of sweetness. It's honestly an explosion of flavours in your mouth. Jalapeno cornbread was nice - pretty mellow compared to the thai chili one. Enjoyed the cornbread crumble texture in the ice cream though. Also tried the red hot banana - not a fan.

Love that the flavours here are so unique. This place has awesome ice creaaaaaam!! OH! And comes with a sugar cone, which is nice and crispy. Yummmm
author: Miam M.

description: Located in the Ferry Building, this small little shop is EASILY one of the best ice cream shops I have ever visited. The flavors are unique as they are delicious. I even sampled one called "Wine n Cheese" which was a red wine and goat cheese concoction, and that was strangely good. After partaking in samples on samples, I ended up ordering the Wicked flavor (matcha green tea with black & white cookie bits) andthe Harvey Milk & Honey Graham flavor (milk flavored with honey graham bits). The flavors of the ice cream themselves were prominent, but not overwhelming nor too sweet. The mix-ins also were tasty and not just a crunchy and chewy afterthought tossed in there for added texture. The texture of the ice cream was incredibly smooth and creamy, and not heavy. This place is a win in my book- I already can't wait to come back!
author: Justine S.

description:
It's inside the Ferry Building so traffic at this location is predictably high.  They've got a fairly long section cordoned off for the line.  Fortunately for us, we came during early evening non-peak hours so not a terribly long line.

They are happy to let you sample things, which is great since they can often have some unique flavors.  I tried samples of both the Red Hot Banana (Red Hot candies mixed with roasted banana) and Halvabaloo (black vinegar and Halva, a sesame-flavored concoction) - we both settled on the Halvabaloo, which was surprisingly delicious.

Ice cream here is typical SF prices, which is to say, not cheap, but in line with other unique scoop shops.

If you're in the Ferry Building I suggest checking it out.
author: Brent T.

description:
Ugh, it's crafty but not good.
Flavors are innovative but for the cost I would have expected an expertly made product. I ordered the PB fudge ripple and it was a pile of ice crystals and fudge. Clearly they need to talk to a real ice cream maker, not just make trendy flavors. Ice crystals means the product melted and refroze. Amateur.
author: S. H.

description:
Love their flavors!  Had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and brown sugar fennel.  OMG good! Can't wait to try more!
So many great ice cream joints in the city nowadays. So lucky!
author: Naty D.

description:
SECRET BREAKFAST. GET IT. THANK ME LATER. 

This is my favorite ice cream place in the city! Even though it's a little bit pricey (one scoop is super tiny and definitely not enough), I still thoroughly enjoy it. SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!!

The line is really long, especially on the weekends, but so worth the wait. If you want to get a pint instead, just grab it from the freezer and skip the line! (The Secret Breakfast pint does not come with corn flakes, just FYI.)
author: Anny T.

description:
I found the ice cream at Humphry Slocombe to be okay but not fantastic. I wanted the flavors to be a little more pronounced and the texture was alright but nothing special either. In terms of flavor selection, again, it was alright but I personally like things to be just a little more interesting or have more options (they do have way more interesting flavors listed on their website though- the chocolate smoked salt sounds like something I would really love). 

It was a pretty busy Sunday when I came here and there was just one person working so the line got fairly long quickly since she had to give out samples, scoop ice cream, and work the register. I tried a couple of different flavors but got the Secret Breakfast since it is their most popular- bourbon ice cream and corn flakes. I would have liked more bourbon flavor as well as more crunch from the cornflakes. I think the main thing was that as one of San Francisco's well known ice cream makers, I had much higher expectations for Humphry Slocombe and was thus a tad disappointed.
author: Seema U.

description:
If they gave a bit more for the price I think it'd be a five star. 

I personally think this is the closest thing to Molly Moons down in California. The tahitian vanilla is good. It has a special kick to the vanilla. Texture is on point, but the price for the amount given doesn't seem right.

Would recommend if you can get a flavor you enjoy.
author: Davy C.

description:
Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is a gourmet ice cream shop in the historic San Francisco Ferry building.  Yes, you can order vanilla, but you can also experience some unique and amazing flavors that will have people lining up for.

My Overall Rating - 4 Stars (Atmosphere, Service, Food, Return)

Atmosphere - I love the Ferry Building.  During my last visit I walked straight into the end of the line for Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream.  It was long, so I decided to move on.  But as I walked by, I caught a glimpse of the menu and knew I had to line up.  It's not absurd when you're in line to dozens of like-minded ice cream fans.  It's in the heart of the Ferry Building and this is where artists and food collide.  1 Star.

Service - To my surprise, the line moves fast.  They are fast, even when the gal in front of you wants to taste every flavor.  They have a limited selection, but also enough to keep you coming back.  Our total wait time was less than 10 minutes, and this included taste testing.  1 Star. 

Food - It's great, but it's expensive.  The secret breakfast was recommended and was great.  It was a bourbon (light caramel to me) flavor with corn flakes.  The corn flakes gave it an extra kick of texture that I thought was fantastic.  The Vietnamese coffee tasted exactly like one (sweetened condensed milk with espresso) and well worth the short wait.  While the ice cream was great, I still prefer Bi-Rite creamery.  Still - I wouldn't mind another secret breakfast scoop or two.  Or three.  1 Star.

Will I Return? - Yes.  Any trip to San Francisco will mean I will visit the Ferry Building.  This also means I'll be lining up for another round at Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream.  After all, Secret Breakfast is the most important meal of the day.  1 Star.

My Yelp Rating Scale (Sum of all parts):
1 Star - Atmosphere - Is it a cool dive?  Perhaps an upscale place?  No matter the type, atmosphere plays a big part and I'll give a star if I like it or thinks it has great charm.
1 Star - Service - You can have a great meal with bad service.  But that's also what can make a five-star joint drop to four.  It's important to the dining experience that service is great and on point.
2 Stars - Food - I'll award up to two stars for the food, since this is the main reason we dine out.  Sometimes the extra star is given for value, but it's really all about the food.
1 Star - Will I come back? - If I know for a fact I'll return, I'll give this a star. A place has to make an impression for me to return. 

Each Category can be given up to 1 star except food (2 stars) because I consider all these categories important to the overall dining experience.  I will sum them up to provide my final Yelp score.
author: Trinh T.

description:
Food: 5/5

Service: 1/5

Heres how it went down:

Boyfriend: "Can I have three scoops on a cone of ___, ____, and ____? (I forgot what he ordered)
Cashier lady: "You like picked the hardest flavors to scoop."

So, yes, we changed the flavors because they were "easier" for her. Even so, the final product was messy, and she did not care about how it was scooped as she laughed when she scooped the last flavor on top, as it was slowly sliding off and melting with the rest.

We picked the hardest flavors? I'm sorry, but isn't that your job? Laziness at its finest meant we couldn't fully enjoy Humphry Slocombe.
author: Marissa R.

description:
If you're in San Francisco, and you find yourself in the Ferry Building, you HAVE TO stop by the Humphry Slocombe corner booth for deliciously unique ice cream! 

While the actual larger loaction is on the corner of Harrison and 24th St. in the Mission District, this one serves exactly the same flavors and specials. You can never go wrong ordering anything here, yet my favorite items to savor are their Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes!), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Elvis. 

They have a myriad of flavors, from the typical (Here's your damn Strawberry), to the exotic (Foie Gras?!), and I am on a mission to try every. single. one.

The Ferry Building location does get crowded, yet the servers are all very helpful and efficient, offering free samples to help you decide. It is a bit pricey, but worth every lick!
author: Kyrie S.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is just okay, especially considering all the hype from Yelp.

I came around 3pm and there was a long line, but it moved quickly. The service was nothing special.

I got a double scoop for $6.50: one scoop of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and one of Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream with cornflakes), since those seemed to be the flavors that reviewers raved about the most. The coffee ice cream was very strong, which I did like. As for Secret Breakfast, they definitely do not skimp on the alcohol, but what I did not like at all was the saltiness of the cornflakes. I'm not a fan of salty ice cream flavors, so I didn't find this appealing. However, my boyfriend looooved this flavor.

Overall, I still think Bi-Rite is the best ice cream in SF. I'm glad I tried Humphry Slocombe's unique flavors, but I would never crave it or come back.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
My boyfriend and I really wanted to come here after seeing the super unique flavors they have. Whenever I go to an ice cream place, I always want to go to parlors that have unique flavors that no where else can offer. Humphry's is definitely one of those places!

We taste tested a lot of the flavors that they had, and they definitely are a place that is revolutionizing ice cream flavors. The two most interesting flavors that I taste tested was mint pepper, which was savory and really interesting, and wine & cheese...I didn't like that one, but props to them for making such a daring flavor.

I ended up going with Kumquat Poppy Seed, which had the rind of kumquats in there! The ice cream was very light and smooth. It didn't make my stomach hurt, which sometimes ice cream can do that. The poppy seeds added great texture too. The citrus flavor was prominent, and I fully enjoyed this tasty refreshing treat!

The staff was super friendly as well. I felt kind of bad since we taste tested all the flavors and it felt like as if we were cheating and getting free ice cream, but the woman who helped us was super nice about it, and told us which ones were the most popular as well.

I would come here again/recommend it to my friends for sure!
author: Hana B.

description:
So as to not inundate this Yelp page with any more raving about how great and unique the flavors are, I'll just say one thing:

Halvabaloo may scare you off with its combination of black vinegar and halva (a sweet sesame and honey treat), but give it a try -- it's a unique mix of sweet and sour in a non-sour-patch-kids way that is difficult to explain but immensely delicious!
author: Ingrid A.

description: I can't remember if I've gotten ice cream here before, but I did last night, so I thought I better write a quick review. Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream is in the Ferry Building, and it is open until 10pm, so I walked over to get a sweet treat. Slocombe has a bunch of creative flavors, but nothing that really jumped out at me. I wanted to get something rich and chocolatey, but I had no such luck. There was a dark chocolate smoked sea salt, but they only had pre-packed containers. Since I was staying at a hotel, I figured that'd be a waste. I ended up getting a 'Tin Roof Sundae' which was made with Tahitian Vanilla, frosted peanuts, hot fudge, & Maldon salt. Now that I think about it, I should've bought a pint of that dark chocolate ice cream instead of that $9 sundae. It was just okay and I went to bed still craving chocolate.
author: Lorianne L.

description:
My last visit was a bit disappointing. I was so excited to try some new flavors too! Not downgrading the rating because not all is lost. The quality of ice cream and service are still great, but I wanted to share my thoughts on a few flavors still in rotation.

- Jalapeño Cornbread: the texture in the sample was granular due to the cornbread crumbs. Jalapeño and cornbread flavor were there though.
- Toast & Jam: same texture as Jalapeño Cornbread. ugh. Sample wasn't enough to make a definitive opinion on flavor.
- Nectarine Plum Yogurt: bright, summer flavor, but I didn't want a whole scoop of it that day

I really wanted all of those flavors (and their texture) to blow me out of the water. The granular ones didn't in their samples, but I thought I would give the Jalapeño Cornbread a try in a full scoop. Wishful thinking.

Flavor was good; you can taste the cornbread, jalapeño, and I got a few small chunks of straight butter too. However, I couldn't really get over the texture. I think I'd like it better if the cornbread were either cut into whole chunks like the size of cookie dough gobs rather than what seemed like broken up pieces that were over mixed/folded in the ice cream, transforming the majority of the cornbread into crumbs.

Appreciate the creativity, but overall I wasn't sold.

PS only one flavor per scoop. Bummer, I know..
author: Lindsey C.

description:
Sometimes I wonder how they come up with flavors such as their "Secret Breakfast" with Bourbon and Corn Flakes. Corn Flakes? That's brilliant!!! Who knew the sweet Bourbon with crunchy corn flakes would go so well together! Yum! 

McEvoy Olive Oil is creamy and delicious. Again, why would anyone make an olive oil flavored ice cream?! And then when you try it, your eyes will just light up. The olive oil's presence is very sublte, but enough to make the ice cream extra smooth. It has this lingering almost nutty taste, very aromatic. I think they get their olive oils from the shop next door!

My only complaint was, they ran out of cones!! It was only 3pm in the afternoon. I think because of the long lines, they may have compromised on the quality of the ice cream because my "Secret Breakfast" was melty and not in a scoop form. I was a little sad.
author: Janny S.

description:
So my Yelp friends Anne C. and our CM, Emily C raved about this place. Could it live up to expectations? 

A big big yes.  The secret breakfast was so good that we had to come back twice to get it.  Just awesomeness in a cone.  

We didn't try the Dolly Parton (made with two melons, get it?) but did try several other flavors which were big hits too.

Is it as good as Bi-Rite? Better? Who knows. We had a split within our family on the answer. But I do know that you can't do wrong ordering from here. A great find in the Ferry Building. 

If you love ice cream, this should be on anyone's top 10 list.
author: Dan S.

description: This place is a MUST! I never thought ice cream could be this delicious! I had the special of the day - a scoop of ice cream, a chocolate brownie, and chocolate fudge. Let me start by saying I'm super picky when it comes to brownies and fudge... And ice cream too... Lol. I picked the Tahitian vanilla ice cream. So delicious, creamy, smooth... Pure heaven! Next was the brownie. It was so dense yet soft. Rich chocolate flavor. Tasted homemade and fresh. Next, the fudge... Oh the fudge! I wanted to go back and order a huge cup of pure fudge with a spoon! It was so rich, thick, smooth, and just utterly amazing! I literally scraped the bowl clean with my spoon. Would've licked the bowl clean if I hadn't been out in public. Lol! So worth it!
author: Lissette B.

description:
Though I don't consider myself an ice cream connoisseur - I like a good scoop (or 3) from time to time.  Heading to San Francisco this past weekend I had heard several times from our Hartford CM  Emily C that every time she was in the city, she headed to Humphyry Slocombe Ice Cream and that if I was there I HAD to get a flavor called Secret Breakfast.  Oh and by the way, she said, it's made with bourbon and corn flakes.  

Say What?????  Now I like "things" in my ice cream but cornflakes AND bourbon.

However, being the adventurous Yelper that I am - I figured I could try anything once and if I did not like it I would get another flavor to "mask" the flavor.  

Pro Tip #1- if you are there first thing in the morning and they are open - regardless of the time - stand in line.  I made the mistake of waiting until "ice cream time" (about 3pm) and the line was plenty long.  No worries - I was able to pursue the Flavor of the day (see picture) and read some other reviews which leads me to Pro Tip #2 - the staff lets you try samples - Score.  

So after a bit of a wait (not too long though, those employees are lightening fast!) - I was able to sample the Candy Capp, Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple and Matchata.  All were good but I passed on the PB as it was something I could get any where and Matchata as it was Meh.  I also tasted the Candy Capp and told the employee it tasted like Butter Pecan - however this was not the case - it is actually a mushroom (What????) that they steep and use to flavor the ice cream.

So I ended up with two scoops - this Secret Breakfast (I was already going to get it so why try it) and Candy Capp.  No toppings or flavors for this girl - I needed to try it in it's purest forms.

Taking my cup outside I dug in and OMG - I know this is used a lot but that is what I felt.  The ice cream was not too sweet but creamy and luscious.  And that cornflake/bourbon combination - Game Changer.  I could definitely taste the bourbon and the crunch of the crushed cornflakes made this flavor a winner.  

So glad I was the adventurous Yelper or I would have missed out on trying some unique and very flavorful ice cream.  It was what I needed to wet my sweet tooth
author: Anne C.

description:
I wanted to go to another location that I saw on yelp but we were in the ferry building and I saw it in there so yay! The bf was instantly attracted to the Glenlivet ice cream float that they had. I sampled 2 flavors and instantly chose those 2. The girl that helped us was really friendly and helpful. My bf just wanted the Glenlivet ice cream but she said that it was portioned with the floats because it was a special that would be gone by last Sunday. But she did let us try it and we got the float anyways. 
The blue bottle vietnamese coffee is really good and there's a blue bottle store right across from it! The wicked flavor is matcha cookies and cream. OMG. When I heard that I had to try it. It was sooooooo bombbbbbbbbbbbb.com. I would have to say that it is now one of my favorite icecream flavors. I ended up mixing it with the coffee and it was even better. Everything just went really well together.
My boyfriend ate all of the ice cream out of the float and got a little buzzed. That ice cream was pretty strong.
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
Jasmine Lychee - Tastes like flowers! I couldn't really taste the lychee flavor, but the jasmine was a nice touch.
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - SO delicious. Tasted exactly like Vietnamese coffee, but in ice cream form. Win!
Secret Breakfast - I tried this because it's a pretty popular flavor, but it wasn't my favorite. I'm not a huge fan of bourbon, but for those of you who are, this could be a great choice for you!

I will have to say though, that my three flavor combination was a pretty good one, and I thought they all complemented each other in a delicious way. The wait on a Saturday around 3pm was around 30 minutes! It was a pretty long line. No problem though. I think it was worth it. 

Would I wait that long again? Maybe...only if they had different flavors that I wanted to try! Thanks for delicious tasting ice cream. The titles are very apropo!
author: Crystal C.

description: I had the kumquat poppy seed ice cream. It was sweet, creamy, a little tarty, and a little citrusy. Undoubtedly, it was one of the most unique flavors of ice cream that I tried. It seemed like Humphry's signature was offering one of a kind flavors.
author: Joseph T.

description:
Had to rewrite this review after another trip here and after realizing I was dumb and posted my review to the wrong location:

I can't deny always wanting to make a stop at Humphry's whenever I'm in the Ferry Building. The line can be long or short, it's all just luck to be honest. I've been here at random times of random weekdays/weekends and I haven't noticed a consistent trend yet. Today I came on a Friday and the line was basically empty the whole day.

On my first trip here I of course had to give their famous Secret Breakfast a try. It basically tastes like corn flake cereal/milk with bourbon and I gotta say the two flavors work together damn well. It's not my favorite flavor ever but I'd definitely recommend sampling it. I've also really enjoyed the Szechuan strawberry. It has a very strong fresh strawberry flavor and the slightest bit of spice leaves you with the classic tingling lips feeling. I also love the Jasmine Lychee flavor. The lychee is very subtle but pairs very well with the Jasmine. I also loved their Spring Ale flavor though a full scoop of it was a bit heavy. I believe the various beer flavors are mainly available during SF Beer Week.

I also gave the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Ice Coffee another try today and it was more fragrant than my previous trips. I still wouldn't opt for it considering there's so many other options but if you're looking for a safe choice, this one's for you.

The only ones I wouldn't personally go back for are the Peanut Butter Curry or the Brown Butter. I'm not saying they're not good. They're both decent. While the curry one is interesting and the combo works, it's just a bit too much for me as a full scoop. The brown butter was just a bit too savory for me and a full scoop of it is just too much. Overall, I really like this place and would love to come back!
author: Vivian C.
