description:
Ice cream snob in the house! Yes, that's me. 

After a full morning of foodieventures in SF, I was stuffed as a button! I debated whether topping off my muffin top with some ice cream was the smart choice, but hey, ya only live once! 

I had all intentions of ordering the secret breakfast during my long wait in line, but ended up settling for strawberry (I did sneak in a sample of the secret breakfast) because the strawberry was that damn amazing! The ice cream prices are a tad steep but I'd give my left arm if I'd have to because it was so rich and creamy and screamazing!
author: Kathy D.

description:
I was very disappointed in how they treated my family (and my three children), after we showed up at 9:20pm, 10 minutes before the closing. They would refuse to service us because because they had four other groups in front of us. I am sorry, but we ran for 30 minutes from Pier 39 so we could try your glorified ice-cream!!  instead, we were told "sorry, you are out of luck! we have other people in front of you....the other location at Mission is still open"
Yes, I thought, let me load all of my kids in the car and I'll be right on my way! are you kidding me? 
the queue of people in front us was shocked! they came up and said "if you were running your business and cared for it, you wouldn't turn your customers 10 minutes before you close!" It takes 2 minutes to scoop the ice-cream! common... The ice-cream guy was unbreakable, he had every answer for every plead. It was apparent he didn't care what everyone thought of him and this business at that moment.
Thank you to the girl in front of the line for offering to buy ice-cream for my 5 and 7 year old girls. It was a sweet gesture that my family appreciated.  Shame on you, Humphry Slocombe. I know this 1-star rating will not affect your flavors, but your customer service needs improvement desperately.
author: Anya P.

description:
ICE CREAM:
This ice cream is so delicious!! There are only 2 real flavors that are worth $5 ice cream to me!! 1) SECRET BREAKFAST & 2) MATCHA-DOODLE. The secret breakfast is vanilla ice cream with bourbon and corn flakes-super delicious!! If you love this, also try the SECRET BREAKFAST COKE FLOAT-I think its more worth it since you get more ice cream and a mini coke. Also try MATCHA DOODLE, which is green tea ice cream with snickerdoodle cookie bits. I can never choose what to get between these two!!

SERVICE:
Expect a super long line. It doesn't move by fast but the ice cream is worth it!

TIPS:
Try as many flavors as you want-they give free samples. Also, the ice cream flavors change daily so everyday you go is kind of a surprise.

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? YES!!! MUST EAT!
author: Kelley Y.

description:
I tried this place out on a whim while I was wandering through the Ferry Building's Marketplace during their weekend farmer's market outside, and WOW their Secret Breakfast ice cream is officially my jam! It's a bourbon ice cream base with carmelized cereal bits in it to add a chewy crunch and completely fulfilled my cravings for After's Milk & Cereal ice cream--no, probably surpassed it.

They have a rotation of other delicious flavors that they display on their tiled wall. To be honest, sometimes it can be really difficult to read if you're trying to make some choices for samples beforehand. However, employees were nice and patient while I was there and gave me great recommendations. There is usually always a line so be aware of that, but it usually goes fast.

Come during the farmer's market and you can eat some while checking out the fresh flowers and fruit outside, a prime weekend gallivant!
author: Rene B.

description:
I don't understand the hype. 

Honestly, not just a few fries short of a happy meal, but the toy too. This place leaves so much to be desired. The flavors are monotone, the amount of fixin to ice cream ratio is pretty skimpy, and it's almost good, but not quite. I ended up throwing away what I had after a few bites. Subpar.

Sorry, Humphrey! You're not worth the wait in line or the calories. I've had better.
author: Shereen A.

description:
Omg...the ice cream here is out of this world!

There's usually a long line of people at this place...but that's always a good thing, right? Trust me...it's well worth the wait as the lines move pretty quickly here. 

This place has an exceptional list of unique ice cream flavors to cater to every pallet. I ended up getting the Harvey milk and honey graham ice cream, and it was pretty epic. The ice cream itself is a vanilla based ice cream with chunks of graham cracker mixed into it. The ice cream was really creamy and absolutely delicious. 

I give this place a 4/5 only because the portion size was on the smaller side compared to the price paid (it's $4 for a single scoop). But I'd probably come back considering how good the ice cream was.
author: Claudia C.

description:
Deliciously gourmet ice cream. t'was a little too soft the last visit, not sure if it was warmer than usual or we just weren't eating it fast enough?

Portions are pretty good for the price, but then, it's the Ferry building, you don't expect affordable prices here.

3.5 stars. I know some are huge fans... I enjoy it but oddly enough I can resist.
author: Brian W.

description:
I was so happy I finally got to give this place a try! All the glowing reviews are well earned. 

We just finished eating lunch at il Cane Rosso, and I knew I didn't want to leave the building without dropping by the famous ice cream shop.

The line surprisingly wasn't long when we got there around lunchtime on a Saturday. I'm pretty sure I would've waited had there been a line, but I now know if I'm ever back in the area and there's a wait, the wait would be totally worth it.

The staff is very friendly and efficient, and you're free to sample the different flavors. I tried the viet coffee, which was heavily raved about. It was tasty and had a strong flavor to it, but I felt like ordering the pepper and mint chip instead. 

My boyfriend ordered the banana strusel (?) and the viet coffee, both of which he incredibly enjoyed. Prices are great for the quality and amount you're given, at $4 for 1 large scoop. The flavors are incredibly unique, and I'd love to come back and try out some more.
author: Alyssa B.

description: Tried the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham ice cream and it was smooth and creamy with chunks of chewy honey graham crackers throughout. It was so good, but so expensive. $4.25 for one scoop on a cone.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
I generally prefer ice cream places that stick to simple traditional flavors. At some of the places I've been to in the Bay Area (looking at you Ici's), it seems like the ice cream makers are trying to imitate the chewing gum from Willy Wonka that was a roast beef dinner with tomato soup and blueberry pie for dessert. In my opinion, all of those places come up short with their convoluted flavor combinations, and I just end up feeling blue (or should I say violet). That being said, Humphry Slocombe has managed create innovative flavors of ice cream without going completely overboard. Each ice cream that I tasted at Humphry Slocombe had a simple clean taste supported by a smooth, rich (but not overly so) body.

The first flavor that I tried was black sesame. If you have ever tried Beckmann's wonderful three-seed sourdough bread, this ice cream managed to capture that same tantalizing taste but in ice cream form. I tried a couple other flavors which were good too, although the flavors escape my memory now.

I ultimately decided on the Secret Breakfast which is bourbon ice cream with corn flakes. The bourbon aspect of the ice cream was incredibly well done. The ice cream was just sweet enough and still maintained the warm gentle burn of bourbon in spite of being cool and creamy. The crunchiness of corn flakes provided an excellent textural contrast to the softness of the ice cream. Although it was a bit pricey, I feel that the high quality justified the price. Humphry Slocombe definitely lives up to the hype and its high Yelp reviews.
author: Ravi S.

description: The secret breakfast here is amazing. I've also tried the Vietnamese blue bottle coffee which is also good, but definitely can't beat the secret breakfast. It's definitely pricey here and the line was really long when I went, but the ice cream is so good, so it's worth it. I would definitely like to stop by again next time I'm in the area.
author: Winnie X.

description:
Ice cream heaven!! 

My husband braved the insanely long line. I thought, no way it could be worth the wait. But the line moved quickly and it was worth every minute in that line! 

So many fun, unique flavors, but also standard ones, too. Great for adventurous types as well as those who like the basics. 

2 scoops - strawberry & cinnamon. Both were so creamy and I could immediately tell that they were made with quality ingredients. It just melted in my mouth. The strawberry was bright and fresh, but the real star was the cinnamon! Get me an IV of that!! So, so good!!!
author: Elise H.

description:
There isn't much to be said about this shop in the Ferry Building that hasn't been said by the 556 other reviewers before me. This place is awesome. 

Pro tip for the fellow Vietnamese people out there: GET THE VIET COFFEE FLAVOR. JUST DO IT. IT'S LEGIT. 

Oh, and the Secret Breakfast is good too, I suppose.
author: Viet N.

description: My fiancé was in love with the secret breakfast, I got the peanut butter fudge ripple and salted caramel cocoa nib and wasn't extremely impressed. Good - not great. And the woman who helped us was less than friendly.
author: Hannah K.

description: I've always passed by this place in the Ferry Building and finally decided to give it a try.  Glad I did, I really love their Secret Breakfast flavor which has some cornflakes and bourbon in it!  The ice cream had great smooth texture, but I would say that the cornflakes were a little on the chewier side.  I also tried the POG flavor which is a common juice in Hawaii (Passion Orange Guava).  The flavor was spot on to the juice I remember from Hawaii!  I also sampled the jasmine lychee which was also great holding hints of the tea and lychee and the creaminess of the ice cream itself.  Great ice cream spot!
author: Bryson L.

description:
As this place was on the Embarcadero and in the Ferry building, you'd expect it to have long lines filled with tourists. And that's exactly what I got. However, the line moved fast and was worth it. The struggle I had was between the black sesame or oolong flavour, and I knew two scoops of ice cream would be too much. They both had very earthy flavours that weren't too sweet or overwhelming, that's my jam for ice cream and Humphry Slocombe definitely delivered.

I ended up going with the oolong ice cream on a cone. The one downside was that the portion of ice cream was rather small. When most ice cream shops say "one scoop", its usually one scoop and a little more. However Humphry Slocombe was pretty literal with the "one scoop" such that once I got to the cone, there was no ice cream in the cone and I was just eating cone. A bummer end to such a wonderful eating experience... but clearly not too much of a bummer because I still rated this place five whole stars.
author: Pam H.

description:
This is exactly what businesses should strive for.

Customer service - 5 stars.

Quality of products - 5 stars.

Creativity of products - 5 stars.

Location - 5 stars.

Value / price - 5 stars.

I love that they have a smaller location down in the Ferry Building. Saves me an additional stop in town as this combines my favorite ice cream stop with a grazing opportunity through the many vendors. 

The line was reasonable and moved fast. It was a tad awkward to line up basically in the middle of the walkway as the hallway isn't too large to begin with. 

I have tried and enjoyed almost all of their flavors during my many visits to their main location. My favorites are Jesus Juice, Blue Bottle and Secret Breakfast. This visit they had Banana Streusel. One sample spoon of the Banana and I was hooked. I ordered a scoop of Banana and a scoop of Blue Bottle. Blue Bottle always has the best sharp coffee flavor. Pure coffee perfection. The banana was refreshing. Small pieces of streusel combined with a strong banana flavor. A bite of the two together was like brunch in a spoon. A sharp bite of flavor with the coffee combined with the subtle banana bread flavorings. A perfect pairing.

The staff were smiling and seemed genuinely happy to be serving up scoop after the scoop to the ever growing lines of customers.

I will always add this to my list of stops when in the area. I love supporting this company and enjoying a delicious treat! I only wish I lived closer so I could take pints to go!
author: Sabrina B.

description:
I have passed by this cute ice cream stand in the Ferry Plaza Building several times.  However, I have never found the space after pigging out at Hog Island Oyster or other eateries in the area.  This is an outlet of the main location, on Harrison & 24th in SF.

Humphry has new flavors daily, and unique ones like the caramel apple I ordered ($4 one scoop).  The ice cream was very good.  It was served in between soft & hard, and the flavors really stood out.  Nonetheless, I think Mitchell's in SF and McConnell's (Santa Barbara & Grand Central Market LA), are better.

The space is really cute, and the signature two cow head sign is genius:  4 Stars.  The workers are super nice, and allow you a taste w/ a real spoon:  4 Stars.

I have to remember not to eat so much when I am in the area to save room for some very good ice cream, with unique flavors, and friendly service.
author: Joe P.

description: Best ice cream ever, seriously though it is. Had many flavors  here but the Eton Mess is amazing. That malted milk ball one is serious too. I don't pass the ferry building without getting this, it's that good, even if the line looks like it sucks just wait it in because there will not be any disappointment.
author: Scott B.

description:
Yes, I got lured in by The Secret Breakfast. I mean, how can one not try that? I came for the bourbon but stayed for the ice cream, lol. I thought I was too full to eat anything else after my lunch but it was really delicious and I finished it all! I'm sure the other flavors are great as well--looking forward to trying some other flavors the next time I'm in town! The Vietnamese Coffee flavor, in particular...

STEPH JUDGEMENT: Great unique ice creams in the Ferry Building.
author: Steph H.

description:
A little pricey but honestly one of the best ice creams I've had, with its rich and creamy textures. I love how unconventional the flavors are--the Secret Breakfast with its strong bourbon flavors and crunchy corn flakes is hands down my favorite, but I also really like the Vietnamese coffee and the Adzuki Dr. Pepper (seasonal). 

It's always a treat to stop by this place.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Delicious! Secret breakfast sundae with the cornflakes and caramel bourbon! All I can say is yum!
author: Chelsey L.

description:
LONG line!!! Located in the north side of the Ferry Building, we decided we wanted a sweet treat before heading off to Union Square. On a weekend, to get ice cream, the line wraps around in a loop, but it quickly goes (unless you get people who are very indecisive and they ask for every single sample!). UGH... Annoying...

We opted to share a 3 scoop - salted caramel, peanut butter cup and maple pecan. Surprisingly the best flavor was the salted caramel. We decided to just mix it all together since the pbc and maple flavors lacked a bit. Once swirled, it was delicious!
author: Maria C.

description:
This location is perfect: nestled right in the fairy building and just right for either a snack while walking around or dessert after one of the places in the ferry building. There's never a long line when I go and I like that they have like a whole wall that explains all the flavors and things.

I'm super basic in that my go-to is their Secret Breakfast. It's just so good! The bourbon taste is strong but not overpowering and I love that there's something crunchy in it too. It's perfect. Really rich and doesn't melt too fast. I also highly recommend their Vietnamese coffee, Christmas Story, Honey Graham, and really anything else that they have. I've also heard a lot of positive things about their sundaes but have yet to try them. Anything and everything here is absolutely to die for. Any time I'm in the area, I always make sure to stop by.
author: Catherine B.

description:
Whoah I really like this. Lately I've really been getting into this whole gourmet ice cream scene and am definitely happy I've come this far since I can never go back to those Haagen Daz days again. 

I came to Humphry Slocombe around 1pm and holy was it crowded. I waited in line for about 10 minutes or so which I think is insane. But anyways the line was basically four rows deep when I got there. They are really efficient at serving you though so I guess the people before me were just slow choosers.

As per Yelpers, I tried the Secret Breakfast and the Four Barrel Vietnamese Coffee. The bourbon flavor is definitely evident in the Secret Breakfast and I don't really like bourbon so it wasn't for me, but the coffee was so so so spot on. Would definitely come back. I've had a lot of coffee flavors but this one is just perfection. Literally just tastes like coffee but in ice cream form. Texture is great--doesn't get all melty-like which is a quality I've noticed is pretty common amongst all these new gourmet ice cream places

It's expensive, but the scoops is definitely very generous as you can see in my photos. Huge giant scoop makes for a happy girl on a Friday afternoon.

tldr; yum super good ice cream at a higher price but the quality is so worth it. go for the four barrel vietnamese coffee
author: Jasmine X.

description: I LOVE THEIR ICE CREAM! Best in the bay area that I've had. It's so smooth and creamy and all their flavors are amazing! My fav is the blue bottle coffee but I've also sampled a lot and almost every flavor I've had is just so good! Their service is great because they're willing to let you sample as many as you want and they give you a good scoopful of it. Whenever I'm in the Ferry building, you bet that I'll be in line here getting myself at least 1 scoop!
author: Cynthia H.

description: So I am really not a big ice cream guy, but the lady has been raving about this for a long time. So we were finally here and decided to give it a try. The line gets crazy long especially on hot days, but hey as long as its good its worth the wait...and it was fantastic. The people working were nice..the ice cream was great. The Elvis one is what I got...and it was great...would come back.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I'm rather curious what would have happened if Truly Scrumptious left Caractacus Potts at the altar in "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang" and instead married Humphry Slocombe because she discovered she couldn't live without his Secret Breakfast. Would that make her Truly Scrumptious-Slocombe? Because Humphry's ice cream is truly scrumptious, at least the flavors I favor like Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, but somehow the pixie dust got lost on the way from the Mission. That's probably because he took the 14 since that would make anyone homicidal or at least jaded about the world. I'm not sure what exactly happened on the trip or why it took so long for them to open at the Ferry Building.

All I know is that it's not the same satisfying experience here as it is in their little shop on Harrison. And that's a predicament for me and Jamie W. After all, the lines are long at both places, but the stampede mentality of the tourists here makes the wait more disheartening, especially since there is an equally long line at Blue Bottle across the hall. Needless to say, the congestion is unnerving and brings out the worst, anti-United Nations behavior out of the multilingual masses. As we waited for the samplers to try everything in the case, I perused the subway tiles and noticed the prices went up in the past couple of years as a two-scooper is now $5 whereas that used to get you a third (photo: http://bit.ly/1r77Kjw).

But given that you can get Humphry Slocombe at a lot of the trendier eateries in town now, I guess I shouldn't mind paying for their overhead. I didn't even bother sampling and threw caution to the wind. For something completely different, I had the Brown Butter with Blueberry Swirl and the Harvey Milk & Honey (photo: http://bit.ly/1ukHFyO). Good, creamy but surprisingly melty like their freezer wasn't gauged quite right. I've been back since and experienced the same meltiness.By the way, they're not very consistent on when they close in the evenings, as Jamie W. and I have come before their stated closing hour only to find them locked up for the night. Maybe Truly wlll whip him into shape with a little chitty chitty, bang bang...if you know what I mean.

ICE CREAM - 3.5 stars...great flavors still but more melty in texture here than on Harrison
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...if they set Soylent Green in San Francisco, here is where it would be
SERVICE - 3 stars...efficient, probably tired of demanding tourists
TOTAL - 3 stars...some of the Humphry Slocombe magic is lost amid the packs of tourists...lick with caution
author: Ed U.

description: Not only was the Harvey Milk flavor insanely good, but the name honors two of my favorite characters! Highly recommended after dinner at Hog Island Oysters or for a quick treat at any time.
author: Patricia B.

description:
WOW. This may be the best ice cream I've had, definitely the best I've had in a long time. The line out the door was the first clue, then I read the Yelp reviews and saw only ONE negative review. My boyfriend said I had to try it and I'm glad I listened!

Such interesting flavors, wish I could have tried the one with the chocolate covered potato chips but wasn't on the menu this time around. I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and the Malted Milk Chocolate with the Bourbon Caramel sauce. OMG DELICIOUS!

I don't typically like coffee flavored ice cream but the Blue Bottle was amazing! Not overpowering at all. The Malted Milk Chocolate tastes like it was straight out of a 50s diner. The ice cream was so rich and creamy, not hard and icy at all. Kind of melted a little fast but didn't bother me at all because I love having the "soup" at the end.

Will FOR SURE be coming back every time I'm in SF!
author: Danielle Y.

description:
TL;DR - Did I just.... miss the mark?

What is going on??

EVERYONE raves about this place and I had to come to the Ferry Building to check it out.

Initially I was kinda impressed by the flavor variety and cool aesthetics. 

Then.... it all went downhill. The service was very lackluster and I felt really rushed (despite the fact that it was 50 degrees out and the place was empty) We decided on the miso apple, secret breakfast and maple walnut. The miso apple tasted more like a cheesy fruity mix. I thought I liked it, but.... after a couple bites, I scooped up the rest and tossed it. The secret breakfast.... meh. Are people new to alcohol infused ice cream? Because this was really unimpressive.... The maple walnut was the best and that was the safest flavor choice. Despite the flavors, what really stood out was the fact that the base was super icy. I mean, chunks of ice with every bite. Yikes.

The flavors were ok, but it was the texture that really lowered the rating. Its already cold out, so why is my ice cream melting as though it was actually 100 degrees out? Right from the freezer, the ice cream already started drooping when the scooper put it on the cone stand. After I paid and went to get the cone, the ice cream was already melting down the sides of the cone.

Final Verdit: Overhyped and failed to deliver.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Humphry Slocombe ice cream flavors are just as unique + unusual as their name. This is my go-to sweet spot for a taste of quirky. 

My favorite flavors are Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (Blue Bottle Coffee, condensed milk, chicory), Secret Breakfast (condensed milk, bourbon, caramelized cornflakes), Black Sesame (toasted and nutty black sesame).

Quirky flavors I want to try: Honey Thyme, Jesus Juice, Mexican Chocolate, Strawberry Szechuan Sorbet, Banana Chai, Kurios ~ Cirque du Soleil (say, whaaaaa?), White Miso Pear, Carrot Mango Sorbet, Earl Grey Plum Sorbet, Pear Lambic Sorbet, Valrhona Fudge Sorbet.
Full list of flavors - http://www.humphryslocombe.com/flavors/all-flavors/

The ice cream is made with ingredients whose quality you can taste, and they're often sourced from local producers like Andante Dairy, Straus Family Creamery, and Blue Bottle Coffee. 

I adore their location in the Ferry Building. The Ferry Building is a one-stop-shop for all things delicious, artisanal and cool. 

I'd try every flavor if I lived in the Bay. For the sake of my waistline, maybe it's a good idea to keep a 6 hour drive between us.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Got a scoop of the secret breakfast flavor ice cream, my partner in crime got the Vietnamese coffee flavor. The coffee flavor was strong - just like a good Vietnamese coffee. The bourbon and corn flake flavors with the creamy, buttery hints were downright decadent. One scoop was plenty as an afternoon snack while wandering the terminals - just plain outright yummy!
author: Saori T.

description: I rarely write reviews, ice cream is great but a girl who just got her teeth pulled should not be working there looking rude and like she's about to kill someone.
author: Chris L.

description:
The biggest struggle that I have when I come here is trying not to be that annoying person that asks for a million samples because so many of the flavors sound (and prove to be) so good. Hence why I always split sample spoons with my boyfriend, when we want to try a few of the same flavors ^^;;

I've gotten Brown Butter, Harvey Milk & Honey Graham, Black Sesame, plus sampled a bunch of others. But there's no use looking at review highlights and flavor suggestions on the Yelp page for this place, because no matter what you try, the ice cream is always super creamy and super flavorful.

The staff is usually friendly accommodating too!

Definitely one of my favorite ice cream shops in the Bay Area
author: Sara L.

description: I was not planning on eating ice cream thinking I could pass on the extra calories. Then someone in our group bought a cone with two scoops. The top scoop was strawberry.  I took a taste and that was all it took and I found myself in line anxiously waiting for my turn. The two flavors I bought were malted chocolate and of course, strawberry. Ecstasy! Creamy, full of rich flavor authentic to name of the flavor. Some one in our group is dairy free so they tried the tried the Earl Grey Plum Sorbet was good too!  Don't miss this treat!
author: Jaqueline B.

description:
Really good custom flavored ice cream. We got honey graham and malted chocolate and it was creamy and delicious!

If you're not sure which flavor you'd like, sample a few!

Worth stopping by and walking around the ferry building as you enjoy your ice cream.
author: Francisco D.

description:
Where there is a line, there must be great food!

Located in the Ferry Market Building, HS had just that...a huge line! After yelping the spot, I just had to have a scoop of this so called deliciousness!

About a dozen flavors were written on the wall and all sounded so good! The line went fast since we were busy trying to decide on our order. I sampled The Secret Breakfast (Bourbon Ice Cream mixed with cornflake cookie clusters) and the Blue Ribbon Vietnamese Coffee. The Secret Breakfast had a strong bourbon taste that was good but I just wasnt in the mood for. I decided on the single scoop of the Blue Ribbon Vietnamese Coffee that had a strong creamy coffee flavor that I needed after a long drive from the Monterey Bay area. My son sampled the Basil Lime Sorbet and Candied Ginger. He said they were both good, but the Basil Lime Sorbet was smooth and more refreshing. 

Price:
1 scoop $4
2 scoops $6
3 scoops $7.50
Choice of cup, cone, or both! 
Serving size is generous.

Service:
Line moves fast. Staff is surprisingly polite & friendly.

Overall, unique flavors with a great taste that is a must try.... just wish the ice cream was thicker and creamier. If you're in the area, stop by and try it so you can say you've tried one of the top 10 places to buy ice cream in the SF area. I can't wait to go back and try more of the flavors!
author: Marissa P.

description: This place is in the heart of fisherman marketplace. We tried their vietnamese coffee ice cream and they are as authentic as it gets. They got many flavors and specialty ice cream. Would definitely come back
author: Tan D.

description:
The line was long, the selections were limited, and the scoops were tiny. The nebulous names for some of the flavors, such as "Christmas Story" and "Classic Breakfast" without accessible descriptions made it difficult to decide on which flavors to sample, as I had no idea where to start.

I ended up getting the POG Sorbet, which was pretty sweet. I was very disappointed with the amount of scoop I got for the hefty $4 one scoop price. I would not come back here.
author: Krissy W.

description:
There is only one thing I come to Humphry Slocombe for... Secret Breakfast. That or the Coke Float with Secret Breakfast in it. This location is much more convenient for me than the Harrison St location, and both lines can get pretty long... totally worth it though. Especially on a rare hot San Francisco day. If you are with someone who has never tried Humphry Slocombe, drag them here and make them try a bunch of samples. Lots of interesting flavors.

At this particular location, I was annoyed by how rude the servers were. Both the girl serving ice cream and the cashier looked super miserable, and it's not like I was asking for a lot of samples or demanding complicated things. Anyways, I was not going to let crappy service ruin my delightful culinary experience. Humphry Slocombe is a local must-have!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Holy. Bananas. We went to both locations of Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream during our week long trip to San Francisco over Christmas. Because we're from New England, it's always the time of year to eat ice cream and frozen treats. ALWAYS.

The flavors are imaginative and delicious. I like unusual and different when it comes to edibles, so I was absolutely not disappointed with the rosemary ice cream, peanut butter rootbeer, and best of all, the bourbon cola float-- utilizing their 'Secret Breakfast' flavor (bourbon and cornflake) for cola float with bourbon caramel. It was delicious!


Very long wait, even despite it being the dead of winter. It was well worth it, but only if you're a diehard fan of ice cream. Had I been a local, I don't know if I would have waited as long with so many bored children in line (I'm not exactly a fan of unruly children and enjoy having an unmolested personal space).

Already cannot wait to come back to San Francisco to feast on such delicious ice cream. Thankfully, we do have an ice cream maker and their recipe book to hold us over for the mean time.
author: Erica T.

description:
The line wasn't too long, but it still took a while, about 20-30 minutes. The wait is most likely due to customers getting samples.

I sampled the vanilla and breakfast and settled with breakfast in a cup. The flavor is unique and the ice cream was enjoyable. I'd like to try the green tea next time. Someone else got the green tea with chocolate drizzle on it and it looked delicious. Just beware that even though the line doesn't look long, it will take a long time to get your ice cream.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The best ice cream in SF Bay Area! I like WICKED the most. However, they don't have that flavor right now and I'm hoping it will be back in Summer. Second and third choices are Tahitian Vanilla and Secret Breakfast.
author: Euodia A.

description:
After a very filling visit to many different stalls I couldn't resist having a little dessert. What better place for some ice cream than the famous Harvey Slocombe.

I  sampled a few of their options, including Secret Breakfast, which I didn't love (or even really like, guess I'm the only one). I opted for the salted chocolate. It had a salty, smoky flavor that I loved. It was rich and silky smooth. It had a savory and sweet combination that I loved. 

It was the perfect way to cap a very successful Saturday morning of eating and shopping. I'm always so happy when a popular institution lives up to all the hype.
author: Emily R.

description:
The only reasons we came to Humphry Slocombe was because it was near our hotel and they had interesting flavors. I really didn't expect much, but I ended up loving their ice cream! It is some of the best ice cream I've had in the country.

As a lover of traditional vanilla bean ice cream, I had to force myself to try something different. After reading reviews, I decided to sample secret breakfast. It didn't sound good to me at all. I didn't think bourbon and milk would mix. Then, to top it all off, there was cornflakes in it? Gross!! BUT I was soooo wrong! Secret breakfast was amazing!! Somehow, everything came together and made one of the best ice creams I've ever had. The cornflakes are actually cornflake cookies, not straight up cereal! The cookie pieces reminded me a lot of Momofuku Milk Bar's cereal crunch topping. I'm obsessed with anything pumpkin, so I also got a scoop of peppered pumpkin. I enjoyed it and it didn't taste spicy or peppery to me. Probably because they use ancho chilies peppers, which are sweeter.

The scoops are huge! I would recommend sharing with someone if you want multiple flavors instead of ordering them all for yourself. Although, I would totally understand if you want all the ice cream for yourself :) If I travel to San Francisco again, I will definitely come back to Humphry Slocombe to try all their unique and delicious flavors!! :)
author: Kellie Y.

description: yummy ice cream in the ferry building with interesting flavors (black sesame, viet coffee, bourbon and cornflakes) along with the more mainstream options. lines can be long at lunch, but totally worth it. take a taste before you order because some of the flavors are so unusual
author: Bob U.

description: Secret Breakfast!  The best ice cream I've had.  The smooth bourbon flavor and the crunch of the corn flake cookies make this one of the best scoops around.  We luckily stopped here after dinner with no lines and enjoyed the perfect treat to end a great dinner.  Really can't speak of any of the other flavors and I will probably just keep getting Secret Breakfast for the rest of my life.  Enjoy!
author: Brandon K.

description: Humphry's always has such adventurous flavors! We've always received amazing customer service when visiting.  Highly recommended!!!
author: Kris V.

description: Super yummy and unique flavors! Pricey though, I believe it's $4ish for a single scoop. The lines can be long but they move relatively quickly. I've tried many of the flavors but my favorites so far have been the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Harvey Milk and Graham. I'm usually not a huge fan of coffee flavored ice cream but this one for some reason is different. I didn't get sick of it at all, in fact I wanted more after I was finished! The Harvey Milk and Graham has a honey flavor to it which complements the milk ice cream and Graham pieces suuuuuper well. I would get it again in a heartbeat! Every time I'm in SF I need to stop by Humphry's!! Definitely would recommend!
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Of course the line was ridiculous and of course the prices would be inflated, even longer and pricier than Ici in Berkeley! ...but I guess it's tourist jurisdiction.

So, is it all hype?
I thought it was pretty good.
I've never had EVOO ice cream before and it might seem disgusting and I thought the same but....it was DELICIOUS! Mildly tart and unique flavoring.
The Harvey milk & honey graham was also yummy. I'm not much of a milk drinker but the milkiness of this was like heaven.

*Like Ici, you can ask to sample the different flavors before deciding.

*Ici cones are far more flavorful, crunchier & in general just better than Humphry's.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
After a great lunch, we decided to end our lunch break with some great ice cream. My friend's claim was that this was the best ice cream in town. I was surprised to hear that with Fentons and other big names but I was definitely going to be open minded. 

It's a little stand from it's original location but just as awesome! Remember that you can try as many flavors of their ice cream before choosing your final decision. The staff was super helpful and really personable. She had a great attitude and made our experience awesome!!

For my lunchtime dessert, I got 2 scoops for $6. My flavors: Secret Breakfast and the Salted Caramel with Cocoa Nibs. OH-EM-GEE, what an amazing combo! The Secret Breakfast was flavored with Bourbon with cornflakes. What an awesome flavor. The ice cream was soft and the cornflakes brought a nice crunch texture. The salted caramel was also great! The small cocoa nibs offered a nice crunch as well and the flavors seemed to pop out at you! Both flavors were on point and HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

I haven't tried the other big ice cream joints in the city, but after trying Humphry's, the others have a tough competition. I'm so happy to have found an awesome ice cream joint so close to work. I will definitely be visiting this place again soon and so should you!
author: Rockne H.

description:
HOLY COW. How have I not reviewed this place. I've been here more than one and on multiple occasions to both of the locations. I even went out of my way to get here to pick up a pint for a gift. First off, you DEFINITELY have to go in a try the secret breakfast. No one else makes any thing close to this flavor and its description is cornflakes and bourbon--which can be a double edge for people who maybe don't like one, some or either of those two ingredients or just think it sounds plain weird. Don't bump it until you try it. It will melt in your mouth and give you a treat that you have never had before. BUT, if you don't like it, just sample as much as you want of their other interesting flavors like blue bottle coffee (located right across the way), jasmine lychee, or any of their special flavors of the month. you seriously can't go wrong with this place and will be happy you stopped in. The line can be pretty long at times, but is well worth the wait!

Happy Sweet Tooth finding and Eating!
author: Cherise K.

description:
I swear this place has THE BEST ice cream that's ever melted in my mouth!!!! I've walked past the lines here  few times while perusing through the Ferry Building and I AM SOOOOOO GLAD I decided to check out the hype. 
I didn't diverge from the popular flavor that was suggested so I went for it...SECRET BREAKFAST with Honey Caramel Bourbon Topping...I'm hooked!!!! 
It's sooo good that 3 pints of YUMMAGE is stored in my freezer...with the toppings of course!

The Secret Breakfast and Blue bottle Vietnamese Coffee is a great combo! Try it and you'll regain some ooomph in your ! NO REGRETS and dig in :P
author: Dee R.

description:
Oh, secret breakfast. I've never had the pleasure of anything like you before... bourbon vanilla creamy cornflake crunch. However, I have to say the bourbon flavor gets stronger as it begins to melt. I practically felt drunk by the time I made it to Battery Street!

Tucked snuggly right in the ferry building, with the handwritten list of today's stellar flavors, with fresh faced girls, silver spoon tastings, and free hot fudge if you're wearing Giants hear (during the World Series, I presume). LOVE. Coming back to snag a four dollar single scoop of pumpkin or the blue bottle vietnamese, ya best believe.
author: Natasha P.

description:
If you love ice cream, and you visit or live in San Francisco,  people are going to tell you that you have to try Humphrey Slocombe's. Do not trust these people when it comes to ice cream. In fact, you should seriously reconsider your relationship with them, and their general level of acumen about the world around them.

People rave about Humphrey Slocombe because it has funky flavors. OK, I can take a live and let live attitude when I walk into an ice cream store that serves lavender ice cream or even bone marrow ice cream (not a hypothetical) alongside essentials like salted caramel or some kind of chocolate. But when you offer me Thai chili lime or Harvey Milk and Graham (admittedly, an awesome name), but not a single chocolate or vanilla or caramel ice cream, I call into question your commitment to the long and proud tradition of sticking cream in a cold container and churning until it becomes delicious.

But fine, Humphrey,  I will roll with you. I will judge you on your own freaky flavored grounds. People rave about your "Secret breakfast" (bourbon and cornflakes), and much to my surprise, it wasn't disgusting. In fact, my first bite was even good. So I ordered a cone.

And hey, full marks for that:  A classic sugar cone, not one of those froufrou waffle cones that have been all too widely adopted. But hey, when your cone is the best thing about your ice cream, you are in trouble.

The ice cream itself has way, way too little butterfat. Very thin, even somewhat icy. I suppose the flavor intensity was OK, but how am I supposed to judge? I mean, I don't have anything to compare boozy cereal to unless I am a hard-core alcoholic who pours whiskey on my morning Cheerios.

In truth, this was perhaps a three-star ice cream, on a par with overreaching "artisanal" ice cream I will settle for on a hot day in a small town with no Bi-Rite Creamery.

But the fact that this place draws so much praise in a city with so many better options tells me that something has gone terribly wrong with the whole artisanal ice cream phenomenon and its emphasis on alternative flavours as opposed to essential quality. It even has me questioning foodie culture, and our society itself. When did we decide that something good and classic was less desirable than something mediocre but hip?

This ice cream tastes like existential despair.
author: Alexandra S.

description:
Very cute shop in the ferry building!! There was a decent line and we waited 5-10 mins. The workers are super cooperative and patient and give you really big spoonfuls for samples. I tried the poached pear (sweet with a strong red wine aftertaste), candy capp (can't describe but kind of tasted like roasted marshmallow??) and got the scoop of jasmine lychee (which was the most interesting combination of green tea with a hint of lychee). 

Cone and cup cost the same, and the sugar cone is pretty ok!!
author: Ariana C.

description: Really good ice cream!! And the price is not that bad at all! We came in at night, maybe around 7pm. I wasn't expecting the place to be in a terminal-like area. But it was nice and made me reminisce the foreign countries I went to!
author: Janet L.

description:
This ice cream shop in the Ferry Building was the best find on a BURNING HOT day. My friend and I were walking outside the ferry building and suddenly saw someone with an ice cream cone and realized we absolutely had to have one. Soooo we decided to explore the ferry building and ended up here. 

I've gotta say, this little shop is unlike any other ice cream shop i've ever been to. The flavors are all incredibly unique and intriguing. I wanted to try all of them but decided not to since the line was consistently long the entire time we were there and didn't want to hold everyone up. I ended up going with the Harvey Milk + Honey Graham and Black Sesame. Both were delicious! The black sesame was surprisingly sweet. I didn't even expect to like it but it was great. 

I totally get that this place is known for their unique flavors but would it kill them to have a Cookies & Cream flavor? I'm a creature of habit., what can I say?
author: Ilana B.

description:
Well I'll be a monkey's aunt, I think I've gone bananas for this place!

I've had their main location at Harrison bookmarked for the longest of times, but I never seem to find time to go to that one. However, upon my visit to the ferry building at the Embarcardero, I was surprised to find their stand there! Their menu is written on a wall in clear bold print, so you pretty much won't be confused.

I've heard about how tasty their ice cream is, and to my surprise, I was given the opportunity to try out almost all of the flavors (not the coffee ones because of lent, but when it's done maybe I'll take a whack at those).

To be clear, a LOT of their cream flavors have that saltiness to it. Idk about you, but the idea of putting salty and sweet together in ice cream works like hell for me. This isn't the "insanely sweet" ice cream you'd find at Baskin Robbins, but it's definitely worth trying.

I sampled the following:

Oolong Tea: my favorite one. The taste of actual oolong tea is prominent in this one and there's also a slightly salty kick to it.

Peanut Butter Curry: you would think, ew gross what?! BUT hot dang this one was unique. At first you get the peanuty taste of peanut butter, but as you taste it even longer, you will get the spicy curry kick to it also.

Salted Caramel Cocoa Nib: ah, this is the exactly what I mean about "salty and sweet". You have a very salty base, but then the caramel sets in and you taste the sweetness within the saltiness, if that makes any sense.

Basil Lemon Sorbet: this is a refreshing delight for the sunny days. The basil is very prominent in this one, with a very lemony citrus twist. And it's a sherbert, so there isn't any dairy in it. 

Tahitian Vanilla: the classic vanilla is good, but Tahitian vanilla is great. Made with 5 different kinds of vanilla beans (as said by the worker assisting us) this one is very creamy, sweet, salty, and rich in texture. There is also that nice hint of bourbon in there also!

McEvoy Olive Oil: yup, you guess it. Olive oil. How does that work, who knows? All I know is that it worked perfectly here. It's actually really creamy and has a slight buttery taste to it. 

Lemon Ginger Sorbet: oh oh oh I LOVE ginger, and this one tastes like citrus ginger! And it's a sherbet so it actually is really refreshing like the Basil Lemon. There's a spicy ginger taste to the citrusy lemon taste and it works so well!

Cinnamon Brittle: like french toast? This one's for you. It's a sweeter taste compared to the other flavors and it has that sweet cinnamony kick. It's creamy, and there's peanut brittle in every scoop!

Butter by Moodlight: not sure if its spelled "moodlight" or "moonlight" lol. This one is uber buttery is all I can tell you. I think this also had a hint of raspberry ribbon in it, but it was super buttery and creamy.

Secret Breakfast: definitely something you could consider "breakfast". Creamy, rich, sweet saltiness that melts in your mouth with ease. Nommies.

The worker was super helpful, so that's a plus for customer service. It is a slight bit pricey for a scoop, but the ice cream is worth it, imo. 

I believe they also sell other things here too. Will I be back? You bet.
author: Jerianne G.

description: I heard so much about Humphry Slocombe and wanted to try it out!  There are many different places to try in the ferry building so this location is perfect.  The line was pretty long.  I ordered the Vietnamese coffee and it was pretty good.  A place to try if you're nearby!
author: Mikayla M.

description: Black Sesame ice cream was great.  So was the Money Ball (secret breakfast plus bourbon caramel).
author: Mark B.

description:
Came here on a weekday around 3 pm to meet a friend. The line wasn't too long, but it was a rare hot day so there were a fair amount of people. However the line moved quickly and we only waited 5 minutes or so.

After trying a few flavors like the Harvey Milk and Honey, I decided to go with my go to - Secret Breakfast. I've always loved that you can actually taste the bourbon in it, and it mixes so well with the sweet taste of the vanilla and corn flakes. I do have to say it was a little on the melty side right when they handed it to me, but it was still just as good all the same.

I'd give 5 stars if it wasn't for the service. I'm used to going to the original location on Harrison, where the staff is always very friendly and interactive. Maybe it was just the heat, but the woman helping me was a little rude (rolled her eyes because she had to hold out her hand with my ice cream in it for a few seconds while I put my change in my wallet). It made me laugh more than anything, but not anything that would keep me from coming back.

I've seen pictures of the butterbeer flavor and am dying to try it flavor next time I'm back if it's available!
author: Jaymie S.

description:
I got to redeem my free scoop the other day, and what a perfect day it was to redeem it.  It was so hot and stuffy in the city, that a scoop of ice cream cooled me down a bit.  I tried the secret breakfast, which didn't really wow me.  But what did was the Toast & Jam.

The ice cream had bread crumbs in it along with a berry-jam flavor.  It was so good!  I could have eaten two more scoops because the flavor was so unique and tasty.  And despite all the carbs it had, it was pretty light, but still rich in texture.

My coworker and I were lucky to beat the line because once we got our scoops, the line started to form around Gott's.  But if you're in that situation, it's best to wait because the ice cream is worth it.
author: Vira P.

description:
Oh man, this was my first time trying Humphrey Slocombe and I must say, it was AWESOME.  

I usually like "traditional" flavors (my favorites are rocky road and mocha almond fudge) so I wasn't sure if I'd love their ice cream.  My BFF has been telling me to get the "Secret Breakfast" for years, but the description wasn't something I would get excited about.  I ended up getting the 3 scoop (to share!) because my Hubs, cousin, and I were pretty full.... we did the Secret Breakfast, Harvey Milk & Honey Graham, and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  First bite, Coffee... mmmm.  Second bite, Harvey Milk... oooh, yum... Last bite, Secret Breakfast *mind blown*.  The texture is amazing, the flavors pop, and it just doesn't taste like any other ice cream I've had in the past--and let's be real, I know my ice cream.

I love that you can pick up the prepackaged pints and now you can buy it at some local grocery stores!
author: Leanne P.

description:
My coworker and I were strolling though the Ferry Building earlier this week when the weather was warmer and decided to share a half pint of the Secret Breakfast.  The only flavors the cart had that day were Tahitian Vanilla and this.  The shop won't be ready until March in Ciao Bella's old space.  And as their sign says, cash only and no samples.  

The half pint ($5) was actually a good size though.  You do get a hint of bourbon mixed with the creamy vanilla ice cream complimenting the crunch of the cornflakes.  Though you can taste the bourbon, it's not harsh, and trust me because I don't enjoy dark liquor at all.  I do miss Ciao Bella though but I think Humphry Slocombe's storefront will be nice for the area, especially since there's only a few froyo places around.  I still think Bi-Rite has more attractive flavors, but I can't wait to try HS's other flavors as well.  3.5 rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description:
I feel like there is always a line here....for a good reason.  If you have the time, go for it!  

A single scoop will set you back $4, two scoops for $6.  If you want 2 flavors in 1 dish, you must order a 2 scoop bowl (no half scoops here).  Feel free to ask for a sample before you commit to an entire bowl....

My top 3 favorite flavors:

1.  Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes!!)
2.  Peanut Butter Chocolate (more PB than chocolate-- just the way I like it!)
3.  Lemon Vanilla Buttermilk


BTW, I think the relationship with Blue Bottle (about 10 fee to the east) is adorbs.  Humphry Slocombe has a Blue Blottle Vietnamese coffee flavor and Blue Bottle has a Humphry Slocombe offogato drink.  Now that's Ferry Building love right there!
author: Andrea H.

description:
Most ice cream places are good, great, delicious, nothing negative to say. But it's extremely rare when an ice cream shop completely "wows" me, and Humphry Slocombe did it for me! 

The flavors here are more unique than at other places. I literally wanted to try them all. Every sample I got was absolutely delicious but we decided on the secret breakfast and the Vietnamese iced coffee. Everything you've heard about the secret breakfast, I will back up a thousand percent. It is SO good. If you've had the cereal milk ice cream at Milk Bar, this is like that but on crack. I promise it won't disappoint unless you don't like bourbon or cereal flavored things which in that case, the Vietnamese iced coffee is just as amazing! And if you don't like that, well there's a lot more to try.

If I ever come back to SF, I'm making sure to come back here. Definitely one of the highlights of my trip!
author: Alice L.

description: Flavor wise it was pretty good, but it was really over priced and I thought it was a little icy.
author: Celeste A.

description: Went here because Gott's yogurt and ice cream was already closed. Decided to try a scoop of their Toast & Jam. Didn't disappoint it was rich and creamy jam was raspberry which i love raspberry jam. Only thing is $4.50 for a baby scoop is a bit pricy.
author: Stina N.

description:
Unusual flavors that tickle my adventure taste buds.

I walked by Humphry Slocombe and saw a list of random daily ice cream flavors.  Among the list was the flavor "Secret Breakfast."  I dropped what I was doing out of curiosity to examine the flavor.  A freshly made vanilla ice cream sweetened with bourbon and full of corn flakes.  I only planned on getting a light lunch but that combo of unheard of flavors had my full attention and was a must try before the day was through.

I came back with a hunger for sweet secret breakfast and saw a daily special called "Complete Breakfast".  It was a scoop of Secret Breakfast with a scoop of Vietnamese Coffee flavored ice cream, made with locally made coffee.  Bam!  I had the perfect combo pairing right in front of me.  The Vietnamese Coffee tasted sweet and strong and woke me right up.  The Secret Breakfast stole the show, with a sweet bourbon flavor accompanied by the crunchy texture of the cereal.  I also had a sample of the jasmine tea ice cream, which tasted like an ice cold cup of jasmine tea, very refreshing, but couldn't hold a candle to Secret Breakfast.

If Humphry Slocombe can keep up with the wonderful array of flavors, then expect me to be there every week to tr
author: Nadav P.

description:
Secret Breakfast, if I could have you as my secret breakfast I would have no words.

Though, I've heard the great rants and raves about Humphry Slocombe in the Mission I was glad to see they had a spot in the Ferry Building! Of course ... the long, winding line spoke volumes on the popularity of their ice cream- that and the fact it was a warm and toasty 70(ish) degrees in the city at that time.

For the day's flavors nothing stood out to me none other than the Secret Breakfast. "What's in it?" I ask my SF resident and great friend. "Bourbon and ..." - Bourbon? That's all I need to know, I was sold. Later figured out that it's a Bourbon vanilla ice cream with corn flakes and most likely one of the better ice cream flavors I've had in a long while- actually like in life. Great consistency, hefty portion and the flavor out of this world. Sounds crazy? Maybe I'm crazy, yes indeed for this genius idea! (I swear I'm not an alcoholic!) The flavor in itself is comical, a bourbon flavored ice cream with corn flakes. Bourbon is made of corn, it's like corn-ception. Appreciated the fact that the corn flakes are still crisp with a caramelized, slight bitterness to it.

Line went fast and the workers were quick with explaining what was in the flavors and offered samples. Very quirky bunch is a good description. One scoop is $4 then a dollar for any addition scoop. Interesting flavors, good quality and unique toppings make this place weirdly great. A must try!
author: Janet N.

description:
Pretty cool ice cream shop! :)

The ice cream flavors are all extremely interesting and unlike your standard flavors. I tried both the "Holiday surprise" (I think that's what it was called - it had vanilla ice cream, sugar cookies, and peppermint bark), and the Honey Thyme. I ended up choosing the honey thyme - it was extremely fresh tasting, and creamy. The texture of the ice creams were great! 

They have other flavors like blue bottle coffee, "Breakfast" (bourbon ice cream with corn flakes), oolong tea, tahitian vanilla, brown butter, etc. 

Definitely worth checking out - especially since it's inside the Ferry Building, which is super cool. Each single scoop is ~$4.25! They have some cool looking sundaes (including seasonal) that were tempting too!
author: Azinda M.

description: This ice cream shop is one of my favorite things about SF and The Ferry Building! All of their ice cream is made with high end and unusual ingredients, leading to some unique flavors that you won't find anywhere else. My favorite flavor is their famous and most popular "secret breakfast." Once you try it, you can never go back to ordinary ice cream again. The secret breakfast flavor is cornflake cookies with bourbon, which sounds really strange, but is actually the most delicious ice cream I've ever tried. I'm craving some right now! Yum yum yum.
author: Pooja M.

description:
Do you ever get eater's remorse? I do. I do the whole "let's be healthy today and get something that's not popular". And then what happens? I try the dehealthified item and I immediately look down at my super cute/small sorbet from a place that's known for it's ICE CREAM. 

DUH LISA. Ok, so, a group of co-workers and I braved the 20 minute line for this place, and I walked out with a sorbet.  The walk back was the functional equivalent to the Walk of Shame on a Sunday morning.  Just sad.  While I had tasted the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Chocolate flavors, I decided that I wasn't going to tack on the extra calories after lunch.  Big mistake. Huge. 

If you're going to brave the line, then get ice cream. Duh.
author: Lisa I.

description: Very good ice cream with some really creative flavors. Not sure it is worth the hype though. It is worth checking out if you are in SF and are craving some ice cream.
author: Akhil C.

description:
The ice cream here is OFF THE HOOK! 
Prices 1 scoop $4, 3 scoops $7.50. Forgot how much for 2 scoops OOPS!
My buddies got the 3 scoops and we shared. They have very unique ice cream flavors, mostly blends meaning they combine flavors.

My favorite was the Harvey Milk and honey grahams. Tasted like milk vanilla ice cream with honey graham bits and you can really taste the honey in the flavor. The black sesame was okay... nothing special about that one to me. 

The line was really long (might have been the longest line I saw in the entire Ferry building), but I would wait in line again for ice cream like this! It is very rich and creamy! 5 people shared the 3 scoop and we could not finish it haha.
author: Andrew S.

description:
ER MAH GERD DA BERST ERC CRERM ERVER !!!

I am not a huge ice cream person, but the ice cream I tried at Humphry Slocombe was life changing!  I really dislike that so many artisanal ice cream joints just use cream and maybe a few dashes of milk. Cream is a fat that coats your tongue, so much of the flavor is lost. Humphry Slocombe got their formula down. The ice cream wasn't too sweet ( i dislike over sugarly desserts and opt for less sweeter options), and packed tons of flavors. The staff was super friendly.

I had a scoop of ginger something and some other cheese based ice cream, Both flavors blew my socks away!
author: Lana S.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe has a location in the ferry building now! A bit easier to get to than their Mission ice creamery. I've had several of their flavors. It's artisanal ice cream with a twist - they create some really unique flavors here: 

1) Secret Breakfast is really good - it's got bourbon and corn flakes in it! Yum

2) Harvey Milk and Graham Cracker - graham crackers!! Need I say more? Plus a great name for a flavor! 

3) Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - really amazing coffee flavored ice cream. I wonder if they run across the hall to Blue Bottle to get more coffee when they run out :D

4) After School Special - it's got potato chips IN it - salty AND sweet!

It's fun trying their out-of-the-box idea creations! You can sample flavors (and when you're done, put them in the little pails that say "filthy spoons" hehe). Another thing I really like is that the walls are their whiteboards where they write the day's available flavors. I guess it's some sort of tile that you can also use dry-erase markers on. What a great way to minimally utilize the space. 

One scoop right now costs $4 and you can only get one flavor (no splitting one scoop into two flavors like you can other ice creameries). Also, the last time I came here and had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - the flavor was really great but then it left this like waxy filmy taste in my mouth. I hope that was just that batch (cuz I don't remember that happening the other times I've eaten here).
author: Sylvia K.

description: Came here after we went to Hog Island for a quick bite. Initially, I didn't know this is one of SF's biggest ice cream joints but the flavors appealed to me and I figured the fact that they had a long line was a good sign. The line went by quick. They were super nice about trying different flavors. I think I tried like 8. I eventually settled with Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and salted caramel with dark chocolate cocoa nibs although the cheesecake was also amazing!! The ice cream was probably the best I have ever had, perfectly rich and creamy with the sugar not being too overpowering. SO good I would definitely come back here no doubt.
author: Amanda M.

description: Sadly they replaced the delicious and unique gelato place with this mediocre typical American salty caramel style creamery.  I gave it a try but it was not worth the wait or money.
author: Michael W.

description:
Best Ice Cream I've ever had.  Move over Big Gay Ice Cream in NYC, I've got a new favorite.

I tried the Vietnamese Coffee, Secret Breakfast and Sugar Daddy.  All three were fantastic -- with Secret Breakfast edging out due to the corn flakes additional texture.
author: Dimitri Y.

description:
YES IT IS FINALLY AT THE FERRY BUILDING.
Blue bottle viet ice coffee ice cream, secret breakfast, and oolong tea. 3 scoops for $6.
author: Lily P.

description: Pretty good, had the secret breakfast sundae which was yummy but disappointed that they ran out of vanilla...who runs out of vanilla?!  Anyways, I don't know if I would make a special trip out here just for the ice cream but I would surely grab one if I was in the area.  Oh yeah I think my friend has the Vietnamese coffee ice cream sandwich and she said that was super yummy...forgot the name of the actual ice cream sandwich.
author: V J.

description:
Humphry's comes very close to being the top ice cream shop in the city. With their unique flavors and signature 'Secret Breakfast', I find myself stopping by here often when at the ferry building. I have tried many of their flavors, including the popular vietnamese coffee and olive oil, but nothing compares to the solid chunks of cornflakes that are buried throughout secret breakfast. I also really enjoy the frosted almond topping that they offer. It adds a great crunchiness to the mix.

If you're feeling ambitious, try the coke float version with secret breakfast. It must be a million calories but it tastes great, like a whiskey coke with cream and cornflakes. 

I believe the original location is down in the mission near 24th as well.
author: Mark O.

description:
In opinionated discussions, I usually leave the word "overrated" out. But in this case, I'll make an exception. Humphrey Slocombe was one big overrated disappointment. In a city full of amazing ice cream artisans, this one ranks toward the bottom. At the end of my scoop, I fully regretted the whole experience. Service was decent. The eco-friendly utensils and cup was appreciated. But the ice cream was absolutely dreadful. I am glad most people love the pizzaz of out of the ordinary flavors like Anchor Steam Cream, Jalapeño Cornbread, and the famous Secret Breakfast. (All of which I either sampled or bought on this occasion) But what is not masked by the back-of-the-palette flavoring is the lack of good ice cream. 

Call me old fashioned but something has to be said about the quality of the ice cream itself. It does not hold well at all. On a typical chilly, windy SF day, Humphry's ice cream was almost melted by the time we reached the doorway. Understandably, ice cream melts. But considering that each exit is no more than 2 minutes away, therein lies a problem. I wanted a scoop of ice cream, not a milkshake.

I was less than enthused with this soupy mess. Even the bites I had pre-melt were uninspired, which is ironic considering how most people feel how inspired Humphry's flavors are. When you can't even make a good basic Chocolate or Strawberry, it's just sad. The texture itself was somewhat icy, lacking any kind of smooth consistency. The ice cream felt unfinished, unsubstantial, just like the flavor. The base of this ice cream just did not exist.

It seems to me that Humphry's, with its menu items more outrageous than the next, is just compensating for the fact their ice cream is mediocre at best. The variety of flavors and catchy names are just hiding the vulnerability of their poor execution of making the actual ice cream. So, stick to Mr. and Mrs. and Bi-Rite. Sure, they may have similar flavor names, but don't let that fool you. I'll take those two over a hollow flavor bonanza any day.
author: Carlo D.

description: It was a Sunday afternoon when we went to this ice cream shop inside the Ferry Building. There was a pretty long line of about 20 people in front of us. However the wait wasn't bad, it took about 10-15 minutes. I sampled the jalapeno cornbread, red hot banana, and toast and jam. I didn't like any of them, to be honest. The names sounded much more creative than the taste. I eventually got two scoops: blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and something something plum yogurt. I liked the coffee one because it was pretty thick and rich. The yogurt one was more icy and melted faster. I've had better ice cream overall at Bi-Rite or Marco Polo Gelato. This place is really just for satisfying tourists, plus it's right across from the Blue Bottle Coffee shop. I'm hoping the other Humphrey Slocombe is better.
author: Alice S.

description: I've had basically every ice cream here and the Mexican Hot Chocolate. I think if Jesus made an ice cream it'd be something like this. Maybe if instead of water to wine, it was water to ice cream or something. I don't know how they do it, but tbh they're doing the lord's work.
author: Lauren G.

description:
I finally had a chance to try the Humphrey Slocombe stand at the Ferry Plaza after waiting for the last several weeks for their opening.
First off, the shop itself made me think of large white bathroom tile and the inside of a refrigerator. Go figure this subliminal stuff.

It's a very spartan shop and there may be more decorations coming; otherwise, it's a plan to have people focus on the ice cream.
At $4 for one scoop, it better be a pretty big scoop. The staff, at least, are very nice about offering tastes of all the ice cream that your conscience will allow you before you feel guilty enough for holding up the line.
I tried three samples: Oolong tea, salted caramel with cocoa nibs and Browned butter.

The Oolong had a surprisingly direct flavor, not faint or wispy as I was expecting.
The Salted caramel had a nice full caramel flavor with the bits of chewy nibs sprinkled through. The Browned Butter was really lovely, a really satisfying sauteed buttery taste.

Portion-wise, a single scoop seemed really small. But you do get a sugar cone if you want to or you could go the cup route.

Overall, I'm very happy there is an ice cream vendor back in the Ferry Building. HS is a good local business;a bit pricey but quality ice cream is worth it. Just wish the scoops were a little more generous (hint hint!).
author: Joanna T.

description:
The Vietnamese Coffee flavor was meh, but the Secret Breakfast... DAMN! Take your five stars and go, Humphry's. 

First bite--the bourbon packs a fleeting punch. As you continue eating, it becomes more subtle and helps balance out the sweetness of the other ingredients. Some how, the little clusters of chewy cornflakes work perfectly with the bourbon while providing a nice contrast in texture. 

Only downside was that the serving size was small and price may have been a bit steep, but it was worth it. I sat at a park with my friend, toying with the idea of going back for seconds and musing over the combination of these flavors as genius. 

If you're ever near this place, you owe it to yourself. 

Secret. Breakfast.
author: Kevin W.

description:
This was my sugary treat for the week and it was totally worth it.  

I tried the after school surprise which is vanilla with chocolate covered potato chips and caramel swirls. So good! They have a bunch of other daring flavors but I wasn't feeling very adventurous today.
author: Michael P.

description:
Humphry Slocombe has made me forget who used to be in their space before them.  That's how good they have been in terms of their popularity for tourists as well as local workers who come here during lunch.  Sometimes when the weather is nice, I break out my walking shoes and go to the Ferry Building to have an ice cream lunch and coffee then back to the office.  It's not the healthiest lunch but with the rotating flavors that HSIC offer, I usually never leave disappointed.  On one visit I had the Secret Breakfast flavor which I liked.  The most recent visit, I got the Brown Butter Fennel.  Note, the Fennel taste was strong...not faint at all.  It's really in your face.  

With a few weeks of sunny weather left, I'm going to make some more time to walk over before it becomes doom and gloomy.
author: Ben H L.

description:
It's pretty funny how despite being open for a few months now, and the fact that I'm a frequent visitor to the Ferry Building, I finally stopped by this location of Humphry Slocombe.  

It's a great replacement in the space formerly occupied by Ciao Bella, and it's quite fitting too, since a good amount of their flavors come from the tenants inside the marketplace like Blue Bottle for their Vietnamese Iced Coffee, McEvoy Ranch for their Olive Oil, and Boccalone for their infamous Prosciutto flavor which I still have yet to try!  So really, they should have no excuse at all to run out of those flavors!  And I love how they sell their Bourbon Float here as well, which is essentially their Secret Breakfast (Cornflake + Bourbon) and Mexican Coke, and to add more insult, a drizzle of Bourbon syrup.

The prices are pretty much along the same lines as their shop in the Mission.  I think what I like about this location slightly better is that the line isn't too long like how it is at their Mission shop, but it depends really on when you visit, which during the weekends can be just as long.

The Ferry Building shop of Humphry Slocombe is a great place to stop by if you can't make it out their Mission shop.  Even if you're not into ice cream, it's worth it just to taste their unique flavors.
author: Rodney H.

description:
When you start day dreaming about ice cream, you begin to crave the sweet, creamy, cold goodness... usually when you go buy ice cream from the store or the "chains", you'll get OK ice cream that is typically icy and not so much creamy.

I haven't had "GOOD" real ice cream in a while so when I had a chance to sample and order some from Slocombe, I was blown away. The flavor options are on point, so sweet and creamy... I wanted to be that little kid again sitting on the curb with icecream all over my face dripping down my shirt. *drooools*

Yes, its that good!
author: Jason L.

description:
Pros: interesting and delicious flavors, friendly service

Cons:  lines can be long at times but it goes by pretty fast
author: Bayarea K.

description: Have the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee float with the Tahitian vanilla ice cream and you won't regret it!
author: Ann S.

description:
What sort of ice cream sorcery is this?

I strolled up to Humphry Slocombe to discover they had a passion-orange-guava flavor.  That's something I haven't tasted since I was in Hawaii, sipping POG juice.  I happily ordered a scoop without even sampling it.

Indeed, it brought back those island memories.  It wasn't the best ice cream I've ever had, but it was darned tasty.

Thanks to the mad scientists at Humphry Slocombe for that tasty treat!
author: Ben B.

description: Humphry Slocombe is yet another ice cream shop in SF with unique, delicious flavors. They're famous for their Secret Breakfast flavor which has bourbon and corn flakes in it. The bourbon flavor isn't too strong and the crunch of the corn flakes is a great addition. Other amazing flavors are the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Harvey Milk & Honey Graham! Anytime I'm near a Humphry, I have to stop by. It's one of my favorite ice cream places in the city.
author: Sandra N.

description: YESSS!! Everything ice cream should be! Creamy, rich, and perfect flavor combinations! Definitely lived up to the hype!
author: Rachel S.

description: Get the secret breakfast ice cream. You'll thank me later. It's divine and wonderful! Be warned you'll likely wait 15-20 mins for a scoop!
author: Jackie G.

description: Oh man the Harvey Milk with honey graham was so delicious!! It was creamy and milky with chunks of honey graham. So good. The ice cream sandwich with ginger snaps and oolong ice cream was good too, but oolong flavor was a bit too faint. Prices are very high -- over $4 for a tiny, tiny scoop.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Checking out the ferry building around 5pm on a Monday is great; it was empty and no lines for any of the little shops, including Humphry Slocombe. I was intrigued by the Secret Breakfast, which is a bourbon ice cream with cornflakes. Tbh, I was intrigued by most of the flavors but the fact that Secret Breakfast strayed me away from my usual staple coffee-flavor is something.

The bourbon flavor comes on strong at first lick, but is really quite good. The consistency of the ice cream is also soft and creamy, not hard and over-frozen.
author: Alice C.

description:
I knew Ciao Bella closed down months ago, and have been meaning to try Humphrey Slocombe ever since its opening.  So here I was, on a sunny Friday afternoon, mid 70s weather, perfect time to take a stroll to the Ferry building for an afternoon delight.  My only mistake...going after lunch rush where everyone and their uncles would be lining up for ice cream.  Okay, it wasn't THAT long of a wait (about 20 minutes or so), but I should have known there was bound to be a wait...

But it was totally worth it!!  Okay, so here's the scoop (pun intended).  They rotate their flavors daily (usually 10 or so flavors), which leaves you still with plenty of options.  On this particular day, blue bottle and oolong tea was the perfect combination.  1 scoop/$4, 2 scoops/$5, 3 scoops/$6, OR you can get a full pint/$8.99.  

After the first bite, I knew immediately I'm in trouble.  Soft, rich, and creamy!  Oh my goodness...10 minute walk from work, reasonably priced (considering the Ferry building), very generous scoop portions (don't change that!!!)....I'm sold!  It's safe to say there will be many more afternoon strolls to the Ferry building in the very near future...
author: Kevin C.

description:
This ice cream is so good that I had it three days in a row during a visit to SF (basically the EAT during my eat/pray/love).

I'm not sure if it's even legal to serve ice cream that reeks and tastes of sweet sweet bourbon to children without a disclosure but I'm guessing it's the not-so-secret ingredient for SECRET BREAKFAST. It's like the momofuku cereal milk ice cream except like 2372842x better because there's alcohol. More "secret" ingredient flavors (read: alcoholic) please!!!

I'm in love with all the different textures they have going on in their ice creams. The chips in the After School Special give the ice cream a pleasant and salty crunch and the graham cracker flavor is just fun to eat.
author: Susan L.

description: Amazing! I dont know what else to say but you must try Humphry Slocombe. Ive only tried about 5-6 flavors but all are super tasty. My current favorite is the Malted Chocolate.
author: CaliGirl X.

description:
Breakfast secret! Bourbon and cornflakes, Yay! Well, everybody likes when there is spirit in ice cream. Such a smart idea to incorporate them together. 

It is rich and creamy. And they have a lot of flavors and they probably change pretty frequently as well. So next time if you see the 'breakfast secret' go get it.
author: Priscilla Z.

description:
The line here is really long, so be prepared to wait (but it is worth it, and it goes pretty fast!). I guess they have different flavors available each day. The staff is super friendly and pleasant, and will help you decide what flavors by offering samples. These are the flavors I tried:

POG SORBET: This is basically a sorbet of my favorite juice of passion, orange and guava. A little bland for my taste. (Tip: Pog Sorbet + Tahitian Vanilla tastes like a Creamsicle.)

SECRET BREAKFAST: Vanilla ice cream mixed with bourbon and pieces of corn flakes. I highly recommend this one.

TAHITIAN VANILLA: Can never go wrong with this flavor. I highly recommend this.

All in all, I would definitely return here again.
author: Jay C.

description:
BEST. ICE. CREAM. IN. THE. WORLD!

No matter when, where, or why I'm in SF, I always go to Humphry's and force all of my friends to go as well. So far, everyone has agreed that it is the best ice cream they've ever had. The price is the same as ice cream you'd get anywhere else, except it tastes 100x better so it's definitely worth it. The line here gets really long whenever the Ferry Building gets busy, but it moves at a steady pace so don't be deterred.

Pretty much everything is good here and I've tried A LOT of flavors. My absolute favorites are honey graham, candy cap, and maple walnut, in that order.

Seriously, everyone has to come here. If you've ever seen Codename Kids Next Door, this is the 4th flavor!
author: Kern S.

description: Its hard to make bad ice cream so...yeah. But Humphrey Slocombe is yum!!!!! Secret breakfast is definitely the most unique flavor, but I also loved Wicked and Honey Graham. They also sell pints in the local grocery stores. And honestly those are just as good. And convenient. And fun to eat if you're feeling lazy :D
author: Connie Q.

description:
Viet coffee ice cream. That is all.
