LOVE that this is in the Ferry Building, meaning it is accessible to people who work in the FIDI/SOMA area now! Lines can be long but sooooo worth the wait. Drools.

You only need one scoop. The serving size is GENEROUS. So definitely get a sample before committing to a full-size scoop because I honestly don't like the S*cret Breakfast flavor (rum and corn flakes aren't my thang, I guess).
Even though it's only $0.50 or $1 to get another scoop, you might regret it later.. speaking from experience here. Had to kill myself to finish!

The workers here are super nice and never rush you (i ALWAYS take my time to look over the flavor options, and they have so many cool ones (peanut butter curry? oolong tea?!) They're always happy to give out (multiple) samples even when the line is long.

Menu changes week to week but the staples are always there!
author: Emily C.

description:
This is my FAVORITE ice cream spot in NorCal. I'm so excited that they opened this shop in the Ferry Building because now it's more convenient for tourism (I'm definitely a tourist up in the Bay).

I love the authenticity and uniqueness of the flavors. The quality may not be as creamy as Bi-Rite, but that can be overlooked by how amazing their flavors are. The flavors I've liked so far are: Earl Grey, Harvey Milk & Graham, and Black Sesame.

The Secret Breakfast is also a must try.

Be prepared to wait at least 15 minutes. The shop is small and all the tourists are sampling flavors so it may take some time.
author: Emily C.

description: We got the Christmas special - the "XXXmas  Sunday". Peppermint ice cream with lots of peppermint shavings on top plus hot fudge. Great to enjoy on a cool, sunny day in the SF harbor during the holidays.  Only thing is that there are long lines but they do move quickly. Also difficult to find a place to sit and enjoy.
author: Sal E.

description:
Very good! 
Catherine suggested the Oolong on Ginger Oh-Snaps ice cream sandwich and my wife had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee w/ Chocolate Cookies ice cream sandwich. 

Since I was thinking of chocolate but wanted to try both, and my wife getting the coffee sandwich already, Catherine suggested adding some chocolate syrup on top. They were both yummy, but overpowered the wonderful oolong tea flavor. 
But thanks for trying!
author: ben c.

description:
I was so astonished by their unique flavors and I really loved their ice cream names! Like secret breakfast. I'm a huge ice cream lover and had this first thing in the morning which is bad but That's how much I love ice cream. I stumbled upon this place because of a friend's recommendation. It's my first time in San Fran and I heard that I had to go here. Loved how clean everything was and loved the jasmine lychee flavor! It wasn't as creamy as I thoughts it would be But the waffle cones were pretty good.

A downside to this place is that it was pretty expensive. Other ice cream places were around $3 to $4 but it was $4.75 for one scoop waffle cone. And I wish they scooped better because the person who scooped mine looked like it was going to tip over and the ice cream melted so quickly.
author: Esther R.

description: Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee is my favorite! The flavors are incredible and so tasty. Thank goodness this is not conveniently located near me, otherwise I would come here every day! I also liked the secret breakfast, Tahitian vanilla, and the milk chocolate. Make sure you get your ice cream on their tasty cones.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Yum!! Finally got to try Humphry Slocombe and was very pleased. I tried the Thai chili lime sorbet which really tasted like Thai food in your mouth! The strawberry Szechuan wasn't too spicy but I ended up getting the oolong, which was nice and tea-y :) I loved the creamy consistency of the ice cream!
author: Yenny D.

description: Had the Vietnamese Coffee ice cream. It was alright. I'm not really a coffee ice cream flavor person. I didn't like the other most popular flavor either, I think it was Sweet Jesus, can't recall exactly!
author: Kristen Q.

description:
I had never heard of Humphry Slocombe before I saw the store, so when my friend wanted to get in line for it, I opted to try Blue Bottle Coffee (they're right across from each other) instead because I had heard so much about the coffee there. However, by the time I had gotten my coffee, my friend was still in line so I just decided to join him and give a few of the flavors a try. I tried the Thai ice tea flavor, the Secret Breakfast, and a third flavor (forgot which one heh) but I didn't think any one of them were anything special at the time. The initial taste of the bourbon in the Secret Breakfast was a little overwhelming.

Regardless, my friend decided to order a scoop of the Secret Breakfast and it was probably one of the best decisions he made that day (or the only good decision he made all day, rather :P). The more I ate, the more I fell in love with it. The cornflakes in the ice cream pair sooo perfectly with the bourbon!! I basically ate more than half of my friend's scoop... Oops! I just couldn't get enough. Although the ingredients in the Secret Breakfast might sound strange at first, it is a must try!!!

I'll definitely be back here again to sample other flavors next time I'm in SF, but I already know what I'm going to end up ordering - the Secret Breakfast.
author: Melody Y.

description:
Ask my friends and they'll pretty much tell you that all I really talk about is ice cream, and I'm glad to have found another really good one! I'm never intimidated by a long line, and this place is no exception. This Humphry's is located inside the Ferry Building among many other food places and you know it's good when their crowd is bigger than all the others. What I love about this place is the unique flavors and interesting combinations. I got a scoop of the jasmine lychee which was really light and refreshing and a scoop of the thai chili lime which had a nice tart taste with a hint of spice. 

Overall, I love the flavors and the ice cream is soft and really good. Definitely stop by for dessert (or lunch in my case) if you get the chance!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Humphry is on a LOT of ice cream lists and yet, even though I have been to SF so many times, I still haven't tried it, until now. The store is so small and the line sometimes goes all the way out the door and around the block. Some tourist was shocked at how long the line was and asked me if it was worth waiting half an hour for.  Yes and No. Yes in that if you have never had quality ice cream in your life. No, if you have had Bi-Rite before and short on time. I have had Bi-Rite before and in my book, that is still the number 1 ice cream shop in SF, in my opinion. 
Humphry isn't bad. But it's not Bi-Rite. I had the Vietnamese coffee. The flavor was strong and veered more to super sweet. The breakfast ice cream flavor's speciality is that they bake their corn flakes and that makes it buttery, which blends well with the "milk" ice cream. It's a bit pricey as well, but that's SF prices for you. 
If you're in the area, try it. But I don't think it's something that's worth a long trip away.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Worth the wait. There were so many ice cream places in the market, but I'm glad I chose this one!

Their ice cream is out of this world! The flavors and texture are exquisite. I cannot wait until I'm back in SF. I'm definitely coming back. Next time, I'm getting a pint! Hopefully they will make their way to LA soon!
author: Laura C.

description:
Aaaw yea, ice cream overlooking the bay with a slight breeze blowing through your hair. That's the life.

Thanks, Humphry Slocombe, for making the Ferry Building that much livelier and that much more desirable to visit. Keep doin' what you're doin' and making those awesome, unique flavors!
author: Audrey L.

description:
Insanely good ice cream, better than Bi-Ryte Creamery in Mission. I came here on a hot Thursday afternoon, i see the line (always a good sign). They had a bunch of different signs up which was kind of confusing as they had specials and a regular menu (bad UX). I checked Yelp and everyone talked about the Secret Breakfast flavor. I got one scoop of that on a cone which was $4. Jesus it was so damn good, it wasn't like any ice cream I had before. You could taste maybe the corn flakes/cinnamon toast crunch flavor within the vanilla ice cream fshafioahfiaf SO GOOD!

They take card woot woot
author: Daanyaal K.

description: Flavors! I love almost all their flavors. I tried the highly coveted SECRET breakfast (bourbon ice cream with cornflakes). Needless to say, I loved it. There is that hint of bourbon and then the contrasting texture with the cornflakes. The line wasn't too long at 3pm and it went by quickly. The only downside of this place is that it is quite expensive, but what place isn't in SF? I only had one scoop and that was $4.25. My girlfriend got two scoops and that was $6.50. Overall, I would still come here and get my bourbon ice cream.
author: Alden C.

description:
For any ice cream lover, this is a must try during a visit to the Ferry Building. The flavors are truly unique and the customer service can't be beat. We sampled almost every flavor, thanks to the awesome girl helping us choose a flavor today.

We settled on the Duck Fat Pecan Pie with Tahitian Vanilla Ice Cream. It was excellent. The crust, the filling, the sugared pecans on top, it was a great piece of pie topped with perfect ice cream.
author: Mary Y.

description:
I am giving Humphry Slocombe a five star because they have some really interesting and unique flavors, but also because I just like Ice Cream and I feel like you have to go out of your way to make ice cream suck. 

I had 2 scoops - secret breakfast and caramel coconut sorbet. Both were really delicious. Secret breakfast has bourbon and corn flakes. HILARIOUS! They also had a goat cheese and wine one that I sampled but wasn't really feeling. But props for trying!
author: Ryan P.

description:
3.5 stars! 

Surprisingly the line moves super quick here! When i first saw the line snaking around the corner i walked away, when i walked back it was shorter. YAY! i love secret breakfast and harvey milk & cookies and when i went, i was hankering for something different. immediately oolong tea caught my eye. 

Oolong tea: 3.5/5: it has a nice oolong flavor but its a bit sweet. kind of reminds me of milk tea but i wish that it wasn't that sweet. it tasted sweeter and sweeter with each scoop and i felt like it overpowered the oolong tea taste in the end. overall, this was decent, but not sure how i feel about ordering it again

Total for 1 scoop: $4
author: Stella J.

description:
Ice cream is the magical common denominator between drooling 5-year-olds and established millionaires, fashion models, farmers, what have you not.

I sampled the Thai chili sorbet, which amazingly tastes like fresh Thai chili + in a sorbet. So true to the name, so refreshing, and spicy. Not my cup of tea for ice cream, but you can just taste honesty and real stuff in this sorbet, which I deeply appreciate. The Blue Bottle coffee flavor was good but not amazing.

The matchadoodle is my cup of [matcha] tea. There are bits of crunch in there, lot of matcha flavor, and perfectly half-sweet. I say it's a bit on the rich side, there is a dense aroma of cream, but it's a natural de-stressor once in a while :) good for your soul.

In other words, I will definitely be back to try the Secret Breakfast. And special shoutout to the friendly workers who are efficient and pleasant.
author: Maggie G.

description: Very delicious and innovative ice cream! It's a tad pricey but totally worth it. My Favorite is secret breakfast! You'd never think corn flakes in ice cream is good..but you know what- it's delicious!
author: Samantha R.

description: The service was great. He was very friendly and helpful and upbeat despite them closing soon after we left. However, the menu options were short and sadly nothing stood out. The almond toffee crunch (not sure of exact name) tasted almost like chocolate syrup was just poured in it. The blue bottle coffee flavor was my favorite, but still not as strong of a coffee flavor as I expected.
author: Lizzy S.

description:
I can see why Humphry Slocombe is a hot spot for ice cream. The location is convenient if you're eating or walking around the Ferry Plaza Building and get the sudden craving for ice cream. The storefront is quite simple - the menu is written on a white board, thus allowing for change from day to day. They have pretty amazing flavors that can draw in a crowd! 

I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor, and it tasted exactly like what I expected. Strong coffee flavor, but not too much of a bitter taste either. They really mastered the ice cream/strong coffee combination. I'm not too big of a fan of coffee or ice cream in general, but I definitely enjoyed this ice cream! 

The lines can get long. I came for a single scoop right after my meal at Hog's, and it completed my night! It was a few minutes before closing, too but there was still a crowd of people waiting for ice cream. The price was decent. Around $4 for a school, I believe - but with the location and everything, I can pretty much say that the price is on point. 

I definitely want to come back and try the Secret Breakfast and Caramel Apple. Seems like those are two popular flavors!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Maybe my tastebuds have been desensitized to the comfort that Texas Blue Bell ice cream brings me, but I will gladly rent a bike in SF again while finishing off a two-scoop cone of Secret Breakfast and After School Special. No offense taken. 4/5 stars for creativity and creaminess. Gone in a wink.
author: Hannah S.

description: The ice cream was inventive and really tasty. Perhaps a three scoop sundae is too much right after lunch. My Tin Roof Sundae had their renowned Secret Breakfast (vanilla, bourbon, and corn flakes), Harvey Milk and Honey Graham (vanilla and chunks of graham cracker), and Tahitian Vanilla with roasted almonds, butterscotch, and hot fudge.  The butterscotch complimented the sundae very well.
author: Marc B.

description: One of the best ice cream I've ever had! You gotta try secret breakfast! It is knock your socks off and change your life good. Pairs well with a sugar cone :)
author: Leah A.

description:
Update:  This store occupies the space formerly used by Ciao Bella, across from Blue Bottle Coffee.  On a mission for a friend, I stopped in after shopping the Tuesday farmers market.  I purchased a coconut sorbet for said friend and studied the menu as she packed my pint.  POG (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q)?  Pinch me... am I dreaming?
No, it wasn't a dream, so I immediately ordered a pint for myself.  For those not from the 808 (as in Hawaii), POG stands for passion fruit, orange, and guava, a popular juice beverage combination that sparked a bottle cap craze in the early '90's.
If you have a tropical sweet tooth, you'll enjoy this and, being a HUGE freeze fan, I'd bet that this would make a great flavored one.  Just need a blender and some carbonated water.
Will be back for this and hope to try some of their ever changing flavors especially if they are as true flavored as this.
author: Mike C.

description:
Magical!  The ice cream here is truly magical.  It's amazing how complex the flavors can get or just even a simple flavor as Tahitian Vanilla is creamy goodness.  I absolutely love the Blue Bottle Vietnamese robust coffee flavor.  A single scoop is probably a good replacement for an actual cup of coffee!!! 

My favorite though has to be the Jasmine Lychee.  Each bite is fragrant and pleasant to the taste buds.  

There are lots of other flavors I have to try still so I can't wait to make another stop here the next time I'm at the Ferry building.  

Here is a tip: Get the 3 scoops as you get to try 3 different flavors but it's the most worth it on your wallet.  1 scoop is $4.25.  3 scoops is $8. Do the math :)
author: Amy L.

description:
After hearing about this place and reading all the reviews about it, I finally got to try it! I love that they have unique flavors that you can't get anywhere else. The one they are most known for is their Secret Breakfast, which has Bourbon and Cornflakes. That's the one I got and it was one of my favorite breakfast meals (because I ate it at 10 AM). It was my first time having ice cream for breakfast! 

I also sampled Jasmine Lychee, Fluffernutter, and Harvey Milk and Graham and they were all very delicious! I'm absolutely coming back for more.
author: Regina L.

description:
On a hot day like this, thank God for ice cream. I have a very big sweet tooth so I tried many flavors!!

+++Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee - really good! Just a hint of coffee though. Not very sweet. Definitely makes the list to one of the 50 sweets one should try before they die.

-Limoncello sorbet - too sour for my taste, didn't like it..

+++Tahitian vanilla - omg another favorite of mine. Tastes a lot like vanilla bean ice cream.

+++Dulce de Leche- I love this one too! It was sweet and yummy.

-Jesus juice sorbet- this was gross lol no idea what this was.

+Peanut butter chocolate chip - very peanut buttery. Not my favorite but it was still good.
author: Benita M.

description:
My first taste said yes this is good. The vanilla was creamy and lush. Perfect smooth texture. Not hard and frozen. The chocolate was just as delicious. The bourbon and corn flakes was too commercial for me. 
Definitely some great really creamy ice cream.
$4 a scoop
WIGB? Yes
author: Hungry K.

description: Awesome service and the line went fast. Tried the secret breakfast and a fort point manzanita scoop. both were great
author: Nikolai D.

description: Love their unique and interesting ice cream flavors! Their serving sizes are decent, but their prices are somewhat expensive. I ordered a scoop of malted milk chocolate along with their Tahitian Vanilla in a waffle cone and it is amazing. The tastes was fresh and delicious. I would definitely come back here soon to try other flavors!
author: Danika P.

description: You can be sure to find tasty, unique flavors at Humphry's. I tried the Eton Mess flavor which was strawberry with marshmallow fluff - incredibly tasty and gourmet. However, the ice cream here was more on the pricier side. To be completely honest, I'd probably only come back here if it was to take someone who's never tried this place.
author: Henry W.

description:
Got 2 scoops on this warm day in SF.  I got Black Sesame & Harvey Milk & Honey Graham in a bowl with a sugar cone for $5. That's including tax.  Both are pretty tasty, they do milk pretty fast so gotta eat them fast.

Flavors change often and not all always available.  Ask for samples if you want.

Charge it, no AmEx though.
author: Ann L.

description:
Easily my favorite ice cream in the city. The flavors are innovative, the staff is nice, and the portions are decent.

Secret breakfast - bourbon & cornflakes. i dont like either of those things but together in ice cream is phenomenal. There is a reason why this is the best-selling flavor.

Salt & pepper - reminds me of salt & pepper chips. mmmm

Elvis (the fat years) - banana ice cream w/ bacon peanut brittle. come on. 

Line is probably longest on Saturday bc of the Farmers Market. Worth the wait though!
author: Lucy N.

description:
2015 is the year that all my hopes and dreams come true. I'm caught up on my tv shows, my hair is the longest it's ever been in my whole life, and I'm going out of the country for a month. 
With this being said, one of my other dreams was to finally have secret breakfast from Humphrey Slocombe.

This was a flavor I had dreamt about, and even recommended to others. But every time I would go to try it, the line would be too long for me wait in. And twice, I was there before it was even open! 

But finally, one Saturday afternoon, I did it.
I had some time to kill. The line was still long, but I made it through. Now, would I just get one scoop of secret breakfast or two? Or try another? Stay tuned for the dramatic conclusion!

So I'm waiting in line, and I'm weighing out all the flavor possibilities to the same degree of deciding what my major in college is. I changed my mind a few times, but I decided on the roasted white chocolate lavender. 

I get to the counter, I don't taste test anything. I went into this blindly, like a blind date. Would I be catfished? There were no cones. They had ran out. Kind of a bummer.

I got my two flavors. I walked outside to go sit by the water. 
As I began to eat my ice cream, I felt fulfilled. One more dream had been completed. The roasted white chocolate was just that, roasted white chocolate... And a hint of lavender danced around at the end, like little jazz hands. 
The secret breakfast was the better flavor though. A creamy bourbon flavor, not too strong. It didn't punch you in the mouth or burn your throat. It almost would give a novice drinker the false comfort of thinking they could drink bourbon and casually enjoy it without coughing and sputtering. The cornflakes were somehow not mushy. How did they do that? Every time I have a chance, I know I will go to get this ice cream.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Overpriced, over-flavored ice cream.  $5+ for a tiny scoop of ice cream?  

Secret breakfast is over-rated in my opinion.  Tried the caramel apple, but it was too sweet to have by itself.  Tried also the cream cheese chocolate chip, but the cream cheese flavor was overwhelming.  Ended up with the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham, which I believe was made from goats'/sheep's milk.  Unfortunately, this left an unpleasant taste in my mouth after I finished my ice cream.  Final verdict- not worth your $.
author: TZ J.

description: We went to get blue bottle coffee  (when in sf, you do as sf-ans do), and spotted this place. We weren't in the mood for ice cream, but saw that it's top 5 ice cream in the US by food network. So, we decided to have dessert before dinner. Asked what the most popular flavor was and we tasted it and got a cone. Bourbon and corn flakes. It was sooooo good. My baby loved it, too. And, no there's no alcohol in it. It was worth $5 for one scoop. They had blue bottle float. I would try that next, if there is a next time for us.
author: Sue K.

description:
Advice for first-timers trying Humphry Slocombe: don't afraid to be courageous. 

Yet another ice cream maker similar to the likes of Ici's and Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe is the store in the Ferry Building with the long line and eclectic flavors written on the wall. In comparison to Ici's, which has been rotating the same conservative flavors since I started school in Berkeley, Humphry Slocombe has a far more interesting variety to offer. The more basic flavors of coffee and vanilla are accompanied by things like Olive Oil and Secret Breakfast.

I tried Olive Oil, and it really had that sleek oily feel. It was quite strange because I was pretty sure oil wasn't supposed to taste that good. I think the ice cream here is a bit too sweet for my liking, but there are few places that can pull off these flavors better than Humphry Slocombe. Their ice cream actually tastes like the flavors they're advertising, in addition to being good. Sample the ones you want so you can make a good, informed decision, and then be bold! You won't regret it.
author: Sophie W.

description: Bad review cuz they close at 9pm but they don't let pp order around 8:50pm :( Friday night
author: Tingting X.

description:
I like ice cream.  A lot.  A whole freakin' lot.  It's the cure to a hot summer's days, and on cold, rainy days I actually CRAVEEE it even more.  Every person in my home group knows my favorite Ben & Jerry's flavor (Chunky Monkey!).

So, when I caught wind of this new ice cream spot so close to my work place, well, I consulted the wisdom? of weather.com to find the warmest day of the week, and reached out to my friend, JQ, who also shares my obsession with all things sweet.  A few hours ago, we found ourselves at the tail end of something that Ici in Berkeley would probably not even deign to call a "line."  Strike one?  (On a side note, maybe strike one should have been their apocalyptic, straight outta the Book of Revelations, two-headed calf mascot with large, beady eyes).

They have their daily menu posted high up on the back wall, but also on a wall to the right of their shop.  

10 ice cream flavors (on 3/21/14):
Secret Breakfast
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
Tahitian V*nill@
McEvoy Olive Oil
Oolong Tea
Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt
Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip
Cinnamon Brittle
Salted Caramel Cocoa Nib
Cream Cheese Chocolate Chip

2 sorbet flavors (on 3/21/14):
Lemon Ginger Sorbet
Basil Lime Sorbet

+ Bourbon Coke Float (two scoops of Secret Breakfast, Bourbon Caramel + Coca Cola) - $6.50 + Tax

Toppings: Bourbon Caramel; frosted almonds; frosted peanuts - add $1

1 Scoop - $4
2 Scoops - $5
3 Scoops - $6
Pints - $8.99 + Tax

The lady who took care of us was such a sweetheart.  She approached us with a smile on her face and lots of shiny tasting spoons clutched in her hands.  Wanting to practice some restraint, it is Lent after all, I asked to sample the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Oolong Tea.  From what I've heard from coffee connoisseur church friends, Blue Bottle is supposed to be this amazing Promised Land flowing with milk and honey (literally).  And from what I've experienced with Vietnamese Coffee, that is, "Mama Said Knock You Out" in liquid form, well... I was so underwhelmed.  Oolong Tea was mellow, but altogether too faint.  

JQ asked to sample Secret Breakfast, but when she heard it had bourbon in it, told me that I should try it.  HR.  Riiiiiight.  After two fairly lackluster flavors, SB came in like a champ, though, with its distinct flavor and corn flake cookies to mix up the texture.  When she asked the woman what she would recommend, she simply said that she would recommend that we try everything.  

Well.  In that case.

I sampled Cream Cheese Chocolate Chip and the Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip, too.  I know that it's CREAM CHEESE, but it completely overwhelmed any hint of chocolate and thus succeeded in making me feel like I had essentially licked a brick of the Philly stuff.  Mm mm... no.  As for the PB Chocolate Chip, that was a little better balanced, but not a standout by any means.

In the end, I opted for the Secret Breakfast and Oolong Tea.  I know, I probably should have just gone with the SB, but their math totally got to me... why pay $4 for ONE scoop when you can get TWO at $2.50 each?!  I'm such a sucker.  T_T

Anyway, JQ and I headed over to Sushirrito after for lunch, and on the way there, I had enough time to reflect on what I had gotten.  SB became altogether TOO sweet and the Oolong Tea began to taste very, very salty.  Ugh.  

I'm not going to write this place off entirely, since they have many more flavors (http://www.humphryslocombe.com/www.humphryslocombe.com/Flavor_List.html) and they rotate daily, but I am a bit disappointed.
author: Iona C.

description:
What a hella good place for ice cream. Went there on a chill Tuesday afternoon, waited in line for a bit and then got some deelish ice cream. Check the wall each day because the flavors change.

I got the secret breakfast and also a scoop of fluffernutter. On point. Neither was too sweet and just the right mix of milky fatty goodness and smooth tastiness.
author: Mike V.

description: Good quality ice cream. Great for a touristy stop as you enjoy the views outside the ferry building. The flavors are unique and satisfy a wide array of tastes
author: Natasha B.

description:
Let me just say that the ice cream was SO AMAZING. I loved it!! My friend and I visited the ferry building hoping to find some goodies and this place definitely did not disappoint. We went around 12pm on a Thursday and the line was kind of long but the it long took about about 15 mins which wasn't that bad. 

This place has some really interesting flavors ( one with like cucumbers or something) but I decided on the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee on a cone. As a coffee lover, this was amazing. Not too Sweet which is a plus. It costed $4 for a scope which is average for a icecream place. The cone had a settle sweetness and a crunch that was really nice. I would encourage everybody to give it a try!
author: Linda Y.

description: Good ice cream with interesting flavors. Line can be long. Not as good as Bi-Rite but the best option around the Ferry Building if you're here on a trip.
author: Abad M.

description:
I came here 2 days in a row because the ice cream was that good! The first time I ordered 1 scoop blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and 1 scoop Tahitian Vanilla- such a good combo together!  The coffee ice cream had a strong coffee flavor and paired well with the creamy Vanilla. 

The second day I tried the Earl Grey Plum sorbet- flavorful and light if you like earl grey tea with bits of plum mixed in.  I also tried the "Double Happiness" ice cream sandwich which composed of oolong tea ice cream sandwiched between 2 gingersnap cookies.  I liked how the ginger cookies did not have an overly ginger taste, very subtle and complemented the green tea ice cream, also very light in flavor. 

The line can get long but it moves fairly quickly.  It is a little pricey, $4.25 for a single scoop but the flavors are unique and quite tasty, ice cream sandwich was $5.50.  If I'm ever in the area again, I will make the effort to come back again for dessert.
author: Angela L.

description:
Recommendation: Unique flavors and the staff is very willing to let you sample flavors. Worth a visit, provided the line isn't miles long like usual. Ice cream is also on the expensive side

I went here for a scoop of ice cream a little before noon on a weekday. Last time I was in the Ferry Building, the line was tremendously long. Seriously, there were over 30 people in line and it was outrageous. Even having the biggest sweet tooth of anyone I know, I don't think I'd be willing to wait that long for some ice cream. 

However, when I went there were only a few people in line. This gave me a moment to look through the dozen or so flavors they had up on the white wall and decide which three I wanted to sample. After getting to the front and requesting samples (on little reusable metal spoons!) I ended up going with a scoop of the carrot mango sorbet in a dish. I have to say, it was pretty unique and delicious! There were definitely hints of carrot here and there in the aftertaste but the dominant color and aroma lent itself to the mango.

The staff was really nice and the flavors are playful and unlike any I've seen at other places.  However, the price was a little extreme. I paid 4 dollars for a pretty small single scoop of ice cream, and the iPad they use for Point of Sale had preset $1, $2, and $3 tips. Keep an eye out for this, and don't get confused thinking this is your order's total! 

I'll definitely be going back to try more flavors, provided the line isn't too long.
author: John B.

description: Located within the Ferry Building, Humphry Slocombe always has a line, but it goes pretty quick! Not as good as Van Leeuwen, but similarly priced. They aren't very consistent - sometimes they're really good; other times it falls flat. But they do have interesting, innovative flavors which keeps me coming back. My favorite is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - it's delicious!
author: Judy S.

description:
one of my favorite place for ice cream. tried the secret breakfast for once. I don't drink alcohol but this bourdon and corn flakes actually tasted good. I can why it is a popular flavor. when I don't see anything see that entices my tastebuds, I always go for the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. A winner in my book. 

usually a line. smaller than the one in the Mission. no seatings. just take it by the water if you want to sit down while enjoying it. plenty of benches there and can people watch at the same time. 

they encourage you to taste test so go ahead because they have flavors there you won't see everyday. if you are looking for a classic vanilla or chocolate. go somewhere else. it is not here. Can buy their pint sizes too.
author: Jules L.

description: Wow, I am kinda glad I don't live in San Francisco because I would get fat by eating here every day. Don't let the long line fool you- it goes fast! The ice cream flavors are so creative and super yummy. I had a flavor with the bourbon caramel sauce on top- a MUST try. If they would ship to Europe for me, I'd be in trouble!!
author: Michelle E.

description:
I tried almost every flavor, and they were all amazing. The secret breakfast was my favorite though, and that is the one I got.

The service was really nice as well, overall fantastic experience.
author: Yanir R.

description:
Located inside the Ferry Plaza Bldg right across from Blue Bottle Coffee.

My family and I originally went to the Ferry Bldg to indulge in delicious seafood at Hog Island Oyster Co. After our dinner, I just had to have a scoop of Humphry Slocombe's Tahitian vanilla ($4). This is my second time here and I must admit HS is by far one of the best ice cream shops in SF (comparable to Bi-Rite and Smitten). Their Tahitian vanilla ice cream is so rich and creamy. You could taste the vanilla in every bite and it's not too sweet. 

The line for ice cream is always long but it moves quickly.
author: Tuyen T.

description:
Harvey milk and honey graham and vietnase coffee were soooooo good! 

You can also taste few flavors before you order.
author: Stella L.

description: This place is located inside the Ferry Plaza Building and boy is it worth a visit! I had the secret breakfast here and it was so delicious!!! I wish I could take some home with me.The flavor is truly unique and the service is outstanding.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Was doing the tourist thing with family visiting from out of town, showing them around and stopped by for a treat.  So glad we did!

All the praise heaped on HS is well-deserved.  I had their signature Secret Breakfast with Bourbon Caramel, and it was amazing.  My sister got a scoop of the Thai Chile & Lime sorbet and loved it.  

Had heard about Humphry Slocombe ages ago, but had never managed to get to their original location.   Will definitely be going out of my way to stop there again!
author: Will B.

description:
OMG. The. Ice cream. Here. Is. Amazing.

If you're in the Ferry Marketplace Building just going around seeing the cute stores and food places, you MUST have an ice cream break at Humphry's Slocombe shop. The place is cute, attached sort of in the wall. They write their ice cream flavors in marker on the tiled walls of their shop. 

The line was long (people like to sample), but it also goes by pretty quickly. The waiting gives you time to decide on what unique flavor of ice cream to choose from off of their menu! I sampled the Secret Breakfast and the Harvey Milk + Honey Graham -- but I chose to get the Secret Breakfast. #Bestdecisionever. I've never really had ice cream that tasted like it! The Secret Breakfast is Vanilla ice cream with Bourbon flavor and cornflakes. Gahh. It was so freaking delicious.    I found the ice cream very smooth and creamy, and quite strong in flavor. I especially loved the corn flake chunks. Their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is also really good! I think those two flavors are their most popular. 

If it's your first time, don't be afraid to try one of their unique flavors instead of just sticking to basic chocolate or vanilla! I reccomend the Secret Breakfast :D
author: Jodie R.

description: Finally had their ice cream and tried their secret breakfast.  I was sold once I know it has whiskey in it.  It's definitely a very unique flavor and it's very delicious.  Their blue bottle coffee flavor was also very good.  I am not a coffee person so I am enjoying blue bottle and Humphrey at the same time.
author: Desmond L.

description:
The short of it:
- located in the Ferry building
- unique flavors
- pricey for what you get
- ice cream is too melty

The long of it:
As an ice cream snob, this place just did not impress me at all. I stood in a semi-long line for mediocre ice cream that was too soft and melty. On the other hand the service was good, they let me sample multiple flavors since I was having trouble finding one I really liked. When I realized I wasn't wowed by any of them (yes, including the secret breakfast...Bourbon flavor is just not my thing) I decided to just go with a scoop of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I've had way better Vietnamese coffee ice cream before. This particular one didn't have really remind me of Vietnamese coffee and I didn't think the flavor was strong enough. By the time I paid and started eating my ice cream, it was already losing it's shape and creating a puddle. I was really surprised and I felt rushed to finish it before it would turn to liquid. Overall, this ice cream does not live up to the hype and that price tag doesn't help things either.
author: Kristin A.

description: All the flavors were delicious. My favorite is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. The lines can get a little ridiculous... but what can you expect. It's in the Ferry building.  The lines can take a while as people can sample whatever they want. The prices are a bit on the pricey side...
author: John L.

description: I love coming to the Ferry building...full of food, treats and even ICE CREAM! There's different flavors of ice cream. I tried the beer nut and malt milk chocolate. Yum! It's always perfect when the sun is out and hits the sweet spot when I'm there.
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description: Would I normally say it's worth paying $4.25 for a single scoop? No. Would I say Humphry is worth it? I think so. The cantaloupe cayenne sorbet was definitely the most unique sorbet I've had-- a combination of opposite sensations: mellow and jolting. The cayenne doesn't pull through as much when you are eating it, but 5 minutes later it starts kicking in and it's a nice, well if you are masochistic, nice burn/buzz in your throat. I think I went through a stage of hating it and a stage of loving it. Anyways, still not entirely sure about that intense price tag. Why is this place labeled as 1 dollar sign? Anyways, I would probably recommend trying it if your are by the ferry and don't mine shelling an extra two bucks for some interesting flavors.
author: Claudia D.

description:
Words and pictures are simply not enough to describe how amazing the ice cream is here. Emphasis on the cream. If you want your ice cream to orchestrate within your mind images of happy, well-treated, wide-eyed cows mooing and prancing in open pastures and buckets of sweet whole milk, do try the ice cream here. 

I sampled Red Hot Banana, then Jalapeno Cornbread, and then finally decided to have a small cup of Nectarine and Plum Yogurt. I was pleasantly surprised that the yogurt was tart as well as slightly salty. It's like they scooped up the cream from whole milk and did some sort of magic. 

A few problems I noticed were:
1. the frozen yogurt had ice crystals
2. I could not taste the jalapeno in my sample of jalapeno cornbread
3. I still do not understand why the Red Hot Banana was red and hot other than the fact that the ice cream had faint swirls of red; although, the banana flavor was definitely there.
author: Judge F.

description:
This was my first time getting Humphrey Slocumbe ice cream and I sampled earl grey plum and secret breakfast. Both were great but honestly it's hard to resist secret breakfast's blend of bourbon and caramelized corn flakes (which lends a satisfying crunch to the whole experience), so that is what I ended up having. I did not try it but apparently you can have it in a sundae, a float, etc. 

Although it was not an offered flavor when I visited, I saw that they had matchadoodle to pick up (green tea and snickerdoodle, apparently), so now I got to come back for that another time!
author: J P.

description: The line is always really long, but it moves quickly. The employees are super friendly and they don't rush you, regardless of the line. It's encouraged to taste test the flavors of the day. One downfall is that the toppings are overpriced (i.e. whipped cream - $1).
author: Jieun L.

description:
$4 a scoop, but some knock your socks out flavors. 

Vietnamese Coffee and Jasmine Lychee were great. But the Secret Breakfast float is the real bomb diggity. Bourbon flavored ice cream embedded with cereal, and dunked in a bottle of coke. Get breakfast for $8 and you'll be quite satisfied.
author: Tunaidi A.

description:
4.5 stars, but I'll round up. Nothing beats my Bi-rite! Today, I sampled:
 -jasmine lychee- amazing
-watermelon- it was okay
-vietnamese coffee- amazing 

I ended up with the Vietnamese coffee which I've tried before at their other location. My caffeine cravings were kicking. Ice cream here is $4 a scoop, and totally worth it. A must try if in the ferry building!
author: Corinna T.

description:
Tried secret breakfast today. It was good but no so good as people saying. Anyway their unique flavors worth to try 
Vietnamese coffee is good. Not too creamy, not too sugary rich in flavor
author: Yana C.

description: I loveeeeeeee ice cream. I think ice cream should be a food group on its own. Anyway, JASMINE LYCHEE is the shiz. First time trying this place and I'm hooked. Wish I got a double or triple scoop instead of the 1... poor life decision. There aren't too many choices so being the little greedy piggy that I am, I asked to try like half the flavor options. I was surprised that I didn't really like the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee because I'm a caffeine addict that loves ice cream. Line moved pretty fast and service isn't anything to note. It was more of a grab and go and I just walked around the ferry building like a giddy child. Humphrey, please come to SoCal!!!!
author: Macy G.

description: Secret Breakfast is my fav so rich and unusual. Dont like the long lines wish they had more places in the city that served it
author: Louisa B.

description:
Yes, long lines and it's a bit pricey - $4.25 for a single scoop - but SO TOTALLY WORTH IT!!
They have really funky flavors - peaches and popcorn? - and then amazing ones as well - Turkish coffee! All of which they will let you sample. 
If you like tea, I would recommend the Earl Grey Plum. Oh lordy, it was fantastic! 
If you're wanting something normal, don't go here. 
Only get your ice cream here if you're wanting to experience something new and exciting! :D
author: Stefan F.

description: I'm an ice cream fanatic and was happy to finally try Humphrey Slocombe.  Sampled the peanut butter curry (yummy but can't eat a scoop of it) but landed on roasted milk chocolate rosemary.  It had salted caramel notes and pieces of rosemary in it - so interesting and lovely.  I never thought to pair chocolate and rosemary together. That's what makes this ice cream great- unexpected flavors.  Also, the texture and mouthfeel is rich but not overly so.
author: Amelia S.

description: I love a good ice cream spot. One of Mister's friends said there was a place better than Bi-Rite Creamery in San Francisco and it is called Humphrey Slocombe. Luckily, there was one in the Ferry Building, so we got our dessert on.  The line was long, which is a good sign.  I looked at the menu and  honestly, the flavor choices were disappointing. Yes, they were creative, but nothing too out of the box as compared to some of the ice cream shops in LA.  I settled for a scoop of the milk chocolate passion fruit.  It was aight.  The flavor was dull and it wasn't creamy enough. Now I had to check out Bi-Rite to see which reigns supreme.
author: Rochelle R.

description:
Legit! They're happy to give you samples of whatever flavor you're curious about.

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee was excellent and the strong coffee flavor truly hit the spot and cleaned the palate off after some meats and cheeses down the hall.

The line was nonexistent when we arrived (but I wish I could say that about Blue Bottle across the hallway!) so we took our time and got to try out quite a few of their unique flavors without having to hurry.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Seriously:  probably the best ice cream I've ever had!  Creamy, but not too sweet.  You enjoy this ice cream and don't regret eating it afterwards.  The best!

Employees have good manners and are pleasant.  Appreciated.

My wife couldn't remember the name of this place.  I said, oh, that's easy, just remember Mr. Humphries and Mrs. Slocombe from "Are You Being Served".  I was pleasantly surprised to find out later that these two characters were the inspiration for this business name.  I mean, how many hipsters today know about that old BBC program?

Tip:  buy a cup of Blue Bottle coffee to enjoy with your cone.  A great combo!
author: Yelp R.

description: Best ice cream ice had in this city (and I am VERY selective with my stars when it comes to ice cream). I literally shouted over this ice cream. Super unique flavors that are executed to perfection and aren't TOO bizarre. The boy who served me was adorable and so happy to help me decide and didn't rush me at all despite the growing line. Every flavor had me going "oh that sounds amazing" and it was so hard to choose. Honestly can't say enough about how much I loved my experience.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
A little ice cream shop in the Ferry Building, just across from Blue Bottle. They definitely have some collaboration going on. We contemplated getting the Complete Breakfast. Instead, we got the Special Breakfast and the Sesame ice creams.

Special Breakfast is definitely a different kind of ice cream. It tasted a bit like bourbon, but I guess it was more of the aftertaste that made it seem more like alcohol. It was interesting but not sure if I'd get it again. I did like the cornflakes in the ice cream because they were kinda soggy haha

We also tried the Sesame ice cream. I've had black sesame flavored shaved snow in LA which I thought was better, but it was still nice here.

They also had a beer float party near the Mission, but we missed it due to time constraints! Seems like they have a lot of cool things going on (pun intended!).
author: Erin H.

description:
Before I had even sampled Humphry Slocombe ice cream I was pre-judging it based on the Yelp reviews of my lovely yelp friends. I was certain that the ice cream here would be just a-ok and that Bi-Rite would have the superior SF ice cream.

Despite what my fellow yelpers have declared I fell head over heels in love with Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream. Not that people were saying anything horrible about the ice cream, they just weren't raving about it. Well, I'm here to rave about it. It was creamy, unctuous and the artisan flavors were novel, rich and satisfying. It was one of my most memorable ice cream experiences I've ever had.
author: Oulie T.

description:
8/2/14

I had bookmarked Humphry Slocombe MONTHS before my trip.  Before there was even a remote possibility that I was going to visit SF, much less during SF Yelp's 10 Year Anniversary celebrations.  It was one of those bookmarks I made while I'm reading Yelp friends' reviews and end up looking at random photos when I really should be asleep.  A couple of weeks before the trip, I looked at my bookmarks and made a note NOT to forget to visit HS, and am I so happy to have experienced the BEST three scoops of ice cream I've ever tasted in my lifetime!  (I had just returned from the two-hour hiking yoga adventure and was ready to refuel.)

Was walking through the building just looking at the different shops and their offerings when I came upon a snakeline of about ten people and I looked up and saw the sign and I immediately lined up. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humphry-slocombe-ice-cream-san-francisco-4?userid=M9rRM6Eo5YbKLKMG5QiIPA&select=0O5jT3x-qGinuzlL1e3J3w#0O5jT3x-qGinuzlL1e3J3w  I read on the white marker board the flavors of the day and saw three that called out to me.  I asked the young woman who greeted me if I could sample three flavors before deciding on one, and she said yes.  After said tastings, I couldn't decide on just one, so I chose ALL of them.  I believe it was $3 for one scoop, $5 for two, and $8 for three.  It was the best $8 I've ever spent on dessert EVER. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humphry-slocombe-ice-cream-san-francisco-4?userid=M9rRM6Eo5YbKLKMG5QiIPA&select=FXoXouI8DqqKTIJ8hMroaw#FXoXouI8DqqKTIJ8hMroaw

Brown Sugar Fennel- Definitely felt crystals of sugar, but by no means grainy.  Dark caramel, and delicious floral fennel.  Mmm...

Harvey Milk and Honey Graham- Honeyed graham.  Salt. Decadent, milky, shortbread.  I can still taste it!

Black Sesame- Toasted, smokey sesame.  Definite peanut flavor- I'm allergic to peanuts, so this was a bonus pleasure!  The sounds and textures of eating caramel wafers (think very thin waffle cookies, or a Kit Kat) sliding under each other...   Beautiful scoop of ice cream.  Gorgeous color, and those haunting black sesame specks!  My favorite of the three, if I had to choose. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humphry-slocombe-ice-cream-san-francisco-4?userid=M9rRM6Eo5YbKLKMG5QiIPA#LERbm9zDm-yfmIm9dinayA

After taking a few photos of my delicious meal and the beautiful HS mug I bought for an extra $10, I enjoyed my bowl of ice cream at one of the dock benches outside.  One of the most memorable traveling food experiences ever,  forever and ever, amen.  Thank you, Humphry Slocombe!

#720
author: Aileen B.

description:
MUST TRY! tried their jasmine lychee and Vietnamese coffee and they were both REALLY good !!

The staff were also super friendly, so that's always a plus.
author: Antonio T.

description: I think Humphry Slocombe is a little overhyped, but I still enjoyed the two flavors that I got - oolong tea and Vietnamese coffee. The oolong tea was perfectly balanced (sweet, but not too sweet) and the Vietnamese coffee wasn't as overpowering as I thought it might be. Overall, I don't think the two flavors matched well with each other, but separately, they were delicious. I do really like the fact that the scoop size here is huge compared to other high quality ice cream shops! Because of this, I make it a point to try to come here and order something whenever I'm at the Ferry Building.
author: Trisha V.

description:
This is as far as a I know the only ice cream joint in the ferry building and the lines are always pretty epic. I'm usually commuting thru so I'm  focused on getting to work and don't mess around with ye olde epic lines. When I passed by and there was only two peoplein line,  I saw my chance to try this place out.
 The secret breakfast and blue bottle Vietnamese coffee were both good, but the coffee overwhelmed the secret breakfast flavor. Next time I'll chose a subtler flavor for the second scoop, or just have the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee by itself.
I didn't look at any any reviews and I'm I glad for that as the consistent raves would have raised my expectations to a level that is not supported.  The ice cream was good, but not great. Four stars as it's  the best ice cream in the ferry building/embarcadero area.
author: Steven W.

description:
Friendly service, they let you try a bunch of the wild and interesting flavors they have before you buy your full scoop(s).  We tried 4-5 flavors than settled on a scoop Harvey Milk + Honey Graham (with hot fudge) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Delicious and wonderful home style (full milk-cream/sugar) ice cream.

This is home made, awesome ice cream with amazingly different flavors. If you are down by this area, check them out.
author: Rob K.

description:
This ice cream shop was recommended to me by Les S., so I made sure to stop by before heading home. Luckily, this location is in the same building as Hogs, so I got my ice cream fix right before dinner!

I asked to try the vietnamese blue bottle coffee and the secret breakfast as the guy recommended it, and I ended up getting both. The guy actually gave me the wrong sample (I did not get vietnamese blue bottle), so when I actually got my ice cream, I was surprised at the difference in flavor. 

The vietnamese blue bottle coffee was good, but since I am not a big fan of coffee, I can't say much. I wish I got a different flavor instead as this was not what I tried.. but oh well.

On the other hand, the secret breakfast was amazing! In the beginning, I was surprised at how it tasted- not what I expected, but I loved the unique flavor as well as the crumbles in the creamy ice cream. The ingredients are definitely "secret," as I couldnt figure out what flavor it was. 

I wish LA had all these amazing ice cream places... This ice cream spot was a great end to my trip. The two giant scoops cost $6, which was worth it as there was so much ice cream given. However, I wasn't given the options for cones.. not sure if they sell those? I also heard the crispy almond topping was delicious.. will have to try that next time!
author: Celine L.

description: Had their secret breakfast, here's your damn strawberry, and Harvey milk.  All flavors were good, but very melty.  So melty that you have to eat it immediately after you pay.  Prices are a bit high, and for the size of the scoop that you get, it's not really worth it.  Another gripe is that the line is always long and its takes foreverrrr!
author: Samantha C.

description:
Ice cream scoops! Floats! and sweet goodness! 

A must stop when at the Ferry Building Marketplace. It was a beautiful sunny day around The Embarcadero. Sadly missing our Yelp 10th Year Anniversary event due to traffic...and...After all the walking & running around Market Street with my SoCal friend, something sweet & cold sounded perfect! My son, sweet friend, and I had to wait in line. My parents didn't want to try it. While waiting in line, after I checked in, I received some suggestions on various flavors & floats to try from friendly Yelpers.

They are very quick when requesting for samples. I sampled the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Tahitian Vanilla, and Horchata. Concerned if the coffee flavored ice cream had any actual caffeine, I decided not to chose that flavor even though it was delicious. Mmmmm :) Tahitian Vanilla was a basic flavor so I got that scoop for my son who actually did chose that to eat. As for myself, I got the single scoop horchata. I love the actual drink. LOL. Everything is in a cup. No waffle cone since that would definitely be too messy walking around. I take my time to enjoy my Horchata ice cream. Luckily, I decided not to chose waffle cone for my son nor myself because, uh oh, our scoops of ice cream were melting so fast! Thank goodness for napkins. I had a spoonful of my SoCal friend's Bourbon Coke Float. It was alright for me but tasted strong. In my friend's opinion, she told me it tasted really good and liked it very much. My son and I enjoyed our scoops. 

I enjoyed my first time finally trying Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream! All my other SF friends are very lucky to have them sooo close by! Definitely a must try again! So many unique flavors and floats to chose from next time! Wonder if it's possible to try all the flavors in 1 day...probably would be in a sweet, sugary ice cream coma! LOL
author: Andrea S.

description: We had the peanut butter and the vanilla. Really good, tastes very natural. Unfortunately they refused to redeem a gift card I'd been given.
author: Tian B.

description:
Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! Secret Breakfast! 

Even though it was our wedding weekend, we still visited Humphry Slocombe not once, but TWICE.. SO GOOD!
author: April M.

description:
Honestly, I expected more given it's reputation and the raves it received from people I know. We had been wanting to try it since the last time we were in town, but the ferry building location wasn't open yet at that time. It's not bad ice cream, it's just 'ok' ice cream. The quality isn't extraordinary. I did like that they had interesting flavors like 'secret breakfast' (which is corn flakes and bourbon) and poached pear. However, the flavors sound more adventurous than they taste. They are actually quite mild. The ice cream is fairly soft and not dense; depending on your preferences in ice cream this is a good or bad thing.

Again, it's not bad, but I've had better elsewhere. It's location and unique flavors give it cachet. It's definitely worth a try if you run across it. I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Ian T.

description:
One of my favourite ice cream purveyors in the Bay Area, I used to have to travel to get my fix of Humphry Slocombe. So, I was pleasantly surprised to see that they had opened a store in the Ferry Building

The line told the tale of the quality of the ice cream. However, the friendly efficient employees kept the line moving quickly

After taking our fill of Ferry Building Farmers' Market food, we were looking for something lighter. The POG (pineapple, orange, guava) sorbet was the perfect thing, with a subtle yet complex flavour. We also mixed in a scoop of vanilla

A top tip - by buying the 2 scoops in one tub, we saved $2 compared to buying a scoop each
author: Yee Gan O.

description:
I have been waiting for this location to open and was happy to see it was opened! (I know it's been open for some time now, but sadly I only come to sf for the holidays now) 

Who said ice cream at 11:00am is too early? I was the lucky customer to be their first flavor board picture of the day! (Thank you for my ice cream.) 

Samples a few of their flavors (secret breakfast, honey thyme, poached pear) but ended up with matchadoodle. It was a hard choice, but I can never say no to green tea! Good flavor and the cookie adds a nice texture. 

Will definitely be back before I leave the city..
author: Chris K.

description:
If your by the Ferry Building, definitely stop by!

The staff were all very nice and let me try multiple flavors. I ultimately ended up going with the White Chocolate Lavender and the Ancho Chocolate. Both were rich, and creamy, yet not too sweet. I got it in a waffle cone, which tasted excellent.
author: Alex C.

description:
UGH the wait is soooOOo long but kinda worth it. Being that there is a wait, it means that there will be a crowd and it will be cramped. I actually got a bit light headed and dizzy while waiting that I had to step out of the line and have the husband wait for me. Located inside the ferry building, just look for the two headed cow sign and the long line and you will be there.

You are able to try out a few of the flavors prior to making your purchase. There is for sure some really different flavors here and for what I understand they change them around every so often. I tried the secret breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes), the salt and pepper one (yes, salt and pepper) and their cantaloupe cayanne (different, right?! I told ya! The cantaloupe cayanne was totally just how I imagined it to taste like. ) I was hoping that I would like the flavors to all of them being that I was feeling adventurous but sadly I didn't dig them all. We ordered a scoop of the secret breakfast (you do get the bourbon flavor in there) and a scoop of the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. The coffee one was delicious and the best one there. Its enjoyable but soon you get tired of the taste, even though the scoop is small. The ice cream itself is creamy, rich in flavor and expensive! I'm guessing the hype and the different flavors allows them to have high prices since they obviously do not have any trouble having ice cream lovers line up. 

Reason why I deducted stars was
1. I was hoping to like more than just one or two of their flavors. I was expecting to be blown away (yes, maybe my expectations were high but heck, for a 15 minute wait and $4 a scoop, I am expecting a lot more than just weird flavors with rich ice cream)
2. Service. The people working behind the counter are probably so annoyed and get irritated by the customers having to ask about this and that and try this flavor and then that one. I am assuming they are always super busy too so that doesn't help but as a customer service representing the Humphry company, its kinda sad that they weren't very friendly. The staff seemed to rush us on placing our order and being tourist here/out of towners and with a kid along for the ride, I would have wanted a bit more patience and felt a bit more valued. I guess service isn't too important here, the ice cream is. 

Side note:
With the random and different flavors, not sure if this place is kid friendly. I know my nephew didn't like any of the flavors and I felt bad having to make him wait in line with me for my own ice cream pleasure.
author: Catalina T.

description:
Not much needs to be said except that this branch of Humphry is particularly easy to get to being in the heart of the Ferry Building.  While the selection of flavors doesn't nearly match that of the original in the Mission, all the fantastic core selections are available along with a nice array of seasonal ones.

The line moves quickly and the Secret Breakfast is as mouthgasmic as ever.  Even better, grab a scoop (or three) and soak in the gorgeous view just outside.
author: Eric F.

description:
This place is the perfect way to finish a eating fest at Embarcado.  Innovative flavors and a nice creamy ice cream keeps me coming back here for more.  Like many other people have mentioned the Secret Breakfast is a solid choice.

Some other which I like are:
Strawberry balsamic
lemoncello: light and tart
milk and honey
pb chocolate chip

I'll pass next time:
horchata: slightly salty
mango chamoy
author: Kenneth H.

description:
***This new Humphry Slocombe location provides a convenient way to try their ice cream (you do not have to make the trek out to Humphry Slocombe's original location in Mission and deal with the difficult parking situation there); Humphry Slocombe's ice cream is fine and tasty, but it is overpriced and a notch below some of the Bay Area's best ice cream shops like Bi-Rite Creamery in Mission and Three Twins in Napa***

Humphry Slocombe is a cool ice cream shop.  It is an artisan ice cream parlor like Bi-Rite Creamery, but it features much more interesting flavors--unique sweet flavors and even a few savory flavors.  This new Humphry Slocombe location (the original location is in Mission) is in the very popular Ferry Building so lines can get extremely long here.

Humphry Slocombe has many ice cream flavors in their arsenal, but they change by the day.  I tried their banana with cinnamon, which was interesting--a banana ice cream base with touches of spiciness and heat (kind of like eating banana ice cream with finely crushed Red Hots).

I also had their secret breakfast, which was bourbon ice cream mixed with corn flake cookie clusters.  I liked the bourbon flavored ice cream.  It was creamy and sweet, but it also had a noticeable bitter burn.  The corn flake cookie clusters were okay.  They were not mixed that evenly through the ice cream so you only get big chunks here and there.  Also, while the corn flake clusters were tasty, the unique texture of the corn flakes did not really come through so it did not really create that cereal with milk and booze feeling that I believe was intended.

Prices are high, but that is a given since Humphry Slocombe is in the Ferry Building.  I am not sure if the Mission location is less expensive; I have not been to that location in a long time.

Service was personable and polite.

Humphry Slocombe is a satisfying ice cream parlor.  I did not love the ice cream here, but I would probably need to come back and try more of their flavors before really deciding where I would put this among my personal ice cream favorites.

Based on this experience though (as well as my trip to Humphry Slocombe's original location), I did walk away liking Mission's Bi-Rite Creamery, Napa's Three Twins and Los Angeles' Carmela more than Humphry Slocombe.  While those places lacked Humphry Slocombe's creativity, the ice cream I had at those ice cream shops were more delicious and with a more pleasing and smooth consistency and texture.

You can find metered street parking near the Ferry Building.
author: Anthony N.

description:
I looooooooooove ice cream. So much so that I eat it even though I'm lactose intolerant. Small details. The friend who brought me here was raving about this ice cream the whole time. Before we went, while we were in line, while we were eating... After we ate it. And she had a reason to. The queue was super long when we got in line but everyone behind the counter was super friendly and let me try a variety of flavors (I'm indecisive and like to know what my options are).

I ended up getting the earl grey and it was so, so, so good. I love subtle flavors like earl grey but ice creameries often skimp out on the flavor; not Humphry Slocombe. The flavor came through so strongly and it was the perfect creaminess. I'll definitely be coming back. Hopefully they'll have violet!

----------

I'm not a fan of peanut butter but I tasted their flutter nutter and ended up getting a whole scoop! I was right when I said I'll definitely be coming back. Seems like you can't go wrong--all the flavors are great!
author: Michelle K.

description:
MATCHADOODLE: This was my favorite (the Vietnamese coffee being a close second). Green tea ice cream with tiny bits of snickerdoodle sounded weird at first, but it was surprisingly very good! 

BLUE BOTTLE VIETNAMESE COFFEE: If you're a coffee lover, definitely go for the Vietnamese coffee. The coffee flavor is strong but not bitter nor overwhelming. Might just be the best coffee ice cream I've ever had.

HORCHATA: In terms of creaminess, I wouldn't say this was very creamy when comparing it to the creaminess of standard ice cream. It was still very good though. 

They let you sample the flavors, so you can't really go wrong with what you purchase. I shared 3 scoops with a friend. I probably wouldn't have been able to finish 3 scoops on my own, because that's just too much sweetness for me. There was a bit of a long line, but it moved pretty quickly, so don't be intimidated if there's a long line. I would definitely come back and try the other interesting flavors they have. Go get yourself a few flavors and enjoy it outside next to the water!
author: Kathy N.

description:
Perfect location cause my friend and I were craving something sweet after lunch in the ferry building!

I've tried secret breakfast and blue bottle coffee in the past, so this time I wanted something different.

I sampled harvey milk with graham crackers, basil lime sorbet, and cantaloupe cayenne. The basil lime was pretty good and had strong hints of basil. As for the cantaloupe cayenne, it definitely had that spicy kick at the end! Not quite what I was expecting though.

BUT let me tell you about harvey milk - it was so damn delicious my friend wanted to steal my ice cream! Very milky for you milk lovers out there. I highly recommend it. 

Minus one star because my scoop was a bit melted.
author: Tina C.

description: I saw a big line to this place so we decided to try out the ice-cream. I never heard of this place but it occurred to me if the line is big for a ice-cream than must be popular. For the Valentines month, they had a rose petal ice-cream which was delicious. But one small scope is $4.25.. A little expensive for a small serving size.
author: Ashi C.

description:
Meh, overrated and not worth the twenty plus minute line. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee had a nice flavor and was my pick. Sampled Secret Breakfast (bourbon cornflake), bourbon was great cornflakes not so much.

I prefer richer tasting ice cream. Go big or go home.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Been here a couple times. Probably the best ice cream I've ever had. Secret Breakfast is my absolute favorite. Harvey Milk is my 2nd. Vietnamese coffee is delicious. It was totally worth the random drive from Santa Clara on a late Sunday afternoon. Just wish the service was a little more friendly. Everyone seems so frazzled. Like it bothers them to give a sample.
author: Cynthia H.

description:
I love the Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream in the Mission, but love this one even more since it is located at the Ferry Building -- so close to where I work! Now I can enjoy it on my walks during lunch. 

The line was pretty long today, but it moved quickly. The staff were friendly and never showed any signs of annoyance to any patrons if we wanted to try more than one flavor. 

I chose the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Oolong, which were both sooo dericious. It's $6 for two flavors -- seems a bit much for ice cream, but they are pretty generous with their scoops!
author: Jen N.

description: I love trying ice cream everywhere I go and SF is one of my favorite ice cream scene. Secret breakfast is my favorite! Who does not love ice cream for breakfast? Have one of scoop of Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee = your morning is complete :)
author: Katie T.

description: I was happy to try their coffee and malt chocolate ice cream flavors. Their malt chocolate tasted almost exactly like a whopper (but it in the form of ice cream) and their coffee was yummy too. The next time I go, I'd like to try their POG flavored ice cream.
author: Bobby S.

description: Very nice guy let me sample 2 flavors, peanut curry & salt/pepper.  Surprisingly delicious!  Of course being a klutz I dropped my cone right when I was about to start on the cone!  waaahhhh!
author: Fong L.

description:
THE SECRET BREAKFAST! 

I'm sure all of their other flavors are as amazing, delicious, and creamy as the secret breakfast, BUT there's something so absolutely fantastic about everything in this ice cream that I can confidently say it's the best ice cream I've ever had. Overstatement? NO. It's seriously that good. Do yourself a favor and head over to the Ferry Building- buy yourself 1,2,3,4 scoops of the secret breakfast ice cream and sit outside on the benches and enjoy yourself!
author: Jade R.

description: Flavors are innovative & some push the envelope but nothing wows me so my heart still belongs to Bi-Rite.  Plus the location less convenient.  Tried the malted chocolate & secret breakfast, meh.  Creamy tho.
author: Kim S.

description: WOW! I am not actually an ice cream lover. I'll eat it like twice a year and be like, meh, it's ok, and go back to eating savory things instead. But my friend sang the praises of Humphry Slocombe and I was in the Ferry Building anyways so I got a scoop of their Secret Breakfast - maybe the best ice cream I've ever had? I enjoyed it so much. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Emily V.

description:
Loveee the secret breakfast ice cream (bourbon and cereal). The line is rather long, but the ice cream is well worth the wait!

Servers are very patient when you request for samples. I tried the salt and pepper flavor for fun, and was surprised by how good it tasted.

Will definitely come back for more!
author: Christina N.

description:
Mmm...I keep thinking about the Blue Bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream. SO rich and creamy and infused with a heavenly coffee flavor. Other coffee ice creams just don't taste the same after this! And the Secret Breakfast was pretty much just as good as everyone else raves about. You can definitely taste the Bourbon and the cornflakes look kinda more like Golden Graham chunks. It adds a nice texture that isn't too sticky and goes wonderfully well with the bourbon flavors! 

There are a lot of other interesting flavors too...we tried the black sesame which tasted like...black sesame! But as soon as I tried the coffee, I knew that the flavors were so much more overpowering and would linger with a sweet aftertaste in my mouth that was so much better. Wouldn't mind coming back to try more flavors, but I could get the coffee and secret breakfast every time and still be happy! Price wise, they are a bit steep, but it's worth it! ($4 for 1 scoop, $6 for 2)

If you head into the Ferry Building from Embarcadero, it's more down at the farther end almost where you'd exit the building. Right across from Blue Bottle, which uses Humphrey Slocombe ice cream for its affrogatos. 

Humphrey Slocombe  over Bi-Rite!
author: Jasmine C.

description: I came here once for breakfast because the Blue Bottle line was too long. So happy! There are soooo many flavors with clever names and enticing combitions, and each one of them is delicious.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Came across this ice cream shop while strolling in the ferry building. Never knew it featured in food network as five best places to have ice cream. Tried the Tahitian Vanilla ice cream and wow, it was yum.
Their other popular ice cream was blue bottle coffee and some cornflakes ice cream but tasted it and did not like it to may taste. 

The server there was however not so friendly and inspite of just 2 people behind was in a rush and when asked for tasting the ice cream, I think did not like that. 
But yes, for the icecream will definitely give full marks and would deduct some for the service .
author: Neha J.

description: First time here, and I couldn't think of a better way to celebrate finishing The SF Marathon than with a scoop of ice cream!  Secret Breakfast (made with Bourbon & Cornflakes) was the special, so I tried it and holy crap it's one of the best flavors I've ever had!   It was perfect for the occasion, though I could call it the Breakfast of Champions in light of the marathon I just ran to "earn it!"
author: Giselle P.

description: Very good ice cream! And, lots of great flavors!
author: Jen G.

description:
Located within the ferry building is this delicious gourmet ice cream shop with a decently unique set of flavors. Going in before noon on a weekday, there was no line, which was fantastic for two reasons: (1) you did not have to wait and (2) you can take your tine sampling the different flavors!

I sampled the vietnamese blue bottle coffee, the candied ginger, and the bourbon with cornflakes. Each flavor had a distinct taste that matched their non-ice cream counterparts! If you are a whiskey or coffee lover, definitely sample the respective flavors!

I just had a heavy lunch, so felt that the candied ginger ice cream suited me the best at the time.

Pros:
- awesome selection of flavors that gets cycled every month
- samples
- quick service and not too busy during the weekday

Potential improvements:
- ice cream was pretty soft so it started melting shortly after leaving the store; maybe a lower storing temperature would be nice if it doesnt cut into taste
- when ice cream started melting, it dripped through the bottomnof the cone; would recommend changing up the cone (maybe with candy or cocolate at the bottom!)
author: Jeff M.

description:
OH. OHOHOHO. HO. HOHOHO.

Jolly shibe. Many jolly shibe = rotund shibe. 

OHOHOHO. HOHOHO. Oh. HOHO.

Line iz much long. But iz expect for grand opaning. Shib waiting.

OHOHOHOHOHOHO. HO. HOHO. OH.

Shibe see flavur sign. Wow. Much exoticc. Olive oil! Such intensity. Butter by moodlight?? What sorcery iz such? Queue shib drool.

OHOOOOOO. HOOHOOOO.

shib get olive oil + butter by moodlight (limiting flavur!) and take bite. MMMMMM MMMMMMMMMMMMM. MANY CREAM. SO FAT. SUCH RICH. Shib donut think ice crem cud become such falvor!!!!!!!!

MMMMMMMMMMMMM
MMMMMMMMM

MM
M

Each bite is such rich. Like meal of many kings. So butter and fatty. If u donut lik thik ice crem plz donut come here. Bcuz ice crem here iz fat like biggie smalls ate 2pac and iz still such hunger.

So yum which is wai shib still laugh lik king.

HOOOOOOOHHOHOOHOHOHO. HOHOHOHOGOHOHOHOIPOPPP.

Hoohohoho.

wow.
author: Doge S.

description:
overall - 4.2/5
-----------------

food - 4/5
1) black sesame ice cream - 4/5

service - 3.5/5

cleanliness - 4/5

location - 5/5

experience - 4.5/5

------------------------
wait time:  5 mins (afternoon, weekday)
author: John V.

description:
I believe.
I believe we will.
I believe we will eat all the ice cream.

The "Tahitian V*nill@" or Vanilla, for all you non-Humphry-Slocombe-folk, is probably the best vanilla ice cream I've ever had.

I was waited on by two guys and both of them were very sweet, had accents and were very attractive. Well done, Humphry Slocombe. You have a new believer.
author: Gabriela K.

description:
I was waffling between the horchata and the salted caramel cacao nib. My decision was made after I observed that the salted caramel cacao nib didn't actually have any cacao nibs in it. I realize that this is known what HS is known for, but horchata just sounded too good to pass up.

I got a scoop in a bowl with a cone on top. That's an awesome idea for someone who wants the cone, but doesn't want to get messy. The cone, by the way, was fantastically crispy and just sweet enough. The ice cream was a little salty, and very strong, but in a good way. I still prefer Treatbot's version though, since its horchata is more toasty and cinnamony.
author: Heather F.

description:
Everyone raves about Bi-Rite being the best ice cream shop in SF, but I think Humphry Slocombe takes the cake. Located in the busy Ferry Building, you can easily spot where Humphry Slocombe is because of the line that snakes around. But don't worry - the line moves fast so you won't have to wait too long to taste some delicious ice cream!

- Secret Breakfast: a MUST try. Bourbon and cornflakes? Heaven in a bowl (or cone, whatever floats your boat).
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: another very popular flavor. And a Blue Bottle is right across from them!
- Black Sesame: not overpowering, which is nice.
- Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip: all you peanut butter lovers will enjoy this.
- Peach Habanero Sorbet: first sweet... wait for it... then a little kick in your mouth! ;)

- 1 scoop: $4
- 2 scoops: $6
- 3 scoops: $7 (So grab a friend and share! The more the merrier!)

I'm definitely down to be the little spoon if I can sample all of the flavors at Humphry Slocombe!
author: Christine S.

description:
A "stall" in the Ferry Building there isn't any seating. It's just a take-and-go establishment. Though the line is long, they move fairly quickly. With the amount of people they serve I'm surprised how friendly they were when they helped us. No doubt it's a very tiring job.

Hours:
Mon - Fri: 11AM - 8PM
Sat: 8AM - 8PM
Sun: 11AM - 8PM

The Menu on 7/19/2014
Flavors:
Secret Breakfast
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
peach Habenero Sorbet
Pepper & Mint Chip
Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip #306727
Harvey Milk & Honey Grahm
Early Grey Plum Sorbet
Black Sesame
Malted Milk Chocolate
Brown Sugar Fennel
Tahitian Vanilla
Lemon Butter Milk

1 Scoop: $4
2 Scoop: $6
3 Scoop: $7.50

Toppings: ($1) Amarena Cherries /  Frosted Almonds / Frosted Peanuts / Bourbon Caramel / Butterscotch / Hot Fudge

Bourbon Coke Float: ($8) 1 scoops of Secret Breakfast in Coca Cola topped with Bourbon Caramel
Tin Roof Sundae: ($8) 3 scoops of Tahitian Vanilla topped with Hot Fudge, Frosted Peanuts and Maldon Salt

Our Order:
Brown Sugar Fennel and Harvey Milk & Honey Graham
Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee

My typical go-to flavor is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. My friend needed caffeine so he said he wanted to try it and the Secret Breakfast since he never had Humphry Slocombe (which he loved both and now really likes frost cornflakes in his ice cream).
