I got the other two flavors. The Harvey Milk & Honey Grahm was very creamy and had crumbs of graham crackers mixed in. It was great with the Brown Sugar Fennel since it's a more lighter flavor and the Brown Sugar Fennel is a strong bold flavor (tasted like black licorice, which I enjoyed).

I love Humphry Slocombe because of their unique flavors. More often than not, they'll have a flavor you can't find anywhere else. Some may sound strange, but they generally work! And the ice cream texture is super creamy while the sorbets are smooth and refreshing. Should definitely stop by!

Review of other flavors I've tried at their original location: http://www.yelp.com/biz/humphry-slocombe-ice-cream-san-francisco?hrid=fEk6eT1V700VFtwWI0ad6A
author: Kitty K.

description:
This place totes reminds me of Icis haha. I know this place has another location that is way more yelpy but since I was at the Ferry Building, it was awesome to be able to try it out. They have unique flavors that probably change daily but I knew I had to try the Special Breakfast which has a very slight alcohol taste. I am not a fan of any alcohol flavored ice cream but it wasnt very strong and I loveddd the texture of the cornflakes. This was of course a sample because I didnt want to risk getting a scoop of something I didnt like but it was nice to have tried. I also tried the coffee and I didnt like it because I dont like coffee to begin with. The harvey milk and honey was settle and sweet so I did enjoy it. My favorite flavor was for sure the peanut butter chocolate chip. Yummmm you cant beat peanut butter ice cream which chocolate bits all over. They give you pretty big scoops and they are all so velvety, light and smooth. It is sorta difficult to describe but if you try it, you understand the texture of it. 


**TIPS**
1) One scoop is $4, two scoops is $5, and three scoops is $6 so obvs its more worth it to get three scoops. That is how they get you but $2/scoop isnt that bad at all. Go for three or go home.
2) 4 people can split the three scooper.
3) Enjoy!
author: Amy H.

description: Best ice cream ice ever had! And I've had A LOT of ice cream. The flavours were so unique and incredibly well balanced. Absolutely delicious! The Secret Breakfast and Mary Berry's Victoria Sponge were unreal.
author: Bianca N.

description:
Oh man.

I've had a lot of ice cream in my life. Growing up in New England we'd often tell jokes about going out to the ice cream stand before the snow had melted ("That's what your car has heat for, right?"). So ice cream is kind of an institution for me.

This was the best ice cream I've ever had in my life. Period, hands down, no contest. 

I had two flavors - the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Malted Milk Chocolate. The Vietnamese coffee was a very subtle surprise - it had the bitter, full-bodied flavor one expects from Vietnamese coffee instead of being just a slight variation on traditional coffee ice cream. I didn't absolutely adore it at first but I could see it growing on me over time.

But then there was the Malted Milk Chocolate. 

It was obvious that a generous helping of malted milk went into the preparation from the beginning. One thing I love - malted chocolate shakes. This was exactly that, only without the milk. Simply put, it was better than any malted chocolate shake I've ever had. Even simpler - it was better than any chocolate ice cream I've ever had. 

The peripherals really don't matter in light of that, but - service was fast and friendly and prices were high-ish but reasonable as compared with how much everything costs at the Ferry Building. Portion size was on the small side but not so much so that it felt like a rip-off. 

Highly recommended.
author: Dan K.

description: I've been to HS a few times before and thought it was good and probably would have rated them 4 stars.  But today I ordered the salted caramel with cocoa nibs ice cream and that flavor skyrocketed them to a 5.  I've never had a salted caramel ice cream that was the perfect balance of sweetness, butteriness, and creaminess (yes, the last two words exist...look it up in a dictionary).  They always end up too sweet to the point of being painful.  This was perfection in a cup.  I probably could have been fine with a few less cocoa nibs but otherwise it was perfection.  So glad I don't work that close to this place.
author: C L.

description: I don't think this place has the best ice cream in the world but it's definitely up there. There was a decent line when I got there but it went by very fast. I got the secret breakfast and the blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream. I loved how the secret breakfast had some texture in it with the corn flakes and it also balanced out some of the sweetness. Would definitely come back here if I'm in the area.
author: Alice K.

description:
Oh this place is yummy. The line did take awhile, but I don't blame them. Their flavors are unique and for those who aren't from the area (aka tourist season) would want to try at least 2 flavors, shoot I tried 3 before picking one I wanted. 

It's near other places in Ferry Building and next to a French Bakery place. It was a nice a way to end lunch with dessert :D one cup and they give a good amount. Made me so happyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy. :D
author: Corie L.

description:
I've been to the ferry building quite a few times and every time I've wanted to try this place at the recommendation of a friend. This ice cream shop seems to have a long line in front of it at all times. It seems like no matter how many people they serve, more people just come and fill up the line. 

Today I went on a Sunday as opposed to Saturday when I usually go, the line was still long but much shorter compared to the lines on Saturday so I decided to give it a shot. A friend of mine recommended the secret breakfast which is a bourbon ice cream with chunks of corn flakes in it. The bourbon taste initially surprised me as it is quite strong but combined with the sweet creamy vanilla flavor made for a delicious dessert. 

Besides the fact that the line here is long on weekends, I definitely want to come back and try some of the other flavors, hopefully before the weather gets colder.
author: Zach C.

description: Recommend the "Secret Breakfast." Knocked off a star because I feel the friendliness of the employees could improve.
author: Mallory L.

description:
Recommended flavors:
- Black Sesame - My FAVE b/c it tastes like Reese's peanut butter cups
- Peanut Butter fudge ripple
- Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) - really didn't like this upon first bite but it grew on me

Other flavors I've tried:
- POG sorbet (light and refreshing)
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
- Tahitian Vanilla
- Harvey milk and graham
- Candy Capp (mushroom ice cream, super sweet)
author: Jen G.

description:
OH THE SHEER JOY THAT IS THIS ICE CREAM.

I'm so glad that they finally opened! I wasn't sure if they'd opened yet, but Boyfriend and I headed over there on our lunch break and found out that they are! Turns out that today (3.5.14) is their grand opening! Hooray!

$3.75 for a single scoop, $4.75 for a double and $5.50 for a triple, with cups and sugar cones as the available options for your ice cream carrying. Since we both had to go back to work, Boyfriend and I each snagged a single scoop in a cup -- I got Butter by Moodlight and he got Peanut Butter Curry.

I took my first bite of ice cream and was in BLISS. Tart because of the blueberries, but smooth thanks to the brown butter. But I'm SUPER jealous of Boyfriend's flavor! I was thinking that his flavor would be really odd, but OH. MY. GOD. I love it! Not really sweet at all, but VERY flavorful. It tastes mainly of peanut butter, but with the aftertaste of curry. I'm not doing this ice cream flavor any justice at all in my description, but trust me, it's DELICIOUS, and I could probably bathe in it given half a chance.

THANK YOU HUMPHRY SLOCOMBE FOR MOVING TO THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT! Now I have a cheap way to serve my sweet tooth! Especially with the summer coming up!
author: Anna W.

description:
Still my favorite ice cream in the Bay Area. Sorry everyone else! Don't take it personally, you just don't got Secret Breakfast as your secret weapon.

Love the digs here as opposed to their original San Francisco spot. Sure, there's no indoor seating, but there's plenty outdoor seating right there on the waterfront. Plenty of benches to sit and observe the natural wildlife (and by that I mean certain people of San Francisco)

Flavors are always rotating so you gotta take what you get. Quick hitters would be of course the Secret Breakfast and the Black Sesame, but you can't really go too wrong here. If anything, you can taste test so at least you won't be totally in the dark about what to try out.

Service is surprisingly chill for how busy it gets here. Got greeted with a smile and a "Thank you", which was nice. Line went by pretty quickly as well. They got all their gears greased here.

Probably gonna be a usual hangout for me, seeing as this location is much easier to get to than the other for me. Quick hop and skip off of BART! Do yourself a favor and come see why Humphry Slocombe is the best bowl of ice cream in the bay.
author: Sean H.

description:
Whoa whoa whoa. I waited 2 weeks to go to this place hoping the line would die down! But it never did. I went at an off hour too at 4pm, people should still be at work but nooooo, they're waiting in the 20 minute line like I am. 

Any who, I've never been to the first location but this place is among the best of the best. Bi-rite? What's that? Mitchell's? Who are you? Ok I actually like Mitchell's too but this place is great. It's tucked away in the corner of the ferry building right across from blue bottle coffee, and they have blue bottle coffee flavor (I highly recommend it)! So awesome. If you like whiskey, you'll love their breakfast flavor (which in a big fan of as well)! I'd pass on the brown butter though (too sweet for my liking). 

All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed this place and it was well worth the 20 minute wait.
author: Stanley S.

description: I've heard so much about this place I was really excited to check it out. They had some sort of surprise breakfast flavor that had whiskey or bourbon and cinnamon toast crunch. It was DELICIOUS. Being a native portlander I don't think it was quite as good as Salt and Straw, but it was definitely a treat!
author: Jessica N.

description: The ice cream was not bad! They had several interesting choices, but we ended up going with the gingerbread and the peanut butter fudge. They were phenomenal :) the peanut butter one tasted like a peanut butter cup...just enough hints of peanut butter and fudge. Yum!
author: Amy K.

description:
I have nothing bad to say!  Will definitely return here next time I'm in the area. 

The line looked really long, but actually moved quickly.  I was hesitant to sample things because I was worried about getting jumped by all the people behind me, but the people working are so efficient and uber friendly, no one looked peeved.  Everything is handwritten on the wall made up of huge white tiles with menu offerings and quick breakdowns of things like 

Tin Roof Sundae
3 scoops: Tahitian Vanilla, hot fudge, frosted peanuts, Maldon salt 

Do they need to elaborate?  If you think so, then ask!  They were happy to help and answer any questions.  Each sample was handed to me with a quick description. Nice! 

So try everything I did and happy I was!  My no-fail chocolate approach didn't go as expected. The Ancho Chocolate was yum in flavor, but thick and slimy in consistency.  The Breakfast Special (bourbon with frosted flakes), Browned Butter (self-describing), and Tahitian Vanilla were our sundae choices.  Seriously, can that just be my last meal?  Oh yeah, unicorn style!  Served with an upside down cone.  The peanuts (they sell in a bag there) are seriously, crazy good!  Do it! Unless you have peanut allergies, then get an Epi-Pen and still do it! Just kidding!
author: Jade L.

description:
This ice cream place is inside of Ferry building along with brunch of goodies.

They have periodic specials and that day their special is "bourbon with corn flakes".

It tastes very good and there are 2 also my favorite that day is Vietnamese Coffee and horchata.  All of them taste so rich and creamy, love it.

Memorable ice cream moments in bay area :)
author: Salina L.

description:
After a delicious meal at Hog Island Oyster Co, head over here to satisfy your dessert cravings. They offer numerous unique flavors of ice cream here, which taste authentic, not artificial. 

The workers were friendly and patient while I sampled their ice cream. I sampled the Black Sesame and Jasmine-Lychee. The black sesame literally tasted like freshly crushed black sesame...yum! Jasmine-lychee won my heart. It's absolutely heavenly; there was a perfect balance of both flavors, and compliments each other nicely. The ice cream is smooth, creamy, and rich in flavor, while not being too sweet. It definitely hit the spot. 

All in all, I enjoy their ice cream here. I especially LOVE THEIR JASMINE- LYCHEE ICE CREAM. Although the prices are a bit steep, the quality of the ice cream and its flavors are well worth it. I'd recommend this place for anyone craving ice cream in the area!
author: Wendy T.

description:
Delicious! I tried the iron platter.

There were so many mesmerizing flavors that I tried three and by the time I went picking it was a combo.

Double fudge.

It all melted into a delicious chocolate sauce by the time the flavors were mixing in the bowl. Hot day.

Just thinking about it makes me want more.

Their menu can be confusing but I think I remember paper menus.
author: M R.

description:
If I wasn't married, I imagine I would eat corn flakes with whiskey every morning for breakfast.  But since I am, and wives tend to frown upon that sort of thing,  I have to get my fix from Humphrey Slocombe every time I come to San Francisco.  Their "Secret Breakfast" is crazy good, and it is even better when paired with the Vietnamese coffee flavor.  Best breakfast ever.

Yes, the prices are a bit high, but this is the Ferry Building, what do you expect?  Plus, it's the Bay area, so you can guarantee the milk and cream come from happy cows.

There isn't any seating inside, but there are some benches out back that look out over the Bay.  Perfect spot for breakfast.
author: Mark A.

description: Don't be intimidated by any line, it should move fast. ANYWAY, friggin delicious ice cream, this has to be one of the most tasty and flavorful ones I've ever had. You can really taste each ingredient and how strong it is. Sure the single scoop is literally a single scoop and not much to American standards, but you gotta go for flavors here cause that's what they do well. I ordered the secret breakfast and yes I do recommend it.
author: Micki H.

description:
I stopped by the Ferry Building for lunch and got distracted by Humphry. There wasn't a long line (on a Friday noon) and service was great! 

I was really sad they didn't offer oolong tea or black sesame flavors that day, so I got the harvey milk/honey graham and salted caramel cacao nib. I wanted a half scoop of each, but their policy is 1 scoop/flavor. 

Harvey milk and honey graham: If you like the taste of whole milk, this is the flavor for you. It's really "milky" and creamy with a slight note of honey. Definitely, the better of the two I ordered. 

Salted caramel cacao nib: I liked the crunch of the cacao nibs, but the flavor was just ok, nothing amazing. 

Overall: Really creamy and rich! I wouldn't want this every day since it's the type of ice cream that makes me really thirsty afterwards (not like Ici - it's more of a refreshing taste).
author: Jennifer L.

description:
It was a beautiful day in the city. Warm for the city! Perhaps warmer for me because I had walked BLOCKS before arriving here. 

I ordered the small cup of peanut butter chocolate chip ice cream. It was pretty good! I liked it. My friend ordered the chocolate, which melted so quick. She couldn't even eat the entire thing because it melted so fast. That was quite disappointing! She had to throw it away. 

In my opinion, their ice cream is pretty expensive! Considering it's ice cream... This isn't my favorite ice cream spot. Mainly because I was disappointed that the ice cream melted so quick, and because it was expensive. Not to mention, I felt like the workers were rushing us.
author: Jenn R.

description: Favorite ice cream in SF. Love the secret breakfast get it every time and then try a second scoop of something new. Today I had the honey graham. It is my new fav. Love this place. Love the name too. Named after two characters from the famous British sitcom Are You Being Served.
author: Christina O.

description: Very interesting ice cream flavors.  My favorite is the Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream with corn flakes)--delicious. Don't miss it.
author: Alexa S.

description:
I power walked all the way from the Mission Bay UCSF campus to get here on a workday. I got there 5 minutes before the 7pm closing time and there was this lady standing at the end of the line. I nervously asked her if that means they are closed. She said yes. Disappointed, I explained I came all the way and if it wasn't that damn fire disrupting the T-line, I'd be there sooner. Luckily for me, she begrudgingly let me be the LAST customer for the day. Yayyy! I told her I planned to use my Kudos monies and she told me they are not accepting it at the Ferry Building and that the Mission location is going to phase it out soon. Whhhaaatttt? Ooopsie... 

Well, I still wanted my ice cream and I knew what I wanted. Got a scoop of Oolong and a scoop of Secret Breakfast. $5. When I was paying, the cashier recognized me from the Mission store from a particular incident involving 2 ice cream cakes A YEAR AGO and comped my ice cream. I learnt that the cashier (don't want to mention names) got promoted and she definitely deserved it. She did tell me that they are still accepting Kudos at both locations so that's nice. 

The ice cream was as good as the Misison location.  Oolong tea had the subtle tea flavor and Secret Breakfast is still the reigning combo in the city. 

To the tired HS employee that had to tell people you are closed, I understand that you are tired and want to go home but please don't be mean about it. You are the first impression of HS to those who just wanted to get some ice cream and it leaves a sour taste in their mouths that might turn them permanently off your establishment. Thank you for letting me in but your subsequent rants and complaints made it a very awkward and guilt-ridden wait for me.  

Taste: 3 out of 3 stars. Customer service: 1 out of 1 (the guy who scooped my ice cream was very nice). Special mentions: That special individual who made my day so much better by comping my ice cream. Friends will be coming by soon.  1 star. 

Total: 5 stars
author: Gene L.

description:
Best Ice Cream I have tasted in San Francisco!

As I entered the small shop in the ferry building, I was greeted, right away, by the beautiful smile of the vendor. There were not many flavors to choose from, but they all looked fancy and original. Hesitant, I finally ordered a malted milk chocolate ice cream. The ice cream was edible perfection. The chocolate was not too bitter and not too sweet, and the ice cream melted in my mouth. As I was walking home, content, I did not regret my choice.
author: DJ B.

description: Came here 2 weeks ago when visiting the farmers market and obviously had to stop by to get some ice cream! I came a little earlier- around 1230 and the wait was about 10 mins. If you go in the afternoon on a weekend, get ready to wait for 20-30 mins. Secret breakfast is my fav flavor but it is pretty sweet, so if you don't have a super sweet sugar tooth, I wouldn't recommend. Blue bottle coffee is also pretty good!
author: Samantha G.

description: It's okay, they have some interesting flavors and it's in the ferry building, not exactly sure what the rave is about. My execs seem to enjoy coming here so I'll tag along from time to time.
author: Tiff W.

description: 3 times in 3 days! Lol! I got the Harvey Milk & honey graham + salted caramel Choco nib! FANTASTIC!!! Soooo gooooood!!!
author: Isma S.

description: D-lish! The staff was patient with the kids. Some of the flavors were adult oriented, with the breakfast surprise (bourbon and cornflakes) being the best!
author: Cooper J.

description: Pretty yummy ice cream. Dude had me try almost all of them! All pretty good. I got the secret breakfast, which has bourbon and cornflakes. Almost got buzzed from afternoon icecream :x haha. $4 a scoop? Something like that
author: Kathleen C.

description: Very very good ice cream. The Honey Graham is by far my favorite. Absolutely delicious
author: Daud K.

description:
The ice cream flavors here are interesting to say the least and they keep changing. I got the blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream, which was just awesome and the brown surgar, which was also awesome. also had burbon breakfast ice cream which was guess what awesome. 

Only cons are that i really didn't like the cone, there was nothing special with it, and it was quite expensive for the quantity that you get.  

And the lines here are usually ridiculous.

But its pretty good ice cream.
author: Anuj C.

description: Still the undisputed leader of the ice cream world Humphry Slocombe still offers their staple flavored (including the amazing "Secret Breakfast"). Is always innovating on something new (loved the "Peppered Pumpkin" none of that traditional pumpkin pie spice, this is pumpkin all grown up and angry). Although I'll always be partial to the original location the Ferry Building offers a lot more visibility and accessibility. Helping more and more people lick that! Heck yeah!
author: Stephen S.

description:
$4 single , $6 double , $8 triple.  Accepts credit cards.

Even the single scoop is a generous portion compared to some other competitors.

They let you taste before you buy.  I was excited for the "secret breakfast" of bourbon and cornflakes but it ended up being way too sweet for me.  The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee was on spot for strength and taste.  Ice cream is rich and creamy -- Humphry Slocombe is one of the creamier options around.  I'd love to try some of the other flavors sometime too!
author: Jennifer M.

description: I like the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and the maple pecan flavor. Also the cone is really good! Fortunately there was no line when I went, but I think it's a bit overpriced. I wish that they allowed two flavors for a single.
author: Tiratat P.

description:
I love ice cream. I was killing time in the Ferry Building and saw this place was finally open. I knew I wanted to try it but the line was a little long at the time. I stopped by the next day on a Saturday while on my way to the Exploratorium. There were only a couple people in front of me. The employees were friendly and generous about giving samples (my boyfriend didn't want any ice cream but the guy helping me insisted on a sample haha) Definitely get two scoops for just $1 more. For me, two scoops were a very generous portion of ice cream and satisfied my ice cream craving for the day. Unlike a previous review, my ice cream didn't melt too quickly either. I was able to slowly walk to the Exploratorium and sit down to finish my ice cream without any significant melting happening. 

I got the Oolong Tea and Cinnamon Brittle. Oolong Tea was delicious! It was rich and creamy, and you can definitely taste the tea flavor. Its a good flavor if you don't want something super sweet. So far, Oolong Tea is my favorite ice cream from Humphry Slocombe. Cinnamon Brittle initially tasted equally delicious until I got half way through. Sad to admit but I'm a weenie and the cinnamon got too spicy for me. Normally, I like cinnamon flavored ice cream but this one started to hurt my mouth. I was able to power through and finish all my ice cream by switching bites between the two flavors. I won't be getting that flavor again but I'll definitely be back to try their many other flavors.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Long lines await you.

The ice cream here is as good as the original location in the Mission, but a bit of the charm is lost here.

They let you try as many flavors as you want, I tried beer butter (YUM) but settled on black sesame in a cone which was incredible. I recently discovered this flavor in a quart container from a gal who makes it in Berkeley, and had not seen that flavor ever before.  It was almost a sweet/savory flavor combo that was fantastic. $4 for a cone is a bit pricey, but heck  - it is the Ferry building so not so bad.

I wish they had frequency cards.
author: Amy W.

description:
Hmm.. I really wanted to like this place. Of course I tried the SECRET BREAKFAST. Tastes like bourbon and has cereal flakes in it. 

Definitely flavorful and creamy but it was so melted they couldnt put it in a cone. I dont know about you... but I HATE melted ice cream. I like mine thick and firm!
author: Jenny F.

description:
This place makes me sad...Because it is so far away from San Diego.

On a more serious note, this place is really freaking good. Definitely, definitely, worth standing in line (depends which days you go) for! 

My favorite is the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham flavor. I am in love with the creamy, enhanced milk flavor that comes from it. I also really like the Mango-Carrot one. It is one of the more refreshing flavors. 

From a vietnamese gal who grew up drinking Vietnamese coffee in Orange County, take my word when I say their Vietnamese Coffee flavor isn't going to be exactly what you're looking for. It had a great coffee taste but the name is a little misleading. Just think of it as coffee ice cream and you won't be disappointed.

If you like BOURBON then get the Secret Breakfast (this one goes pretty fast) because that thing will smack you in the face once you bite into the cornflakes!!

It's located inside the Ferry Building so there are a lot of other places to check out or you can eat it outside next to the bay! Winning.
author: Olivia T.

description:
This place teeters between 3 and 4 stars for me. On certain days, they have many flavors that I love leading me to get 2-3 scoops like the fat ass I am. But then, they have those days where the flavors are really out there and I can't seem to find one that I really want a whole scoop of. I prefer their coffee ice cream or their tea flavors when they offer them. It is on the pricier side as well so usually it's better to get multiple scoops in one order and just share it with everyone. Some of their flavors can be very very sweet and overpowering so make sure you try them before you decide to get a whole scoop. 

Pros:
- the best ice cream in the ferry building (not that there are that many to pick from)
- tea/coffee/less sweet flavors are very refreshing and tasty

Cons:
- some flavors are overcloyingly sweet
- its a hit or miss place when it comes to flavors
- a bit on the pricey side
- can get really crowded at prime hours
author: Diana C.

description:
I loved the ice cream from this place!! Luckily we went at a time where there was only a few people in line. After trying this place I have added it to my "need-to-visit" list for whenever I'm in SF. 

I had the Secret Breakfast and Harvey Milk & Honey Graham flavors....absolutely delicious. I ended up basically inhaling my ice cream. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Tahitian Vanilla flavors were also very good as well!

The ice cream was true to flavor and not artificial tasting. The Vanilla and Coffee flavors were spot on. I can honestly see why people wait in long lines for this ice cream! Definitely not a place to pass up.
author: Tina M.

description:
SO HAPPY WITH THIS PLACE!
I'm surprised Yelp reviews haven't exploded for this branch!

Secret Breakfast is to die for! The bourbon mixes perfectly with the ice cream.  Flavor is perfect! Cornflakes added a wonderful flavor.

Yes, it's expensive, but it felt so worthwhile!

The cone also comes for free!
author: David W.

description: Yummy, delicious, and different. I was stuffed from lunch at Cowgirl Creamery, but I thought that I could force something else in because you only live once right? I ate at the Ferry building almost everyday during my visit to SF and passed by Humphry Slocombe everyday but did not stop. On my last day, I stopped and I am glad that I did. I did not want to be too adventurous, so I chose chocolate chip and cream cheese. It tasted a lot like chocolate chip cheesecake and I was sad when I finished my ice cream. This is a MUST for dessert while in and around the Ferry building.
author: Caroleigh N.

description:
One scoop, two scoop, three scoop... as simple as $4-$5-$6-  basically one dollar for an additional scoop. 

Crazy long line, slow service because of the option to sample the flavors before ordering. Kind of annoying but....guilty as charged, I do it too. They have a lot of flavors and all very unique, it was hard to choose. Prior to coming here, Kristen T. recommended the secret breakfast (a hint of whisky flavored ice cream with corn flakes). After tasting the secret breakfast, and POG (pomegranate, orange, guava sorbet), my husband and I walked away with a scoop of secret breakfast and blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor.  If you like coffee, this coffee ice cream is amazing! My husband thought the secret breakfast was a little too sweet, but I thought it was fine. The ice cream here is definitely worth trying, unique flavors and very creamy. I'm glad I tried it, but I think the line is too long for my waiting. =)
author: Louisa T.

description:
Malted Dulce de Leche!

How rich tasting is that? Hella rich, and hella good, too.

Years ago I tried their product at Starbelly's and loved Secret Breakfast. Never got around to their store in the MIssion, too long a line for me.

This pop-up looking stand in the Ferry Building is perfect. Not much of a line and it moves quickly, and the staffers are friendly and samples no problem and who the heck every thought of fennel in an ice cream? 

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream.  It's their second most requested after their Secret Breakfast.

I got a small scoop in a cup $4.00.  It was a great finish after having seafood at Hog Island Oyster Farm.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Friendly and efficient staff keep the long lines moving quickly.  The stand is near an entrance, next to the Dandelion chocolate shop.

I got a chocolate stout milkshake for a crazy $10.  The shake was basically a gigantic cup of rich milk chocolate ice cream with a strong hint of nutty/smooth stout beer.  Not sure if I would buy again at that price, but it was damn good.  The straws are thin and made out of paper and were pretty much useless for the milkshakes...For 10 bucks I should be getting a useful and maybe collectible straw haha...
author: Sean C.

description: I got here at 9:15pm, 15 mins before closing and they wouldn't serve us. I brought my aunt from Paris, Australia, and niece from the OC to try this ice cream. I even called the phone number to the store to ensure that they will be open and they said yes. Not a fan.
author: Dianna L.

description: First visit here when my bro in law recommended the place. I tried the Vietnamese icecream and love it. I had the bourbon caramel swirl on it too. Lines were about 20 people deep but they moved very fast. Kids loved their cone ice-creams too. Staff was quick and nice.
author: Manoj N.

description:
I just had a few bites of secret breadfast, but it was pretty good.
I'll come back to try different flavors.
author: Kaori M.

description: My favorites are secret breakfast and the ginger ice cream!!! Must try!
author: Prashant S.

description: Probably the best ice cream in town.  Obviously the Secret Breakfast is a crowd favorite for good reason.  Would also have to give honorary mention to Elvis - The Fat Years for all you banana lovers.
author: Art V.

description:
My best friend swears by this place, she loves it and it is her favorite ice cream. After this trip to San Francisco, I now have a new and first ever favorite ice cream! Humphry Slocombe, you have now become my favorite ice cream! YUM YUM YUM!

I had Humphry Slocombe for the first time this week, and I even came back a second time this week to consume more before my flight out of SF the very next day. Yes, it is just that delicious. Of course ice creams are always good and yummy, but however, I do think it is difficult to get ice cream to be just right, or just (almost) perfect (as we all know nothing in life is perfect)!

The honey graham was a bit sweet for me, sweeter than the others. Peanut butter chocolate chip is not bad. But my favorites are definitelyyyyy the blue bottle vietnamese coffee AND secret breakfast. It's hard to choose between the two but if you make me choose, I'd have to say I'd pick blue bottle vietnamese coffee just because I've never had other coffee flavored ice cream this good! There's always a line the last 2 times I came but it is definitely worth the wait. It is seriously THE most delicious ice cream, ever!

A MUST TRY FOR ALL! :)
author: Jade F.

description:
I came down to the Ferry Building with my girlfriend one day, and my very first impression pf this joint was of their tasting spoons. Why? Cuz this is the only place I've ever been to that uses tiny real spoons as taste spoons for customers. I'm talking about real, honest to God, silverware. Mind blowing. Who does that nowadays?

You know what's also mind blowing? How long that line can be on a Saturday afternoon when it's 85 degrees outside. The line moves along pretty quickly. The attendants behind the counter are nice enough, but they're not gonna let you try every single flavor twice and hold up the line.

Here are the flavors you ABSOLUTELY need to get on your trip: 

+ Secret Breakfast (Bourbon infused ice cream + corn flakes)
+ Maple Walnut
+ Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
+ Five Spice Pumpkin

The ice cream itself is a little more on the melted side than I would hope, and this is especially the case with the Secret Breakfast because of the alcohol in it. One thing I really appreciate is that it doesn't give you that weird aftertaste or feeling that you just ingested a bunch of dairy afterwards. Props to them. If I'm ever in the area again and I find myself wanting some ice cream, I'm definitely gonna hit this place up.
author: Zi-on C.

description:
After a lot of hype, I was so happy to see that Humphry Slocombe opened up a spot in the Ferry Buiding! When I went I barely waited for five minutes, and straight up went for the Secret Breakfast. It was singing my name. 

I got one scoop of the secret breakfast in a cone and the flavor of the bourbon and the crunch of the cornflake cookies was every bit as perfect as I thought it'd be. The cone was also yummy and didn't get soggy. Only gripe is the meltiness of the secret breakfast due to the alcohol content, but that can't really be fixed.

I'll be back to try out all the other flavors ( maybe even that bourbon coke float ?) and hopefully visit the original store in the Mission!
author: Fiona Z.

description:
Freakin good.

I am an avid Ici's ice cream-er since I'm from Berkeley but I think this place might be better than Icis. Their flavors are unique but on point. The lime sorbet was very refreshing and the salted caramel chocolate had the perfect dynamic for the flavor. 

Tip: get the ice cream on a cone and then ask for an extra cup so you can get the best of both worlds :)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
There are an adequate number of reviews of this small ice cream stand in the Ferry Building so I'll keep this short.

-- The Ferry Building is amazing for food choices in general.
-- There aren't many dessert options
-- Humphry Slocombe has many unique flavors as well as the typical.

Tried Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes combo) and it was creamy and delicious.

Wife had peanut butter cup and that was amazing too.

I also had my eye on Fat Elvis -- banana and peanut butter.

I had overweight guy's dessert guilt/remorse after.

Can't go wrong getting a scoop or two here.
author: Eric W.

description: I went here based on the yelp reviews. I got there right when they opened. Not one person in line. I thought I hit the lottery.  I tried a scoop of the secret breakfast ice cream and it was really good. I liked the consistency of the soft with the crunchy cornflakes. I actually wanted to go back and try another flavor yet my friend and I had lunch plans. I hope they start stocking this ice cream in a store in AZ. It's hot here and we like ice cream.
author: Alicia F.

description: Delicious. I can see why so many people mention the Secret Breakfast. It was amazingly good.  I'll definitely come back.
author: Catherine W.

description: This was my second time trying their ice cream. This time I tried their POG sorbet. It tasted just like the drink and Hawaii to me. It was super refreshing. I think last time I had the Tahitian vanilla, which I found very unique and more pronounced than regular vanilla. I taste tested the secret breakfast and found it too bourbon-y for me. I know, how can that be but I wasn't a fan and probably couldn't eat a whole scoop of it. It's pretty pricey at $4 a scoop. But a nice treat.
author: Alison W.

description:
Very rich, good ice cream. I tried the Special Breakfast, Oolong, and Blue Bottle viet coffee flavors #noshameinsampling 

The Special Breakfast was too sweet for me, but the other two were great! I love coffee flavored ice creams because they're not outrageously sugary and have vivid flavors. This was just that! Quite expensive (well not for the Ferry Building) at $4/serving but it's so rich and filling, you can share one with two... Or just suck it up and treasure it all like I did!
author: Aradhana V.

description: I came here with my family, who unlike me, are  picky eaters. None of them are fans of artisan and creative ice cream flavors, but this place created the exception! We had the blue Vietnamese coffee float, Tahitian Vanilla ice cream, and the XXX chocolate ice cream. All of which were very good! Definitely a place I would recommend.
author: Caleb V.

description: Love this place.   Great flavors and it's always nice to sit outside by the water eating ice cream.
author: Brad S.

description: Tried a bunch of flavors, chocolate, caramel, coffee, then I tried the Secret Breakfast! It truly ROCKED MY WORLD!!! It blew all of the others away. I honestly think it was the best ice cream I have ever had in my lifetime! Not sure what's in it, but I wish I ordered 2 scoops. The line was really long & I see why... wish they had one of these in Chicago- hint, hint!
author: S M.

description: Soooo i ordered from here on caviar delivery when my girlfriend and I were too lazy to go out and get ice cream. We thought their package names like "Netflix and chill" and "get lucky" we're hilarious but overpriced. We got the "get lucky" which was two pints and a small container of bourbon caramel. When the order arrived we laughed really hard when we opened the package as we finally found out why it costs so much; they delivered two condoms along with our ice cream lol. This is probably the next best thing for my single friends since tinder lol
author: Andrew W.

description:
Delicious Vietnamese coffee paired with secret breakfast. Loved it! 

Need to correct incorrect information from my first feview.  Humphry Slocombe is not opening a cafe here. It's another company who will be doing so. Still can't wait for that!
author: Debbie T.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe made my night. 

I had a rough evening, so I ordered their cup of Secret Breakfast ice cream. One of the cashiers asked me how was my day, and I told them briefly my story. They were caring enough to make the order on the house. 

Not only the ice cream was full of flavor, but it was very comforting, and the staff was awesome! Definitely going back there again!!!!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
We had quite the fateful run-in with this place on Friday. The original brick and mortar Humphry Slocombe was already on our to-go list for that evening, so finding this one in the Ferry Building was the best surprise. It's right next door to Miette and replaces the old gelato place?

We had the Black Sesame and Secret Breakfast. The black sesame was awesome, and very mild. I'm usually put off by black sesame, but this wasn't too sesame-y and had a ton of sesame crisps to add texture. The superstar, however, was the Secret Breakfast. It has so much bourbon taste to it, and the cornflakes were more cookie-like. The only "con" to it was that it was a little too soft, almost melty. Our guess is because the bourbon doesn't allow the ice cream to freeze all too well.

So glad that this place opened up in the Ferry Building. It makes it way more convenient and accessible than going out to the original shop in the back of the Mission (which we did anyway two days later). Expect an insane line and wait on the weekends.

P.S. The prices here are 25 cents higher than the original shop in the Mission.
author: Vivian L.

description: Okay, have to update my review for Humphry Slocombe to 5 stars. They've definitely won me over the last few times I've visited them. Their strawberry crumble, oolong tea, and white miso peach flavors are all SO GOOD. The scoop is pretty sizable compared to a place like Ici's, and they give you such a large spoonful when you ask to taste a flavor. Thanks for being part of my ultimate ice cream weakness.
author: Sophie H.

description: Feel it's a bit hyped up... It's located inside the popular ferry building, and there was around a 15-20 minutes wait on Saturday. We tried three flavors: secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes), black sesame, and Harvey milk and honey graham but were not impressed. Everything was a bit too sweet or salty. The sesame didn't have a lot of sesame taste; it just left a salty aftertaste. The price was also a little bit pricy. $4 for one scoop and $6 for two scoops (at least the tax is included).
author: Lina C.

description:
After always seeing long lines, there happened to be a short one and decided it was time to give Humphry's a go. It was good, I thought it was extremely creamy and not hard like most ice cream shops. I got the secret breakfast which has corn flakes in it. It was okay, not out of this world, perhaps another flavor would be better. They had a bunch of flavors with salt/pepper and after trying it, it didn't gel with me.

Again, I would still pick bi-rite over this, but when in the area, I wouldn't mind trying another flavor.
author: Bevi K.

description:
New ice cream shop at the Ferry Building, oh yes, yes indeed! I was at the Embarcadero when this little stand caught my eye; something was different, there was something there that wasn't there before! I yelped it and saw that Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream has officially replaced Ciao Bella, with this new, second location! Perfect for all of the tourists and frequent ferry building visitors :) The line was growing longer so the bf and I instinctively migrated to the end of it. We had to try this new delicious looking ice cream with the peculiar and exquisite sounding names.

THE ICE CREAM
-SUPER RICH AND CREAMY. Current prices: $4 for a small single scoop, $5 for two scoops, $6 for 3. 
-Pro tip: Go for the $5 double scoop and choose two flavors that balance each other out!
-I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: amazingly sharp coffee flavor, not sweet at all. Just plain and simple, rich coffee, paired with Cinnamon Brittle: superr rich and creamy! Tasted like sweet cream with a kapow of cinnamon afterwards. You definitely will want something to balance out this flavor (hence why I got the coffee). Together they were the perfect pair :)
-I also tasted the Butter by Moodlight: ice cream that tasted like heavenly butter with a little bit of blue berry, and McEvoy Olive Oil: had little bits and pings of citrus in it.
-My other friends got Oolong Tea and Secret Breakfast. I'll have to try those out next time. (They tell you what the secret ingredients are for Secret Breakfast ;)).

PROS
-Homemade, creamy, delicious ice cream - you can sample all of the different flavors!
-Lines can get long but they move pretty fast!
-Staff were friendly and welcoming to everyone! 

After I got my ice cream I photobombed my cousins and told them all to try this place the next time they visited the Ferry Building, he he he he... :)
author: Grace J.

description: Pricey but perfectly pleasing on a horribly hot day. While I can no longer partake of ice cream(the joys of being gallbladder-free), I have recently begun a love affair with sorbet. Today, the POG (Passionfruit, Orange, Guava) didn't disappoint. Fruity, melty goodness.  My daughter enjoyed her Tahitian Vanilla. It was a great pre-museum snack. Our cashier was cheerful but her counterpart was loudly complaining about what an awful day she was having as she mopped up the floor and then had a look of annoyance as she helped ring up our purchases. Despite that, we will definitely be back.
author: Julie C.

description: Really expensive tasty teeny tiny scoop of ice cream. Looks like some people got lucky based on their posted pictures. Not me :(. I got a literal golfball-sized scoop, about 1" in diameter. It was a year ago and it still bothers me. Thankfully, I just saw that Whole Foods is selling pints of their ice cream. Even if it's $20/pint, it will be a much better value than what I got at the Ferry Building.
author: Lisa W.

description:
They have a limited amount of ice cream- maybe eight flavors- but the flavors are not your normal chocolate and vanilla. Look somewhere else for that. One of my group mates had a "Secret Breakfast" ice cream, which was bourbon and corn flakes. I had the Tahitian Vanilla, which was close to plain vanilla. The other group mate got chocolate Cabernet ice cream. I tried the toast and jelly ice cream, which was gritty. It tasted like toast and jelly. 
The servers were very nice and this was a vey good ice cream place.
author: Olivia S.

description:
Dare I say best ice cream ever??

Ok well from what I've tasted, YES, this is #1 in my book. I've heard about this place for quite sometime, but my tastebuds have only recently discovered Humphry. Humphry Slocombe has a unique menu and is a nice change from the typical kind of ice cream flavors. Call me crazy, but I'm not a fan of their infamous secret breakfast flavor!! I've tried their salted caramel and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee, both of which are good. But what keeps me coming back is their Tahitian Vanilla flavor. I know, how basic could I be right?! There's something about Humphry's that is so different than the zillion of other ice cream places that make vanilla ice cream. It's the creamy texture and jam packed vanilla flavor. I usually take a pint of Tahitian Vanilla home with me and get a scoop of a different flavor to eat while I'm there. LOVE it. 

So Humphry may not have a TON of selections at a given time compared to other ice cream establishments but really, I come here for the QUALITY, not variety. But It's definitely worth a try here!
author: Cristina L.

description:
Fresh off the plane from good 'ol Toronto, we head straight to the most touristy place I can think of:the ferry marketplace. 

I spotted thine lineup and mentally bookmarked it. Came back around 4:45 and the line was more reasonable, so went and tried the Secret Breakfast and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Oh my god... I don't know what I was expecting but I wasn't expecting that! So yummy! A burst of flavor. It says it's Bourbon and cornflakes but the mix ends up being more like Bourbon toffee with toffee bits and crunchy-bits. The coffee tastes straight out of your local viet restaurant, strong and sweet. 

I don't even have a picture to share because we gobbled it down too fast....
author: Angel L.

description:
We were walking along the ferry building looking for dessert after our lunch when we stumbled across this place. There was a long lineup, so we figured it has to be good.

After looking at the menu, we agreed the ice cream selections are certainly unique (Vietnamese coffee? Beer? Olive oil? Whoa). At the end we ordered the oolong tea ice cream.

I have to agree with the reviews here, the taste is very unique, yet still delicious! It didn't taste exactly like oolong tea, but there was definitely that tea taste, which was surprising in itself (aside from green tea, that's too common). There also didn't seem to be a heavy amount of sugar, so that was also a benefit.

I loved the ferry building in terms of food variety, and with this dessert place you can enjoy lunch at your favourite place, then stop by here for some sweets!
author: Calvin S.

description:
Though I don't find the ice cream consistent to be super special, they keep such delicious and uncommon flavors on hand all the time, I can't help but come back. Heads up: the flavors can be intense! 

So far my favorites are: blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, Matcha Snickerdoodle, Peanut Butter Curry and Oolong Tea. 

The breakfast special is too strongly alcoholic in flavor for my taste. Take advantage of those free samples to find your faves ;)
author: Angela K.

description:
This ice cream will haunt me when I return to LA.
I tried Secret Breakfast, Black Sesame and Harvey Milk & Graham. 
I ended up getting a scoop of HM&G  with Bourbon Caramel.

Words can NOT  describe how GOOD  this is.
My husband even remarked on how good it was and he had more than I was willing to share =P 

Will definitely come back when I'm in SF. 

Cheers!
author: Jam B.

description:
Secret breakfast actually lives up to the hype.  Bourbon ice cream and cereal clusters go so well together.  They seriously need to go large scale and look into mass distribution with this flavor so I can buy a tub of it when I'm not in San Francisco.  

The location is pretty convenient, but it is on the pricier side for $4/scoop, but I can justify it since I don't eat ice cream everyday.
author: Debra C.

description:
First time trying this, it was delicious and I was not surprised. I work at an ice cream shop myself but can't help it when I come across other ice cream shops (especially quality ones with unique flavors). I've always passed by and wanted to try it. Yesterday, I tried olive oil and harvey milk & honey graham. I went for a double scoop of harvey milk & honey graham and carrot mango sorbet. I liked their olive oil, I just like bi-rite's version better. It was expensive at $6 for a double ($4 for single) but I will almost always splurge on quality ice cream. 

Harvey milk & honey graham was super creamy and rich w/big, crumbly graham pieces and the carrot mango sorbet was thick and refreshing. You're able to really taste both elements of carrot and mango.

YUMYUMYUMMA. 5 stars.
author: Emily M.

description:
I must say, after hearing a lot about this place and their out-of-the-world unique ice cream flavors, I was a tad disappointed when I actually got to it. Their claim to fame is a list of flavors that you've probably never heard of before - for example, schezwan strawberry, chocolate with sea salt, candy cane etc., and they had a HUGE line of people. I don't know if it was because it is that popular, or because other people (like us) saw the line and thought it must be really great, and lined up as well.

So, given that they have strange flavors, it's only natural that you want to taste them before you make up your mind, right? But that's a difficult proposition when so many people are lining up behind you, and the server is getting slowly frustrated that you aren't being able to make up your mind - and I only had three!
Finally I decided to go with Tahitian vanilla and chocolate with sea salt. I wish someone had told me about the secret breakfast flavor, because the ones that I tasted and bought, were not really that great.

I'd have given 2 stars, but it's one extra for the whacky flavors :)
author: Anujit C.

description:
Yummy ice cream, we tried the peanut butter fudge, smoke almond brittle , malted chocolate and blue bottle vietnamese coffee.  Enjoyed all of it!

Ate it so fast.  The line was long but moved quickly on a warm day.
author: rugbarn d.

description:
My first trip back to the Ferry Building.  Having eaten lunch at Hog Island, I didn't really have room for ice cream, but as Catherine says, "there's always room for ice cream."

Had Secret Breakfast (love it) and got really lucky.  Had the Malted Dulce de Leche.  Divine.  I had to talk a friend into trying the Ancho Chocolate.  She said it was the best chocolate she ever had.
author: TennisBum P.

description: Finally got to try the ice cream here-the line is always so long! Tried two flavors: jam toast and jalapeño corn bread. Pro: the ice cream was definitely delicious, creamy, unique. Con: the flavors really didn't reflect the name. Overall, I enjoyed the ice cream but wasn't really impressed with the unique flavors.
author: Susan G.

description: Another let down for new year.  Grainy and very sweet not even creamy.  Our first n last visit for 2016. 0-STAR .
author: Manu3l L.

description: Who doesn't love coffee and ice cream? My favorite is the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee I love it! Single scoop is just the perfect amount for $4.25 including tax
author: Rita A.

description:
Got the secret breakfast and it was good. Like 8/10 good. My friend got the oolong tea which was good as well but like the other reviews said...the ice cream is too soft. I'd prefer it to be more like ice cream than soup as well and would say that this place is over rated.

I might come back after a Giants game but for the price and the consistency of the ice cream...ehh...
author: Joshua F.

description: Gotta love Humphry Slocombe! I've been a long time fan of the Mission location, and their flavors know no bounds. Their ice cream is really delicious and the flavors just explode in your mouth! I was happy to see they opened a location in the Ferry Building. Waves of customers at this location, given the high density crowds. Service is really quick, despite all the people. The ice cream is just as good as their original location. I'm a happy customer!
author: Kevin J.

description: Very interesting ice cream flavors. I sampled almost all the flavors and the workers were very patient with me. I decided on getting strawberry crumble and secret breakfast. This place is great but I can't give it five stars because the ice cream was way too thick and creamy for my liking. It was more like a thick frozen milk shake than ice cream but if that's your style then this place is perfect! I'm down to come back and try the flavors again but I wouldn't come on a hot day looking for some leisure ice cream, this place is definitely just for taste.
author: Kimmy L.

description:
This is phenomenal. Like seriously delicious ice cream.
If you can get over the long line and the prices then you're in for a treat. I have yet to try all the flavors but the ones I have tried were all amazing.
author: Mel P.

description:
Highlights
- I love this addition inside the Ferry building. It makes it way more accessible to me than the Mission district location, which could be pretty dangerous! :)
- So many unique flavors to sample and scoops to get. 
- When in doubt, choose the Earl grey tea and Vietnamese coffee flavors. GET it and you won't regret it! These are staple flavors that will never fail to fulfill your ice cream cravings. 
- Matcha doodle was a new one that I went with recently, since they didn't have earl grey. Snicker doodle bits blended into green tea flavored ice cream. Not as great as my favs, but it hit the spot. 

Improvements
- Is there ever a time that this place does not have a line? Maybe the day you win the lottery, but with all the tourists and such a prime spot, be prepared to wait for your turn to sample and pay. 
- They offer very cool experimental flavors that you've probably never seen before, but I haven't been impressed by any so far. The one that stuck out the most was their new mushroom flavored ice cream (forgot the name?), but it left an aftertaste that I won't forget. 
- Secret Breakfast: I don't get the hype. No doubt it's surprisingly refreshing, but the bourbon flavor was just too strong for my taste.

Tips
- Parking sucks unless you come after 6PM and find a metered spot around the vicinity. 
- Take public transportation and walk here so that you can thoroughly enjoy your ice cream and not worry about the wait.
author: Tracy T.

description: I actually liked this place more than Bi-Rite. Get the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham if it's on the day's menu.
author: Vince S.

description:
OM NOM NOM.  Why have I walked by this place so many times and not gotten ice cream!?!?

Blasphemy.  

I am so glad that my husband was magnetically drawn to a sign that read "Bourbon Shake" (which was delicious btw) since I then decided that I should also sample some flavors.  The sampling led to an inevitable purchasing of a scoop.  The sea salt chocolate and the brown butter were absolutely spectacular.  

Highly recommend coming here if you are craving a delicious and absolutely unique scoop of ice cream!
author: Alyx F.

description: Had to stop after I saw Special Breakfast was ranked in the Top 5 Best Ice Creams by Food Network. While all their flavored looked awesome I had to go with SB. It was creamy, sweet by not too sweet, and had great texture from the cornflake cookie crumbles in it. If you're in San Francisco it's a must try!
author: Becky N.

description: I think I have experienced the best ice cream.  HUMPHREY SLOCUM'S.  I ordered the Tahitian Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream.  That creamy texture with a kick of the coffee flavor.  Excellent.  It is not too sweet but sweet enough to satisfy.  If your in SF, you must try this,  SON.  #YOURWELCOME
author: Chris P.

description:
Excellent ice cream slightly diminished by their customers.

Unique flavors well executed, just like the original location.

Tourists have discovered it, but that's not the end of the world.

Looks like 2 scoops is the best buy, but don't forget to sample everything new!
author: Patrick S.

description:
I shared a Bourbon coke float with one other person and it was definitely interesting! Yay bourbon.

The Bourbon coke float included:
-two scoops of Secret Breakfast ice cream
-Bourbon caramel
-Classic coca-cola

The coke was a little overwhelming but the bourbon caramel was a nice touch and very good. I'm a bit disappointed though because the coke float made it difficult to taste the actual Secret Breakfast ice cream everyone has been raving about on yelp. Secret Breakfast is bourbon ice cream + corn flakes, but in the coke float it just seemed like vanilla to me. The corn flakes, however, were surprisingly still crunchy and I loved it! Having corn flakes mixed in was a great addition.

So it was a good midday dessert and I love that this place is different, but I don't think I would order the coke float again because I want to actually taste and enjoy the ice cream next time.
author: Kelly T.

description: I had a bourbon coke float and it is delicious!!! Two scoops of secret breakfast, coke, and bourbon caramel.
author: claudia y.

description:
Really yummy ice cream that is worth the stomach pains since I'm lactose intolerant! Located in the ferry building and across from blue bottle.

This place reminded me a little of Ici's which is located in Berkeley. The flavors are not going to be your average chocolate or vanilla. I sampled the secret breakfast, blur bottle vietnamese coffee, and matcha doodle. I absolutely lived the secret breakfast which has bourbon and cornflake clusters in it. It was so perfect. I wanna say the base tasted almost like a mixture of toffee and butterscotch. I got a scoop ($4) of the secret breakfast on a cone. Too bad I couldn't savor it because it .melted pretty fast.

Anyone who is a coffee lover should try the blue bottle coffee flavor. It was pretty strong but not too overpowering. I would've got that one if they ran out of secret breakfast. The matcha was just your standard matcha flavor ice cream, nothing special.

Must try if you're in the area and craving something sweet :)
author: Fiona Y.

description:
The ice cream was tasty but I was a bit underwhelmed with the service- which surprised me since how much of a transaction is it really to buy ice cream? 

1) Signs were not updated on the wall and the board they had next to people waiting in line, so the 3 flavors we wanted were out. 
2) I asked for a sample and had barely finished letting my boyfriend try it too when she snapped "Are you going to buy something too or just get samples?"
3) I asked for a split scoop of two flavors and received only one. 

Wanted to like this place more because of the reviews and my deep love of exotic ice cream flavors, maybe whoever was working there was having a bad day.
author: K N.

description:
I remember trying this yeeeears ago when I wasn't much a fan of ice cream. Yeh, who does that! Years later, the today me wishes she didn't love ice cream so much....

This time around, I got the black sesame, one scoop, $4, on a pretty & delicious waffle cone! It was pretty damn good. Not one of those flavors I will dream about though. I will be back soon to try their famous Secret Breakfast. That sounds like my thing.. ;)
author: Lisa K.

description:
Excellent!

This place is fast becoming my 'well done for getting through the work week' treat stop!  So good, and they definitely take pride in their product. 

Yes it's expensive but I'm happy to pay $4 for a single scoop knowing that I'm helping to maintain a local business, employing local people. 

Best flavors: Matchadoodle, Harvey Milk & Graham, Olive Oil, and Secret Breakfast. 

They have Maldon Sea Salt which is amazing and nice to have a little sprinkled over my chocolate ice cream.
author: Nina N.

description:
Had a scoop the usual go-to, Secret Breakfast, because it was 3 PM on a Friday and a taste of bourbon is just what we all need.

But my favorite was the Cinnamon Brittle.  The ice cream itself was like a creamy snickerdoodle, and the brittle bits had a slightly spicy bite.  Absolutely perfect, even if half of it melted all over my hands as I was eating it.

The only flavor that I wasn't totally in love with was the Harvey Milk and Honey, but it'd be good for those looking for a more classic taste.

Longish line, but it moved fairly quickly.  Guy behind the counter was awesome and quick; encouraged me to try more and more flavors until I had pretty much sampled them all.
author: Lincoln L.

description: AMAZING! Although it's a bit pricey for the small portions you get, it is still worth it! Sometimes the long gets long, but I went midday during the week so there was almost no line at all. The Vietnamese Coffee...was so good I wish I could go back and get another one. They have a lot funky flavours if that's your thing. I tried a lot of them but still settled on the coffee. It's also right across from Blue Bottle Coffee, which is a perfect pairing with your ice cream.
author: Susie C.

description:
It really is as good as it gets.  Their flavors are unique and change constantly.  They do allow you a few sample tastes.  But I always end up with Secret Breakfast anyways (Bourbon + Cornflakes). 

The warmer the weather, the longer the line.  I'm glad they've got this outlet near the FiDi.  It makes for a perfect afternoon break.
author: Marc E.

description: I feel bad I made my group walk from Pier 39 to here for ice cream but it was worth it! I got a scoop of Secret Breakfast and it was so creamy, loved it! I stood in line for a while, but it moved fast. Now if I could get someone to take me back!! ;)
author: Meryl C.

description: Excellent ice cream and extremely generous portions. The scoops are huge. Even the tasting spoons are huge. The flavors are original and inventive. I loved the black sesame, and the toast and jam was one of the best and most unique flavors I've ever had. The ice cream is very high quality, super rich and creamy. I've had a lot of good ice cream and really it's hard to be better than this. Hope to be back soon!
author: Erin Y.

description: Good ice ceam, a bit too sweet for me.  We were wandering about the Ferry Building and I wanted ice cream.  We got 2 scoops $6, in a cup - Ancho Chocolate (with chili) and Harvey Milk Graham Cracker.  I thought the chocolate tasted better than the HM graham cracker. When there is too much sugar in the ice cream, you can't taste the ice cream flavor as well and the HM graham cracker was way sweeter than the Ancho chocolate.
author: Ry T.

description:
The problem when you build up a place in your head is that you're setting yourself up for disappointment. That's the risk I took when I decided to come here. Humphry Slocombe's Secret Breakfast ice-cream has been listed in many of the San Francisco must-eats posts floating around on the inter webs. And I had to try it.

But I was far from disappointed. The flavor is like a secret breakfast: crunchy in places, there was definitely some cookie and cake in there, and other bits of heaven. And, of course, there was bourbon. The ice-cream itself was creamy, smooth, and rich.

It was so good that I decided to come back and get the Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee ice-cream too. Now, I am not a big fan of coffee, but this was exceptional. I liked it even more than the secret breakfast.

Expect long lines, but they move fast. And the staff's super friendly: they let you try the different flavors and don't really rush you.

Amazing place.
author: Avadhut P.

description:
Secret Breakfast Bourbon and Cornflakes (6/5 NOMs)

First day and first dessert to uncover secrets of ice cream from the world famous Humphry Slocombe in Pier 1 Ferry Building, San Francisco. We just couldn't pass up trying something as weird as Secret Breakfast Bourbon and Cornflakes flavor. Now thats a mouthful, both in name and flavor. First spoon taste and suddenly the world just disappears and all is left is you and this luscious ice cream. Yea we used a fancy word like that to describe it! Made me so sad when it was gone that really thought about order more or maybe a bucket to go. I could just eat it for every meal. Nah lets just replace all our meals with it. Its so sweet and refreshing made for a perfect dessert to enjoy outside while looking at the bay. No wonder this place came so highly recommended and was featured in GQ, Wired, O Magazine and so many more. This made for a great first dessert of our trip. Humphry Slocombe set the bar is so high now that anything after might just not be awesome enough.
author: Boris S.

description:
When we first got to the Ferry Building we came across Humphry Slocombe. There was no line but we were craving ice cream so we decided to give it a try. 

We got three scoops for $7.00. They let you have tasters, my husband tried Salt and Pepper flavor but he did not like it. They had some interesting flavors!! 

We ended up with a scoop of Vietnamese Coffee, Black sesame, and Peanut Butter crunch. The Viet coffee ice cream and black sesame was real good. Peanut butter crunch was just ok. There were about three guys working and they were all really nice. 

We had lunch at Hog Island and then when we left we saw Humphry Slocombe had a huge line! Seems pretty popular.
author: Tammy N.

description:
One person ordered the Secret Breakfast and loved it. I thought it was icy and not smooth.

I ordered the blackberry crisp and the person serving didn't know what the "crisp" was, he thought it might be graham cracker.

Shouldn't the staff serving you know what is in the ice cream?  

It for sure was not a graham cracker, it was a broken up cookie,

I will definitely go back, I loved the rich flavor.
author: Foodlover B.

description: Secret Breakfast is my favorite flavor here. I love walking over and grabbing a cone in a cup and enjoying the view of the bay afterward.
author: Bon N.

description:
Same amazingness in a wonderful downtown location!

I kid you not- I'm obsessed with ice cream. Not only going to all the stores selling ice cream, I make ice cream myself with random flavors and technique. I can tell the diff between Philly, French and gelato from one taste. 

So yes... Humprey. What isn't there to love? Such imaginative, super awesome flavors. Using every part of a pumpkin in an ice cream? Bring it on. What about lavender? Why not. Chili lime is a sorbet, not what you find served with Pad Thai. 

Alas, my faves are salt & sweet combos, and of course the classic secret breakfast. 

I now live close to the Harrison St store, and work near Ferry building. So help me, Lord.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Staff is super friendly!

They have very interesting flavors of ice cream. I haven't been disappointed by any of the flavors.

I have tried secret breakfast, blue bottle viet coffee (must try!), and oolong tea!
author: Jessica H.

description: I'd heard so much hype about the Secret Breakfast, but was not impressed when I tried it. Not to mention the server seemed absolutely disinterested in serving us or letting us try flavors - we only tried 1 flavor each for 2 of us. Everything was done with a scowl and without a word of greeting. We ended up trying the Malted Milk Chocolate and the Blue Bottle Coffee. The Coffee ice cream wasn't fantastic, and the Chocolate was pretty good to begin with, milky, creamy, smooth, but started getting too cloyingly sweet midway through. We didn't finish our cones.
author: Casatrina L.

description: Best vanilla ice cream in town!  Perfect amount of cream, sugar, and you can bite onto the vanilla and not just see it.
author: Connie W.

description: For the quality, serving size, and wait, this was pretty average. Add the exorbitant price ($6.50 for two tiny scoops), and I most likely won't return. I love ice cream, and have had ice cream all over the world. I think this could be much better. If the portion sizes increase or prices drop, I would reconsider.
author: Djenab C.

description: Ice cream was delicious & has new & trendy flavors - good ice cream is always a crowd-pleaser & the locations are well-placed.  Unfortunately, the service was abysmal; 2 young girls who clearly didn't want to be there & couldn't handle the stress of the long summer line in the Ferry Building.  The girl who served me was downright rude, displaying obvious irritation when I asked for adjustments to an order she never even asked for specifics about.  Maybe the owners don't care about the service they provide in a high-traffic place that is sure to get business no matter how they act. Also, $3.50 a scoop seems a little much, no matter how good it is.  Sadly, another good novelty idea that fails to impress in SF.
author: Karyn E.

description: Got 3 scoops ($7.50). I enjoyed Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee & Toast and Jam. Secret Breakfast was alright, but I liked the other 2 more.
author: Jackie M.

description:
I'm so glad Humphry (we're on a first name basis, you know) is in San Francisco. Otherwise, I would gladly neglect all my other friends to spend all my time with Humph. I've not tasted a single flavor I didn't like. I don't play favorites. So far, I've liked them all equally. Well, with a slight leaning toward their chocolates and to be perfectly honest, candy capp was my least favorite. 

candy capp - meh
Guinness gingerbread - delicious
FlufferNutter - good
milk chocolate passion fruit - OK, a safe bet for the uninitiated
Thai chili lime - refreshingly adventurous
secret breakfast - deliciously strong bourbon flavor, cornflakes were chewy, wish they were crunchier

$4 for single scoop, $6 for a double
author: Cece E.

description:
I don't know. I thought the ice cream was good but to me this place wasn't my favorite.
I had the secret breakfast and the honey gram one and their were both good and very rich. But they weren't mind blowing.
author: Cecilia B.

description: Humphrey Slocombe was at the 2016 Eat Real Festival offering an array of ice cream flavors. I ordered the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and it did not disappoint. It was so good that I would have enjoyed a second scoop, but with other vendors still to try I couldn't.
author: D B.

description: Yummmm one of a kind flavors tried the chocolate malted and Vietnamese coffee on a cone and it was fabulous!!!!! Even on a cold day lol
author: Steph S.

description: There was a long line at this place, waited about 20mins. Had coffee flavor ice cream, felt like we gulped it in about a min. Tried this place on friends recommendation, worth the wait, Yummy! Must eat!
author: Anil L.

description: OMg the milk and honey graham ice cream is da jam. I ordered it two days in a row. You can taste the cooked milk and it's so light and airy. Also really enjoyed the Vietnamese coffee ice cream, it's strong and very well flavored. Great texture. Will be back. Two thumbs way up.
author: Nilo K.

description: The menu is unique and flavorful. A bit pricey, but worth it for the quality. Yesterday I had a bourbon Coke float -- two scoops of Secret Breakfast ice cream, Coca-Cola, and bourbon caramel syrup. Just the ticket after a hot afternoon of walking along the waterfront.
author: P S.

description:
They know how to make ice cream here. All those flavors. So hard to decide. But no worries, they're friendly and don't limit your tastings. 

They have some really interesting flavors and change it up from time to time. To be honest, some are a hit or miss. Just order something you like and it'll make your day.
author: Katrina L.

description: Yummy ice cream, with a dash of yummy and topped with yummy! My favorites are their Blue bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream and the Secret Breakfast. They don't have a huge variety of flavors but whatever they have they do really well. I usually make sure to take all our SF visitors here. Will keep going there again and again :)
author: Bhavya K.

description:
"Wow, you seem really excited to see me."

I was about to retort something feisty had I not looked up in time and saw the amusement in the Humphry Slocombe guy's eyes. He did have a point. I was, in fact, skipping merrily towards him. And I was, in fact, wearing a grin from ear to ear. I can't help it! The sight of ice cream is more than enough for me to abandon dignity. The sight of Humphry Slocombe, of which I have heard great things about, in the farmer's market (Tuesdays and Saturdays) really made me ecstatic. Fine, Humphry guy, I'll be nice.

Today's samplings were: bourbon breakfast, chocolate with smoked sea salt, and fluffernutter. I got a scoop ($3, $5 for 1/2 pint), and when my indecision was evident, the guy was nice enough to give me a little bit of everything (so glad I didn't sass him!). 

The bourbon breakfast was my least favorite of the lot, but this is only the case because I still have to rank my favorites! It was still really very good. It was a different flavor that still delivered happiness to my mouth. The fluffernutter was peanut buttery without being overly so, and the chocolate was not too sweet and perfectly set off by the sea salt. The two flavors mixed together is the stuff dreams are made of. It was just truly fantastic -- especially in the middle of the frenetic energy of the farmers' market and with the Bay Bridge within view.

So yes, Mr. Humphry guy, I was indeed really excited to see you. You and I may, in fact, become best friends, so get used to it.
author: Clarice O.

description: So many flavors, not enough stomachs! While vacationing in SF, went here twice. First time got tres leches cinnamon and vanilla, second time got Secret Breakfast. Completely satisfied both times! I need to find a reasonable facsimile near my hometown! Free samples of any (and all) flavor(s) you want, so great way to be sure you are pleased with your order. Everyone in our group (both times) was completely satisfied with what they ordered. Can't wait to find an excuse to come back!
author: Maryanne L.

description: Yummy, creamy goodness in a cone...and the line cuts down super fast! They always have the most unique flavors/flavor combos available. Ive had matcha doodle and candied ginger and neither had too overpowering of a certain flavor, but they still stood out. The people there are always so friendly. I wish they had more locations!
author: Nessa R.

description: SO good but so expensive (hence 4 instead of 5 stars). Really yummy and unique flavors. Like everyone else says, the secret breakfast is awesome!
author: Stephanie D.

description: A decadent array of flavours. Some really interesting ones which can surprise your tongue. It's nice and creamy. Takes the heat off (though it's always windy by the piers). The long wait for the ice cream is kind of worth it to try out the funky flavours available.
author: Han Teng W.

description: I am easily impressed by all things dessert. It's nearly impossible to make a sweet I don't like. I devoured a tres leches milkshake (consistency of a sundae) with their signature caramel sauce and the cherries. I'm writing this review two weeks after my and my husband's bay area visit so forgive my lack of recall for the specific names of the condiments. The service was adequate but it's hard to shake the feeling that the waif-thin hipster staff isn't judging you even as they serve up your ice cream. I accidentally tossed a sample spoon into the tip jar that the girl behind the counter literally plopped in front of my face as I was paying. I apologized and tried to take it out but she just held up her hands, smirked and pulled it out. The whole experience was cringe worthy lol but the ice cream was out of the park.
author: Waffle I.

description: It's ice cream, who can give anything less than 5 stars for ice cream? We've tried the Tahitian Vanilla and Vietnamese Coffee ice cream, both flavorful and very tasty. A little pricey but you're paying for quality.
author: Hung L.

description:
Whoa this was some tasty ice cream.

Even though I hadn't even eaten lunch yet, I stopped by Humphry Slocombe to grab a scoop of their famous ice cream. There was no line (awesome!) so I tried a couple flavors to help me decide what to get. I couldn't decide on just one flavor, so I ordered a scoop of Secret Breakfast and a scoop of the Vietnamese Coffee. $6 seemed like a lot for two scoops but these were MASSIVE portions... I freaked out a bit when the lady placed the ice cream in front of me... but it was too late to go back.

So I wandered around outside the ferry building eating my enormous serving of ice cream a little after 11 AM ;) Yes I got some weird looks. But I didn't care because the ice cream was DELICIOUS! I enjoyed the Vietnamese coffee a tad more than the secret breakfast, but both were very tasty. The coffee flavor isn't overpowering, it's just right. You can definitely taste the alcohol (bourbon?) in the secret breakfast, and I enjoyed the cornflakes that were dispersed throughout. 

I'd be back here in a heartbeat but I have to give my body a chance to recover from lactose overload. I wish you could order two flavors for the price of one scoop!
author: Sam F.

description: Jasmine lychee flavored ice cream is my favorite! So delicious and different from regular ice cream.
author: Mandy Z.

description:
