Secret breakfast is my favorite ice cream flavor. Ever. I always come here excited and leave here happy.

5 stars no doubt, and even overlooking the cashiers/workers that always look like they got a stick up their crack...SMILE kids youre working with the best ice cream in the world!

The lines can get long, but the time can be best spent laughing at the poor suckers buying blue bottle coffee. Who the hell spends that much for a cup of coffee anyway?
author: Justin L.

description:
Man...why are all the good ice cream places in SF...
I was getting blue bottle and spotted this next door. I was curious as to what flavors they had and when I saw Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and cornflakes) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, I was sold!!
I was a little skeptical of Secret Breakfast at first..sounded so weird and unappetizing but I was so curious that I had to try it! It was seriously wayyy better than I expected!! Great flavors combined together, I can't even describe it..you just gotta try it!
I also tried Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit. The chocolate kinda overpowered the passion fruit a little too much but nevertheless it was still super creamy and yummy.
They don't allow half-half's for one scoop so I had to get two scoops because I really couldn't decide on one flavor!!
Seriously, this place is worth stopping by. They give you huge scoops: 1scoop($4), 2 scoops($6) and the ice cream is super creamy and unique!!
author: Heidi L.

description: I got the two scoop: secret breakfast and matcha doodle. Both flavors tasted wonderful. The secret breakfast does taste exactly like how you think it would ice cream with a hint of bourbon ! the match doodle was really good too except I couldn't taste the snicker doodle. The price is a little steep but definitely worth trying. The location is great since its in the ferry market you get to see so many other stores as well
author: Nhung N.

description:
After running the San Francisco marathon, decided to reward my girlfriend and I an ice cream cone.  We spot this location as we were checking out the Ferry Building.  She got the Basil Lemon and I got the Bourbon and Corn Flakes Ice cream.  

Basil Lemon ice cream is actually more of a sorbet.  It is very refreshing and delicious.  I thought at first it was going to have that sweetness that concentrate lemonade has like Minute Maid products.  The sorbet tasted like fresh lemons.  

The Bourbon and Corn Flakes ice cream is a house special that they have.  The ice cream has this rich cream taste that compliments that actual bits for corn flakes in the ice cream.  Total blast of breakfast flavor in your mouth.  Highly recommend to try it if it's your first time.  Recommended by employees here.

The place's ice cream taste really fresh.  If you don't eat the ice cream quickly, it will start to melt fast.  Thats how fresh it is here. Proof of that is my lovely girlfriend trying to take a picture of it ( that she manage to accomplish) but at the cost of the scoop of sorbet falling off the cone to the ground.  It was something out of a movie.  Couldn't help to laugh but offered to get her a new scoop.  Sadly she refused lol.

PS. she loved it here too, even if she didn't finish her cone.
author: Rafael D.

description:
Even though I'm not usually an ice cream person, this place was really good. And the flavors are fun (try as many as you can)! I shared the Secret Breakfast + Salted Caramel w/ Cocoa Nibs. The Secret Breakfast was bourbon and cornflakes, which other Yelpers recommended so I got it. Next time I'd try a different flavor, but this one certainly was a tasty experience.

The Salted Caramel was the absolute star - it was creamy and surprisingly airy! It was light, kind of like it was whipped. The flavorings were just right. I usually find ice cream too sweet and salted caramel flavors too salty, but this one was perfect. 

And the two of these flavors mixed very well, so I would absolutely recommend it. I would definitely come here again to try some of the other flavors. 

This location is very busy because it's in the market, so there isn't anywhere to sit inside. But it's great to take the ice cream out to the benches/tables out on the pier overlooking the water (there are plenty of seats there).
author: Cissy C.

description: Great ice cream. I had their secret breakfast. It was a sweet vanilla with some sort of malt crumbs. Think of cookies and cream but instead of cookies it is malt (I love malt). One thing though, their ice cream is more on the sweet/heavy side. I had it on an empty stomach so it felt a tiny bit overwhelming for me. I still enjoyed it though. I can imagine it being amazing if I have it after a savoury meal!
author: Andy A.

description: What's not to like about this place? The usual long line outside is testament to how good it is - it certainly seems that I'm not the only one willing to wait in a long line for this ice cream. And this probably won't be the last time that I eat ice cream for dinner lol. The flavours are amazing. The latest one I tried was pear-something. I think they have a set of flavours that they change regularly, but they also have their ol' faithfuls, like Blue Bottle which is a nice go-to if you're not feeling super adventurous today.
author: Bianca C.

description:
VERDICT: Very tasty flavors, which I think varies from store to store. I would still like to try others.

QUALIFIER: We really didn't intend on coming here, but the building is so busy on a Saturday, with the farmer's market going on, that this place looked quite empty in comparison...

FOOD: The secret breakfast is what they're known for. It's pretty tasty with a striking bourbon flavor. My second favorite is the Vietnamese coffee, which was right on the spot for ice-cream, but I might prefer the taste of the actual coffee.

SERVICE: Very helpful and generous with the tasting spoons. This is not their main location, but it's set right across from Blue Bottle, so some people just swing on by for ice-cream to wait out the long lines at Blue Bottle.
author: Harry T.

description:
Two words. Secret Breakfast.

I'm on the quest for the best ice cream in SF, and this is up there with Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous. I really like the crisp and clean simple flavors of Mr and Mrs (earl grey and mascarpone yummm) but HS has some fun and complex flavors! (They are both good! Don't wait in line at BiRite - go to mr and mrs or to HS!)

Had a taste of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee which was also delicious.
author: Food E.

description:
I came here a few weeks ago and had a little more room for Humphrey Slocombe's raved ice cream. We had previously eaten at Hog Island Oyster and felt like a cold treat since it was really hot outside and there was the crowded farmer's market happening.

We arrived at 12:20 PM and there was a relatively small line that made us wait about 5 minutes and gave us some time to decide on what we wanted. When we got to the front, we sampled some flavors and finally decided.

Here's what we got:

For all 3 flavors, it was $7.50.

CHOCOLATE SMOKED SEA SALT: This was okay but nothing spectacular and was probably my least favorite. After all for me, chocolate ice cream is chocolate ice cream. However, the thing that makes this version stand out is that the sea salt makes the chocolate ice cream more interesting while it doesn't overwhelm it. The texture of the ice cream is really nice because it's creamy but it was noticeably melting after a few minutes which is the mark of fresh ice cream. My only gripe was that the ice cream was too sweet for me.  They were pretty generous for this flavor.

HARVEY MILK & HONEY GRAHAM: My favorite of the three flavors. It was a delicious milk ice cream with infused honey. I enjoyed this one more than the Three Twins one because it had graham crumble in it. The texture of the ice cream is once again super creamy but it didn't melt for us since this flavor was everyone's favorite and we finished it so quickly. My only gripe once again was that it was a tad too sweet for my liking but still nonetheless the combination was brilliant. They were pretty generous with the portion size.

BLUE BOTTLE VIETNAMESE COFFEE: This was good but nothing that made this coffee flavor stand out from the other versions at other places. My favorite is still the Ciao Bella version because that one I can really taste the coffee flavor while this one it's much more subtle. Once again it was a tad too sweet for my liking and it did melt pretty quickly. They were very generous with the portion, however.

BUTTER BY MOODLIGHT (SAMPLED): This is basically brown butter ice cream with blueberry swirl. I actually liked this because I really like blueberry ice creamy and the pairing of brown butter and blueberry swirl was really innovative and interesting. I would've ordered it but it was once again way too sweet for my liking. 

OTHER FLAVORS WE SAW WERE:
-Secret Breakfast
-Tahitian Vanilla
-Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip
-Oolong Tea
-Cinnamon Brittle
-Lemon Ginger Sorbet
-POG Sorbet
-Beach Blanket Babylon Banana

SERVICE: They were really nice and patient with us since we each sampled a  flavor. They also explained their whimsical flavors one-by-one and never rushed us. There was a huge line after us and a little one before us yet they still didn't seem too bothered and they weren't stressed out. They were happy with what they were doing and I'm happy for them too. 

DECOR: The place is pretty cute and is easy to recognize with their easy to read sign and their 2 cow heads logo. The place really feels like an ice cream parlor and they use the walls to put their menu on. They also have shelves filled with other goodies and purchasable items. The only downfall is that there is no place to really sit and enjoy the ice cream.

Will I return? Yes, I would but the only thing that keeps me from going back is that depending on the time of the day they do get pretty filled. Also, the flavors are a bit too sweet for my taste. Other than that, with their innovative, creative, and very delicious fresh ice cream, I would probably come here each time I'm in the area.
author: Jacquie H.

description: The Secret Breakfast keeps me coming back. They're generous with the bourbon and yet it's still balanced nicely with the cream taste and a light corn flake crunch that goes together better than it sounds. Well worth the stop. Could be a little creamier and colder (it melted too fast).
author: Steven L.

description:
Came here on Saturday. Waited in line for about 15 minutes, all the while knowing our parking meter had run out and we were risking a possible ticket. Nonetheless, it was all worth it!

I ended up getting 2 scoops of the Vietnamese coffee flavor and it was awesome! I'd come here again in a heart beat!

FYI: No parking ticket!!!!
author: Reena P.

description:
Ambiance:  Small, take-out only spot in the ferry plaza.  
Service:  Super friendly ice cream servers, free samples are offered.

Ice Cream:  Some adventurous flavors that I usually pass on.  Last time I got salted caramel and it was delicious.  The ice cream is sooooooo creamy.  Wife got sorbet and thought it was so-so, but isn't sorbet always just so-so?
author: Kyle E.

description: DELICIOUS. Don't skip this one, and definitely grab a waffle cone while you're at it. Thank me later!
author: Audrey H.

description: Just discovered this by chance.  This is absolutely the best ice cream I have ever had in my entire life.  There is no room to sit.  The wait was reasonable.  The people are really nice.  The "Secret Breakfast" ice cream is so amazing.  I'm sure everything has 5,000 calories per gram and whatnot, but it's worth the extra days of fasting or extra miles jogging or whatever.
author: Charles B.

description: Secret Breakfast!!! Sometimes I've had a hard day, or week, or month, and I think to myself - I need a drink!! However, I'd much rather have ice cream. That's not weird, right?! Thus, Humphrey Slocombe created this heavenly combination especially for me! Ok, not really. Breakfast, lunch and dinner is the perfect time for boozy ice cream. Or is that just me??! Creamy bourbon vanilla ice cream with a cornflake crunch for the win! Super tasty, especially on an ice cream cone! If you feel like having a caffeinated morning instead, Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream and oolong ice cream are totes to die for! Super delicious ice cream made with locally sourced ingredients and creative flavors!! Definitely stop by for a legendary scoop if you're anywhere near the Ferry Building Marketplace!! This ice cream is legit.
author: Liv K.

description: I had the secret breakfast (bourbon with cornflakes) and it was delicious, but recommend getting it in a cup, not a cone. I'm not big into sweets, and really enjoyed it! The GF had fluffernutter (peanut butter with marshmallow fluff) and  we both thought it was great! She probably enjoyed it a bit more because she has a major sweet tooth, but all in all this place is amazing - definitely worth a visit!!
author: RickyNshaena H.

description: Overpriced ice cream that is only popular because some food network people like it. Listen, I love ice cream, but I think that other types of desserts are worth a shot because there are no places in Marin that have those certain desserts. And, because we were in San Francisco at The Slanted Door, my sister insisted that we go to Humphry Slocombe. I went here before, and I had a flavor that I have had success with before in a different place, but the ice cream here was... Not good. Ate a quarter of the ice cream before throwing it away. Now, back to the most recent time, I have been to another dessert place that was a bit farther away, and I freaking loved it, so I suggested the idea to the rest of the table. My sister, who did not like the place I suggested, really did not want to go there, so we went to Humphry. In a desperate attempt to avoid overpriced ice cream, I went through the rest of the ferry building to find another place that seemed I would like other than ice cream, but to no avail. I finally gave in and had a sample of two flavors I liked from other locations. I tried the horchata flavor, but it pales in comparison to the horchata shaved snow from Powder. I also tried the malted milk chocolate, because I like some chocolate ice cream. It also was not good. So, I ordered the vanilla thinking "Ok, this is a classic flavor in ice cream. What could possibly go wrong?" After the first bite, it was promising. However, as time went on, it just felt too strong for a vanilla flavor. So, threw it away after eating about half of it, wasting over 2 dollars in the process. I really don't understand the appeal. The line is usually very long and slow, the ice cream is way too expensive for the size, and it somehow can screw up the most simple flavor of ice cream. If you ever wind up going to a nice restaurant in SF, don't waste your time waiting a long time for overpriced ice cream. Spend it somewhere else, maybe at a good candy shop or bakery, or maybe another ice cream stand. It says top 5 in the country according to one source, but not in my book.
author: Desmond R.

description:
I'm not a big ice cream eater, but I LOVE this place. Best ice cream ever!! What diet? I'll go out of my way to come here. Haha! 

I've tried the following so far:
Tahitian Vanilla 
Malted Dulce de Leche
Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee
Jasmine Lychee
Here's your damn strawberry
Toast and Jam
Oolong Tea

Amarena cherry topping - yum!
author: Darlene M.

description:
Oh dear sweet baby Jesus. I'm not ice cream's biggest fan. My teeth have been bleached to oblivion, rendering anything cooler than room temperature a tortuous feat to eat.  But I'd sooner have all my teeth pulled than give up this delicious treat. Salted caramel, Vietnamese iced coffee-- it's all good. The mango pepitas sorbet- DAMN- so good, makes you want to slap yo' mama. Just kidding mom, I'd never lay a finger on your precious face.

We stopped in around 6:40, just prior to closing. A steady stream of customers but the wait wasn't insane.
author: Kai P.

description:
I thought it was the best ice cream I've ever had, and my wife thinks it's about as good as BiRite. There's nothing subtle about the rich and smooth sea salt smoked chocolate. The chocolate was strong. The sea salt was strong. Every mouthful was just full of flavor.

The Harvey milk and honey graham was creamy comforting goodness.  Like if your mum gave you a milk and graham cracker snack after school(which my mum never did, but I imagine it would be like that).  Blue Bottle Viet coffee was strong.  Best coffee flavor ever. Wake you up in the afternoon for some delight good.

Best ice cream, eaten on a bench overlooking the bay with loved ones on a warm summer afternoon. Aahh goodness, me loves the Ferry Building and Humphrey Slocombe.
author: Ed L.

description: I ordered the sea salt chocolate ice cream and it was too salty for my taste. I tried two other flavors which also didn't wow me.
author: Won K.

description: I'm not really sure how else to describe the ice cream besides what's already been said by the thousands of Humphrey fans. I didn't know they opened a new location but was excited when I saw it! I tried the secret breakfast, the Vietnamese coffee and the peanut butter chip.   By far my favorite was the Vietnamese coffee, but even the other flavors were better than any other ice cream I've had.  I've drunk the Humohreys juice!
author: Hayley H.

description:
This ice cream is so good that I cannot believe it is real.  "Bursting with flavor" is an understatement.  It is the best ice cream, by far, that I have ever had.

Now, I do get the point that it can be overwhelmingly flavorful. I tried three flavors before settling in on candied ginger, RELATIVELY subtle.  I think one answer is that this is ice cream you savor, don't gobble quickly.  But, I get that some people will just find it too much.
author: John B.

description:
Ice cream at Humphrey Slocombe is icier and thicker than other places. I'm not an obsessive fan of HPS but appreciate the imaginative flavors. It's a contrast from the usual Bi-Rite which is SF's standard of old-fashioned ice cream. The texture is hit and miss, and it depends if you get a fresh batch at the Ferry Building.

Harvey milk and honey graham: Great infusion of honey into ice cream. Graham cracker inclusion is simple, yet innovative. Sort of like what a child eats afterschool for snack.

Blue bottle vietnamese coffee: Coffee flavor is strong. Color is nicely light brown like at Blue Bottle, though it was a notch too saccharine sweet.

Chocolate smoked sea salt: Really not a fan of the flavor, which had too much going on at once.

Secret breakfast: Great flavor. Innovative with corn flakes and bourbon flavor.

Tahitian vanilla: Ok flavor. Texturally too rich.

All in all, texture is fine, inconsistent at times, but constantly too sweet.
author: Jay C.

description: I go some times per week,  yes!!  I love their ice cream,  really good,  sometimes the flavours could be a little weird,  just go with open mind or chose a classical one. Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Black Sesame are awesome.
author: Koe S.

description:
Short line at 1pm on a Wednesday! Very fast service.

Took all you yelpers' advice and went for the Secret Breakfast. Tasted something close to toffee nut / bourbon / caramelly / creamy / milky goodness with corn flake clusters! 

I would have gone for the Blue Bottle Viet Coffee which was DELISH but a bit overwhelming for me after a lunch on the pier.
author: Jo L.

description: My favorite ice cream ever!! I love all sweet things, and ice cream is no exception. I particularly love Humphry Slocombe because not only are the flavors unique, but the ice cream is super creamy and filled with generous amounts of mix-ins. My favorite flavor of all time is the candied ginger which has HUGE chunks of ginger mixed in. The ginger flavor is perfectly spicy, too. The scoop sizes here are more generous than some of the other gourmet ice cream shops I've been to in the Bay Area, which is an extra plus. Also bonus points to the friendly and patient staff, especially since I can imagine how tough it must be to serve the patrons at this particular location. Humphry Slocombe is worth a visit; don't be intimidated by the long lines as they tend to move fairly quick!
author: Jasmine H.

description: The ice cream is great and tasty. They have a lot of flavor to choose from. My favorite ones are Blue Bottle Coffee and Green Tea. This is a must-go place in the summer when you are going to the Ferry Bldg.
author: Amber W.

description: This place is packed on Saturdays, so be prepared to wait in line.  The best flavors I've had here are Harvey milk & honey and the coconut sorbet.  Both are absolutely delicious.  Not quite as good as Smitten, but a little better than Bi Rite, in my opinion.
author: Simon L.

description:
I was happily surprised they stay open till 7 p.m. when all the other shops have already closed up. Which by the way is a great time to come, no lines!!

Secret Breakfast is still my go to scoop but the Basil Lime was quite bright and interesting.
author: R J.

description:
I finally got my long awaited secret breakfast! I thought it might be too hyped up, but it definitely met my expectations.  The line is always long, but I would say it's worth it.  The Secret breakfast has a good bourbon flavor without being too alcoholic, and the crunch from the corn flakes makes it even better.

They have a lot of unique combinations that sound like they would be odd together, but I love when places do ice cream flavors like that.  If you know what you want by the pint, you can bypass the line and just get it from the freezer case, but it's a limited selection, and I don't think they usually have the Secret breakfast in there.
author: Marilyn T.

description: Wow this ice cream shop is better then Mitchell's! The Tin roof sundae was AMAZING.. I'm so glad I found this place, I definitely recommend to anyone who hasn't tried it. Well worth the walk
author: Jeffrey O.

description: Simply delicious! The love shows through its flavors. The one stop you can't miss in SF.
author: Ere L.

description: Got two scoops here from a friendly staff which were brown sugar fennel (just ok - tasted more like licorice) and maple walnut (SO GOOD!). Overall, line goes pretty quick so it's worth a try if you're in the Ferry Landing!
author: George P.

description: Got one scoop of the butterbeer flavor and one scoop of the bourbon cereal/breakfast flavor (I think that's what it was called). I did not like the butterbeer at all, but my friend really liked it. I loved the bourbon icecream. It had a really nice flavor and the occasional crunch from whatever cereal they used. I would definitely get it again.
author: Jeanne K.

description: The Harvey Milk and Honey Gram was my favorite out of all the selections that I tried that day! It was really simple, creamy and satisfying. I wish I had a whole tub of it right now! Ughhh
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Traveling half the world and looking forward to Humphry's, we might have put up our hopes to high... 
Don't get me wrong, it was good, and the flavors are special and great, but it wasn't as good as we thought it would be. 
I got the fluffernutter and my other half took the secret breakfast. The flavors were nothing like you have ever had before, but it didn't pop out to anything thing else I have ever eaten.
You should definitely try it, but we won't be repeating it!
author: Florence V.

description: Est. 2008, Humphry Slocombe is a very poppin' place to get ice cream in Norcal. They're found in many coffee shops and restaurants but there's an entire store of it in the Ferry Building (YESSSSS!). There's almost always a line here, but the line wasn't too slow. The flavors are all interesting if not intriguing, and feel free to ask for samples. My boyfriend and I shared one scoop (it was kinda expensive at $4 for one scoop) of malted milk chocolate and enjoyed it on a bench behind the Ferry Building with a few of the Bay Bridge. The malted milk chocolate was creamy and smooth, not too chocolate-y and not too sweet as milk chocolate frequently gets. With the great view and REALLY nice weather that day, it was perfect! Excited to try the other flavors soon!
author: Judith C.

description: This place is amazing.  I've tried a few different flavors and they are all so weird but so delicious.  I take visitors here to impress them and it's a perfect way to end a stroll down Embarcadero.
author: Steven H.

description: The vanilla ice cream here is amazing. I love all the different fancy flavors as well, but sometimes you really just gotta enjoy the beautiful simplicity of a well done vanilla flavored ice cream!
author: Andrew Y.

description: Very unique flavors.....1 scoop for $4 and 3 scoops for $7.50.  Of course we opted for 3 scoops.   All 3 were very good.  Secret Breakfast  ( bourbon flavor with cornflakes )  won the top spot.  Second  by Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, followed by Milk chocolate with passion fruit.  Definitely will  come back whenever I  come back to San Francisco.
author: LoveToEat Z.

description:
Positively outstanding.

I had the Secret Breakfast, which has already been discussed in great detail in many other reviews. I'd ask, "Who knew bourbon and corn flakes could be so good?" but, well, duh. The corn flakes were gooey cookie clusters mixed into a delightfully creamy but not overly sweet scoop of decadence. 

Getting a scoop on a cone is a bit of a risk, as the ultra creaminess lends itself to quick dripping...so one might consider a cup with an upside down cone on top. But...YUM.
author: Kiesha R.

description: Soooooooo goooooooood!!!! Had the cantaloupe cayenne sorbet and WOW! Very refreshing and a slight kick in the back of the throat. I love their Secret Breakfast and their bourbon caramel... but I was without my lactaid pill. I don't think you can go wrong with any of their flavors.
author: Stephen Y.

description: Easily the best ice cream I have ever had. The simple combinations of flavors just amazed me. Even the toppings just add the right texture to not over complicate or over power the amazing taste of they're quite original flavors. My opinion on ice cream has forever changed.
author: Katelynn F.

description:
It was a warm breezy day at the ferry building, perfect weather for perfect ice cream. Surrounding me were signs of a normal summer day: I was waiting in line for my ice cream, contemplating about the flavors, and swiping my smartphone; people around me were walking around with ice cream and the blue bottle iced coffee in hands, but who knew that this normal day would soon crash down unexpectedly by a bite of an ice cream. 

The two flavors I have tried were the secret breakfast (recommended by the worker here) and the carrot mango sorbet, AND OH MY GOODNESS, MY TRAIN OF THOUGHT WAS TOTALLY INTERRUPTED. IT WAS THE BEST ICE CREAM I EVER HAD, I LIKE IT BETTER THAN BI-RITE, THERE, I SAID IT, I LIKE IT BETTER THAN BI-RITE! I'm sorry but I can't lie to my heart. Every bite I took was glorious, and a different experience. 

The secret breakfast was magical, It tasted sort of like a brioche french toast, but better because it's in the form of an ice cream. I tasted some syrup, and perhaps some liquor. In certain bites I got chunks of bread, which gave the ice cream more substance as a whole. It really works as a whole, and it was never so easy to say that it's the best ice cream flavor I have ever had.

The Carrot Mango sorbet was another world of its own too. The unique fresh flavors of the carrot tingles on my tongue, and then I got the warm sweetness from the mango. It was a sorbet, but it did not feel watery, instead it was quite substantial from the texture of the carrot and every bite was satisfying. 

I have to say that my favorite thing about this place is that it is honest. The ingredients really shines through, as it doesn't rely on all these unheard chemical ingredients to make it taste great. Compared to other ice cream, which has this sticky sweetness lingering in your mouth after taking a bite, it doesn't happen here at Humphry Slocombe. Here, the flavors of the ingredients are what lingers in your mouth. Humphry Slocombe has done this amazing accomplishment by bringing the quality and the flavors onto a level unseen (untasted) by me before.
author: David H.

description:
They'll always have a flavor for you to put it short. I tried the vietnamese coffee which was wonderful. Good solid place but nothing that puts it into the 5 star category. 

Theres always a line because of the hype but it's worth it. If you come too late then the flavors may run out. When I came at 7:30 (they close at 8) both malt chocolate and the tahitian vanilla had run out.

Definite must try.
author: Evan D.

description: I've only been here one time but it was enough to convince me that they literally have the best vanilla ice cream on the planet. Their Tahitian Vanilla ice cream is something of the ICE CREAM GODS. I was very sad that I am only a tourist and had no way of bringing any back home with me! If you're looking for something amazingly delicious and perfect for your sweet tooth craving, look no further than this ice cream spot. You can thank me later. I will definitely be returning my following visit to SF.
author: Dakota T.

description:
Delicious!   If I get back again, I am going to have breakfast and lunch there and by that I mean I am going to stuff myself with ice cream for breakfast and then as soon as my mouth thaws, I'm going back for more.  

Loved Secret Breakfast.  After I had a taste, I had to have it.   The name makes me giggle.  The corn flakes seemed like they were caramelized, which I liked.   

I also had Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee.   It was good, because the ice cream base is good, but it was not spectacular like Secret Breakfast.   I had never been to the Ferry Building before, so it was only when I went over to get espresso at the shop across the way, that I realized what the "Blue Bottle" meant.  

My friend had Cantaloupe Cayenne sorbet, which I never would have picked but it was quite good.  It tasted like frozen cantaloupe with a little kick at the end.  I would get that again.  (Maybe I'll start with a sorbet, and then get Secret Breakfast for breakfast and then for lunch explore two more flavors)
author: Catherine S.

description:
The ice cream is good. I had the vanilla in a small tub (which was actually rather large). 

I tried it before the actual shop opened. It was just a cart and someone selling it, inside the Ferry Building; no queue, zero hype. People were walking by, taking no notice whatsoever.
 
I'm pretty sure that my reason for trying it was twofold: firstly, I felt slightly bad for the  guy trying to sell it; secondly, it seemed to be one of the few options without a line in the whole building and I was not in the mood for lining up.

Every time I've visited the Ferry Building since the actual shop has been open, the line has been ridiculously long. I'm not sure whether this is due to ice cream being served at snail's pace, or something else... I might have it again sometime, but only if the line shortens itself quite significantly. Somehow, I don't think they're going to miss my patronage in any case!

Try it, but make room in your schedule for a long wait.
author: Kira G.

description: Ice cream was good- nothing advanced and outrageous. The peanut butter was definitely Tier 4 status. It was good to try- but not a must.
author: Cen'Cere C.

description:
Mmm yummy in my tummy! 
I've been here 4 times and every time it does not disappoint!! 
They switch flavours every 2 months so I visited just in time for the switch.

I've tried the Blue Bottle Viet Coffee, Green tea flavour one (forget what it's called but it's delish)
author: Janice C.

description:
Flavor: Oolong Tea and Butter By Moonlight!

The line was long but it moved fairly quick. Friendly staff and they were awesome answering our questions in regards to their unique flavors. The oolong tea was soo refreshing and good! Butter by Moonlight was a little more rich tasting but also very good! Mmm..can't wait to go back!
author: Dung N.

description:
Glad I finally got to try this place. Bf and I love trying new ice cream shops and this has been bookmarked for quite sometime. Secret Breakfast lives up to the hype. Nom nom! Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is a pass. Tastes like Haagen-Dazs' coffee flavor.  Their Pumpkin one is also a pass for me but the boy liked it. 

Service was mediocre.
author: Audrey N.

description: Cannot tell if better than Tin Pot in South Bay. Seems to be on par. Sweet Scoops in Sonoma seems better.
author: Nick H.

description:
I've always enjoyed humphry slocombe ice cream. Secret breakfast is delicious and is my favorite I think. I was so happy when they now have a storefront in the Ferry Building and I'm sure it's good for business. 

Secret Breakfast is the best - there's this bourbon sauce that is amazing. I will admit that the ice cream is a little soft, so it's not the best to try to wait and eat it, but who is waiting to eat ice cream?
author: Nina Y.

description: Really good quality ice-cream. I'm allergic to gluten and eggs, and usually avoid ice-cream, sorbet, or anything sugary. I had a cheat day and this ice cream was some of t he best I've ever had. I have no idea if their products have eggs/gluten in it, but I had no reaction. I'm assuming it's just really high quality ice cream- was really light and delicious.
author: M M.

description:
Oh my... Humphry, how you make my taste buds dance in merriment and wonder of all the flavors that only you manage to put together so well!

So the usual highlight that is synonymous with Humphry Slocombe, if  you haven't heard by now is the Secret Breakfast, which is delicious when balanced just right. My Besties and I have gone here enough times to notice that each batch is slightly different from the last, so just asking for a sample can show you if it's to your liking or a bit too strong on the bourbon side. Although the Secret Breakfast is one of the big hitters, my personal favorite, when they have it, is the White Miso Pear! I swear, if this flavor were to magically turn into a man, I would ask him to marry me on the spot, soooooo good with the perfect amount of sweetness, and the creamy texture! 

Now that you know how I feel about the deliciousness that is Humphry's, let's talk about the peeps behind the counter.  A month or so back my Best Bud and I went to a game for the Giants Hello Kitty themed day, and we figured that since these guys were just a few blocks away we would give it a try, and head over after the game, but before they close, especially since we've been wanting to try the POG flavor.  The game probably ended around 6:45, and this place closes at 7:00!  But we're SERIOUS when it comes to our ice cream, so we pretty much ran from the ballpark to the Ferry Building as fast as we possibly could!  You can imagine our relief, when the staff decide to close the (crazy long) line right behind us!  Every five minutes or so, someone would ask the staff if they could squeeze in line, one guy even offered to pay extra! Just goes to show, how much people love their goods!  So we finally get to the counter, and ask for the POG, and of course, they just ran out!  But being the weirdos that we are, we still ask if we could just scrape the bottom to taste the flavor, and they totally accommodated, bringing us the mostly empty jug just smiling and giggling at us. (BTW, the small taste that we did get was pretty good!) I ended up going with the Harvey Milk and Honey that completely satisfies.  But the cherry on top of that visit was when we walk to the register, and the gentleman says that it's on the house! Not sure if he could see how sweaty we got from the run to the shop, or maybe the slight disappointment on our faces when we found out the POG was gone, but either way, completely worth all the efforts!
author: Susan R.

description: Worth the wait.  So wait in the line (no matter how long it is) and you will not be disappointed.  Tried the pumpkin spice, POG, Harvey Milk and graham cracker.  Went with the Secret breakfast.  $4 for a HUGE SCOOP.  I was VERY HAPPY.  I even clapped when our ice cream came out and the worker said it was the first time he received applause for ice cream.  Perfect afternoon snack!
author: Chris L.

description:
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Tahitian V*nilla@. 
Try it, you won't regret it.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I like how Humphry Slocombe made getting three scoops the best value over just getting one or two. One scoop is $4, two scoops is $6, three scoops... just a little over $7! It's obviously a no-brainer to get three scoops, especially when you have so many awesome flavors to choose from. :)

I've tried a couple of flavors over several stops at this location, but I think my favorite flavors are from my most recent visit. The Pepper + Mint Chip flavor is #1 for me. It's not peppermint as traditional ice creams go; it's actually a pepper-flavored ice cream, with dark chocolate chips and hints of mint in the aftertaste. When you eat it, it tastes almost savory... The dark chocolate is the transition between savory to mildly sweet, and the mint provides a refreshing ending. It's probably not for everyone; the counter guy actually asked me if I wanted to taste it before scooping it. That made me a little unsure, but I am very glad I went with it - it's the most interesting and complex flavor I've had so far.

The other flavor I really liked was the Oolong Tea. If you like tea, you'll appreciate this flavor; the tea was unmistakable, deep, and creamy. 

I guess when I'm presented with non-traditional flavors at an ice cream shop, I tend to go for trying the "weirdest" ones on the menu. Maybe that's why I liked the Pepper + Mint Chip and Oolong Tea the most. In comparison to these two, the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee, while very good, was pedestrian. I found myself a little bored with it. But if you're in the mood for a good coffee ice cream, you can't go wrong with this flavor.

No stop at the Ferry Building is complete unless you get three scoops at Humphrey Slocombe. :) The line may seem daunting, but it moves relatively quickly and the counter guys are very friendly. Have your significant other grab two cups of Blue Bottle across the walkway while you hold down the fort in line!
author: Steph S.

description:
So... I've been to a lot of ice cream places in my life. Everywhere from Toscanini's in Cambridge to that ice cream place Barak Obama went to in Bar Harbor. I've had frozen custard from southern Utah, and have visited all the "best" ice cream places in NorCal.

Humphry Slocombe is the best. period. I've never had better.

All the flavors are amazing. Rich, flavorful, not too sweet. My favorite is vietnamese coffee, which they make with Blue Bottle coffee (best in the world). Get a cone, get a cup, deal with the fact that it's not that cheap, but if you love yourself, do yourself a favor and get yourself a cone of this ice cream next time you are in town. 

Tip: If you are a bourbon lover, you have to try the Secret Breakfast. If you're not, like me, feel free to explore all the other amazing flavors.
author: Laura M.

description: HARVEY's MILK. That's all. I've tried secret breakfast, black sesame, and earl grey but milk is far the best. Just get it and you won't regret it. The Wait is whole another story....
author: Michelle K.

description:
I had high hopes for this ice cream place and was unfortunately a little bit let down.
My order was a scoop of salted caramel and one scoop of thai chili lime. For the last one, I wanted to be a little exotic and try something new. One mistake I made was, that I did not try it first but ordered a scoop right away. Big mistake. Well, I was not pleased at all with the taste of the thai chili lime, it had an unpleasant aftertaste that reminded me of bad days...
Well, the salted caramel was not bad. I would have left out the crumbs in there (they somewhat did not fit to the rest of the flavor) and would have called it burned caramel ice cream, since it tasted more like the latter one than like salted caramel. But I do also like burned caramel, therefore I liked this one.

The scoops are huge and worth the price! And the staff is very friendly and quick in taking orders. Another plus is that I like the branding concept and how the "store" looks like.

Nevertheless, I would prefer other ice cream places to this one. Sorry, I am sad about this too! I might give it another chance!
author: Vera H.

description: Flavors are absolutely pouring out of your cup/cone.  As good an ice cream as you will find anywhere.  Lot of exotics which makes tasting so much more fun.  We had the secret breakfast and blue coffee.  Excellent!
author: Des D.

description:
Visited to fulfill my quest to discover the best ice cream in SF and I'd say this place ranks in my top 3. Their flavors are very unique, that's something they got going for emm.

I had the Vietnamese Coffee flavor, partially because I felt obligated and secondly 'cause I was falling asleep. I'd say it was pretttty clutch in terms of capturing the flavor and the only reason I don't rate Humphy's the complete 5 star because I feel it lacks the rich, creamy consistency that I crave. Buttt, still very great ice cream and I left satisfied. I definitely recommend this place!
author: Christina N.

description: Creamy ice and fun flavors! They're okay with you sampling every flavor they have too! The only reason I'm withholding a star is because they didn't have any vegan or lactose free options for those that want it. Otherwise, this is some of the best ice cream I've ever had
author: Stella M.

description:
How can one not like this place.  I love the unique flavors that come out of this ice cream shop including Secret Breakfast, Raisin Rum, and Roasted White Chocolate Lavender. 

Lines can get long, but the wait is worth it especially when you get to sample as many of the flavors as you can.  I love the creaminess of their ice cream and the flavorful flavors.  Also, one scoop goes a really long way.  Don't come here after a full meal, you want to save room for that scoop of ice cream!
author: AJ T.

description:
Wow!! This Ice-cream is amazing. I love Ice-cream and any chance I get I will consume it. In all my years of trying out different types this place houses some of the greatest flavors I have ever tried. The Secret Breakfast and Graham Cracker flavors are just amazing.

You must come and try this ice-cream place, you are surely missing out until you do!
author: Jose G.

description: One of the best ice cream places I have every been to. They had excellent flavors and it was extremely creamy. Highly recommend getting the honey Graham crackers.
author: Emil D.

description:
After hearing about their 'Secret Breakfast,' I knew I had to come and try it when I got to San Francisco. It was well worth it. It is their most popular flavor and now I know why. Living so close to New York, I've had Momofuku's Cereal Milk ice cream and this blows it out of the water. 

We went around 5:00pm and there was no line surprisingly. I'm sure their other flavors are amazing, but I only tried the Secret Breakfast, which I do not mind. It is located inside the Ferry Building which is great because you can sit outside next to the water and enjoy the view of the Bay Bridge and watch all the ferries leaving and arriving.
author: Wayne L.

description:
i recently came across Mr. Slocombe at his newly installed retail outlet at the Ferry Building.  I have been meaning to venture out to his storefront in the Mission, but never got around to it while it was open.  Lucky me; I had the entire place pretty much to myself.  While not vegan, I'm not a big ice cream eater and it'd be unusual for me to eat ice cream more than five times in any given year.  That said, this was amazing.  It's creamy.  It's flavorful.  It's rich.  It's just delicious.  The Slocombe clan was generous about my sampling various flavors.  The ice cream is the true star here, as the two sorbet flavors didn't boast the creaminess or smoothness that I would have preferred.

It's not cheap ($4 for 1 scoop; $6 for two), but it's on par with my other favorites in San Francisco (Bi-Rite and Mitchell's), and reasonable for the quality.  The last time I had ice cream was at Bi-Rite in October, and maybe just because it's been so long my memory has been skewed, but this may very well be my new running favorite.  The Peanut Butter Chip was unbelievable.  The Salted Chocolate was decadent.  The Banana whatever-it-was-called was perfection.

Go.  Enjoy.  Appreciate.

One day, I imagine, I'll cut dairy out of my life entirely.  Until then, on one of the few occasions I ever do eat ice cream, I'll look forward to the perfection that emanates from the ice chest of my friend Humphry.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream spots here in SF! It's conveniently located inside the Ferry building and they have lots of flavors to try! The ice cream is creamy and delicious. I got the mint chocolate chip, a staple and favorite flavor of mine and they did it perfectly- kudos!

I'll definitely be coming here again!
author: Lillian C.

description:
Fun, unique flavors, and a great location inside the Ferry Building.

--Harvey Milk and honey graham is my favorite flavor! It is so perfectly creamy yet light, sweet and flavorful. 

--the olive oil flavor was a bit too for how I like olive oil ice cream, and it didn't have as pronounced of an olive oil flavor. I usually like it when they drizzle it with oil and sprinkle a bit of sea salt on top. 

--peanut butter curry was actually really tasty too! Those two flavors definitely bring out the intensity in each other.

--blue ribbon Vietnamese coffee was very, very strong and deep, definitely for real coffee lovers. It wasn't very sweet like the mild coffee flavors at other places.

Unfortunately, they only allow 1 flavor for scoop, so it's about $4 for one scoop, $6 for two. But it's worth it, especially if you're spending your day walking along the Embarcadero :)
author: Nancy X.

description:
I am a fan of this place. Super delicious, unique flavors

Positives (+): 
(+) Secret breakfast - super yummy
(+) Blue bottle vietnamese coffee - my favorite
(+) POG Sorbet - delicious, i love pog, but it melts very quickly
(+) Honey and milk - yummy
(+) Cinnamon brittle - delicious

The lines get pretty long and they close early, as does everywhere else in the Ferry Building, but it's one of the better ice cream places in the city!
author: Tiffany C.

description: New location that is much more convenient. The service is really fast and they let you try a bunch of flavors before you commit to some expensive ice cream. The flavors are very bold and very tasty. It is a bit expensive at $4/scoop but its definitely worth it if its once in a while.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Deeply embroiled in the Ice cream wars, Humphry Slocombe is always a top contender. Located in the tourist-friendly Ferry building, this branch offers their tried and true flavors, with fewer experimental flavors. They have their staples, Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and mix it up with daily flavors such as  Limoncello Sorbet and Harvey Milk & Honey, among others.

You can sample anything and everything, but be quick about it, cuz there's usually a line and you're prolly holding it up.

I went with Butter Beer, and Butter By Moodlight. Both brown butter-based, Butter Beer included a Stout beer, while Moodlight featured blueberries. I mighta overdone it with the butter ice creams but hey, they were both great. 

Their sorbets aren't bad either. The Limoncello was sweet, sour, and a little salty all at once. The POG sorbet (Passionfruit Orange Guava) was pretty intense too, with all that fruit crammed into one scoop.

I'd like to try the original spot, but this one is pretty convenient for visitors. And they have a book available, so I can try making this stuff myself until I return.
author: Christopher M.

description: I took a stroll to the ferry building during my lunch break and dropped in here for some ice cream. I got the Secret Breakfast which had bourbon in it and cornflakes. It was delicious and the bourbon taste was strong! Definitely went back to the office with a warm fuzzy stomach from the bourbon. I was worried that I would get drunk from the ice cream given the taste! Super silly but the result is that I didn't, phew! Just strong in taste but not in alcohol! I like the crunchiness from the corn flakes. I sampled other flavors there too and would go back for more scoops on the future!
author: Michelle T.

description:
So my Dad says, well did you go down to that Humphrey place and 
wait 4 hours and pay $8 for a scoop of ice cream and I said, no, Dad, it's not that bad.

In fact  the two times I've had ice cream here, there was no wait and the prices are certainly  in the normal range for the artisanal ice cream, if that is such a thing. 

My complaint is I just don't like the favors. It feels a bit sacrilegious but they just don't do it for me. Also, I like gelato and ice cream with stuff in it, chips, nuts, cookie dough....it's just a preference but their ice creams seem a bit lacking in this area. For me the flavor combinations which include things like Basil, peanut butter and various banana permutations are to me off putting rather than enticing.. I did hi I the salted chocolate was ok, if a bit subtle, but if I want a sweet treat, I want it a little jazzier, a little more fun.
author: Marie K.

description: Out of all the"hyped" up ice cream spots I have tried, this one melts the fastest, although it doesn't take away from the flavor and quality. I'd recommend getting a cup if you're the ice cream salivating type.  Although soft like most people said, it's pretty smooth in texture. Almost like Smitten, I would say. They cycle through flavors every once in a while but keep their staples such as secret breakfast and blue bottle viet coffee. They got some pretty bold flavors, but they meld in beautifully with each other.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Stopped by after brunch to fulfill our sweet tooth. It was a Sunday afternoon and this place had a pretty long line. We decided to buy a prepackaged pint of ice cream instead so it would be faster. 

We ended up with the POG sorbet (Passionfruit,orange, guava). It was DELICIOUS!!!! Great flavors with just the right amount of creamy and icyness. 

Wish I could have sampled the cinnamon brittle, Vietnamese coffee, and special breakfast!! Next time!
author: Tracey W.

description: Blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream hands down the best flavor. The ice cream was really rich and creamy.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Walked up yesterday and the staff were singing/dancing to Destiny's Child's "Writing on the Wall" album... Need I say more? 

Service is always friendly and great, samples are aplenty, and the ice cream is so creamy and delicious. The Harvey Milk flavor is delicioso (they were out yesterday... Que triste!) and the peanut butter chocolate chip is sooo peanut buttery and to die for. Lines are generally pretty long but move quickly. Can't wait to work my way through all of their flavors!
author: Ashlee C.

description: Yeah, really not feeling this place. Servings tiny, half-melted, expensive. Flavors whimsically named but not revelatory. Service perfunctory. Don't bother.
author: Charles B.

description:
Items Selected:
Secret Breakfast with Bourbon Caramel
Butter by Moonlight / Harvey Milk and Honey Graham

Still abuzz from the Kings double-OT Stanley Cup victory and a landmark meal at Saison it was after a long morning jog along the Embarcadero that I stopped to refuel at the Ferry Plaza Market and although samples of fruit and cheese were plentiful it was pie and ice cream that I craved - the latter found first in the new storefront of an old favorite.  Twice visited in The Mission but featuring new digs in a white tile space formerly inhabited by Ciao Bella it was moments before 8am that the hinged wall unfolded and stepping quickly into line smiles flourished - a few jokes about ice cream for breakfast and several samples leading to a $10 two-cup order.  Beginning first with two new-to-me novelties it was in the exclusive brown butter and blueberry swirl of Butter by Moonlight that I first partook and taken bite for bite with the "Milk" Ice Cream studded with housemade honey grahams I continued to marvel at Slocombe's velvety texture while restrained sweetness allowed natural flavors to shine.  Moving onward to my second dish it was more my willingness to indulge like a child than any need for hair of the dog that led to my 'double shot' of bourbon and with a name like Secret Breakfast the bourbon milk and cvornflake composition proved even more memorable when doused in boozy, hot caramel...a breakfast of champions indeed.
author: Michael U.

description: I wanted to specifically write a review for their Amareno Cherries. Those cherries are amazingly good, and I end up putting them on top of Ice Cream flavors that don't really call for cherries, because they are too good. Frankly I kind of just want a bowl of cherries and that would be it - but the ice cream is good too. Makes a good cherry vehicle.
author: Gabrielle M.

description: My heart is still a bit agnostic on HS because, unlike Bi-rite, etc., I feel as though the brand/employees can be a bit snooty/too cool for school (for example, not allowing for two flavors in one scoop!), and I think the "weird" flavors can be too schticky. BUT: I've had a pretty great malted milk chocolate and malted dulce de leche here. It's a lot creamier than other places (and perhaps too much for me, TBD with a few more tries) - you will definitely get richness and specialty, if that's what you're craving!
author: Shendi X.

description: My 2nd favorite ice cream on the planet.  Two words for you.  Harvey Milk.  Two more.  Try it!  Yes, I can justify ice cream at 10am.
author: Kristi C.

description: Mmmm Yum-O!!!! Tried their Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese coffee flavors before. Their candied ginger had a strong taste. I ended up getting a scoop of their Honey milk and graham cracker flavor which was divine...it's like cookies and cream except the cookie is the graham cracker. One scoop is $4.00, two scoops $6 and three is $8. They are generous on their scoop sizes.
author: Ellin C.

description: I've never felt compelled to write a review until my experience at this humphry slocombe location. I went here thinking I would have a the same great experience as I did at their mission location, unfortunately it was the complete opposite.  I did not even get to try to the ice cream.  It closes at 7pm and we arrived 10 minutes before, which we were promptly told they were closed and no longer serving anyone.  I thought that was weird since we still had 10 minutes before closing!  As we walked away, someone else came in the line after us and they served that individual! I was and still am fuming mad.  Don't think I will be going here again, as it seems they only like to serve select individuals! Thumbs down!
author: Stef M.

description: I think they just opened this location when I visited, and boy what an amazing addition to a foodie's heaven in the ferry building! Every flavor is unique and wonderful. I have had their book even before coming to SF and have made a few of their ice creams. It was amazing to taste the original versions! I visited multiple times when in SF, it is worth the wait!
author: Vanessa M.

description: Delish. The Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee & Black Sesame was very good.
author: Grace T.

description: I ordered the Complete Breakfast which included a scoop of Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast. I loved how strong the Vietnamese Coffee was. The Secret Breakfast was also pretty good with the bourbon not being too strong or overpowering and the corn flakes providing a good crunch. Would make a special trip just to order it again.
author: Kiana A.

description:
Three stars for this particular location, four stars for their original store in the Mission.  

I love Secret Breakfast, so I skipped the crazy lines and got the half-pint from their prepacked cart.  Unfortunately, it was a warm day and they probably kept opening and closing the cart door, as the ice cream was incredibly soft and melting already.  Luckily, it's my favorite flavor, and my boyfriend loves ice cream, so we scarfed it down.  Still good, just better when it's colder.
author: Joyce H.

description:
One of the better ice cream spots in the city. Be prepared to wait since the location at the Ferry Building always seems to have a long line. The line moves relatively fast though as long as people aren't trying too many flavors. 

Lots of flavors to choose from which is always nice. The flavors are really creamy and flavor-packed. The staff there is super nice and friendly and they're really patient with you trying out flavors. The serving sizes are also very generous which makes the $4/scoop totally worth it.
author: Alysha F.

description: I liked the flavors, but wasn't too keen on the texture of the ice cream. My boyfriend and I got the Harvey Milk Graham cracker one and the vietnamese coffee. The flavors were delicious, but the texture was too airy for me. The ice cream disintegrated in my mouth too quickly...I wish it was thicker and creamier. Good, unique flavors, but OK texture. Given its high ratings, I was disappointed with my experience.
author: Annie N.

description: Good ice cream. Worth $4 for a cone? Probably not, but okay for an occasional treat.
author: Neha S.

description: My biggest weakness is ice cream. I love it... All kinds. I had banana chai and "harvey milk and honey graham" and good god almighty it was amazing. Friendly staff, long lines but well worth the wait. Better than Fentons.
author: Kelly L.

description:
After hearing about Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream so much, I decided to stop by and I'm really glad that they opened this convenient location, located on the left side in the Ferry Building. 

First of all, the line and reputation speaks for itself. Expect a wait for the ice cream but friendly and helpful workers will make sure that you don't wait too long. They even allow you to try the flavors to help you decide. Trust me, you'll definitely need to try them because they have a wide variety and they all sound so good!

After trying them, my girlfriend and I decided to get the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Elvis (the Fat Years) - which is banana ice cream with Bacon Peanut Brittle. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee had a strong yet sweet taste, but definitely my favorite. 

All in all, I definitely will be back once again to try the different flavors! There are so many that I am still interested in trying. However, I won't come by too often as $4 a scoop for ice cream is on the more expensive side.
author: Christopher Y.

description:
Too bad I waited till 3:30 on a Saturday afternoon for a hankering for ice cream, but it was worth the walk from Washington Square Park. And we needed to digest some of the Tacolicious-over-stuffness we were feeling, and I needed to make room for my ice cream I just had to have!
So I'd heard this was good stuff, and if I was going to splurge and have dessert then it better be quality. But like I said, by the time I arrived a lot of the flavors were "out"...bummer. So I went for the Oolong Tea that was still available. And I wasn't disappointed. 
More on the Vanilla base side with a light hint of Oolong tea, making it not too overpowering and very refreshing. The ice cream is very creamy and rich, just what I was craving on a crunchy fresh sugar cone. My only regret is they ran out of at least 6 flavors and they still had 3 hours before closing. I will try and go earlier to try the Bluebottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor or the Black Sesame which both sound amazing! I love the Ferry Building and make the pilgrimage periodically with the husband so we can happily eat our way through from one end to another. And good ice cream is definitely worth a special trip.
author: Susan D.

description:
I loved this ice cream and the location of the creamery! It is located inside San Francisco's Ferry Building which looks exactly like a farmer's market. I love visiting here and picking up coffee, juice, and fresh organic foods. 

I always pass Humphry's but I decided to try some since it was a hot day. It was so delicious and they have the greatest flavors that you can even imagine! It reminded me of Lottie's in Walnut Creek. I had the Vietnamese coffee and honey graham cracker ice creams for only $7 I believe. I don't mind paying that price for homemade ice cream.

The people are very friendly and you have plenty of time to pick your flavors. I would you go back for sure.
author: Jordyn N.

description:
It was ok.

Between 2 people, we had:
- Secret Breakfast: the softest of the four we had; bourbon was not mixed consistently throughout so some spoonfuls didn't have any bourbon flavor and others had an overwhelming amount of bourbon; also very sweet. 2 stars.
- Brown Butter: tasted like toffee; was one-note and too sweet for me. 2 stars.
- Jasmine Lychee: my favorite of the four; not too sweet; I could clearly taste both the jasmine and the lychee flavors and it tasted natural rather than artificial. 4 stars.
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: Like the Jasmine Lychee, this one is on the less sweet side; very bold coffee flavor. 3.5 stars

I like that they have unique flavors and if I was in the area and craving ice cream, I would go again. But, I wouldn't go out of my way to get ice cream here.
author: C L.

description:
humphry's has finally opened in embarcadaro! there is a small wait to get your ice cream which you can sample first. it's a bit pricey - $4 for 1 scoop, $5 for 2 scoops, but found the secret breakfast which has a light rum infusion to be really unique and the oolong to have a nice woody flavor to it. 

i probably won't be hankering back, but it was a good place to try some unique flavors. :)
author: Mimi C.

description:
I love this place. It's like Bi-Rite Creamery, only weirder. No, you won't like everything you try, but that's part of the fun. 

Salted Chocolate =way too salty
Secret Breakfast = delicious 
Harvey Milk & Honey Graham= divine
Plum & Earl Grey = refreshing
Toasted Sesame = good but hard to eat more than 3 bites 
Carrot Mango = interesting, but maybe too healthy tasting 

Rather than just focus on flavors with mass appeal, the folks at Humphry Slocombe truly extract the flavor out of their ingredients, even if that means their ice cream is polarizing. 

Not every flavor will blow your mind, but I appreciate that they really push the envelope.
author: Shreya O.

description:
Good flavors I've tried include Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Tahitian Vanilla.  Not so good is the Basil Lime Sorbet because it's too tart.

The service stood out to me as sub-par.  The young men working behind the counter seemed uninterested.  The long line and customers requesting samples can do that to you, but I've experienced more welcoming service at other ice cream shops.  

Wish they'd allow two flavors per scoop as an option, instead of just one large scoop of one flavor. 

If you're with a friend or two, purchase scoops together to save some money!  Maybe they'll be willing to put the scoops in separate cups, but I haven't tried.
author: Vivian V.

description:
DELICIOUS ice cream.  This is the kind of ice cream with flavor that explodes in your mouth -- nothing artificial about it.  I went there today, Memorial Day, in the afternoon and there was a huge line.  I'm always willing to wait for ice cream, and they didn't disappoint.
There were about a half a dozen flavors that intrigued me, but I didn't want to seem like a piggy for trying all of them.  I asked the gentleman who helped me to pick two out of the list for me to try before I committed, and although there were about 50 people behind me in line, still offered to let me try all of them.  I declined though, and sampled both the salted caramel and strawberry.  Both had amazing flavor!  I went with the strawberry though -- you don't often find fruit ice creams with such true flavor and without the overwhelming sweetness.
I agree with other reviewers about one scoop being enough.  It's rich, not like the usual ice cream you get at the store.  A perfect treat for a sunny day when you've done lots of walking!
author: Calee S.

description:
Super nice guys who give u lots of samples 
One star off BC so many flavors gone when we got there sat night.

Had pot of gold which is choco with choco waffle pieces. Very good chocolate flavor.
Also had Basil lime. Loved the fresh basil taste and unabashed tartness. I love sour things.

They had other interesting flavors like cantaloupe cayenne that were surprisingly good.

One star off BC really wanted to try their breakfast one, but all gone then. :(
author: Cara H.

description:
This place was such a disappointment. 
I got the basil lime sherbert, Tahitian vanilla, and the blue bottle coffee.

The basil lime sherbert tasted like a confused frozen salad. I threw that away after eating like two spoons of it. It was weird, I felt like there was not enough flavor but at the same time the flavor that was there was horrible.

The Tahitian vanilla was so bland! It had no flavor except for the huge amount of sugar they had added to it. I absolutely love sweets so its really hard for me to feel like something is too sweet but this was wayyyy too sweet. 

Coffee is my favorite flavor of ice cream so I usually always get a scoop of it wherever I go. So I was even more disappointed when it came out tasting so mediocre. Again this was also way too sweet and just not tasty. The flavors had no dimension. 

I tried eating more of the coffee and vanilla but eventually I threw that away too.

I'm not sure but I felt like the ingredients were on the cheap side as well, which would explain the horrible taste. And on top of all of that, the ice cream wasn't even at the right temp! They started turning into ice cream soup the second the guy scooped it up.
author: Sugar Q.

description: Hands down the best ice cream in SF, and in my overall top 5! Pretty much everything here is awesome, so come ready to try multiple flavors! Worth the wait!
author: Michael K.

description: I just had a bad meal at Out the Door and I had low expectation for this as well. I got one scoop of the Vietnamese coffee and another of the Secret Breakfast. The coffee was excellent, but the Secret Breakfast was amazing. Don't believe the naysayers. I
author: Phil S.

description:
Unfortunately I came here on a Saturday night after dinner, so many of their flavors ran out. However, the staff was friendly and they still had a few flavors left to try (meaning I tried everything). Creamy, homemade flavors make a sweet treat after dinner :) I ordered the salted carmel which had enough balance of sweet and salty. MmmmM

I would definitely come back to try the other flavors I missed out, especially the secret breakfast!
author: Kris T.

description: What flavor do I not love??! Now we don't have to go all the way to the Mission. Honey. Lavender, blue bottle, breakfast cereal, root beer...they're all good creamy and smooth.
author: Carlyn C.

description: Took my class here on Tuesday after our field trip. The line as usual was long but pretty fast moving. I order 17 Tahitian Vanilla, 1 strawberry, and the Secret Breakfast Float for me. Considering that I had a big order and there were only two employees, they were very fast with it. On top of their quick, friendly service, they charged me $2 for a scoop instead of $4 (there's no kid size scoop on the menu). My float was delicious and def. worth the $8. The kids loved their ice cream and we all left happy. This was my first time in this location but I have been to their original location and of course they never disappoint.
author: selina n.

description:
Several flavors of the day to choose from including customer favorites and seasonal and yummy flavor combos. 

You can sample before deciding. The scoop size is decent too. Can get it on a cone or cup which is easier for sharing with friends.

The line can be really long especially on the weekends like some of the other popular places in the Ferry Building. But you can people watch or chat with others while waiting.

My favorites are Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast! Yummy.
author: Karrot L.

description: I love ice cream and this place did not disappoint!! I ordered the milk and honey w/ fudge!
author: Christina S.

description:
It locates in the ferry building, and most likely there will be a line. 

We had honey milk with graham. It's quite sweet with light honey flavor, and a lot of graham. The breakfast secret is rich with bourbon and cornflakes. They also have salt and pepper, black sesame, Viennese coffee, and other fruity flavor. I would recommend it.
author: Miao X.

description: Oh this place is special.  It's located perfectly at the Ferry Building, so I can grab a cone while I wait for my ferry.  My favorite flavor is the Harvey Milk and Teddy Graham's.  It is delicious.  A wonderful ice cream version of cookies and really fresh milk.  Please do not stop making that one.
author: Helen K.

description: 6 words: blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream.
author: Joanne W.

description: Usually I love the ice cream and customer service here, but the cashier girl was super rude. I was looking at something and was caught off guard and she literally waved her hand in my face. I would understand if I was far away and couldn't hear her so she would have to wave at me, but I was literally right in front of her. Her attitude was very negative and not customer service oriented. I just wanted to eat my ice cream on this beautiful and sunny day! Didn't need to get sass and shitty attitude. We are not in high school or on the set of Mean Girls.
author: Mimi D.

description: Their ice-cream tasted fresh, but it's a bit too sugary for my taste. I tried the oolong, Viennese coffee and olive oil flavors. My personal favorite was the oolong, for it's strong tea flavor. However, I would like it a lot more if it's more bitter. Also, the olive oil one had little pieces of lemon zest. I'm bit sure if it was supposed to be like that or we just got the wrong flavor. You get a lot of ice-cream for 3-scoops!
author: Maggie L.

description: Best ice cream I've ever had! Yelp wanted me to write more but I don't know what else I can say except this ice cream is like crack except in a much much better way. Secret breakfast is good but Butter by Moonlight is my favorite. Just eat it and you won't be disappointed. P.S. Yall need a store by Lake Merritt. Please and thank you!
author: Jean G.

description:
+ Tahitian Vanilla
+ Blue Bottle Coffee
+ Decent Size, Cheaper the More Scoops you Get
+ Unique flavors and options

- Can be a long line
- Can run out of flavors
- No seating

Celebrated National Ice Cream Day with the BEST Ice Cream in the city.  Can't explain it but you can just tell this ice cream is on a whole different level than everyone else.  Definitely coming back to try the other flavors.
author: Manohak S.

description:
Flavors that will change your life:
Basil with black pepper
Olive oil
Blur Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
Salted caramel (obvi) 
Fennel
author: Amy V.

description: I couldn't be happier that Humphrey Slocombe now has a location in the Ferry Building.  This makes it much more accessible to me as I am in this area often after work and on the weekends.  It was a sunny Saturday afternoon so this was a perfect stop after catching a movie at the Embarcadero Theatres.  Timing has to be just right as this place is instantly popular.  We got in line and waited about 20 minutes - this was ok as we were deciding which flavor we wanted and people-watched.  You can sample ice cream to narrow down your choice - for me, it was between Brown Butter and the Peanut Butter Chocolate (the latter was the winner, so creamy good).  You can get it in a cone or cup (I get mine in a cup as I am a spiller and can't lick it quite fast enough), and I got a pint of the Vietnamese Coffee to go (my bf is oh so happy!).  I can't wait to come back and try more flavors - they change a few daily.  Mmm good - welcome, Humphrey Slocombe!
author: Maile N.

description: The line was really long for a while, but we decided to have lunch and by that time there were only a two three people in front of us, so yeh! I tried a sample of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and that was amazing, but since I was going to have blue bottle coffee after anyway, decided to go with the Secret Breakfast - really great flavor combination and you can actually taste the bourbon. The ice cream itself is not too sweet and too creamy, things I'm not a fan of, so I really loved it!
author: Sona M.

description: Even though it's not as creamy as some of the hot ice cream places we have here in Texas (Amy's ice cream comes to mind), they have an amazing assortment of unique flavors that burst in your mouth with every spoon full.  I mean, who would have though that red hots and bananas would work so well together???  Their fluffy nutter hit the spot with me and the Taitian vanilla won over my wife.  What a unique gem SF has.  Not gonna lie, I'm a bit jealous.
author: Gabriel M.

description: Went with friends and ate a scoop of each of the following flailed (in order of my faves): malted milk chocolate, peanut butter fudge ripple, carrot mango sorbet, secret breakfast and white chocolate lavender. And every flavor was fantastic!
author: Keomailani W.

description:
I like to eat ice cream and stuff. I pride myself in visiting the wonderful ice cream shops that the Bay Area has to offer: balsamic strawberry at Bi-Rite, mango at Mitchell's, taro at Polly Ann's, etc.

I want to add Secret Breakfast to that list. Secret Breakfast is mind-blowing. Strong bourbon flavor, and crisp sweet corn flakes. Memorable.

I've had their Vietnamese Coffee, too, which is also awesome. Apparently Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee is a thing.

One scoop is $4.00. Two is $6.00.
author: Louie L.

description:
The ice cream is pretty good though a bit sweet for my tasting. Their scoops are really huge and one scoop will be enough if you aren't hungry. We tried chocolate and coconut sherbet - the former was great, the second was okay.

The staff there is very nice :)
author: Ilya B.

description: Imagine you're in heaven, and Jesus owns cows. This ice cream tastes like it's made from the milk of Jesus's cows. Hands down one of the best ice cream places in the sfbay. Extremely creative flavors too, I never knew spicy ice cream exists, now I know it does (and tastes amazing).
author: Jay P.

description:
Wonderful, rich flavors. I ordered the Secret Breakfast flavor and also got to sample the Tahitian Vanilla and Blue Moon coffee flavor... All were rich, creamy, and delicious. Real flavors, high-quality ingredients. 

Bourbon flavor was very strong in the Secret breakfast, but not overly so. The cornflake chunks weren't overpowering but provided the right amount of texture and "cereal" flavor. I would recommend only one scoop because of the richness/sweetness but if you're really hungry or indecisive, go for more (but share with a friend or passing stranger). 

Definitely THE ice cream shop to go to in the Ferry Building/the city in general. The line is generally long on the weekends but it's worth the wait.
author: Jazzy O.

description:
Humphry Slocombe gets a lot of buzz. I've been hearing about the famous Humphry Slocombe ice cream for at least a year before I decided to finally give it a go. My boyfriend and I stop into the ferry building farmers market every Saturday and I decided to forego my usual Roli Roti for ice cream. Now be aware, they have a lot of unconventional ice cream flavors but don't shy away, because everything i tried was really good! I ended up choosing the Harvey Milk + Honey Graham Cracker flavor. It was SO good. It is decadent but not overwhelming. It is crazy creamy and tastes like my childhood. Whatever you think Milk + Honey tastes like, it probably does taste like that but EVEN BETTER. It's also pretty sweet so make sure you're in the mood for a creamy sweet treat. 

But seriously, I can't ever imagine a time when you wouldn't be in the mood for it. 

PS-The line will look long but it flies by!
author: Angeline V.

description: My first time here was on Wednesday with my boss during our lunch break, and I had the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham Cracker, while my boss had the Secret Breakfast. I immediately FELL IN LOVE with my order!!! I am not a fan of alcohol, so the Secret Breakfast was just alright to me, but people are a fan of it because of the bourbon flavor it had. I loved it so much, that after work I came back on Friday with a co-worker to order some.. but when I got there, they were out of Harvey Milk :( But, I got to try something else, Oolong Tea, and it tasted really good too! It reminded me of a thai tea flavored, which I am also a fan of. I will definitely be returning here often because  I work across the street :)
author: Amanda C.

description: I don't mind waiting in line but this place has serious freezer issues. I bought a scoop of secret breakfast, and my friend got a different flavor. My ice cream was like soft serve and theirs was hard like normal ice cream. I would think that for four dollars a scoop, they could have consistent freezing. I would not return because I do not want melty ice cream.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Ok, they aren't kidding. The texture alone is amazing. The flavors are clear, clean and refreshing. None of this foodie weirdness. Wonderful ice cream. Long lines.
author: Gregory B.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is finally in a convenient location for me. Even though there's a long line of people here, it moves very quick. Don't be scared off by the line.

== Food ==

Delicious ice cream! I try the guava sherbert they had it was good.

== Service ==

Quick service and friendly service!

== Overall ==

Yumtastic scoops of ice cream. There's unique flavors to try along with their interesting names.
author: Steven B.

description:
The line was long and customers passed the time by taking camera photos of their surroundings, and I overheard tourists talking about how they've heard so many wonderful things about this place. I've had the Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee flavors they're known for at the original location, so decided to try something else: Salted Caramel Cocoa Nib. I didn't ask for a sample because I didn't want to continue holding up the line so took a chance at it. I was disappointed to find the ice cream was already partially melted when it was handed to me, and just continued to drip down the side of my cup as I paid. One of the scoopers also made some comment about customers not tipping. Rude?

$4 scoop of soupy ice cream in a cup. Wouldn't go out of the way for it.
author: Zell C.

description: I tried passion fruit sorbet, vietamese coffee, and horchata.  Sorbet wasn't as fruity as I expected.  The ice cream is not very creamy or heavy, which I liked.
