I did feel that too much salt was added to the coffee ice cream, probably to balance out the sweetness.  If ici is 5 star, then this would be 3.5 to 4 star.  The $4 scoop was a decent size scoop.  Just enough to satisfy ice cream craving.
author: Adalyn J.

description:
How these people are selling alcohol in ice cream without any id check or any warning. My pregnant friend start eating the ice cream then she realize it has bourbon whiskey in it. When I asked where is the alcoholic content information, they said the name of the ice cream flavor is enough. 
How these idiots get license to run this business. I am going to call fda and enquire about it. Please you should also try to stop them selling alcoholic ice cream to pregnant woman.
author: Atul K.

description: Humphry Slocombe is a solid ice cream shop in the mission.  It may not be my favorite ice cream place in SF, but the lines are never too long, the staff is friendly, they let you sample before you decide, and the flavors are always really unique and interesting.  Therefore it is worth of 5 stars in my mind!
author: S J.

description: The secret breakfast flavor was amazing. Probably the best ice cream I've ever had. It was really soft ice cream and it left a taste/coating in my mouth that made me almost get back in line immediately for more. It had just the right amount of bourbon flavor that reminded me of caramel but better, and the corn flakes added the perfect amount of texture and crunch. Definitely worth the wait in line.
author: Carolina F.

description: Review is for the milkshake . Taste was good.  they sold it in a cup without a cap and the straw was useless . For 9 dollars one would alteast expect a decent closed cup and straw  . Had to trash as I could not walk around with it . Staff could be more friendly
author: Naina T.

description:
My husband and I tried HS ice cream today for the first time. I got the brown butter and chocolate smoked sea salt. Yum! My husband got the Secret Breakfast (Captain Crunch and Bourbon) and the sea salt caramel nib. Also both very yum.

Very good ice cream, but not as good as Bi-rite.
author: Faith C.

description:
First time, it really wowed me. I had breakfast flavor and another flavor I don't remember now. The texture and flavor of the ice cream was so different from other stores. 

Last week I tried a number of flavors and settled on Vietnam Coffee flavor. They do not taste so special to me anyone. I could not even finish the one scope I brought, too sweet.
author: Emmy P.

description:
One word...AWESOME! 
I'd heard about this place before it opened in the ferry building, but never got around to trying the other location. So, when saw that it was open in the FB my husband and I had to try it out. 
First off, if you've ever been to the FB before your first time here, you will know how insane the line at Blue Bottle Coffee is...this was the first time I had ever seen it dead. I guess everyone had joined the line at Humphry Slocombe's as it was pretty long!!
The place itself is not overly fancy, but it's clean and modern and works well. We thought it was cool that that they have a tiled wall near where you line up, and they use dry erase markers to update the flavors they have that day.
When we got up to the counter they guy who served us was already waiting with multiple spoons ready to give us tasters. My husband tried the "secret breakfast" and I tried the "butter beer" and the "dulce de leche", both of which I decided to have a scoop of. After asking the guy his opinion on it, my husband decided to go for the coke float, which was 2 scoops of the secret breakfast, bourbon caramel sauce and coke.
The 2 scoops I had were just the right amount and tasted incredibly yummy. 
The coke float was also just the right amount and tasted really awesome. It also came with a cool paper straw - such a silly little thing to mention, but a nice change from plastic.
Overall we were really impressed. Really friendly service (2 of the servers behind the counter even had a conversation with my husband about the shirt he was wearing), awesome tasting ice-cream with a good variety of flavors, and although not cheap, was not stupid expensive.
100% recommend!!
author: Elle B.

description: Love love love their secret breakfast with the crunchy cereal recipe with bourbon! Bought a carton of it to stash at home, although a fresh scoop (the cereal bits are crunchier) from the tub is the best! Always thought of having one whenever I'm near the ferry terminal.
author: Wei T.

description:
Butter Beer omg!!!! Secret Breakfast, of course, is also amazing and I believe is the flavour that made them famous. 

I was lucky enough to be served by the owner/founder at the Ferry Building location. A very nice, humble man. 

This is the best ice cream in the world. Try it!
author: A J.

description: Good ice cream, and not trying to hate but I prefer Bi-rite. To clarify, I love the creamy, dense yet light texture of gelato and find Bi-rite to offer just that. On the other side of the spectrum, there's the non-dense, fluffy, airy texture that many people love (Mitchell's Ice Cream takes the cake on fluffiness!) but isn't my cup of tea. The texture of Humphrey Slocombe's ice cream is close to Bi-rite's but a little more fluffier = less like gelato. They do have sophisticated flavors and quality ingredients, so worth trying.
author: sonia c.

description: If it's your first time having Humphry Slocombe, Secret Breakfast is mandatory!  Creamy, complex, yet complimentary flavors will make your taste buds extremely happy.  I've also had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (tastes like frozen coffee, yum) and White Peach Miso (WOW! So yum.  Not sure where the miso flavor is, but it is absolutely delicious).  Cannot wait to try all of the other flavors!
author: Yue X.

description: Tried the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee as most reviews recommended, it is really good. The brown butter and earl gray with plum is interesting too. The line is super long but moves fairly fast. Don't get scared away.
author: CaroLe H.

description: Delicious ice cream. Unique flavors that vary daily. Super coo people working there. In the ferry building. What more do you want?!
author: Dan V.

description: I tried the strawberry crumble ice cream and it was pretty good. You can taste the strawberry and the graham crumbs. Only wished the ice cream contained chunks of fresh strawberry. $4 for a golf ball scoop isn't really worth it though
author: Mary ..

description:
Thank you, Yelpers!!  It was a beautiful day and I wanted ice cream, and you led me here. Weekday afternoon meant the line was short. SCORE. 

Secret Breakfast + Here's Your Damn Strawberry = a bowlful of awesome. This place is going into the regular rotation for my SFO trips. Yummy!!
author: Lori D.

description: XXX chocolate and pog ice cream. Delicious, rich and creamy. Yum yum yum. Long line but worth the wait.
author: Tracy D.

description: I come here all the time - all their flavors are incredible. My favorite is the Malted Milk Chocolate. I also love their seasonal stuff - every now and then they do an Earlgrey Plum Sorbet which is delightful. I want moaaaar. Always.
author: Maddy K.

description:
This is the perfect treat when you're in the mood for something quirky and different.

Definitely order secret breakfast.

There are times when I really tried to change up my order and indulge with a new flavour, but I always find myself dropping all the tasting spoons and ordering my usual scoop of Secret Breakfast.
author: Camille A.

description: I was excited to see they opened a location in the Ferry Building and I had a Virgin Boarding Pass for a free scoop! Well then..I got in a long line on a weekday late afternoon, which was fine with me, then I got to the counter and there were so many choices. I asked for samples like everyone ahead of me did, but the lady with glasses who was helping me was rolling her eyes and throwing attitude when I asked for samples, umm was I wrong to do so?? I wasn't asking to try all the flavors just 3. I noticed my ice cream was soft and melty when I got it. When I wasn't even half way done it was a melted mess. I know Humphry Slocombe makes good ice cream but that day was a disaster.
author: Karen T.

description:
We live on the best planet in the solar system.

The proof?

Humphry Slocombe's Chocolate Stout milkshake.

Only on Earth.
author: Lynne W.

description: I am an ice cream snob and this is hands down the best ice cream I have ever had. Even something as simple as strawberry is taken to a new level!
author: John F.

description: Long lines that sometimes move as slow as molasses, especially on a hot day. Super exotic flavors and super tasty too! Humphrey Slocumbe usually has the longest line in the ferry building but the ice cream will make you happy!
author: Bebe W.

description: The secret breakfast flavor was absolutely delicious. It's a must try for any traveler! Sample all the flavors before you make a decision. It was rated in the top 33 Ice cream shops in America, according to yahoo news.
author: Jose G.

description: I've had several ice creams from here and loved every one. They do tasters as well which is a great as their menu is... a little different, like Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and Cornflakes). They do a limited selection of ice creams and sorbets each day. Apparently the menu changes every day too.
author: Bartley D.

description:
I am consistently disappointed by overhyped ice cream places. It's not that they're bad. It's ice cream, so it's always good... but not worth the lines/hype. 

I'm pleased to report that this one not only lives up to the hype, but is also worth that the wait. And I waited - close to 30 minutes. That's so long that it couldn't possibly be worth it -- but somehow, it was. 

Got two scoops - secret breakfast and some kind of beach blanket banana something or other. Latter fortunately tasted more of banana and not at all of beach blanket. Looking forward to a return trip, and I don't care how long the line is.
author: Ed M.

description: Tried their "secret breakfast" today.  It had bourbon and corn flakes.  Omg, I have to say this was the best ice cream ever!!!  Who knew the richness of milk and hint of bourbon flavor would be the best combination for ice cream!  Will definitely come back and try others.
author: Mandy L.

description: Great ice cream! Had the secret breakfast and Vietnamese coffee, perfect combo of unique flavors. Highly recommend!
author: Peggy W.

description: Really good ice cream , wide variety of flavor and at a reasonable price . Everything we tried was good!!
author: Ryan B.

description: Being the big fan of bourbon that I am, the Secret Breakfast hit the jackpot!  Bourbon ice cream!!  I didn't think it could get any better until I saw that I could have bourbon caramel drizzled on top!  Kudos to whoever made these flavors... If you're keeping tabs on your Yelp reviews, I want to meet you!  Let's be friends :)
author: Riz W.

description:
this place was MEH.. so apparently they named this business establishment after 2 characters from an English soap opera...

given that there was a huge line for this place and me being the awesome boyfriend that i am to wait in said line despite not having a very big Sweet Tooth, you'd expect that the flavors and taste of the ice cream product were going to be amazing, but sadly, such was not the case.

interesting/peculiar selection of flavors: Blue Bottle Coffee, Vietnamese Iced Coffee, and Maple Walnut (aka "butter pecan") to name a few. for $6-$7? WoW.

-civilities.
author: Joy M.

description: This place is amazing.  They let you sample before you chose.  The fruit flavored ice creams and yogurt are good.  However the secret breakfast was amazing.  It is the best ice cream ever.  I can't think of anything negative to say except there was a long line.  Well worth the wait.  But it is worth it.  Did I mention it is worth the wait???  Yum!
author: Carol L.

description: So I came here today after ordering coffee from blue bottle. After ordering a scoop each of ice cream, the cashier proceeded to give me a dirty look and showed the girl who scooped my ice cream that î didn't tip. Ok so because I paid for overpriced $4 a scoop ice cream I have to tip?! WTF it's not like they're making up ice cream at cold Stone. Very poor customer service IMO. I didn't tip for drip coffee at blue bottle either. It's not like it's a specialty espresso drink
author: Kevin C.

description: I got ice cream here 3 times in 3 days.  What more do you want me to say?  My wife said it was the best ice cream she has ever eaten.  I don't know about that, but honestly, it was pretty damn good.  The flavors are rich and "real" tasting if you know what I mean.  No fake crap in the ice cream.  The ice cream is super creamy and rich and smooth.  The "secret breakfast" is surprisingly excellent, and the chocolate sea salt is rich and intense with a salty finish, the Kurios Cabinet of Curiosities was delicious as well (espresso, caramel and toffee I believe).  Honestly, just super good ice cream with quality ingredients for a very reasonable price.  Incidentally the Thai Chili Lime was no joke (spicyyyy).  A good scoop was $4 I think and a double was $6 and a Coke float with bourbon caramel was $8.  Very reasonable prices.  They DO take plastic also.
author: A. L.

description: Worth standing in line for (the line moves fast anyway). I sampled the olive oil ice cream. It was good. But I ended up committing to a scoop of secret ice cream with the bourbon caramel topping. It was awsome. The caramel has a candied-like consistency and is not like the goopy sugary stuff you'd get on a sundae. The bourbon flavor is strong. And it compliments the ice cream well.
author: Al D.

description: So happy Humphry Slocombe is now in the Ferry Bldg. I grab a scoop or two of ice cream here and then head over to Miette next door for some pistachio macarons. Mmmmmmmm. I haven't found a flavor that I didn't like here. My favorites are the Vietnamese Coffee, Secret Breakfast, and Banana Chai. Happiness in my mouth!
author: Elaine W.

description: I didn't order anything but I got to try some of the flavors from other people in my group and the horchata was awesome! They had a long line so I think they're doing something right...
author: Stephanie D.

description: Humphry Slocombe, you never fail and never cease to amaze me. You're just as good as the store in the Mission. The only con (from my perspective) to this place is that it's in the Ferry Building. So you get so much traffic and you get so many tourists! There's always an insanely long line. However, it's probably really good business for you. On a different note, I decided to venture away from my normal choices - Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I got the chocolate gold rush -  dark chocolate ice cream made with Guittard's Musique Foncée is studded with bittersweet chocolate covered waffle cones. SO GOOD. I heard it was a special flavor for the Outside Lands. Hopefully, they will keep it as a regular flavor.
author: Cassy H.

description: I really do not get what all this fuss is about and those endless lines to order.  I had the peanut butter and chili flavor and I don't remember having tasted chili.  The malted milk chocolate is average.  They give all these fancy names and create big expectations but the tasting experience is quite disappointing.  I would not go there again.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Independent ice cream shops are all the craze in San Francisco, with places like Smitten and Ici boasting lines out the door. Humphrey Slocombe is no different, offering a variety of seasonal and unique flavors from Blue Bottle Vietnamese iced coffee to peanut butter chocolate chip. I had the Secret Breakfast, which was a bourbon ice cream with corn flakes mixed throughout. The addition of bourbon to the sweet vanilla ice cream was decadent, and the cornflakes gave it really good texture! As far as artisan ice cream goes, it was comparable in terms of texture and taste, and I'll definitely be back to try all the flavors on the menu board.
author: Ashley T.

description: I must start saying I had this first before trying Bi-Rite, and Bi-Rite is far superior. I chose to get the cornflake and burbon combos but it was pretty good. Bi-Rite's was just more flavorful and memorable. Both command long lines, but when I think about who would I rather stand in line for Bi-Rite still comes out on top. If your a tourist and foodie like myself then definitely check out both and make your own determination, but for me I just keep thinking about Bi-Rite as I type this review. #HappyEating
author: Latavia K.

description: this place has the longest line in the ferry building so be prepared to wait. definitely a good ice cream place, but I wouldn't call it life changing. the malted dulce de leche was the best out of the three flavors we got, the other two being coconut and black sesame.
author: Norases V.

description: Loved the ice cream especially the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  Server gave us lots of samples so we were able to determine what we did or didn't like.  The line was long, but worth the wait.
author: Deb T.

description: I don't think Humphrey slocombe has the best ice cream in the city, but I do think it's pretty good. I find this location more convenient than the original. Also, the last two times I've gone I've gone close to closing, and the staff there will give you a massive scoop, since they don't resell the ice cream the next day. Oh, and get the bourbon caramel - it's amazing.
author: caroline y.

description: Damn! San Francisco ice cream DOES NOT disappoint!! After Bi-Rite during my last visit, Humphry Slocombe was a must this visit.  It had been a few years since I had been to the Ferry Building, so it was wonderful to visit again.  Humphry Slocombe was so crowded, but the line moved quickly and I was happy to wait for a delicious scoop of ice cream.  I know the Secret breakfast is supposed to be one of their most well-known flavors, but I decided to go with the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor.  Coffee flavored ice cream is pretty special... sweet, creamy deliciousness on top of a sugar cone... such a winning combination right there!
author: Meagan T.

description: What's with the attitude at this place? When I asked for a drizzle of caramel sauce, Homeboy behind the counter rolled his eyes, annoyed at me. What's the matter? Is that too hard for you? You ARE charging customers an extra dollar for this topping (which is ridiculous btw), so what's the problem? Poor customer service and the ice cream melted too fast.
author: CHRISTINE N.

description: hahahahh, absolutely delicious!!! I had the bourbon and corn flakes ice cream....yummy! They had lots of flavors to chose from, I also tried the Root beer ice cream. This location is in the ferry building. $4.00 for one scoop.
author: Marie B.

description: It's nice that it's next to the Blue Bottle Coffee.  Humphry's and Blue Buttle should really open next to each other everywhere.
author: Byron L.

description: All you need to know is that the flavors taste exactly like their names. The staff is really nice and will let you sample any flavor if you have doubts. Happy eating! :)
author: Keny C.

description: The ice cream here is creamy and not too sweet! I got the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast flavors. I liked them both, but thought the Secret Breakfast was more unique. It contains Bourbon (I know!) and Corn Flakes, which go surprisingly well together. What's even more interesting is that it has a bit of saltiness to it. If you like unique ice cream flavors that are not completely out of whack, I definitely recommend getting the Secret Breakfast.
author: Vivian W.

description: Got the secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and the the carmel. Both were delicious and smooth. The secret breakfast was unique. I love their clever flavor names, like the one named after Fat Elvis. Do expect a line, as with pretty much any place in te ferry building, but it's worth it!
author: Emma W.

description: I was looking forward to this ice cream shop during my trip to San Fransico, and I'm glad I went. I ordered the secret breakfast and the Vietnamese coffee like a lot of other yelpers. I really enjoyed both; they were both creamy and you can actually taste the flavor without it being overwhelming. I enjoyed the Vietnamese coffee more, but I love coffee anything. Definitely worth trying if you're in the area.
author: Becka C.

description: Good product, but what's up with extra high pricing compared to Harrison Street location? Also, settle on your hours of operation instead of making it a grab bag every week. Hard to like your Ferry Building location when it is so unreliable.
author: Jamie W.

description: We decided to stop by this ice cream shop one afternoon in the city.  I tried a few flavors, including pepper and mint, bourbon and corn flakes, and the flavor I ultimately decided on, Harvey Milk and honey graham. I chose the honey graham because of the rich, milk flavor and the delicious overtones of honey.  It was really good. The pepper and mint tasted more like licorice to me, which I don't care for. I asked for a cone, but the other salesguy already sold the last cone to the guy behind me, which I thought was weird.  Overall, the flavor I chose was very tasty, but it was disappointing they sold out of cones so early in the day.
author: Sara R.

description: I am an ice cream cone-a-suer. This place is off the hook!  I had the Tibetan Vanilla with chocolate sauce. Ah. May.  Zing!  That is all.
author: Patti B.

description: I love their ice cream and their flavors! The last few times tho they have had melting ice cream. Something might be wrong with this location's freezer? That is why I give it a 4 rather than a 5 star. The main location is great though.
author: Natalie R.

description:
Delicious and different take on ice cream flavors.  If you like non-traditional ice cream this is your place. 

The ice cream cookbook is also great.  Best ice cream recipes we've ever made.  

Baracky Road and Banana Red Hot are favorites.
author: C M.

description:
Service: 5 stars
Ice Cream: 2 stars

I'd heard reviews about Humphry Slocombe (and the lines at the Ferry Building location seemed to speak for themselves...) so I was eager to try it. The servers were really generous about giving samples (and had a nice sense of humor, asking "are you of age?" before releasing a sample of the bourbon-based Secret Breakfast...), so I had the chance to try the infamous Secret Breakfast, the Taqueria Horchata and the malted milk chocolate flavors. I went with the chocolate, but wasn't blown away by any of the flavors (Secret Breakfast and Horchata were a bit icy, chocolate was fine but nothing exceptional). I'd choose Three Twins, Bi-Rite or Ici of Humphry, but I really appreciated the friendly and helpful customer service (which was far above all of the previously mentioned places except for Bi-Rite!).
author: Californian I.

description: one scoop $4, 2 scoop $6.  fame = priciness.  and not so many choices like secret breakfast and harvey milk + honey graham might not be there all the time.  this time had the still ever delicious salted caramel cocoa nibs with blue bottle vietnamese coffee in a bowl with the cone.  can't go wrong there.  several sorbets including POG and carrot mango, also eton mess ice cream with strawberry marshmallow.
author: Rob C.

description: Had the White Chocolate Lavender and the Cinnamon Brittle in a double scoop that paired quite well together. The sweetness could be a little overwhelming towards the end but still a really great treat to have.
author: Kenneth Y.

description: I was so happy to stumble upon this ice cream stop walking through the ferry building! I first noticed the line, which was wrapping around even minutes before they were to close down for the night. Second, I noticed that unique flavors. They had flavors such as black sesame and secret breakfast. I noticed the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham and knew that I had to get that flavor! I was so pleasantly surprised by the fresh raw honey flavor that came through the rich delicious milk ice cream! I would eat this ice cream again and again.
author: Whitney A.

description:
i had the coffee ice cream, one friend had the peanut butter curry and the other had gold rush (choc w/cone chips). peanut butter and curry got tossed away. the coffee was very good, as was the chocolate.

however, for $4, it wasn't all that. not that creamy nor delicious nor more than a small scoop. 

for my hard-earned money, i can't see spending four bucks on a small scoop of ice cream.

the serving folks weren't friendly at all. they just wanted to serve you and get you going. 

unfortunately, not a good experience at all.
author: Diane C.

description:
Yes.

I love you Humphy Slocombe. Your blue bottle vietnamese coffee and oolong ice cream are EVERYTHING. The flavors are rich and the texture undeniably smooth and creamy. Please open a location in LA!
author: Kim C.

description: Very unique flavors, such as salt and pepper? Definitely recommending the secret breakfast and blue bottle vietnamese coffee!!!  The line was kind of long, but the ferry building it's located in has a very nice environment that's perfect for a scoop of ice cream from Humphry Slocombe.
author: Kimberly L.

description: So excited they've opened up store front in the ferry building. I went after dinner near closing time and the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. They let us try as many flavors as we wanted and gave us extra helpings for free. Yum! The strawberry sounds basic but tastes so fresh and smooth...highly recommend it. The only reason for 4 stars is because you'll likely have to wait in line given the volume of locals and tourists eager for ice cream.
author: Karen H.

description: Had their coffee, malt chocolate, and secret breakfast.  2 days in a row.  Very flavorful, not sweet at all, and thoroughly enjoyed each bite.
author: A.S K.

description: The Pumpkin 5 Spice  flavored ice cream is quite possibly the best ice cream that I have ever had. This is one of my favorite shops to stop by whenever I'm in the mood for ice cream.
author: Letisha C.

description: The other day I was bragging about my impressive streak of running. Then, I realized that's only bc Humphry Slocombe recently opened at the Ferry Building, and I've just been running to get ice cream... But this really is my favorite ice cream in SF, and that's saying something in this delicious world of Bi-Rite, Ice Cream Bar, Smitten, Naia, etc. I adore Butter by Moodlight (this ice cream has EXTRA BUTTER), Peanut Butter Curry, Black Sesame, and Butter Beer. The flavors are not ordinary, so if you're a vanilla/chocolate kind of person, skip on this place. You can get cheaper and more ordinary flavors elsewhere. Don't get upset at the people trying a bunch of flavors in front of you--you'll want to do the same!
author: Alison S.

description: Very good ice cream. Not the best sundae as the almonds and the seas salt make it too salty. But the ice cream is tasty. The line is long but moves fast. The service is great. Very friendly and accommodating!
author: Vadim d.

description: Got the pint of Blue Bottle Coffee. As much as I loved it, I honestly think it's overpriced. The sharpness and richness of the flavor is amazing. But.....it's flavor is comparable to Hagen Daaz which is significantly cheaper. I would say lower the prices and then I can give 5 stars.
author: Angelo P.

description: This is my favorite ice cream place in SF! Try the secret breakfast, oolong tea, vietnamese iced coffee flavors. They give generous scoops, are super friendly about helping out with different flavor combo profiles, and have awesome seasonal and daily flavors that keep you wanting to come back and try more!
author: Kevin M.

description: YYYEEESSSSS! So glad they're in the ferry building. Much easier to feed the cravings when I'm commuting home now :)  The lines can be nuts (especially when it's warm) and you can sample before ordering (which is super nice if you haven't tried the flavors already but can slow things down a little), so don't go if you're in a rush to catch your ferry or bus home! But seriously, delicious and worth the wait.
author: Sheena C.

description: 4 stars only because I love their ONE flavor: salted caramel with cacao nib. I'd have to say it's almost as good as Birite's, but they are also so different that the two cannot even be fairly compared. BUT I will remove 1 star because it's rare that they even carry salted caramel when I go and I don't care for any of their other flavors :/ Their scoops are really big though, so I love that. A lot of people I know love this place and it's definitely worth a try if you are wandering around by the Ferry Building on a sunny day.
author: Sandy T.

description:
Glad I walked all the way around the Ferry building, otherwise I would've completely missed this stand. Got a scoop of secret breakfast and chocolate + smoke.

Wasn't a huge fan of the chocolate and sea salt flavor. Secret breakfast, however, was fucking LEGIT. Bourbon ice cream with cornflakes. You could definitely taste the liquor, so if you don't like the taste of it, don't even try it.
author: J C.

description: Humphry's is one of my favorite along with the ice cream bar, and bi/rite. The secret breakfast is never disappointing. I've also had lemon buttermilk, Tahitian vanilla, basil and lime, caramelized honey, and I think a few other ones. Overall this place will always have a special place in my heart.
author: Laurel C.

description: The "Secret Breakfast" is easily one of the best ice creams I've ever had, on par with Toscanini's burnt caramel flavor. Servers are snobbish but that's part of the experience, right?
author: Alastair S.

description: Shh the secret in Secret Breakfast is that it's made out of cheap GMO non-organic cornflakes! I expect more from a $4 scoop of ice cream at the Ferry Building or in San Francisco in general!
author: Joy C.

description: Pretty good ice-cream and unique flavors.  I had the pumpkin one with pepper and it's definitely a flavor you don't see too often (pumpkin maybe, but not with pepper).
author: a f.

description: Tried their salted caramel with cocoa NIB, but it was already half melted when they scooped it up so not great off the bat. Flavor was not as good as Bi-Rite's and the cocoa NIB just doesn't work with it. Also had a taste of their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee which was much better so maybe would try that next time.
author: Sally S.

description: I like the Mission location better as the line isn't as long and there's a place to park. Flavor and quality is still top notch, though, and it's my favorite ice cream in the city.
author: Brandon K.

description: I have tried secret breakfast;Salted caramel, Vietnamese iced coffee and POG(pineapple orange guava) sorbet.This place always has a huge queue so it is best to go during off peak hours.You can try some flavours and pick.They dont have pint size to go option.You can take 2 different scopes of ice-cream.Found the person at counter a bit rude.
author: Priyanka L.

description: This has become one of my favorite ice cream places! The line on a Saturday afternoon was intimidating but don't worry, it moves much faster than it looks. Their menu isn't overly extensive like some ice cream shops which is good for me, because I can never choose. The guys working there were friendly and enthusiastic about giving out samples. Props to them for being able to keep the line moving at a reasonable pace! My taste buds settled on a scoop of blue bottled vietnamese coffee and a scoop of horchata on a cone. Their scoops are huge! I wasn't sure how they were going to be stack it on a cone but they did! The ice cream was soo smooth. Best coffee ice cream I've had to date. The coffee flavor was rich and distinct, but not overly powerful with sweetness or creaminess. Same with the horchata and the two together were a match made in heaven! Can't wait to come back and try the other flavors!
author: Lena L.

description: The ice cream is DELISH. Salted Caramel (of course) and the Sesame sooo good! But the great thing about this place are the scoopers and scoopettes. Buying ice cream at the premium, you want your scoopers and scoopettes to be full of joy, which they are here. Plus, it's the biggest scoop for the money you'll get from any artisan ice cream shop in the Bay Area.
author: Tricia G.

description: It's always been a daunting thing to stand in the line in the middle of the already crowed Ferry Building but I mustered up the courage to do it! After buying the cookbook and making an adaptation of the Thai chili lime sorbet sans chili, I knew I had to eventually see where it all started. I ordered the Secret Breakfast and the Peanut Butter Curry (Go Warriors!) The PB Curry was fantastic but the breakfast one...maybe too much bourbon for me. Expected more creaminess and more of the cereal to come through. I still need to try the Butterbeer one though...
author: Raven P.

description: Vast unique selection. Staff was energetic. Long line that moved fast. I got the black sesame. Delicious. Never even heard of that flavor before.
author: Stefanie S.

description: Got a cup of the coffee ice cream. Felt a little guilty for indulging after eating a huge sandwich from the nearby Golden Gate meat company, but then I blacked out and found out I ran 5 miles afterwards cause I was wired from the caffeine and sugar. Don't do drugs.
author: John B.

description: Had the lemon buttermilk (which was closer to ice milk in consistency than ice cream) and the peanut butter chip. Both good... just not in the same cup. Oops.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Ok, so I admit that no ice cream will ever replace Frusen Gladje (the best of the best of the best and it was a sad day when Kraft ended up with the business and discontinued the brand - probably it was too expensive to make).  I usually make my own ice cream now so that I can control the density.  The denser the better.  Humphry Slocombe never made my radar screen because it never looked dense enough to me.  However, the Secret Breakfast ice cream called to me Sat morning at 8am...I was surprised to find an ice cream place open at that hour but also pleased...there is nothing so good as ice cream for breakfast.  Well, I am not a big cornflake fan - just the opposite.  But I decided to give it a go and there was something wonderful going on with that ice cream.  Could it be the lightly sweetened corn flakes?  Hard to say but I was instantly addicted.  Whenever we are near the Ferry Plaza at breakfast time, I head for the ice cream counter and get one scoop of the Secret Breakfast.
author: Jean S.

description: So far my favorite ice cream in the city. Love the Thai Chili Lime. Yum!
author: Kathy B.

description: Truly lovely ice cream. I tried out the milk & honey graham flavor, and just about died: heaven!
author: Danielle M.

description:
I've wanted to try this ice cream for years.  Finally did and... well... "meh."

I was really psyched while standing in line reading flavors and thinking they all sounded like good options.  Finally settled on the SECRET BREAKFAST cuz... I mean... where ELSE are you going to find bourbon and Corn Flakes in your ice cream? :D  Seriously good flavor.  Was very happy with the balance.  

But.

The ice cream was grainy.  The texture should be smooth and lush as velvet.  It was not.  Ice crystals and then the fat content was bizarre in that it made the roof of my mouth feel coated in cold butter.  

Don't get me wrong.  I ate the whole single cone.  It cost a small fortune, so if it wasn't horrible, I was eatin' it.  

I would not.  NOT... pay for another cone from them.  Sorry.  If they were half the price, perhaps, but it wasn't even remotely as amazing as the buzz led me to think.  Met a friend later that afternoon and told her I'd FINALLY had a cone from them and described my surprise at how underwhelmed I was and how weird the coated-roof-of-my-mouth felt.  She waited until I'd finished explaining and said she didn't think much of their product, either - specifically the coffee flavor.  Not impressive and certainly not the Coffee! flavor you'd expect from featuring a well-known coffee roaster (Blue Bottle) in the description.  Glad I at least didn't get that one.

Good luck to 'em.  I know they have a loyal fan base.  The location and underground buzz alone will keep the place jumpin' (I was in the permanent portion of the Ferry Plaza Farmer's Market in SF).
author: Raelene S.

description: Great flavor.  Malted Milk Chocolate was too sweet though so I got the Vietnamese Coffee flavor.  My friend got the Pear with wine.  $4 for a single scoop 1 flavor.  No extra cost for cone.
author: J W.

description: Excellent service and product. My wife didn't like the ice cream she got and the gentleman kindly gave her another one that she liked at no charge. This place will always do good in future.  Thanks to the kind manager on duty Remy today. 8/23/2014 @ 6pm
author: Sammy G.

description: Some of the best ice cream I've ever had! Perfect for dessert after eating at Gott's Roadside (if you have room for dessert, that is). I had a scoop of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and it was delicious! Really creamy and tasted like real, authentic Vietnamese coffee, distinctly different from your typical coffee-flavored ice cream. My boyfriend got the POG (Passionfruit Orange Guava) Sorbetto, which was also really good! It had a really fresh taste and you could really taste the combination of all three fruits. It wasn't artificial-tasting at all either. One scoop costs $4, which seems pricey until you see how generous the scoops are. I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in the Embarcadero area (it's less than 10 min from the Embarcadero Bart station) and look forward to trying some of there more unusual flavors, like Secret Breakfast, which, according to the guy that served us our ice cream, Humphry Slocombe is best known for.
author: Corinna S.

description: Yuck! Super creamy... don't like the taste of strawberry ice cream. Generally can't be bad... but this is BAD!
author: Pokemon P.

description: This is good ice cream!  Creamy, cold, dense and a perfectly sweet selection of churned goodness....this place deserves to be called gourmet.  And I'm not just being SMITTEN, if you know what I mean.  Secret breakfast is a must try and the tahitian vanilla is simple and delicious.  The black sesame had a good flavor to it but I can imagine it to be overwhelming if you get a whole scoop. Get 3 scoops to share.  Finally an ice creamery that lives up to the hype.  I'm screaming for more ice cream...secret breakfast to be exact.
author: Chris O.

description: Vanilla ice cream has vanilla beans in it and it is really good! Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream taste great with real coffee smell when you eat them.
author: Katy I.

description: Tahitian Vanilla was very good.  But chocolate sea salt was way more salt than chocolate.  What a way to ruin chocolate ice cream.
author: Mark C.

description: Been here a couple of times, and they have a flavor that you will find nowhere else! Secret breakfast, and yes they made this for champions. Line was a little long but moved real fast. Also, I had the POG sorbet, which is, passion orange and guava juice.
author: Ryan Q.

description: I didn't think that I could find ice cream that I would enjoy as much as Bi-Rite Creamery Ice Cream. I was wrong. Humphry's comes pretty close. Tasty way to end my trip today!
author: Benjamin S.

description:
way overrated -  mostly because it is wayyyy too sweet. 

boyfriend and I shared the breakfast, choco smoked sea salt, and cinnamon brittle. 

i had to stop eating it because it felt like I was going to get diabetes soon. it's also way too creamy for me. 

don't get my wrong, i see why people love it. it just really wasn't for me.
author: Janet Y.

description: Yummy ice cream, I tried the French vanilla which had a nice crazy texture and good vanilla flavor. I then dug into the cherry topping which was out of this world! Amazing flavor, tart, sweet, intense and satisfying, these cherries are the best ice cream topping I have ever tasted. It must have been very good because passers by were noticing how much I was enjoying it and asking where they could get some. I would give these guys five stars except the selection is extremely limited, the staff is professional and quick but they are robotic and don't interact well. We were there during non-peak hours between lunch and dinner so it was quiet (no line) yet the staff reluctant answered some of my questions and ignored others. Service is half of the equation and if they can step it up then this will be a great treat shop.
author: Bob L.

description: It's good but no where near as good as it should be considering the line. Best ice cream I have ever had is in Stone harbor NJ Springers. Go there!
author: Sita P.

description: Kinda disappointed by this location. Service was terrible and slow despite the fact there was only one other person in line. They could care less and was more interested in chatting with each other. On top of that, the ice cream was served way too soft. I was drinking it more than eating it. Needless to say, the Mission location is still hard to beat. Service gets a 0 and ice cream gets a 4.
author: H L.

description:
I'm a sucker for pumpkin things this time of year so I had to try the pumpkin ice cream here (appropriately named "Go Giants!).

The flavor was so rich and creamy! It tasted a lot like a pumpkin pie and I really couldn't get enough of it. I'll definitely be back :D
author: Jenny A.

description: Such cool flavors! Secret breakfast is always awesome. Usually a pretty long line but worth it.
author: Olivia M.

description:
I'm sure some of the flavors are good, as the lines are long. I ordered the lemon buttermilk flavor (more like a sorbet), but sour as heck! If there was any sugar at all in it, I must have got the one scoop that got missed!

My son ordered the brown sugar ice cream (real ice cream) and loved it. I tasted it and knew where all the sugar from my flavor went! Yuck! It was so sweet I had to retaste mine to even it out.

Skip these flavors and go with the more conventional flavors. $10 for 3 scoops...we deserve better.
author: RONALD C.

description: One of the best Ice Cream I have ever tried. It was so good that I have got 3 scoops :D Product is authentic and very tasty. Flavors are a good mix of unique and well known. I will take all my friends there.
author: Radoslaw D.

description: Intriguing flavors and rich silky texture, but a little too buttery in flavor for my liking ( and I do like butter, dont get me wrong.  just a personal preference.) I would say that the Affogato made with their ice cream and served with and by Blue Bottle espresso across the hall from Humphrys, is delicious!
author: Jason M.

description: What's up with the weird names?? And why don't they give any info about the flavors? We stood in line for 20 min. I asked the server if he could put one scoop of ice cream into to cone for my 2 toddlers. Answer was a short no. I asked for 2 scoops of mango than. He didn't even bother to say that it had cayenne pepper in it and it's not good for little kids. Well, there's my 8 dollars in the trash. I had the chocolate with smoky sea salt. The name should have been chocolate with an extreme amount of salt. Seriously, how can anybody like this place??!
author: Aniko N.

description: Wouldn't ear ice-cream anywhere else other than Humphry's and Bi-rite. The best ice-cream ever! Bourbon flavored Secret Breakfast and Candied Ginger totally satisfied me!!
author: Kan P.

description: Not the greatest. Kudos for their creativity but I've had better ice cream.
author: Sherry S.

description: Amazing ice cream. Decadently creamy and maintains it's texture for a long period before slowly melting. Unique and interesting flavors, the black sesame was delicious. Great location within the Ferry building next to the piers. The only downer would be to expect a long line. Great customer service tho :)
author: Amy P.

description: I didn't plan to eat ice cream here, but saw a crowd so went to try it. I tasted most flavors, but didn't find the one I like. :(  Therefore, my friend ordered Chocolate flavor ice cream, which the flavor is rich, but not the ice cream I'm looking for.  l like ice cream which doesn't make me thirsty and look for water after eating. I miss Bi-Rite Ice cream more though.
author: Lydia S.

description: Got the blue bottle and Harvey milk. Taste great and generous portions, but it was waaayyyy too sweet for my liking. Tried the horchata, which was sweeter than the Harvey milk. Good quality ice cream though!
author: Jenn L.

description: The Secret Breakfast saved the day. It was delicious with the right amount of bourbon and cornflakes. I instantly fell in love with it.  My husband ordered Tahitian Vanilla, and it didn't taste as flavorful as he and I had hoped for.  My son ordered Milk Chocolate and that was good too, but not as yummy as the Secret Breakfast.  The only downside about Humphry's is the price.  A single scoop was close to $5.  Although their ice creams are great, I felt that $5 was a bit steep for a regular size ice cream scoop.  Staff was friendly and provided decent service. I'll definitely will be coming back soon.
author: Mel A.

description: This replaced Ciao Bella in the ferry building. It officially opens on March 5 but they were still selling half pints. I am super excited for it to open officially so that I can try their more unique flavors.
author: Jessica P.

description: lines are super long bc it's new at the FB but i personally think it's too sweet. But i also don't have a sweet tooth. It's just i need to try this newest shop that everyone's raving about. I might try the gelatos though. So far, i've tried olive oil (yum) and Midnight something which is blueberry with butter. decadent! Bi-rite is still my favorite so far.
author: Emm C.

description: 5 stars for awesome British sitcom tribute. Their ice creams are just as indulgent. I recommend the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, horchata, and here's your damn strawberry.
author: Sue K.

description: The ice cream is amazing! The secret breakfast was delicious. I love seeing all the weird but delicious flavor a they come up with.
author: Eve D.

description: One of the many times in my life when I have been completely blown away with the small choice of amazing ice creams! Who would ever think of the combo of bourbon and cornflakes, the flavor the team named Secret Breakfast or the common flavor I had today, Peanut Butter Chip, which was heaven with the warm chocolate fudge sauce? Hope you love it if you found this review helpful!
author: Taj H.

description: Rated #4 by Food network, I knew I had to try this place when I was in SF. I tried the secret breakfast. The flavor was good, although I could not taste the bourbon and the corm flake cookie was awesome. There are many other unique flavors and the line of people talked about their favorites. The staff is nice and friendly.
author: Ae K.

description: Surprisingly, I wasn't a huge fan of this place. The scoop was small for its price even though it was cash only. The flavors didn't really agree with my tastebuds. The workers seemed kind of impatient to serve me even though I was one of maybe 3 people there. And I thought the ice cream itself wasn't as fluffy or creamy as say Bi-Rite.
author: Candice L.

description:
I used to live a few blocks from the Harrison St location and always stopped in for tastes and a scoop! It's my favorite place to bring friends from out of town as apart of my SF Food excursion(s).

The long awaited Ferry Building location just opened last week and its already making a splash! I work downtown so I stopped by yesterday for a scoop with coworkers and the line was a bit long but definitely moved quickly. For the quality of ice cream you get, no wonder there is a wait! 

The customer service was amazing! The tall woman with red hair and glasses helped us. She directed my coworkers to flavors that were complimentary (Oolong and McEvoy Olive Oil / Salted Caramel Cocoa Nib and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Yum!!) and then the younger guy with tattoos made some funny jokes about how happy we looked to see him/be there while ringing us up! 

All in all, always a great experience with the Humphry Slocombe gang! And, in my opinion, the best ice cream around!
author: Jessica P.

description: There are no words for how I feel about this place. Whenever I come and visit San Fran I always make it a point to stop by bad pay them a visit. I ordered the Vietnamese coffee and my boyfriend ordered the secret breakfast float. The float was insane! The secret breakfast ice cream on its own is my favorite, but the float takes it to another level.
author: Anisha A.

description: Came across this just by accident - we had never heard about it before; saw a huge line in front and decided to take a chance. Tried "harvey milk & honey graham" and "secret breakfast". Both were awesome ! Service was friendly and provided multiple samples for everyone ..
author: Manoj S.

description: pretty great flavors except towards the end of the day, the ice cream started to get the ice crystals in it
author: Pough K.

description: I LOVE having Humphry Slocombe so close to home!  They ALWAYS carry Secret Breakfast, which has been my all-time favorite.  By the way, their chocolate chip cookie is also pretty tasty.
author: Nina L.

description: walking by, my boyfriend and I decided last minute to get a hand-packed pint. the ice cream woman gave us Butter by Moonlight and two spoons. everything about the experience was an utter delight!
author: Tea H.

description: Amazing flavors.  Line moves quickly and they are nice about giving samples.  My only complaint is that the scoops are HUGE which isn't really a complaint but means that if you want to try more than 1 flavor you're eating a lot of ice cream. I wish they did  smaller scoops or split scoops so you can try more of their delicious flavors.
author: Jessica B.

description: darn near perfect service and product, the line of tourists and marina kids is long, but you can just grab a soft pack and check the fuck out.
author: Matt J.

description: secret breakfast is a bit too sweet for my tooth :)  but they still deserve 5 stars
author: Lyn L.

description: The best ice cream in town! I love their creative flavor selection. Can you say "special breakfast."
author: M'famous O.

description: The stand is hidden away behind all the fruit stands, but the ice cream there is freaking amazing. They usually have 3-4 flavors of the day. The Bourboun Breakfast Blend is the closest I can come to drinking during lunch without, well...drinking.
author: Paul V.

description: I soooooo love this place; my first experience, in the Mission district, won me over; I was sorry I didn't get TWO scoops of Secret Breakfast; THIS time around, got 1 of Secret Breakfast, and 1 of Oolong Tea; hard to choose they are both delightful.  Like that there is a location at the Ferry Bldg b/c it was a close jaunt from our hotel; disappointed (in myself) for having arrived so late, allowing me to indulge in only 2 scoops!
author: Frankie G.

description: Swung by here during my lunch break and the service was quick, but they didn't rush you. They are really happy to let you try the flavors and really filled up the sample spoons. I got "Secret Breakfast" (bourbon & cornflakes) and the Harvey Milk (honey graham). The flavors are INTENSE. Who knew ice cream could taste like that?! Definitely coming back and bringing friends.
author: Rachel N.

description: I think it's just me.  I'm not a big fan of really very rich and creamy ice cream.  I really am more a yogurt fan.   They have very creative flavors and I'm all for that but I only had one scoop and could not finish it.  It tasted  good but it was way too rich for me.  It left an aftertaste, like fat/grease.  Not a fan.
author: Cj P.

description: This is the best ice cream place that I have ever been to! I would pay double for the ice cream because it is that good. I got olive oil and my boyfriend got peanut butter and curry and they were both so amazing! We tried several ice cream places in the city but this was above and beyond anything we expected.
author: Dar E.

description: Don't judge this ice cream by its looks. This ice cream blew me away. Got the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip and the Pepper and Mint Chip. Love the fun ice cream names (Pepper and Mint Chip? Pure Genius.) Definitely my favorite ice cream so far. Love, love, loved the Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip.
author: Heidi C.

description: Line was pretty long but went quick, surprisingly.  Very friendly staff ... I tried so many flavors! Shoulda got the Secret Breakfast, but love butter, so got Brown Butter-- sooooo yummy!
author: Nancy S.

description: This place was awesome! I was initially skeptical about the flavors, but to my surprise they were great. Lorraine, one of the servers, was super helpful and let me try all the flavors until I found my favorite (cinnamon brittle and peanut butter curry) YUM, I give Lorraine and Humphry's two thumbs up.
author: Joy L.

description: I had been dying to try some of San Francisco's ice cream spots that I've heard so much about. Yesterday, I was thrilled to finally stop by Humphry Slocombe that I'd read about and saw on tv. But what a disappointment. I had the Vietnamese coffee and missed the strong coffee flavor of actual Vietnamese coffee. What was worse, was that there were literally chunks of butter in the ice cream. From churning too much?? I don't know, I have no idea how it happened but I'd prefer my ice cream without chunks of butter. Gross. The ice cream was premium and tasted ok if I ignored the weak coffee flavor and bits of butter.
author: Sistrsprkl S.

description: omg! vietnamese coffee is soooo good! actually, pretty much all of their flavors are good, but blue bottle coffee vietnamese coffee is a must try.
author: Jess T.
